Web APIs	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>When writing code for the Web with JavaScript, there are a great many APIs available. Below is a list of all the interfaces (that is, types of objects) that you may be able to use while developing your Web app or site.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API
AbstractWorker	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The AbstractWorker interface of the Web Workers API abstracts properties and methods common to all kind of workers, being Worker or SharedWorker.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/AbstractWorker
AbstractWorker.onerror	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The AbstractWorker.onerror property of the AbstractWorker interface represents an EventHandler, that is a function to be called when the error event occurs and bubbles through the Worker.</p><pre><code>myWorker.onerror = function() { ... };</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/AbstractWorker/onerror
Ambient Light Events	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The ambient light events are a handy way to make a web page or an application aware of any change in the light intensity. It allows them to react to such a change, for example by changing the color contrast of the User Interface (UI) or by changing the exposure necessary to take a picture.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Ambient_Light_Events
AnalyserNode	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The AnalyserNode interface represents a node able to provide real-time frequency and time-domain analysis information. It is an AudioNode that passes the audio stream unchanged from the input to the output, but allows you to take the generated data, process it, and create audio visualizations.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/AnalyserNode
AnalyserNode.fftSize	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The fftSize property of the AnalyserNode interface is an unsigned long value representing the size of the FFT (Fast Fourier Transform) to be used to determine the frequency domain.</p><pre><code>var audioCtx = new AudioContext();\nvar analyser = audioCtx.createAnalyser();\nanalyser.fftSize = 2048;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/AnalyserNode/fftSize
AnalyserNode.frequencyBinCount	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The frequencyBinCount property of the AnalyserNode interface is an unsigned long value half that of the FFT size. This generally equates to the number of data values you will have to play with for the visualization.</p><pre><code>var audioCtx = new AudioContext();\nvar analyser = audioCtx.createAnalyser();\nvar bufferLength = analyser.frequencyBinCount;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/AnalyserNode/frequencyBinCount
AnalyserNode.getByteFrequencyData()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>A Uint8Array.</p><pre><code>var audioCtx = new AudioContext();\nvar analyser = audioCtx.createAnalyser();\nvar dataArray = new Uint8Array(analyser.frequencyBinCount); // Uint8Array should be the same length as the frequencyBinCount \nanalyser.getByteFrequencyData(dataArray); // fill the Uint8Array with data returned from getByteFrequencyData() \n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/AnalyserNode/getByteFrequencyData
AnalyserNode.getByteTimeDomainData()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>A Uint8Array.</p><pre><code>var audioCtx = new AudioContext();\nvar analyser = audioCtx.createAnalyser();\nvar dataArray = new Uint8Array(analyser.fftSize); // Uint8Array should be the same length as the fftSize \nanalyser.getByteTimeDomainData(dataArray); // fill the Uint8Array with data returned from getByteTimeDomainData() \n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/AnalyserNode/getByteTimeDomainData
AnalyserNode.getFloatFrequencyData()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>A Float32Array.</p><pre><code>var audioCtx = new AudioContext();\nvar analyser = audioCtx.createAnalyser();\nvar myDataArray = new Float32Array(analyser.frequencyBinCount); // Float32Array should be the same length as the frequencyBinCount \nanalyser.getFloatFrequencyData(myDataArray); // fill the Float32Array with data returned from getFloatFrequencyData() \n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/AnalyserNode/getFloatFrequencyData
AnalyserNode.getFloatTimeDomainData()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>A Float32Array.</p><pre><code>var audioCtx = new AudioContext();\nvar analyser = audioCtx.createAnalyser();\nvar dataArray = new Float32Array(analyser.fftSize); // Float32Array needs to be the same length as the fftSize \nanalyser.getFloatTimeDomainData(myDataArray); // fill the Float32Array with data returned from getFloatTimeDomainData() \n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/AnalyserNode/getFloatTimeDomainData
AnalyserNode.maxDecibels	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The maxDecibels property of the AnalyserNode interface Is a double value representing the maximum power value in the scaling range for the FFT analysis data, for conversion to unsigned byte/float values — basically, this specifies the maximum value for the range of results when using getFloatFrequencyData() or getByteFrequencyData().</p><pre><code>var audioCtx = new AudioContext();\nvar analyser = audioCtx.createAnalyser();\nanalyser.maxDecibels = -10;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/AnalyserNode/maxDecibels
AnalyserNode.minDecibels	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The minDecibels property of the AnalyserNode interface Is a double value representing the minimum power value in the scaling range for the FFT analysis data, for conversion to unsigned byte/float values — basically, this specifies the minimum value for the range of results when using getFloatFrequencyData() or getByteFrequencyData().</p><pre><code>var audioCtx = new AudioContext();\nvar analyser = audioCtx.createAnalyser();\nanalyser.minDecibels = -90;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/AnalyserNode/minDecibels
AnalyserNode.smoothingTimeConstant	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The smoothingTimeConstant property of the AnalyserNode interface is a double value representing the averaging constant with the last analysis frame. It's basically an average between the current buffer and the last buffer the AnalyserNode processed, and results in a much smoother set of value changes over time.</p><pre><code>var audioCtx = new AudioContext();\nvar analyser = audioCtx.createAnalyser();\nanalyser.smoothingTimeConstant = 1;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/AnalyserNode/smoothingTimeConstant
ANGLE_instanced_arrays	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The ANGLE_instanced_arrays extension is part of the WebGL API and allows to draw the same object, or groups of similar objects multiple times, if they share the same vertex data, primitive count and type.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/ANGLE_instanced_arrays
ANGLE_instanced_arrays.drawArraysInstancedANGLE()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The ANGLE_instanced_arrays.drawArraysInstancedANGLE() method of the WebGL API renders primitives from array data like the gl.drawArrays() method. In addition, it can execute multiple instances of the range of elements.</p><pre><code>void ext.drawArraysInstancedANGLE(mode, first, count, primcount);\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/ANGLE_instanced_arrays/drawArraysInstancedANGLE
ANGLE_instanced_arrays.drawElementsInstancedANGLE()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The ANGLE_instanced_arrays.drawElementsInstancedANGLE() method of the WebGL API renders primitives from array data like the gl.drawElements() method. In addition, it can execute multiple instances of a set of elements.</p><pre><code>void ext.drawElementsInstancedANGLE(mode, count, type, offset, primcount);\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/ANGLE_instanced_arrays/drawElementsInstancedANGLE
ANGLE_instanced_arrays.vertexAttribDivisorANGLE()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The ANGLE_instanced_arrays.vertexAttribDivisorANGLE() method of the WebGL API modifies the rate at which generic vertex attributes advance when rendering multiple instances of primitives with ext.drawArraysInstancedANGLE() and ext.drawElementsInstancedANGLE().</p><pre><code>void ext.vertexAttribDivisorANGLE(index, divisor);\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/ANGLE_instanced_arrays/vertexAttribDivisorANGLE
Animation	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Animation interface of the Web Animations API represents a single animation player and provides playback controls and a timeline for an animation node or source.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Animation
Animation.Animation()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Animation() constructor of the Web Animations API returns a new Animation object instance.</p><pre><code>var rabbitDownAnimation = new Animation(rabbitDownKeyframes, document.timeline);\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Animation/Animation
Animation.cancel()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Animation.cancel() method of the Animation interface clears all keyframeEffects caused by this animation and aborts its playback.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Animation/cancel
Animation.currentTime	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Animation.currentTime property of the Web Animations API returns and sets the current time value of the animation in milliseconds, whether running or paused.</p><pre><code>var currentTime = element.currentTime;\nelement.currentTime = someValue;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Animation/currentTime
Animation.effect	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Animation.effect property of the Web Animations API gets and sets the target effect of an animation. The target effect may be either a KeyframeEffect object or null.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Animation/effect
Animation.finish()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>None.</p><pre><code>animation.finish(); </code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Animation/finish
Animation.finished	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Animation.finished read-only property of the Web Animations API allows you to return the finished state of the animation so that further code can be run after it has finished.</p><pre><code>Promise.all(\n  elem.getAnimations().map( \n    function(animation) { \n      return animation.finished \n    }\n  )\n).then(\n  function() {\n    return elem.remove();\n  }\n);</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Animation/finished
Animation.id	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Animation.id property of the Web Animations API returns or sets a string used to identify the animation.</p><pre><code>rabbitDownAnimation.effect.id = "rabbitGo";\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Animation/id
Animation.oncancel	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Animation.oncancel property of the Web Animations API is the event handler for the cancel event.</p><pre><code>animation.oncancel = animation.effect.target.remove();\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Animation/oncancel
Animation.onfinish	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Animation.onfinish property of the Web Animations API is the event handler for the finish event.</p><pre><code>// Add an animation to the game's ending credits\nvar endingUI = document.getElementById("ending-ui");\nvar bringUI = endingUI.animate(keysFade, timingFade);\n\n// Pause said animation's credits\nbringUI.pause();\n\n// This function removes pointer events on the credits.\nhide(endingUI);\n\n// When the credits are later faded in, \n// we re-add the pointer events when they're done\nbringUI.onfinish = function() {\n&#160; endingUI.style.pointerEvents = 'auto';\n};\n\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Animation/onfinish
Animation.pause()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Animation.pause() method of the Animation interface suspends playback of the animation.</p><pre><code>animation.pause(); \n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Animation/pause
Animation.play()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>None.</p><pre><code>animation.play(); \n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Animation/play
Animation.playbackRate	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Animation.playbackRate property of the Web Animations API returns or sets the playback rate of the animation.</p><pre><code>// getting the playbackRate\nvar currentPlaybackRate = element.playbackRate;\n\n// setting playbackRate\nelement.playbackRate = 1;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Animation/playbackRate
Animation.playState	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Animation.playState property of the Web Animations API returns and sets an enumerated value describing the playback state of an animation.</p><pre><code>// getting playState\nvar currentPlayState = anAnimationPlayer.playState;\n\n// setting playState\nanAnimationPlayer.playState = 'paused';\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Animation/playState
Animation.ready	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Animation.ready property of the Web Animations API returns the current ready Promise for this object. The object is replaced with a new Promise object every time the animation enters the pending play state as well as when the animation is canceled.</p><pre><code>animation.pause();\nanimation.ready.then(function() {\n  // Displays 'running'\n  alert(animation.playState);\n});\nanimation.play();\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Animation/ready
Animation.reverse()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>None.</p><pre><code>animation.reverse(); \n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Animation/reverse
Animation.startTime	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Animation.startTime property of the Animation interface returns or sets the scheduled time when an animation's playback should begin.</p><pre><code>var catRunning = document.getElementById ("withWAAPI").animate(keyframes, timing);\n\n/* A function that makes new cats. */\nfunction addCat(){\n&#160; var newCat = document.createElement("div");\n&#160; newCat.classList.add("cat");\n&#160; return newCat;\n}\n\n/* This is the function that adds a cat to the WAAPI column */\nfunction animateNewCatWithWAAPI() {\n\n&#160; // make a new cat\n&#160; var newCat = addCat();\n\n&#160; // animate said cat with the WAAPI's "animate" function\n&#160; var newAnimationPlayer = newCat.animate(keyframes, timing);\n\n&#160; // set the animation's start time to be the same as the original .cat#withWAAPI\n&#160; newAnimationPlayer.startTime = catRunning.startTime;\n\n&#160; // Add the cat to the pile.\n&#160; WAAPICats.appendChild(newCat);\n}\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Animation/startTime
Animation.timeline	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Animation.timeline property of the Animation interface returns or sets the timeline associated with this animation.</p><pre><code>animation.timeline = document.timeline;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Animation/timeline
AnimationEffectReadOnly	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The AnimationEffectReadOnly interface of the Web Animations API defines current and future "Animation Effects" like KeyframeEffect, which can be passed to Animation.Animation objects for playing, and KeyframeEffectReadOnly (which is used by CSS Animations and Transitions).</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/AnimationEffectReadOnly
AnimationEffectReadOnly.getComputedTiming()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The getComputedTiming() method of the AnimationEffectReadOnly interface returns the calculated timing properties for this animation effect.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/AnimationEffectReadOnly/getComputedTiming
AnimationEffectReadOnly.timing	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The AnimationEffectReadOnly.timing read-only attribute of the AnimationEffectReadOnly interface returns an AnimationEffectTimingReadOnly object containing the timing properties for the Animation Effect.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/AnimationEffectReadOnly/timing
AnimationEffectTiming	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The AnimationEffectTiming interface of the Web Animations API is comprised of timing properties. It is returned by the timing attribute of a KeyframeEffect.</p><pre><code>aliceChange.currentTime = aliceChange.effect.timing.duration / 2 ;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/AnimationEffectTiming
Animation Effect Timing Properties	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Element.animate(), KeyframeEffectReadOnly.KeyframeEffectReadOnly(), and KeyframeEffect.KeyframeEffect() all accept a dictionary object containing the following timing properties. These properties are all optional, although without setting a duration the animation will not play.</p><pre><code>var timingProperties = {\n  delay: 1000,\n&#160; direction: "alternate",\n&#160; duration: 3000,\n&#160; easing: "ease-in",\n&#160; endDelay: 100, \n&#160; fill: "both",\n&#160; iterationStart: 1.5, \n&#160; iterations: Infinity\n}\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/AnimationEffectTimingProperties
Delay	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The delay property of the Web Animations API represents the number of milliseconds to delay the start of the animation.</p><pre><code>// Randomizer function\nvar getRandomMsRange = function(min, max) {\n&#160; return Math.random() * (max - min) + min;\n}\n\n// Loop through each tear\ntears.forEach(function(el) { &#160;\n\n  // Animate each tear\n&#160; el.animate(\n&#160; &#160; tearsFalling,&#160;\n&#160; &#160; {\n&#160; &#160; &#160; delay: getRandomMsRange(-1000, 1000), // randomized for each tear\n&#160; &#160; &#160; duration: getRandomMsRange(2000, 6000), // randomized for each tear\n&#160; &#160; &#160; iterations: Infinity,\n&#160; &#160; &#160; easing: "cubic-bezier(0.6, 0.04, 0.98, 0.335)"\n&#160; &#160; });\n});</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/AnimationEffectTimingProperties/delay
Direction	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The direction property of the Web Animations API represents the direction of the animation's playback along its timeline and its behavior after completing each iteration.</p><pre><code>// Get Alice's arm, and wave it up and down\ndocument.getElementById("alice_arm").animate([ \n  { transform: 'rotate(10deg)' },&#160;\n  { transform: 'rotate(-40deg)' }\n], {\n  easing: 'steps(2, end)',\n  iterations: Infinity,\n  direction: 'alternate',\n  duration: 600\n});</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/AnimationEffectTimingProperties/direction
Duration	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The duration property of the Web Animations API represents the duration in milliseconds to complete a single iteration of the animation.</p><pre><code>// Randomizer function\nvar getRandomMsRange = function(min, max) {\n  return Math.random() * (max - min) + min;\n}\n\n// Loop through each tear\ntears.forEach(function(el) { \n\n  // Animate each tear\n  el.animate(\n    tearsFalling,&#160;\n    {\n       delay: getRandomMsRange(-1000, 1000), // randomized for each tear\n       duration: getRandomMsRange(2000, 6000), // randomized for each tear\n       iterations: Infinity,\n       easing: "cubic-bezier(0.6, 0.04, 0.98, 0.335)"\n    });\n});</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/AnimationEffectTimingProperties/duration
Easing	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The easing property of the Web Animations API represents the timing function used to scale the time to produce easing effects. Easing is the rate of the animation's change over time.</p><pre><code>// Define the key frames\nvar spriteFrames = [\n  { transform: 'translateY(0)' },\n  { transform: 'translateY(-100%)' } &#160;&#160;\n];\n\n// Get the element that represents Alice and the Red Queen\nvar redQueen_alice_sprite = document.getElementById('red-queen_and_alice_sprite');\n\n// Animate Alice and the Red Queen using steps()\nvar redQueen_alice = redQueen_alice_sprite.animate(\nspriteFrames, {\n  easing: 'steps(7, end)',\n  direction: "reverse",\n  duration: 600,\n  playbackRate: 1,\n  iterations: Infinity\n});</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/AnimationEffectTimingProperties/easing
EndDelay	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The endDelay property of the Web Animations API represents the number of milliseconds to delay after the end time of an animation. The end time of an animation effect is simply the sum of its delay, duration, and endDelay.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/AnimationEffectTimingProperties/endDelay
Fill	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The fill property of the Web Animations API dictates how and when the animation's effects should be reflected by the element(s) visual state.</p><pre><code>// Create a set of keyframes to slide the rabbit down the hole--and keep him down with 'fill'!\nvar rabbitDownKeyframes = new KeyframeEffect(\n  whiteRabbit,\n  [\n    { transform: 'translateY(0%)' },&#160;\n    { transform: 'translateY(100%)' }\n  ], {\n    duration: 3000,&#160;\n    fill: 'forwards'&#160;\n  }\n);\n\n// Set up the rabbit's animation to play on command by calling rabbitDownAnimation.play() later\nvar rabbitDownAnimation = new Animation(rabbitDownKeyframes, document.timeline);\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/AnimationEffectTimingProperties/fill
Iterations	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The iterations property of the Web Animations API the number of times the animation should repeat. It defaults to 1, and can also take a value of Infinity to make it loop infinitely.</p><pre><code>// Get Alice's arm, and wave it up and down\ndocument.getElementById("alice_arm").animate([ \n  { transform: 'rotate(10deg)' },&#160;\n  { transform: 'rotate(-40deg)' }\n], {\n  easing: 'steps(2, end)',\n  iterations: Infinity,\n  direction: 'alternate',\n  duration: 600\n});</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/AnimationEffectTimingProperties/iterations
IterationStart	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The iterationStart property of the Web Animations API represents which repetition the animation begins at and its progress through it.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/AnimationEffectTimingProperties/iterationStart
AnimationEffectTimingReadOnly	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The AnimationEffectTimingReadOnly interface of the Web Animations API is comprised of timing properties.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/AnimationEffectTimingReadOnly
AnimationEffectTimingReadOnly.delay	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The delay property of the AnimationEffectTimingReadOnly object represents the number of milliseconds to delay the start of the animation.</p><pre><code>bringUI.effect.timing.delay = 2000;\nbringUI.play();\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/AnimationEffectTimingReadOnly/delay
AnimationEffectTimingReadOnly.direction	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The direction property of the AnimationEffectTimingReadOnly dictionary object represents the direction of the animation's playback along its timeline and its behavior after completing each iteration.</p><pre><code>// Returns "reverse" because the sprite was created upside down!\nreturn redQueen_alice.effect.timing.direction;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/AnimationEffectTimingReadOnly/direction
AnimationEffectTimingReadOnly.duration	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The duration property of AnimationEffectTimingReadOnly represents the duration in milliseconds to complete a single iteration of the animation.</p><pre><code>var sceneryTimingBackground = {\n  duration: 36000,\n  iterations: Infinity\n};\n\nvar sceneryTimingForeground = {\n  duration: 12000,\n  iterations: Infinity\n};\n\nvar background1 = document.getElementById('background1');\n\n// Animating the background\nvar background1Movement = background1.animate( sceneryFrames, sceneryTimingBackground );\n\n// Setting the background animation's start position based on its duration\nbackground1Movement.currentTime = background1Movement.effect.timing.duration / 2;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/AnimationEffectTimingReadOnly/duration
AnimationEffectTimingReadOnly.easing	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The easing property of the AnimationEffectTimingReadOnly object represents the timing function used to scale the time to produce easing effects. Easing is the rate of the animation's change over time.</p><pre><code>// Returns "steps(7, end)"\nreturn redQueen_alice.effect.timing.easing;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/AnimationEffectTimingReadOnly/easing
AnimationEffectTimingReadOnly.endDelay	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The endDelay property of AnimationEffectTimingReadOnly represents the number of milliseconds to delay after the end time of an animation. The end time of an animation effect is simply the sum of its delay, duration, and endDelay.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/AnimationEffectTimingReadOnly/endDelay
AnimationEffectTimingReadOnly.fill	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The fill property of AnimationEffectTimingReadOnly dictates how and when the animation's effects should be reflected by the element(s) visual state.</p><pre><code>var nommingCake = document.getElementById('eat-me_sprite').animate(\n [\n   { transform: 'translateY(0)' },\n   { transform: 'translateY(-80%)' } &#160;&#160;\n ], {\n   fill: 'forwards',\n   easing: 'steps(4, end)',\n   duration: aliceChange.effect.timing.duration / 2\n });\n nommingCake.pause();</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/AnimationEffectTimingReadOnly/fill
AnimationEffectTimingReadOnly.iterations	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The iterations property of AnimationEffectTimingReadOnly represents the number of times the animation should repeat. It defaults to 1, and can also take a value of Infinity to make it loop infinitely.</p><pre><code>// Infinity\nreturn redQueen_alice.effect.timing.iterations;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/AnimationEffectTimingReadOnly/iterations
AnimationEffectTimingReadOnly.iterationStart	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The iterationStart property of AnimationEffectTimingReadOnly represents which repetition the animation begins at and its progress through it.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/AnimationEffectTimingReadOnly/iterationStart
AnimationEvent	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The AnimationEvent interface represents events providing information related to animations.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/AnimationEvent
AnimationEvent()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The AnimationEvent() constructor returns a newly created AnimationEvent, representing an event in relation with an animation.</p><pre><code>animationEvent = new AnimationEvent(type, {animationName: aPropertyName, \n                                           elapsedTime  : aFloat, \n                                           pseudoElement: aPseudoElementName});\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/AnimationEvent/AnimationEvent
AnimationEvent.animationName	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The AnimationEvent.animationName read-only property is a DOMString containing the value of the animation-name CSS property associated with the transition.</p><pre><code>name = AnimationEvent.animationName</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/AnimationEvent/animationName
AnimationEvent.elapsedTime	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The AnimationEvent.elapsedTime read-only property is a float giving the amount of time the animation has been running, in seconds, when this event fired, excluding any time the animation was paused. For an "animationstart" event, elapsedTime is 0.0 unless there was a negative value for animation-delay, in which case the event will be fired with elapsedTime containing&#160; (-1 * delay).</p><pre><code>time = AnimationEvent.elapsedTime</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/AnimationEvent/elapsedTime
AnimationEvent.pseudoElement	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The AnimationEvent.pseudoElement read-only property is a DOMString, starting with '::', containing the name of the pseudo-element the animation runs on. If the animation doesn't run on a pseudo-element but on the element, an empty string: ''.</p><pre><code>name = AnimationEvent.pseudoElement</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/AnimationEvent/pseudoElement
AnimationPlaybackEvent	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The AnimationPlaybackEvent interface of the Web Animations API represents animation events.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/AnimationPlaybackEvent
AnimationPlaybackEvent.AnimationPlaybackEvent()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The AnimationPlaybackEvent() constructor of the Web Animations API returns a new AnimationPlaybackEvent object instance.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/AnimationPlaybackEvent/AnimationPlaybackEvent
AnimationPlaybackEvent.currentTime	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The currentTime read-only property of the AnimationPlaybackEvent interface represents the current time of the animation that generated the event at the moment the event is queued. This will be unresolved if the animation was idle at the time the event was generated.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/AnimationPlaybackEvent/currentTime
AnimationPlaybackEvent.timelineTime	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The timelineTime read-only property of the AnimationPlaybackEvent interface represents the time value of the animation's timeline at the moment the event is queued. This will be unresolved if the animation was not associated with a timeline at the time the event was generated or if the associated timeline was inactive.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/AnimationPlaybackEvent/timelineTime
AnimationTimeline	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The AnimationTimeline interface of the Web Animations API represents the timeline of animation. This interface exists to define timeline features (inherited by DocumentTimeline and future timeline objects) and is not itself accessed by developers.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/AnimationTimeline
AnimationTimeline.currentTime	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The currentTime read only property of the AnimationTimeline interface returns the current time value for the associated timeline in milliseconds or null if the timeline is inactive.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/AnimationTimeline/currentTime
Apps.mgmt	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Provides support for controlling Open Web apps in a browser.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Apps/mgmt
ArrayBufferView	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>ArrayBufferView is a helper type representing any of the following JavaScript TypedArray types:</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/ArrayBufferView
Attr	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>This type represents a DOM element's attribute as an object. In most DOM methods, you will probably directly retrieve the attribute as a string (e.g., Element.getAttribute(), but certain functions (e.g., Element.getAttributeNode()) or means of iterating give Attr types.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Attr
Attr.localName	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Attr.localName read-only property returns the local part of the qualified name of an element.</p><pre><code>name = attribute.localName\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Attr/localName
Attr.namespaceURI	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Attr.namespaceURI read-only property returns the namespace URI of the attribute, or null if the element is not in a namespace.</p><pre><code>namespace = attribute.namespaceURI</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Attr/namespaceURI
Attr.prefix	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Attr.prefix read-only property returns the namespace prefix of the specified attribute, or null if no prefix is specified.</p><pre><code>string = attribute.prefix\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Attr/prefix
AudioBuffer	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Objects of these types are designed to hold small audio snippets, typically less than 45 s. For longer sounds, objects implementing the MediaElementAudioSourceNode are more suitable. The buffer contains data in the following format:  non-interleaved IEEE754 32-bit linear PCM with a nominal range between -1 and +1, that is, 32bits floating point buffer, with each samples between -1.0 and 1.0. If the AudioBuffer has multiple channels, they are stored in separate buffer.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/AudioBuffer
AudioBuffer.copyFromChannel()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The copyFromChannel() method of the AudioBuffer interface copies the samples from the specified channel of the AudioBuffer to the destination array.</p><pre><code>myArrayBuffer.copyFromChannel(destination,channelNumber,startInChannel);</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/AudioBuffer/copyFromChannel
AudioBuffer.copyToChannel()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The copyToChannel() method of the AudioBuffer interface copies the samples to the specified channel of the AudioBuffer, from the source array.</p><pre><code>myArrayBuffer.copyToChannel(source, channelNumber, startInChannel);</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/AudioBuffer/copyToChannel
AudioBuffer.duration	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>A double.</p><pre><code>var myArrayBuffer = audioCtx.createBuffer(2, frameCount, audioCtx.sampleRate);\nmyArrayBuffer.duration;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/AudioBuffer/duration
AudioBuffer.getChannelData()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>A Float32Array.</p><pre><code>var myArrayBuffer = audioCtx.createBuffer(2, frameCount, audioCtx.sampleRate);\nvar nowBuffering = myArrayBuffer.getChannelData(channel);</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/AudioBuffer/getChannelData
AudioBuffer.length	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>A float.</p><pre><code>var myArrayBuffer = audioCtx.createBuffer(2, frameCount, audioCtx.sampleRate);\nmyArrayBuffer.length;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/AudioBuffer/length
AudioBuffer.numberOfChannels	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>An integer.</p><pre><code>var myArrayBuffer = audioCtx.createBuffer(2, frameCount, audioCtx.sampleRate);\nmyArrayBuffer.numberOfChannels;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/AudioBuffer/numberOfChannels
AudioBuffer.sampleRate	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>A float.</p><pre><code>var myArrayBuffer = audioCtx.createBuffer(2, frameCount, audioCtx.sampleRate);\nmyArrayBuffer.sampleRate;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/AudioBuffer/sampleRate
AudioBufferSourceNode	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The AudioBufferSourceNode interface represents an audio source consisting of in-memory audio data, stored in an AudioBuffer. It is an AudioNode that acts as an audio source.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/AudioBufferSourceNode
AudioBufferSourceNode.buffer	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>If the buffer property is set to the value NULL, it defines a single channel of silence.</p><pre><code>var source = audioCtx.createBufferSource();\n// from audioCtx.createBuffer, or audioCtx.decodeAudioData\nsource.buffer = myBuffer; \n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/AudioBufferSourceNode/buffer
AudioBufferSourceNode.detune	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The detune property of the AudioBufferSourceNode interface is an k-rate AudioParam representing detuning of oscillation in cents.</p><pre><code>var source = audioCtx.createBufferSource();\nsource.detune.value = 100; // value in cents</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/AudioBufferSourceNode/detune
AudioBufferSourceNode.loop	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The loop property's default value is false.</p><pre><code>var source = audioCtx.createBufferSource();\nsource.loop = true;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/AudioBufferSourceNode/loop
AudioBufferSourceNode.loopEnd	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The loopEnd property's default value is 0.</p><pre><code>var source = audioCtx.createBufferSource();\nsource.loopEnd = 3;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/AudioBufferSourceNode/loopEnd
AudioBufferSourceNode.loopStart	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The loopStart property's default value is 0.</p><pre><code>var source = audioCtx.createBufferSource();\nsource.loopStart = 3;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/AudioBufferSourceNode/loopStart
AudioBufferSourceNode.onended	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The onended event handler of the AudioBufferSourceNode contains the callback associated with the ended event: this allows you to run code in response to the audio track finishing playback.</p><pre><code>var source = audioCtx.createBufferSource();\nsource.onended = function() { ... };\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/AudioBufferSourceNode/onended
AudioBufferSourceNode.playbackRate	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The default value is 1.0. When set to another value, the AudioBufferSourceNode resamples the audio before sending it to the output.</p><pre><code>var source = audioCtx.createBufferSource();\nsource.playbackRate.value = 1.25; // play 25% faster than normal speed (1)\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/AudioBufferSourceNode/playbackRate
AudioBufferSourceNode.start()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The most simple example just starts the audio buffer playing from the beginning — you don't need to specify any parameters in this case:</p><pre><code>var source = audioCtx.createBufferSource();\nsource.start(audioCtx.currentTime + 1,3,10);\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/AudioBufferSourceNode/start
AudioBufferSourceNode.stop()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The most simple example just stops the audio buffer playing immediately — you don't need to specify any parameters in this case:</p><pre><code>var source = audioCtx.createBufferSource();\nsource.stop(audioCtx.currentTime + 3);\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/AudioBufferSourceNode/stop
AudioContext	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>An AudioContext can be a target of events, therefore it implements the EventTarget interface.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/AudioContext
AudioContext.close()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The close() method of the AudioContext Interface closes the audio context, releasing any system audio resources that it uses.</p><pre><code>var audioCtx = new AudioContext();\naudioCtx.close().then(function() { ... });\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/AudioContext/close
AudioContext.createAnalyser()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>An AnalyserNode.</p><pre><code>var audioCtx = new AudioContext();\nvar analyser = audioCtx.createAnalyser();</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/AudioContext/createAnalyser

AudioContext.createChannelMerger()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>A ChannelMergerNode.</p><pre><code>var audioCtx = new AudioContext();\nvar merger = audioCtx.createChannelMerger(2);</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/AudioContext/createChannelMerger

AudioContext.createDelay()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>A DelayNode.</p><pre><code>var audioCtx = new AudioContext();\nvar synthDelay = audioCtx.createDelay(5.0);</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/AudioContext/createDelay
AudioContext.createDynamicsCompressor()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Compression lowers the volume of the loudest parts of the signal and raises the volume of the softest parts. Overall, a louder, richer, and fuller sound can be achieved. It is especially important in games and musical applications where large numbers of individual sounds are played simultaneously, where you want to control the overall signal level and help avoid clipping (distorting) of the audio output.</p><pre><code>var audioCtx = new AudioContext();\nvar compressor = audioCtx.createDynamicsCompressor();</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/AudioContext/createDynamicsCompressor
AudioContext.createGain()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>A GainNode.</p><pre><code>var audioCtx = new AudioContext();\nvar gainNode = audioCtx.createGain();</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/AudioContext/createGain
AudioContext.createIIRFilter()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The createIIRFilter() method of the AudioContext interface creates an IIRFilterNode, which represents a general infinite impulse response (IIR) filter which can be configured to serve as various types of filter.</p><pre><code>var iirFilter = AudioContext.createIIRFilter(feedforward, feedback);</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/AudioContext/createIIRFilter
AudioContext.createMediaElementSource()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>For more details about media element audio source nodes, check out the MediaElementAudioSourceNode reference page.</p><pre><code>var audioCtx = new AudioContext();\nvar source = audioCtx.createMediaElementSource(myMediaElement);</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/AudioContext/createMediaElementSource
AudioContext.createMediaStreamDestination()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The MediaStream is created when the node is created and is accessible via the MediaStreamAudioDestinationNode 's strea m attribute. This stream can be used in a similar way as a MediaStream obtained via navigator.getUserMedia — it can, for example, be sent to a remote peer using the RTCPeerConnection addStream() method.</p><pre><code>var audioCtx = new AudioContext();\nvar destination = audioCtx.createMediaStreamDestination();</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/AudioContext/createMediaStreamDestination
AudioContext.createMediaStreamSource()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>For more details about media stream audio source nodes, check out the MediaStreamAudioSourceNode reference page.</p><pre><code>var audioCtx = new AudioContext();\nvar source = audioCtx.createMediaStreamSource(stream);</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/AudioContext/createMediaStreamSource
AudioContext.createOscillator()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>An OscillatorNode.</p><pre><code>var audioCtx = new AudioContext();\nvar oscillator = audioCtx.createOscillator();</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/AudioContext/createOscillator
AudioContext.createPanner()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The panner node is spatialized in relation to the AudioContext's AudioListener (defined by the AudioContext.listener attribute), which represents the position and orientation of the person listening to the audio.</p><pre><code>var audioCtx = new AudioContext();\nvar panner = audioCtx.createPanner();</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/AudioContext/createPanner
AudioContext.createPeriodicWave()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>A PeriodicWave.</p><pre><code>var audioCtx = new AudioContext();\nvar wave = audioCtx.createPeriodicWave(real, imag, constraints);</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/AudioContext/createPeriodicWave
AudioContext.createScriptProcessor()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>A ScriptProcessorNode.</p><pre><code>var audioCtx = new AudioContext();\nmyScriptProcessor = audioCtx.createScriptProcessor(1024, 1, 1);</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/AudioContext/createScriptProcessor

AudioContext.decodeAudioData()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>This is the preferred method of creating an audio source for Web Audio API from an audio track.</p><pre><code>audioCtx.decodeAudioData(audioData, function(decodedData) {\n  // use the dec&#8203;oded data here\n});</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/AudioContext/decodeAudioData

AudioContext.mozAudioChannelType	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The readonly mozAudioChannelType property of the AudioContext interface can be used to set the audio channel that the sound playing in an audio context element will play in, on a Firefox OS device.</p><pre><code>var audioCtx = new AudioContext();\nvar myAudioChannelType = audioCtx.mozAudioChannelType;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/AudioContext/mozAudioChannelType
AudioContext.onstatechange	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The following snippet is taken from our AudioContext states demo (see it running live.) The onstatechange hander is used to log the current state to the console every time it changes.</p><pre><code>var audioCtx = new AudioContext();\naudioCtx.onstatechange = function() { ... };</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/AudioContext/onstatechange
AudioContext.resume()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The resume() method of the AudioContext Interface resumes the progression of time in an audio context that has previously been suspended.</p><pre><code>var audioCtx = new AudioContext();\naudioCtx.resume().then(function() { ... });\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/AudioContext/resume
AudioContext.sampleRate	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>A floating point number.</p><pre><code>var audioCtx = new AudioContext();\nvar mySampleRate = audioCtx.sampleRate;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/AudioContext/sampleRate
AudioContext.state	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>A DOMString. Possible values are:</p><pre><code>var audioCtx = new AudioContext();\nvar myState = audioCtx.state;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/AudioContext/state
AudioContext.suspend()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The suspend() method of the AudioContext Interface suspends the progression of time in the audio context, temporarily halting audio hardware access and reducing CPU/battery usage in the process — this is useful if you want an application to power down the audio hardware when it will not be using an audio context for a while.</p><pre><code>var audioCtx = new AudioContext();\naudioCtx.suspend().then(function() { ... });\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/AudioContext/suspend
AudioDestinationNode	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>AudioDestinationNode has no output (as it is the output, no more AudioNode can be linked after it in the audio graph) and one input. The amount of channels in the input must be between 0 and the maxChannelCount value or an exception is raised.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/AudioDestinationNode
AudioDestinationNode.maxChannelCount	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>An unsigned long.</p><pre><code>var audioCtx = new AudioContext();\nvar myDestination = audioCtx.destination;\nmyDestination.maxChannelCount = 2;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/AudioDestinationNode/maxChannelCount
AudioListener	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>It is important to note that there is only one listener per context and that it isn't an AudioNode.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/AudioListener
AudioListener.dopplerFactor	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>A double.</p><pre><code>var audioCtx = new AudioContext();\nvar myListener = audioCtx.listener;\nmyListener.dopplerFactor = 1;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/AudioListener/dopplerFactor
AudioListener.setOrientation()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Void.</p><pre><code>var audioCtx = new AudioContext();\nvar myListener = audioCtx.listener;\nmyListener.setOrientation(0,0,-1,0,1,0);</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/AudioListener/setOrientation
AudioListener.setPosition()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Void.</p><pre><code>var audioCtx = new AudioContext();\nvar myListener = audioCtx.listener;\nmyListener.setPosition(1,1,1);</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/AudioListener/setPosition
AudioListener.speedOfSound	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The speedOfSound property of the AudioListener interface is a double value representing the speed of sound, in meters per second.</p><pre><code>var audioCtx = new AudioContext();\nvar myListener = audioCtx.listener;\nmyListener.speedOfSound = 343.3;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/AudioListener/speedOfSound
AudioNode	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The AudioNode interface is a generic interface for representing an audio processing module like an audio source (e.g. an HTML audio or video element, an OscillatorNode, etc.), the audio destination, intermediate processing module (e.g. a filter like BiquadFilterNode or ConvolverNode), or volume control (like GainNode).</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/AudioNode
AudioNode.channelCount	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>channelCount 's usage and precise definition depend on the value of AudioNode.channelCountMode :</p><pre><code>var oscillator = audioCtx.createOscillator();\nvar channels = oscillator.channelCount;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/AudioNode/channelCount
AudioNode.channelCountMode	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The possible values of channelCountMode and their meanings are:</p><pre><code>var oscillator = audioCtx.createOscillator();\noscillator.channelCountMode = 'explicit';</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/AudioNode/channelCountMode
AudioNode.channelInterpretation	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>When the amount of channels doesn't match between an input and an output, up- or down-mixing happens according the following rules. This can be somewhat controlled by setting the AudioNode.channelInterpretation property to speakers or discrete.</p><pre><code>var oscillator = audioCtx.createOscillator();\noscillator.channelInterpretation = 'discrete';</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/AudioNode/channelInterpretation
AudioNode.connect(AudioNode)	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>A reference to the destination AudioNode object. In some browsers older implementations of this interface return void.</p><pre><code>var AudioNode = AudioNode.connect(destination, output, input)</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/AudioNode/connect(AudioNode)
AudioNode.connect(AudioParam)	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>It is possible to connect an AudioNode output to more than one AudioParam, and more than one AudioNode output to a single AudioParam, with multiple calls to connect(). Fan-in and fan-out are therefore supported.</p><pre><code>var lfo = audioCtx.createOscillator();\nlfo.frequency.value = 2.0; // Hz, two times per second\n\nvar lfoGain = audioCtx.createGain();\nlfoGain.gain.value = 0.5;\n\n// this is the parameter that is going to be modulated\nvar gain = audioCtx.createGain();\ngain.gain.value = 0.5;\n\n// Oscillators go from -1 to 1\n// Make it go from -0.5 to +0.5 by connecting it to a GainNode with a gain value of 0.5\nlfo.connect(lfoGain);\n\n// because the value of the gain.gain AudioParam is originaly 0.5, the value is added, and it will go from 0.0 to 1.0\nlfoGain.connect(gain.gain);\n\nlfo.connect(gain.gain);</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/AudioNode/connect(AudioParam)
AudioNode.context	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>An AudioContext object.</p><pre><code>var aContext = anAudioNode.context;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/AudioNode/context
AudioNode.disconnect()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>undefined</p><pre><code>AudioNode.disconnect();\n\nAudioNode.disconnect(output);\n\nAudioNode.disconnect(destination);\n\nAudioNode.disconnect(destination, output);\n\nAudioNode.disconnect(destination, output, input);\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/AudioNode/disconnect
AudioNode.numberOfInputs	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>An integer.</p><pre><code>var oscillator = audioCtx.createOscillator();\nvar inputs = oscillator.numberOfInputs;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/AudioNode/numberOfInputs

In some browsers older implementations of this interface return void.</p><pre><code>var AudioParam = AudioParam.cancelScheduledValues(startTime)</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/AudioParam/cancelScheduledValues

AudioParam.linearRampToValueAtTime()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>NOTE: both the example and live example are incorrect, see https://github.com/WebAudio/web-audio-api/issues/34</p><pre><code>var AudioParam = AudioParam.linearRampToValueAtTime(value, endTime)</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/AudioParam/linearRampToValueAtTime
maxValue	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The maxValue property of the AudioParam interface represents the maximum possible value for the parameter's nominal (effective) range.</p><pre><code>var maxVal = AudioParam.maxValue</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/AudioParam/maxValue
minValue	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The minValue property of the AudioParam interface represents the minimum possible value for the parameter's nominal (effective) range.</p><pre><code>var minVal = AudioParam.minValue</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/AudioParam/minValue
AudioParam.setTargetAtTime()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The change starts at the time specified in startTime and exponentially moves towards the value given by the target parameter. The exponential decay rate is defined by the timeConstant parameter. This is the time it takes a first-order linear continuous time-invariant system to reach the value 1 - 1/e (around 63.2%) given a step input response (transition from 0 to 1 value): basically, the larger it is, the slower the transition will be.  This is useful for decay or release portions of envelopes.</p><pre><code>var AudioParam = AudioParam.setTargetAtTime(target, startTime, timeConstant)</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/AudioParam/setTargetAtTime
AudioParam.setValueAtTime()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>A reference to this AudioParam object. In some browsers older implementations of this interface return void.</p><pre><code>var AudioParam = AudioParam.setValueAtTime(value, startTime)</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/AudioParam/setValueAtTime
AudioParam.setValueCurveAtTime()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>A reference to this AudioParam object. In some browsers older implementations of this interface return void.</p><pre><code>var AudioParam = AudioParam.setValueCurveAtTime(values, startTime, duration)</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/AudioParam/setValueCurveAtTime
AudioParam.value	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Though value can be set, any modifications happening while there are automation events scheduled — that is, events scheduled using the methods of the AudioParam — are ignored, without raising any exception.</p><pre><code>var gainNode = audioCtx.createGain();\ngainNode.gain.value = 0; //'gain' is the AudioParam</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/AudioParam/value

Battery Status API	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Battery Status API, more often referred to as the Battery API, provides information about the system's battery charge level and lets you be notified by events that are sent when the battery level or charging status change. This can be used to adjust your app's resource usage to reduce battery drain when the battery is low, or to save changes before the battery runs out in order to prevent data loss.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Battery_Status_API
Beacon API	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Beacon interface is used to schedule an asynchronous and non-blocking request to a web server. Beacon requests use the HTTP PUT method and requests typically do not require a response. Requests are guaranteed to be initiated before a page is unloaded and they are run to completion without requiring a blocking request (for example XMLHttpRequest).</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Beacon_API
Using the Beacon API	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Beacon interface schedules an asynchronous and non-blocking request to a web server. Beacon requests use HTTP PUT and requests do not require a response. Requests are guaranteed to be initiated before a page is unloaded and they are run to completion without requiring a blocking request (for example XMLHttpRequest).</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Beacon_API/Using_the_Beacon_API

BluetoothRemoteGATTCharacteristic.getDescriptor()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The BluetoothRemoteGATTCharacteristic.getDescriptor() method returns a Promise that resolves to the first BluetoothGATTDescriptor for a given descriptor UUID.</p><pre><code>BluetoothRemoteGATTCharacteristic.getDescriptor(bluetoothDescriptorUUID).then(function(bluetoothGATTDescriptor) { ... })</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/BluetoothRemoteGATTCharacteristic/getDescriptor

BluetoothRemoteGATTCharacteristic.readValue()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The BluetoothRemoteGATTCharacteristic.readValue() method returns a Promise that resolves to an DataView holding a duplicate of the value property if it is available and supported. Otherwise it throws an error.</p><pre><code>BluetoothRemoteGATTCharacteristic.readValue().then(function(dataView) { ... })</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/BluetoothRemoteGATTCharacteristic/readValue
BluetoothRemoteGATTCharacteristic.service	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The BluetoothRemoteGATTCharacteristic.service read-only property returns the BluetoothGATTService this characteristic belongs to.</p><pre><code>var bluetoothRemoteGATTServiceInstance = BluetoothRemoteGATTCharacteristic.service</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/BluetoothRemoteGATTCharacteristic/service

BluetoothRemoteGATTCharacteristic.stopNotifications()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The BluetoothRemoteGATTCharacteristic.stopNotifications() method returns a Promise to the BluetoothRemoteGATTCharacteristic instance when there is no longer an active notification on it.</p><pre><code>BluetoothRemoteGATTCharacteristic.stopNotifications().then(function(BluetoothRemoteGATTCharacteristic) { ... })</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/BluetoothRemoteGATTCharacteristic/stopNotifications
BluetoothRemoteGATTCharacteristic.uuid	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The BluetoothRemoteGATTCharacteristic.uuid read-only property returns DOMString containing the UUID of the characteristic, for example '00002a37-0000-1000-8000-00805f9b34fb' for the Heart Rate Measurement characteristic.</p><pre><code>var uuid = BluetoothRemoteGATTCharacteristic.uuid</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/BluetoothRemoteGATTCharacteristic/uuid
BluetoothRemoteGATTCharacteristic.value	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The BluetoothRemoteGATTCharacteristic.value read-only property returns currently cached characteristic value. This value gets updated when the value of the characteristic is read or updated via a notification or indication.</p><pre><code>var value = BluetoothRemoteGATTCharacteristic.value</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/BluetoothRemoteGATTCharacteristic/value
BluetoothRemoteGATTCharacteristic.writeValue()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The BluetoothRemoteGATTCharacteristic.writeValue() method sets the value property to the bytes contained in an ArrayBuffer and returns a Promise.</p><pre><code>BluetoothRemoteGATTCharacteristic.writeValue(value).then(function() { ... })</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/BluetoothRemoteGATTCharacteristic/writeValue

It can be false while the user agent is physically connected.</p><pre><code>var connected = BluetoothRemoteGATTServer.connected</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/BluetoothRemoteGATTServer/connected

BluetoothStatusChangedEvent.address	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The address property represents the address of the device for which the status has changed in the Bluetooth micro-network.</p><pre><code>var address = instanceOfBluetoothStatusChangedEvent.address</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/BluetoothStatusChangedEvent/address

Body	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Body mixin of the Fetch API represents the body of the response/request, allowing you to declare what its content type is and how it should be handled.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Body
Body.arrayBuffer()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The arrayBuffer() method of the Body mixin takes a Response stream and reads it to completion. It returns a promise that resolves with an ArrayBuffer.</p><pre><code>response.arrayBuffer().then(function(buffer) {\n  // do something with buffer\n});</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Body/arrayBuffer
Body.blob()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The blob() method of the Body mixin takes a Response stream and reads it to completion. It returns a promise that resolves with a Blob.</p><pre><code>response.blob().then(function(myBlob) {\n  // do something with myBlob\n});</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Body/blob
Body.bodyUsed	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The bodyUsed read-only property of the Body mixin contains a Boolean that indicates whether the body has been read yet.</p><pre><code>var myBodyUsed = response.bodyUsed;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Body/bodyUsed
Body.formData()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The formData() method of the Body mixin takes a Response stream and reads it to completion. It returns a promise that resolves with a FormData object.</p><pre><code>response.formData().then(function(formdata) {\n  // do something with your formdata\n});</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Body/formData
Body.json()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The json() method of the Body mixin takes a Response stream and reads it to completion. It returns a promise that resolves with an object literal containing the JSON data.</p><pre><code>response.json().then(function(json) {\n  // do something with your JSON\n});</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Body/json
Body.text()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The text() method of the Body mixin takes a Response stream and reads it to completion. It returns a promise that resolves with a USVString object (text).</p><pre><code>response.text().then(function (text) {\n  // do something with the text response \n});</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Body/text
BroadcastChannel	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The BroadcastChannel interface represents a named channel that any browsing context of a given origin can subscribe to. It allows communication between different documents (in different windows, tabs, frames or iframes) of the same origin. Messages are broadcasted via a message event fired at all BroadcastChannel objects listening to the channel.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/BroadcastChannel
BroadcastChannel()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The BroadcastChannel() constructor creates a new BroadcastChannel and connects it to the underlying channel.</p><pre><code> channel = new BroadcastChannel(channel);</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/BroadcastChannel/BroadcastChannel
BroadcastChannel.close()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The BroadcastChannel.close() terminates the connection to the underlying channel, allowing the object to be garbage collected. This is a necessary step to perform as there is no other way for a browser to know that this channel is not needed anymore.</p><pre><code>var str = channel.close();\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/BroadcastChannel/close
BroadcastChannel.name	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The read-only BroadcastChannel.name property returns a DOMString, which uniquely identifies the given channel with its name. This name is passed to the BroadcastChannel() constructor at creation time and is therefore read-only.</p><pre><code>var str = channel.name;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/BroadcastChannel/name
BroadcastChannel.onmessage	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The BroadcastChannel.onmessage event handler is a property that specifies the function to execute when a message event, of type MessageEvent, is received by this BroadcastChannel. Such an event is sent by the browser with a message broadcasted to the channel.</p><pre><code>channel.onmessage = function;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/BroadcastChannel/onmessage
BroadcastChannel.postMessage()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The BroadcastChannel.postMessage() sends a message, which can be of any kind of Object, to each listener in any browser context with the same origin. The message is transmitted as a message event targeted at each BroadcastChannel bound to the channel.</p><pre><code>var str = channel.postMessage(object);\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/BroadcastChannel/postMessage
Broadcast Channel API	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Broadcast Channel API allows simple communication between browsing contexts (that is windows, tabs, frames, or iframes) with the same origin (usually pages from the same site).</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Broadcast_Channel_API
BufferSource	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>BufferSource is a helper type representing objects that are either themselves an ArrayBuffer, or conform to ArrayBufferView.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/BufferSource
ByteString	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>ByteString is a UTF-8 String that corresponds to the set of all possible sequences of bytes. ByteString maps to a String when returned in JavaScript; generally, it's only used when interfacing with protocols that use bytes and strings interchangably, such as HTTP.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/ByteString
Cache	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Cache interface provides a storage mechanism for Request / Response object pairs that are cached, for example as part of the ServiceWorker life cycle. Note that the Cache interface is exposed to windowed scopes as well as workers. You don't have to use it in conjunction with service workers, even though it is defined in the service worker spec.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Cache
Cache.add()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The add() method of the Cache interface takes a URL, retrieves it and adds the resulting response object to the given cache. The add() method is functionally equivalent to the following:</p><pre><code>cache.add(request).then(function() {\n  //request has been added to the cache\n});\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Cache/add
Cache.addAll()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The addAll() method of the Cache interface takes an array of URLS, retrieves them, and adds the resulting response objects to the given cache. The request objects created during retrieval become keys to the stored response operations.&#160;</p><pre><code>cache.addAll(requests[]).then(function() {\n  //requests have been added to the cache\n});\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Cache/addAll
Cache.delete()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The delete() method of the Cache interface finds the Cache entry whose key is the request, and if found, deletes the Cache entry and returns a Promise that resolves to true. If no Cache entry is found, it returns false.</p><pre><code>cache.delete(request,{options}).then(function(true) {\n  //your cache entry has been deleted\n});\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Cache/delete
Cache.keys()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The keys() method of the Cache interface returns a Promise that resolves to an array of Cache keys.</p><pre><code>cache.keys(request,{options}).then(function(keys) {\n  //do something with your array of requests\n});\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Cache/keys
Cache.match()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The match() method of the Cache interface returns a Promise that resolves to the Response associated with the first matching request in the Cache object. If no match is found, the Promise resolves to undefined.</p><pre><code>cache.match(request,{options}).then(function(response) {\n  //do something with the response\n});\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Cache/match
Cache.matchAll()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The matchAll() method of the Cache interface returns a Promise that resolves to an array of all matching requests in the Cache object.</p><pre><code>cache.matchAll(request,{options}).then(function(response) {\n  //do something with the response array\n});\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Cache/matchAll
Cache.put()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The put() method of the Cache interface allows key/value pairs to be added to the current Cache object.</p><pre><code>cache.put(request, response).then(function() {\n  // request/response pair has been added to the cache\n});\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Cache/put
CacheStorage	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The CacheStorage interface represents the storage for Cache objects. It provides a master directory of all the named caches that a ServiceWorker, other type of worker or window scope can access (you don't have to use it with service workers, even though that is the spec that defines it) and maintains a mapping of string names to corresponding Cache objects.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CacheStorage
CacheStorage.delete()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The delete () method of the CacheStorage interface finds the Cache object matching the cacheName, and if found, deletes the Cache object and returns a Promise that resolves to true. If no Cache object is found, it returns false.</p><pre><code>caches.delete(cacheName).then(function(true) {\n  //your cache is now deleted\n});\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CacheStorage/delete
CacheStorage.has()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The has() method of the CacheStorage interface returns a Promise that resolves to true if a Cache object matches the cacheName.</p><pre><code>caches.has(cacheName).then(function(true) {\n  // your cache exists!\n});\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CacheStorage/has
CacheStorage.keys()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The keys () method of the CacheStorage interface returns a Promise that will resolve with an array containing strings corresponding to all of the named Cache objects tracked by the CacheStorage object in the order they were created. Use this method to iterate over a list of all Cache objects.</p><pre><code>caches.keys().then(function(keyList) {\n  //do something with your keyList\n});\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CacheStorage/keys
CacheStorage.match()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The match() method of the CacheStorage interface checks if a given Request is a key in any of the Cache objects that the CacheStorage object tracks and returns a Promise that resolves to the matching Response.</p><pre><code>caches.match(request,{options}).then(function(response) {\n  //do something with the request\n});\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CacheStorage/match
CacheStorage.open()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The open() method of the CacheStorage interface returns a Promise that resolves to the Cache object matching the cacheName.</p><pre><code>caches.open(cacheName).then(function(cache) {\n  //do something with your cache\n});\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CacheStorage/open
