CanvasCaptureMediaStream.requestFrame()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The CanvasCaptureMediaStream.requestFrame() method forces a frame to be captured and sent to the stream. This allows to capture partially rendered frames.</p><pre><code>stream.requestFrame();\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasCaptureMediaStream/requestFrame
CanvasGradient	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The CanvasGradient interface represents an opaque object describing a gradient. It is returned by the methods CanvasRenderingContext2D.createLinearGradient() or CanvasRenderingContext2D.createRadialGradient().</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasGradient
CanvasGradient.addColorStop()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The CanvasGradient.addColorStop() method adds a new stop, defined by an offset and a color, to the gradient. If the offset is not between 0 and 1, an INDEX_SIZE_ERR is raised, if the color can't be parsed as a CSS color, a SYNTAX_ERR is raised.</p><pre><code>void gradient.addColorStop(offset, color);\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasGradient/addColorStop
CanvasImageSource	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>CanvasImageSource is a helper type representing any objects of one of the following types: HTMLImageElement, HTMLVideoElement, HTMLCanvasElement, or ImageBitmap.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasImageSource
CanvasPattern	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The CanvasPattern interface represents an opaque object describing a pattern, based on an image, a canvas or a video, created by the CanvasRenderingContext2D.createPattern() method.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasPattern
CanvasPattern.setTransform()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The CanvasPattern.setTransform() method uses an SVGMatrix object as the pattern's transformation matrix and invokes it on the pattern.</p><pre><code>void pattern.setTransform(matrix);\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasPattern/setTransform
CanvasRenderingContext2D	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>To get an object of this interface, call getContext() on a canvas element, supplying "2d" as the argument:</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D
CanvasRenderingContext2D.addHitRegion()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The CanvasRenderingContext2D.addHitRegion() method of the Canvas 2D API adds a hit region to the bitmap. This allows you to make hit detection easier, lets you route events to DOM elements, and makes it possible for users to explore the canvas without seeing it.</p><pre><code>void ctx.addHitRegion(options);\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/addHitRegion
CanvasRenderingContext2D.arc()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The CanvasRenderingContext2D.arc() method of the Canvas 2D API adds an arc to the path which is centered at (x, y) position with radius r starting at startAngle and ending at endAngle going in the given direction by anticlockwise (defaulting to clockwise).</p><pre><code>void ctx.arc(x, y, radius, startAngle, endAngle, anticlockwise);\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/arc
CanvasRenderingContext2D.arcTo()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The CanvasRenderingContext2D.arcTo() method of the Canvas 2D API adds an arc to the path with the given control points and radius, connected to the previous point by a straight line.</p><pre><code>void ctx.arcTo(x1, y1, x2, y2, radius);\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/arcTo
CanvasRenderingContext2D.asyncDrawXULElement()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The non-standard and internal only CanvasRenderingContext2D.asyncDrawXULElement() method of the Canvas 2D API renders a region of a XUL element into the canvas.</p><pre><code>void ctx.asyncDrawXULElement(element, x, y, w, h, bgColor, flags = 0);\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/asyncDrawXULElement
CanvasRenderingContext2D.beginPath()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The CanvasRenderingContext2D.beginPath() method of the Canvas 2D API starts a new path by emptying the list of sub-paths. Call this method when you want to create a new path.</p><pre><code>void ctx.beginPath();\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/beginPath
CanvasRenderingContext2D.bezierCurveTo()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The CanvasRenderingContext2D.bezierCurveTo() method of the Canvas 2D API adds a cubic Bézier curve to the path. It requires three points. The first two points are control points and the third one is the end point. The starting point is the last point in the current path, which can be changed using moveTo() before creating the Bézier curve.</p><pre><code>void ctx.bezierCurveTo(cp1x, cp1y, cp2x, cp2y, x, y);\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/bezierCurveTo
CanvasRenderingContext2D.canvas	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The CanvasRenderingContext2D.canvas property is a read-only reference to the HTMLCanvasElement object that is associated with the context. It might be null if there is no association with an canvas element.</p><pre><code>ctx.canvas;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/canvas
CanvasRenderingContext2D.clearHitRegions()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The CanvasRenderingContext2D.clearHitRegions() method of the Canvas 2D API removes all hit regions from the canvas.</p><pre><code>void ctx.clearHitRegions();\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/clearHitRegions
CanvasRenderingContext2D.clearRect()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The CanvasRenderingContext2D.clearRect() method of the Canvas 2D API sets all pixels in the rectangle defined by starting point (x, y) and size (width, height) to transparent black, erasing any previously drawn content.</p><pre><code>void ctx.clearRect(x, y, width, height);\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/clearRect
CanvasRenderingContext2D.clip()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The CanvasRenderingContext2D.clip() method of the Canvas 2D API turns the path currently being built into the current clipping path.</p><pre><code>void ctx.clip();\nvoid ctx.clip(fillRule);\nvoid ctx.clip(path, fillRule);\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/clip
CanvasRenderingContext2D.closePath()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The CanvasRenderingContext2D.closePath() method of the Canvas 2D API causes the point of the pen to move back to the start of the current sub-path. It tries to add a straight line (but does not actually draw it) from the current point to the start. If the shape has already been closed or has only one point, this function does nothing.</p><pre><code>void ctx.closePath();\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/closePath
CanvasRenderingContext2D.createImageData()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The CanvasRenderingContext2D.createImageData() method of the Canvas 2D API creates a new, blank ImageData object with the specified dimensions. All of the pixels in the new object are transparent black.</p><pre><code>ImageData ctx.createImageData(width, height);\nImageData ctx.createImageData(imagedata);\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/createImageData
CanvasRenderingContext2D.createLinearGradient()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The CanvasRenderingContext2D.createLinearGradient() method of the Canvas 2D API creates a gradient along the line given by the coordinates represented by the parameters. This method returns a linear CanvasGradient.</p><pre><code>CanvasGradient ctx.createLinearGradient(x0, y0, x1, y1);\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/createLinearGradient
CanvasRenderingContext2D.createPattern()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The CanvasRenderingContext2D.createPattern() method of the Canvas 2D API creates a pattern using the specified image (a CanvasImageSource). It repeats the source in the directions specified by the repetition argument. This method returns a CanvasPattern.</p><pre><code>CanvasPattern ctx.createPattern(image, repetition);\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/createPattern
CanvasRenderingContext2D.createRadialGradient()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The CanvasRenderingContext2D.createRadialGradient() method of the Canvas 2D API creates a radial gradient given by the coordinates of the two circles represented by the parameters. This method returns a CanvasGradient.</p><pre><code>CanvasGradient ctx.createRadialGradient(x0, y0, r0, x1, y1, r1);\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/createRadialGradient
CanvasRenderingContext2D.currentTransform	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The CanvasRenderingContext2D.currentTransform property of the Canvas 2D API returns or sets an SVGMatrix object for the current transformation matrix.</p><pre><code>ctx.currentTransform [= value];\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/currentTransform
CanvasRenderingContext2D.direction	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The CanvasRenderingContext2D.direction property of the Canvas 2D API specifies the current text direction used when drawing text.</p><pre><code>ctx.direction = "ltr" || "rtl" || "inherit";\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/direction
CanvasRenderingContext2D.drawFocusIfNeeded()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The CanvasRenderingContext2D.drawFocusIfNeeded() method of the Canvas 2D API draws a focus ring around the current path or given path, If a given element is focused.</p><pre><code>void ctx.drawFocusIfNeeded(element);\nvoid ctx.drawFocusIfNeeded(path, element);\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/drawFocusIfNeeded
CanvasRenderingContext2D.drawImage()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The CanvasRenderingContext2D.drawImage() method of the Canvas 2D API provides different ways to draw an image onto the canvas.</p><pre><code>void ctx.drawImage(image, dx, dy);\nvoid ctx.drawImage(image, dx, dy, dWidth, dHeight);\nvoid ctx.drawImage(image, sx, sy, sWidth, sHeight, dx, dy, dWidth, dHeight);\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/drawImage
CanvasRenderingContext2D.drawWidgetAsOnScreen()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The non-standard and internal only CanvasRenderingContext2D.drawWidgetAsOnScreen() method of the Canvas 2D API renders the root widget of a window into the canvas. Unlike drawWindow(), this API uses the operating system to snapshot the widget on-screen, rather than reading from Gecko's own compositor.</p><pre><code>void ctx.drawWidgetAsOnScreen(window);\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/drawWidgetAsOnScreen
CanvasRenderingContext2D.drawWindow()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The non-standard and internal only CanvasRenderingContext2D.drawWindow() method of the Canvas 2D API renders a region of a window into the canvas. The contents of the window's viewport are rendered, ignoring viewport clipping and scrolling.</p><pre><code>void ctx.drawWindow(window, x, y, w, h, bgColor, flags = 0);\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/drawWindow
CanvasRenderingContext2D.ellipse()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The CanvasRenderingContext2D.ellipse() method of the Canvas 2D API adds an ellipse to the path which is centered at (x, y) position with the radii radiusX and radiusY starting at startAngle and ending at endAngle going in the given direction by anticlockwise (defaulting to clockwise).</p><pre><code>void ctx.ellipse(x, y, radiusX, radiusY, rotation, startAngle, endAngle, anticlockwise);\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/ellipse
CanvasRenderingContext2D.fill()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The CanvasRenderingContext2D.fill() method of the Canvas 2D API fills the current or given path with the current fill style using the non-zero or even-odd winding rule.</p><pre><code>void ctx.fill();\nvoid ctx.fill(fillRule);\nvoid ctx.fill(path, fillRule);\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/fill
CanvasRenderingContext2D.fillRect()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The CanvasRenderingContext2D.fillRect() method of the Canvas 2D API draws a filled rectangle at (x, y) position whose size is determined by width and height and whose style is determined by the fillStyle attribute.</p><pre><code>void ctx.fillRect(x, y, width, height);\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/fillRect
CanvasRenderingContext2D.fillStyle	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The CanvasRenderingContext2D.fillStyle property of the Canvas 2D API specifies the color or style to use inside shapes. The default is #000 (black).</p><pre><code>ctx.fillStyle = color;\nctx.fillStyle = gradient;\nctx.fillStyle = pattern;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/fillStyle
CanvasRenderingContext2D.fillText()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The CanvasRenderingContext2D.fillText() method of the Canvas 2D API fills a given text at the given (x, y) position. If the optional fourth parameter for a maximum width is provided, the text will be scaled to fit that width.</p><pre><code>void ctx.fillText(text, x, y [, maxWidth]);\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/fillText
CanvasRenderingContext2D.filter	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The CanvasRenderingContext2D.filter property of the Canvas 2D API provides filter effects like blurring or gray-scaling. It is similar to the CSS filter property and accepts the same functions.</p><pre><code>ctx.filter = "&lt;filter-function1&gt; [&lt;filter-function2] [&lt;filter-functionN]";\nctx.filter = "none";\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/filter
CanvasRenderingContext2D.font	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The CanvasRenderingContext2D.font property of the Canvas 2D API specifies the current text style being used when drawing text. This string uses the same syntax as the CSS font specifier. The default font is 10px sans-serif.</p><pre><code>ctx.font = value;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/font
CanvasRenderingContext2D.getImageData()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The CanvasRenderingContext2D.getImageData() method of the Canvas 2D API returns an ImageData object representing the underlying pixel data for the area of the canvas denoted by the rectangle which starts at (sx, sy) and has an sw width and sh height.</p><pre><code>ImageData ctx.getImageData(sx, sy, sw, sh);\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/getImageData
CanvasRenderingContext2D.getLineDash()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The CanvasRenderingContext2D.getLineDash() method of the Canvas 2D API gets the current line dash pattern.</p><pre><code>ctx.getLineDash();\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/getLineDash
CanvasRenderingContext2D.globalAlpha	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The CanvasRenderingContext2D.globalAlpha property of the Canvas 2D API specifies the alpha value that is applied to shapes and images before they are drawn onto the canvas. The value is in the range from 0.0 (fully transparent) to 1.0 (fully opaque).</p><pre><code>ctx.globalAlpha = value;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/globalAlpha
CanvasRenderingContext2D.globalCompositeOperation	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The CanvasRenderingContext2D.globalCompositeOperation property of the Canvas 2D API sets the type of compositing operation to apply when drawing new shapes, where type is a string identifying which of the compositing or blending mode operations to use.</p><pre><code>ctx.globalCompositeOperation = type;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/globalCompositeOperation
CanvasRenderingContext2D.imageSmoothingEnabled	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The CanvasRenderingContext2D.imageSmoothingEnabled property of the Canvas 2D API can be set to change if images are smoothed (true, default) or not (false). On getting the imageSmoothingEnabled property, the last value it was set to, is returned.</p><pre><code>ctx.imageSmoothingEnabled = value;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/imageSmoothingEnabled
CanvasRenderingContext2D.isPointInPath()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The CanvasRenderingContext2D.isPointInPath() method of the Canvas 2D API reports whether or not the specified point is contained in the current path.</p><pre><code>boolean ctx.isPointInPath(x, y);\nboolean ctx.isPointInPath(x, y, fillRule);\n\nboolean ctx.isPointInPath(path, x, y);\nboolean ctx.isPointInPath(path, x, y, fillRule);\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/isPointInPath
CanvasRenderingContext2D.isPointInStroke()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The CanvasRenderingContext2D.isPointInStroke() method of the Canvas 2D API reports whether or not the specified point is inside the area contained by the stroking of a path.</p><pre><code>boolean ctx.isPointInStroke(x, y);\nboolean ctx.isPointInStroke(path, x, y);\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/isPointInStroke
CanvasRenderingContext2D.lineCap	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The CanvasRenderingContext2D.lineCap property of the Canvas 2D API determines how the end points of every line are drawn. There are three possible values for this property and those are: butt, round and square. By default this property is set to butt.</p><pre><code>ctx.lineCap = "butt";\nctx.lineCap = "round";\nctx.lineCap = "square";</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/lineCap
CanvasRenderingContext2D.lineDashOffset	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The CanvasRenderingContext2D.lineDashOffset property of the Canvas 2D API sets the line dash pattern offset or "phase" to achieve a " marching ants " effect, for example.</p><pre><code>ctx.lineDashOffset = value;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/lineDashOffset
CanvasRenderingContext2D.lineJoin	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The CanvasRenderingContext2D.lineJoin property of the Canvas 2D API determines how two connecting segments (of lines, arcs or curves) with non-zero lengths in a shape are joined together (degenerate segments with zero lengths, whose specified endpoints and control points are exactly at the same position, are skipped).</p><pre><code>ctx.lineJoin = "bevel";\nctx.lineJoin = "round";\nctx.lineJoin = "miter";</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/lineJoin
CanvasRenderingContext2D.lineTo()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The CanvasRenderingContext2D.lineTo() method of the Canvas 2D API connects the last point in the sub-path to the x, y coordinates with a straight line (but does not actually draw it).</p><pre><code>void ctx.lineTo(x, y);\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/lineTo
CanvasRenderingContext2D.lineWidth	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The CanvasRenderingContext2D.lineWidth property of the Canvas 2D API sets the thickness of lines in space units. When getting, it returns the current value (1.0 by default). When setting, zero, negative, Infinity and NaN values are ignored; otherwise the current value is set to the new value.</p><pre><code>ctx.lineWidth = value;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/lineWidth
CanvasRenderingContext2D.measureText()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The CanvasRenderingContext2D.measureText() method returns a TextMetrics object that contains information about the measured text (such as its width for example).</p><pre><code>ctx.measureText(text);</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/measureText
CanvasRenderingContext2D.miterLimit	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The CanvasRenderingContext2D.miterLimit property of the Canvas 2D API sets the miter limit ratio in space units. When getting, it returns the current value (10.0 by default). When setting, zero, negative, Infinity and NaN values are ignored; otherwise the current value is set to the new value.</p><pre><code>ctx.miterLimit = value;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/miterLimit
CanvasRenderingContext2D.moveTo()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The CanvasRenderingContext2D.moveTo() method of the Canvas 2D API moves the starting point of a new sub-path to the (x, y) coordinates.</p><pre><code>void ctx.moveTo(x, y);\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/moveTo
CanvasRenderingContext2D.putImageData()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The CanvasRenderingContext2D.putImageData() method of the Canvas 2D API paints data from the given ImageData object onto the bitmap. If a dirty rectangle is provided, only the pixels from that rectangle are painted.</p><pre><code>void ctx.putImageData(imagedata, dx, dy);\nvoid ctx.putImageData(imagedata, dx, dy, dirtyX, dirtyY, dirtyWidth, dirtyHeight);\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/putImageData
CanvasRenderingContext2D.quadraticCurveTo()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The CanvasRenderingContext2D.quadraticCurveTo() method of the Canvas 2D API adds a quadratic Bézier curve to the path. It requires two points. The first point is a control point and the second one is the end point. The starting point is the last point in the current path, which can be changed using moveTo() before creating the quadratic Bézier curve.</p><pre><code>void ctx.quadraticCurveTo(cpx, cpy, x, y);\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/quadraticCurveTo
CanvasRenderingContext2D.rect()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The CanvasRenderingContext2D.rect() method of the Canvas 2D API creates a path for a rectangle at position (x, y) with a size that is determined by width and height. Those four points are connected by straight lines and the sub-path is marked as closed, so that you can fill or stroke this rectangle.</p><pre><code>void ctx.rect(x, y, width, height);\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/rect
CanvasRenderingContext2D.removeHitRegion()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The CanvasRenderingContext2D.removeHitRegion() method of the Canvas 2D API removes a given hit region from the canvas.</p><pre><code>void ctx.removeHitRegion(id);\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/removeHitRegion
CanvasRenderingContext2D.resetTransform()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The CanvasRenderingContext2D.resetTransform() method of the Canvas 2D API resets the current transform by the identity matrix.</p><pre><code>void ctx.resetTransform();\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/resetTransform
CanvasRenderingContext2D.restore()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The CanvasRenderingContext2D.restore() method of the Canvas 2D API restores the most recently saved canvas state by popping the top entry in the drawing state stack. If there is no saved state, this method does nothing.</p><pre><code>void ctx.restore();</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/restore
CanvasRenderingContext2D.rotate()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The CanvasRenderingContext2D.rotate() method of the Canvas 2D API adds a rotation to the transformation matrix. The angle argument represents a clockwise rotation angle and is expressed in radians.</p><pre><code>void ctx.rotate(angle);\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/rotate
CanvasRenderingContext2D.save()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The CanvasRenderingContext2D.save() method of the Canvas 2D API saves the entire state of the canvas by pushing the current state onto a stack.</p><pre><code>void ctx.save();</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/save
CanvasRenderingContext2D.scale()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The CanvasRenderingContext2D.scale() method of the Canvas 2D API adds a scaling transformation to the canvas units by x horizontally and by y vertically.</p><pre><code>void ctx.scale(x, y);\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/scale
CanvasRenderingContext2D.scrollPathIntoView()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The CanvasRenderingContext2D.scrollPathIntoView() method of the Canvas 2D API scrolls the current or given path into the view. It is similar to Element.scrollIntoView().</p><pre><code>void ctx.scrollPathIntoView();\nvoid ctx.scrollPathIntoView(path);\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/scrollPathIntoView
CanvasRenderingContext2D.setLineDash()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The CanvasRenderingContext2D.setLineDash() method of the Canvas 2D API sets the line dash pattern.</p><pre><code>void ctx.setLineDash(segments);\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/setLineDash
CanvasRenderingContext2D.setTransform()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The CanvasRenderingContext2D.setTransform() method of the Canvas 2D API resets (overrides) the current transformation to the identity matrix and then invokes a transformation described by the arguments of this method.</p><pre><code>void ctx.setTransform(a, b, c, d, e, f);\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/setTransform
CanvasRenderingContext2D.shadowBlur	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The CanvasRenderingContext2D.shadowBlur property of the Canvas 2D API specifies the level of the blurring effect; this value doesn't correspond to a number of pixels and is not affected by the current transformation matrix. The default value is 0.</p><pre><code>ctx.shadowBlur = level;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/shadowBlur
CanvasRenderingContext2D.shadowColor	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The CanvasRenderingContext2D.shadowColor property of the Canvas 2D API specifies the color of the shadow.</p><pre><code>ctx.shadowColor = color;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/shadowColor
CanvasRenderingContext2D.shadowOffsetX	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The CanvasRenderingContext2D.shadowOffsetX property of the Canvas 2D API specifies the distance that the shadow will be offset in horizontal distance.</p><pre><code>ctx.shadowOffsetX = offset;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/shadowOffsetX
CanvasRenderingContext2D.shadowOffsetY	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The CanvasRenderingContext2D.shadowOffsetY property of the Canvas 2D API specifies the distance that the shadow will be offset in vertical distance.</p><pre><code>ctx.shadowOffsetY = offset;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/shadowOffsetY
CanvasRenderingContext2D.stroke()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The CanvasRenderingContext2D.stroke() method of the Canvas 2D API strokes the current or given path with the current stroke style using the non-zero winding rule.</p><pre><code>void ctx.stroke();\nvoid ctx.stroke(path);\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/stroke
CanvasRenderingContext2D.strokeRect()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The CanvasRenderingContext2D.strokeRect() method of the Canvas 2D API paints a rectangle which has a starting point at (x, y) and has a w width and an h height onto the canvas, using the current stroke style.</p><pre><code>void ctx.strokeRect(x, y, width, height);\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/strokeRect
CanvasRenderingContext2D.strokeStyle	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The CanvasRenderingContext2D.strokeStyle property of the Canvas 2D API specifies the color or style to use for the lines around shapes. The default is #000 (black).</p><pre><code>ctx.strokeStyle = color;\nctx.strokeStyle = gradient;\nctx.strokeStyle = pattern;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/strokeStyle
CanvasRenderingContext2D.strokeText()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The CanvasRenderingContext2D.strokeText() method of the Canvas 2D API strokes a given text at the given (x, y) position. If the optional fourth parameter for a maximum width is provided, the text will be scaled to fit that width.</p><pre><code>void ctx.strokeText(text, x, y [, maxWidth]);\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/strokeText
CanvasRenderingContext2D.textAlign	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The CanvasRenderingContext2D.textAlign property of the Canvas 2D API specifies the current text alignment being used when drawing text. Beware that the alignment is base on the x value of the CanvasRenderingContext2D. fillText method. So if textAlign="center", then the text would be drawn at x-50%*width.</p><pre><code>ctx.textAlign = "left" || "right" || "center" || "start" || "end";\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/textAlign
CanvasRenderingContext2D.textBaseline	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The CanvasRenderingContext2D.textBaseline property of the Canvas 2D API specifies the current text baseline being used when drawing text.</p><pre><code>ctx.textBaseline = "top" || "hanging" || "middle" || "alphabetic" || "ideographic" || "bottom";\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/textBaseline
CanvasRenderingContext2D.transform()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The CanvasRenderingContext2D.transform() method of the Canvas 2D API multiplies the current transformation with the matrix described by the arguments of this method. You are able to scale, rotate, move and skew the context.</p><pre><code>void ctx.transform(a, b, c, d, e, f);\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/transform
CanvasRenderingContext2D.translate()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The CanvasRenderingContext2D.translate() method of the Canvas 2D API adds a translation transformation by moving the canvas and its origin x horizontally and y vertically on the grid.</p><pre><code>void ctx.translate(x, y);\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/translate
Canvas API	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Added in HTML5, the HTML canvas element can be used to draw graphics via scripting in JavaScript. For example, it can be used to draw graphs, make photo compositions, create animations, or even do real-time video processing or rendering.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Canvas_API
A basic ray-caster	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Open in new window</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Canvas_API/A_basic_ray-caster
Drawing DOM objects into a canvas	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Although it's not trivial (for security reasons), it's possible to draw DOM content—such as HTML —into a canvas. This article, derived from this blog post by Robert O'Callahan, covers how you can do it securely, safely, and in accordance with the specification.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Canvas_API/Drawing_DOM_objects_into_a_canvas
Manipulating video using canvas	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>View this live example.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Canvas_API/Manipulating_video_using_canvas
Canvas tutorial	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>This tutorial describes how to use the canvas element to draw 2D graphics, starting with the basics. The examples provided should give you some clear ideas what you can do with canvas and will provide code snippets that may get you started in building your own content.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Canvas_API/Tutorial
Advanced animations	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>We are going to use a ball for our animation studies, so let's first draw that ball onto the canvas. The following code will set us up.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Canvas_API/Tutorial/Advanced_animations
Applying styles and colors	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Up until now we have only seen methods of the drawing context. If we want to apply colors to a shape, there are two important properties we can use: fillStyle and strokeStyle.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Canvas_API/Tutorial/Applying_styles_and_colors
Basic animations	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Probably the biggest limitation is, that once a shape gets drawn, it stays that way. If we need to move it we have to redraw it and everything that was drawn before it. It takes a lot of time to redraw complex frames and the performance depends highly on the speed of the computer it's running on.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Canvas_API/Tutorial/Basic_animations
Basic usage of canvas	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>At first sight a canvas looks like the img element, with the only clear difference being that it doesn't have the src and alt attributes. Indeed, the canvas element has only two attributes, width and height. These are both optional and can also be set using DOM properties. When no width and height attributes are specified, the canvas will initially be 300 pixels wide and 150 pixels high. The element can be sized arbitrarily by CSS, but during rendering the image is scaled to fit its layout size: if the CSS sizing doesn't respect the ratio of the initial canvas, it will appear distorted.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Canvas_API/Tutorial/Basic_usage
Compositing and clipping	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>We can not only draw new shapes behind existing shapes but we can also use it to mask off certain areas, clear sections from the canvas (not limited to rectangles like the clearRect() method does) and more.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Canvas_API/Tutorial/Compositing
Compositing example	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>This sample program demonstrates a number of compositing operations. The output looks like this:</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Canvas_API/Tutorial/Compositing/Example
Drawing shapes with canvas	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Before we can start drawing, we need to talk about the canvas grid or coordinate space. Our HTML skeleton from the previous page had a canvas element 150 pixels wide and 150 pixels high. To the right, you see this canvas with the default grid overlayed. Normally 1 unit in the grid corresponds to 1 pixel on the canvas. The origin of this grid is positioned in the top left corner at coordinate (0,0). All elements are placed relative to this origin. So the position of the top left corner of the blue square becomes x pixels from the left and y pixels from the top, at coordinate (x,y). Later in this tutorial we'll see how we can translate the origin to a different position, rotate the grid and even scale it, but for now we'll stick to the default.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Canvas_API/Tutorial/Drawing_shapes
Drawing text	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The canvas rendering context provides two methods to render text:</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Canvas_API/Tutorial/Drawing_text

Hit regions and accessibility	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The content inside the canvas... /canvas tags can be used as a fallback for browsers which don't support canvas rendering. It's also very useful for assistive technology users (like screen readers) which can read and interpret the sub DOM in it. A good example at html5accessibility.com demonstrates how this can be done:</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Canvas_API/Tutorial/Hit_regions_and_accessibility

CaretPosition	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The CaretPosition interface represents the caret postion, an indicator for the text insertion point. CDATASection	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The CDATASection interface represents a CDATA section that can be used within XML to include extended portions of unescaped text, such that the symbols  and & do not need escaping as they normally do within XML when used as text.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CDATASection
ChannelMergerNode	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>If ChannelMergerNode has one single output, but as many inputs as there are channels to merge; the amount of inputs is defined as a parameter of its constructor and the call to AudioContext.createChannelMerger. In the case that no value is given, it will default to 6.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/ChannelMergerNode
ChannelSplitterNode	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>If your ChannelSplitterNode always has one single input, the amount of outputs is defined by a parameter on its constructor and the call to AudioContext.createChannelSplitter(). In the case that no value is given, it will default to 6. If there are fewer channels in the input than there are outputs, supernumerary outputs are silent.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/ChannelSplitterNode
Channel Messaging API	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Channel Messaging API allows two separate scripts running in different browsing contexts attached to the same document (e.g., two IFrames, or the main document and an IFrame, two documents via a SharedWorker, or two workers) to communicate directly, passing messages between one another through two-way channels (or pipes) with a port at each end.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Channel_Messaging_API
Using channel messaging	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Channel Messaging API allows two separate scripts running in different browsing contexts attached to the same document (e.g., two IFrames, or the main document and an IFrame, or two documents via a SharedWorker) to communicate directly, passing messages between one another through two-way channels (or pipes) with a port at each end. In this article we'll explore the basics of using this technology.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Channel_Messaging_API/Using_channel_messaging
CharacterData	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The CharacterData abstract interface represents a Node object that contains characters. This is an abstract interface, meaning there aren't any object of type CharacterData : it is implemented by other interfaces, like Text, Comment, or ProcessingInstruction which aren't abstract.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CharacterData
ChildNode	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The ChildNode interface contains methods that are particular to Node objects that can have a parent.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/ChildNode
ChildNode.after()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The ChildNode.after() method inserts a set of Node or DOMString objects in the children list of this ChildNode 's parent, just after this ChildNode. DOMString objects are inserted as equivalent Text nodes.</p><pre><code>[Throws, Unscopable] \nvoid ChildNode.after((Node or DOMString)... nodes);\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/ChildNode/after
ChildNode.before()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The ChildNode.before method inserts a set of Node or DOMString objects in the children list of this ChildNode 's parent, just before this ChildNode. DOMString objects are inserted as equivalent Text nodes.</p><pre><code>[Throws, Unscopable] \nvoid ChildNode.before((Node or DOMString)... nodes);\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/ChildNode/before
ChildNode.remove()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The ChildNode.remove() method removes the object from the tree it belongs to.</p><pre><code>elementNodeReference.remove(); \n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/ChildNode/remove
ChildNode.replaceWith()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The ChildNode.replaceWith() method replaces this ChildNode in the children list of its parent with a set of Node or DOMString objects. DOMString objects are inserted as equivalent Text nodes.</p><pre><code>[Throws, Unscopable] \nvoid ChildNode.replaceWith((Node or DOMString)... nodes);\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/ChildNode/replaceWith
ChromeWorker	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>If you're developing privileged code, and would like to create a worker that can use js-ctypes to perform calls to native code, you can do so by using ChromeWorker instead of the standard Worker object. It works exactly like a standard Worker, except that it has access to js-ctypes via a global ctypes object available in the global scope of the worker. Examples of ChromeWorker's using js-ctypes are availabe on Github and are linked to from the See Also section below. To use a postMessage with callback version of ChromeWorker that features promises, see PromiseWorker.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/ChromeWorker
Client	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Client interface of the ServiceWorker API represents the scope of a service worker client. A service worker client is either a document in a browser context or a SharedWorker, which is controlled by an active worker. A client object acts as a snapshot representation of its associated service worker client in the scope of a service worker.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Client
Client.frameType	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The frameType read-only property of the Client interface indicates the type of browsing context of the current Client. This value can be one of auxiliary, top-level, nested, or none.</p><pre><code>var myFrameType = Client.frameType;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Client/frameType
Client.id	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The id read-only property of the Client interface returns the universally unique identifier of the Client object.</p><pre><code>var clientId = Client.id;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Client/id
Client.postMessage()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Client.postMessage() method of the Client interface allows a service worker client to send a message to a ServiceWorker.</p><pre><code>Client.postMessage(message[, transfer]);</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Client/postMessage
Client.url	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The url read-only property of the Client interface returns the URL of the current service worker client.</p><pre><code>var clientUrl = Client.url;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Client/url
Clients	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Clients interface of the Service Workers API represents a container for a list of Client objects.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Clients
Clients.claim()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The claim() method of the of the Clients interface allows an active Service Worker to set itself as the active worker for a client page when the worker and the page are in the same scope. This triggers an oncontrollerchange event on any client pages within the Service Worker's scope.</p><pre><code>ServiceWorkerClients.claim().then(function() {\n  // Do something\n});\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Clients/claim
Clients.get()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The get () method of the Clients interface gets a service worker client matching a given id and returns it in a Promise.</p><pre><code>self.clients.get(id).then(function(client) {\n  // do something with your returned client\n});</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Clients/get
Clients.matchAll()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The matchAll() method of the Clients interface returns a Promise for a list of service worker clients. Include the options parameter to return all service worker clients whose origin is the same as the associated service worker's origin. If options are not included, the method returns only the service worker clients controlled by the service worker.</p><pre><code>ServiceWorkerClients.matchAll(options).then(function(clients) {\n  // do something with your clients list\n});</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Clients/matchAll
Clients.openWindow()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The openWindow() method of the Clients interface creates a new top level browsing context and loads a given URL. If the calling script doesn't have permission to show popups, openWindow() will throw an InvalidAccessError.</p><pre><code>ServiceWorkerClients.openWindow(url).then(function(WindowClient) {\n  // do something with your WindowClient\n});</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Clients/openWindow

Comment	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Comment interface represents textual notations within markup; although it is generally not visually shown, such comments are available to be read in the source view. Comments are represented in HTML and XML as content between ' !-- ' and ' -- '. In XML, the character sequence ' -- ' cannot be used within a comment.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Comment
Comment()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Comment() constructor returns a newly created Comment object with the optional DOMString given in parameter as its textual content.</p><pre><code>comment1 = new Comment(); // Create an empty comment\ncomment2 = new Comment("This is a comment");\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Comment/Comment

Console	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Console object provides access to the browser's debugging console (e.g., the Web Console in Firefox). Console.assert()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Writes an error message to the console if the assertion is false. Console.dir()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Displays an interactive list of the properties of the specified JavaScript object. Console.dirxml()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Displays an interactive tree of the descendant elements of the specified XML/HTML element. If it is not possible to display as an element the JavaScript Object view is shown instead. The output is presented as a hierarchical listing of expandable nodes that let you see the contents of child nodes.</p><pre><code>console.dirxml(object);\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Console/dirxml

Console.group()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Creates a new inline group in the Web Console log. This indents all following output by an additional level, until console.groupEnd() is called.</p><pre><code>console.group();\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Console/group
Console.groupCollapsed()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Creates a new inline group in the Web Console. Unlike console.group(), however, the new group is created collapsed. The user will need to use the disclosure button next to it to expand it, revealing the entries created in the group.</p><pre><code>console.groupCollapsed();\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Console/groupCollapsed
Console.groupEnd()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Exits the current inline group in the Web Console. Console.table()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Displays tabular data as a table.</p><pre><code>console.table(data [, columns]);\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Console/table
Console.time()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Starts a timer you can use to track how long an operation takes. You give each timer a unique name, and may have up to 10,000 timers running on a given page. When you call console.timeEnd() with the same name, the browser will output the time, in milliseconds, that elapsed since the timer was started.</p><pre><code>console.time(label);\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Console/time
Console.timeEnd()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Stops a timer that was previously started by calling console.time().</p><pre><code>console.timeEnd(label);\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Console/timeEnd
Console.timeStamp()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Adds a single marker to the browser's Timeline or Waterfall tool. This lets you correlate a point in your code with the other events recorded in the timeline, such as layout and paint events.</p><pre><code>console.timeStamp(label);\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Console/timeStamp

ConvolverNode	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The ConvolverNode interface is an AudioNode that performs a Linear Convolution on a given AudioBuffer, often used to achieve a reverb effect. A ConvolverNode always has exactly one input and one output.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/ConvolverNode
ConvolverNode.buffer	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>An AudioBuffer.</p><pre><code>var audioCtx = new AudioContext();\nvar convolver = audioCtx.createConvolver();\nconvolver.buffer = myAudioBuffer;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/ConvolverNode/buffer
ConvolverNode.normalize	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>A boolean.</p><pre><code>var audioCtx = new AudioContext();\nvar convolver = audioCtx.createConvolver();\nconvolver.normalize = false;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/ConvolverNode/normalize
Coordinates	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Coordinates interface represents the position and altitude of the device on Earth, as well as the accuracy with which these properties are calculated.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Coordinates
Coordinates.accuracy	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Coordinates.accuracy read-only property is a strictly positive double representing the accuracy, with a 95% confidence level, of the Coordinates.latitude and Coordinates.longitude properties expressed in meters.</p><pre><code>acc = coordinates.accuracy\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Coordinates/accuracy
Coordinates.altitude	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Coordinates.altitude read-only property is a double representing the altitude of the position in meters, relative to sea level. This value is null if the implementation cannot provide this data.</p><pre><code>alt = coordinates.altitude\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Coordinates/altitude
Coordinates.altitudeAccuracy	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Coordinates.altitudeAccuracy read-only property is a strictly positive double representing the accuracy, with a 95% confidence level, of the altitude expressed in meters. This value is null if the implementation doesn't support measuring altitude.</p><pre><code>altAcc = coordinates.altitudeAccuracy\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Coordinates/altitudeAccuracy
Coordinates.heading	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Coordinates.heading read-only property is a double representing the direction in which the device is traveling. This value, specified in degrees, indicates how far off from heading due north the device is. Zero degrees represents true true north, and the direction is determined clockwise (which means that east is 90 degrees and west is 270 degrees). If Coordinates.speed is 0, heading is NaN. If the device is not able to provide heading information, this value is null.</p><pre><code>heading = coordinates.heading\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Coordinates/heading
Coordinates.latitude	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Coordinates.latitude read-only property is a double representing the latitude of the position in decimal degrees.</p><pre><code>lat = coordinates.latitude\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Coordinates/latitude
Coordinates.longitude	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Coordinates.longitude read-only property is a double representing the longitude of the position in decimal degrees.</p><pre><code>lon = coordinates.longitude\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Coordinates/longitude
Coordinates.speed	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Coordinates.speed read-only property is a double representing the velocity of the device in meters per second. This value is null if the implementation is not able to measure it.</p><pre><code>speed = coordinates.speed\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Coordinates/speed
Credential	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Credential interface of the the Credential Management API provides information about an entity as a prerequisite to a trust decision.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Credential
iconURL	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The iconURL property of the Credential interface returns a DOMString containing the URL of an image for the credential. The URL must be from a secure context.</p><pre><code>var iconURL = Credential.iconURL;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Credential/iconURL
id	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The id property of the Credential interface returns  a DOMString containing the credential's identifier. This might be any one of a GUID, username, or email address.</p><pre><code>var id = Credential.id;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Credential/id
name	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The name property of the Credential interface returns a DOMString containing a name associated with the credential. This is intended to be a human-readable public name.</p><pre><code>var credName = Credentials.name;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Credential/name
type	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The type property of the Credential interface returns a DOMString containing the credential's type. Valid values are password and federated.</p><pre><code>var credType = Credentials.type;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Credential/type
CredentialsContainer	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The CredentialsContainer interface of the the Credential Management API exposes methods to request credentials and notify the user agent when events such as successful sign in or sign out haappen. This interface is accessible from Navigator.credentials.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CredentialsContainer
CredentialsContainer.get()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The get() method of the CredentialsContainer interface returns a Promise to a Credential instance that matches the provided parameters.</p><pre><code>CredentialsContainer.get([options]).then(function(Credential) { ... })</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CredentialsContainer/get
CredentialsContainer.requireUserMediation()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The requireUserMediation() method of the CredentialsContainer interface returns an empty Promise after requiring user mediation for credentials returned form a particular origin. Mediation is a per origin indication stored in the browser that the user doesn't want automatic sign-in.</p><pre><code>CredentialsContainer.requireUserMediation().then(function() { ... })</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CredentialsContainer/requireUserMediation
CredentialsContainer.store()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The store() method of the CredentialsContainer stores a set of credentials for a user inside a provided Credential instance and returns that instance in a Promise.</p><pre><code>CredentialsContainer.store(Credential).then(function(Credential) { ... } )</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CredentialsContainer/store
Credential Management API	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>This API lets websites interact with a user agent’s password system so that websites can deal in a uniform way with site credentials and user agents can provide better assistance with the management of their credentials. For example, user agents have a particularly hard time dealing with federated identity providers or esoteric sign-in mechanisms that use more than just a username and password. To address these problems, the Credential Management API provides ways for a website to store and retrieve different types of password credentials. This give users capabilities such as seeing the federated account they used to sign on to a site, or resuming a session without the explicit sign-in flow of an expired session.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Credential_Management_API
Crypto	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Crypto interface represents basic cryptography features available in the current context. It allows access to a cryptographically strong random number generator and to cryptographic primitives.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Crypto
Crypto.subtle	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Crypto.subtle read-only property returns a SubtleCrypto object allowing to perform cryptographical operations.</p><pre><code>var crypto = crypto.subtle;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Crypto/subtle
CryptoKey	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The CryptoKey interface represents a cryptographic key derived from a specific key algorithm.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CryptoKey
CryptoKey.algorithm	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The CryptoKey.algorithm read-only property is an opaque value containing all the information about the algorithm related to the key.</p><pre><code>result = key.algorithm\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CryptoKey/algorithm
CryptoKey.extractable	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The CryptoKey.extractable read-only property that indicates if the raw material key can be extracted, for example for archiving it.</p><pre><code>result = key.extractable\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CryptoKey/extractable
CryptoKey.type	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The CryptoKey.type read-only property that indicates the type of the key: if it is the key for a symmetric algorithm ("secret") or for an asymmetric algorithm ("public" or "private", depending of its purpose).</p><pre><code>result = key.type\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CryptoKey/type
CryptoKey.usages	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The CryptoKey.usages read-only property is an array of enumerated that indicates the purposes of the key.</p><pre><code>result = key.usages\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CryptoKey/usages
CSS	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The CSS interface holds useful CSS-related methods. No object with this interface are implemented: it contains only static methods and therefore is a utilitarian interface.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CSS
CSS.escape()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The CSS.escape() static method returns a DOMString containing the escaped string passed as parameter, mostly for use as part of a CSS selector.</p><pre><code>escapedStr = CSS.escape(str);\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CSS/escape
CSS.supports()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The CSS.supports() static methods returns a Boolean value indicating if the browser supports a given CSS feature, or not.</p><pre><code>boolValue = CSS.supports(propertyName, value);\nboolValue = CSS.supports(supportCondition);\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CSS/supports
CSSConditionRule	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>An object implementing the CSSConditionRule interface represents a single condition CSS at-rule, which consists of a condition and a statement block. It is a child of CSSGroupingRule.</p><pre><code>interface CSSConditionRule : CSSGroupingRule {\n    attribute DOMString conditionText;\n}\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CSSConditionRule
CSSCounterStyleRule	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The CSSCounterStyleRule interface represents an @counter-style at-rule.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CSSCounterStyleRule
CSSGroupingRule	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>An object implementing the CSSGroupingRule interface represents any CSS at-rule that contains other rules nested within it.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CSSGroupingRule
CSSKeyframeRule	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The CSSKeyframeRule interface describes an object representing a set of style for a given keyframe. It corresponds to the contains of a single keyframe of a @keyframes at-rule. It implements the CSSRule interface with a type value of 8 (CSSRule.KEYFRAME_RULE).</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CSSKeyframeRule
CSSKeyframesRule	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The CSSKeyframesRule interface describes an object representing a complete set of keyframes for a CSS animation. It corresponds to the contains of a whole @keyframes at-rule. It implements the CSSRule interface with a type value of 7 (CSSRule.KEYFRAMES_RULE).</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CSSKeyframesRule
CSSMatrix	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>A CSSMatrix represents a homogeneous 4x4 matrix to which 2D or 3D transforms can be applied. This class was allegedly part of CSS Transitions Module Level 3 at some point, but is not present in the current Working Draft. Use DOMMatrix instead.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CSSMatrix
CSSMediaRule	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The CSSMediaRule is an interface representing a single CSS @media rule. It implements the CSSConditionRule interface, and therefore the CSSGroupingRule and the CSSRule interface with a type value of 4 (CSSRule.MEDIA_RULE).</p><pre><code>interface CSSMediaRule : CSSConditionRule {\n    readonly attribute MediaList media;\n}\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CSSMediaRule
CSSNamespaceRule	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The CSSNamespaceRule interface describes an object representing a single CSS @namespace at-rule. It implements the CSSRule interface, with a type value of 10 (CSSRule.NAMESPACE_RULE).</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CSSNamespaceRule
namespaceURI	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The CSSNamespaceRule.namespaceURI read-only property returns a DOMString containing the text of the URI of the given namespace.</p><pre><code>var namespaceURI = CSSNamespaceRule.namespaceURI</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CSSNamespaceRule/namespaceURI
prefix	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The CSSNamespaceRule.prefix read-only property returns a DOMString with the name of the prefix associated to this namespace. If there is no such prefix, returns null.</p><pre><code>var prefix = CSSNamespaceRule.prefix</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CSSNamespaceRule/prefix
CSSPageRule	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>CSSPageRule is an interface representing a single CSS @page rule. It implements the CSSRule interface with a type value of 6 (CSSRule.PAGE_RULE).</p><pre><code>interface CSSPageRule : CSSRule {\n  attribute DOMString selectorText;\n  readonly attribute CSSStyleDeclaration style;\n};\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CSSPageRule
CSSPrimitiveValue	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The CSSPrimitiveValue interface derives from the CSSValue interface and represents the current computed value of a CSS property.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CSSPrimitiveValue
CSSPrimitiveValue.getCounterValue()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The getCounterValue() method of the CSSPrimitiveValue interface is used to get the counter value. If this CSS value doesn't contain a counter value, a DOMException is raised. Modification to the corresponding style property can be achieved using the Counter interface.</p><pre><code>var counterValue = cssPrimitiveValue.getCounterValue();</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CSSPrimitiveValue/getCounterValue
CSSPrimitiveValue.getFloatValue()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The getFloatValue() method of the CSSPrimitiveValue interface is used to get a float value in a specified unit. If this CSS value doesn't contain a float value or can't be converted into the specified unit, a DOMException is raised.</p><pre><code>var floatValue = cssPrimitiveValue.getFloatValue(unit);</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CSSPrimitiveValue/getFloatValue
CSSPrimitiveValue.getRectValue()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The getRectValue() method of the CSSPrimitiveValue interface is used to get a rect value. If this CSS value doesn't contain a rect value, a DOMException is raised. Modification to the corresponding style property can be achieved using the Rect interface.</p><pre><code>var rectValue = cssPrimitiveValue.getRectValue();</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CSSPrimitiveValue/getRectValue
CSSPrimitiveValue.getRGBColorValue()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The getRGBColorValue() method of the CSSPrimitiveValue interface is used to get an RGB color value. If this CSS value doesn't contain a RGB color value, a DOMException is raised. Modification to the corresponding style property can be achieved using the RGBColor interface.</p><pre><code>var rgbColorValue = cssPrimitiveValue.getRGBColorValue();</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CSSPrimitiveValue/getRGBColorValue
CSSPrimitiveValue.getStringValue()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The getStringValue() method of the CSSPrimitiveValue interface is used to get a string value. If this CSS value doesn't contain a string value, a DOMException is raised.</p><pre><code>var stringValue = cssPrimitiveValue.getStringValue();</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CSSPrimitiveValue/getStringValue
CSSPrimitiveValue.primitiveType	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The primitiveType read-only property of the CSSPrimitiveValue interface represents the type of a CSS value.</p><pre><code>type = cssPrimitiveValue.primitiveType;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CSSPrimitiveValue/primitiveType
CSSPrimitiveValue.setFloatValue()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The setFloatValue() method of the CSSPrimitiveValue interface is used to set a float value. If the property attached to this value can't accept the specified unit or the float value, the value will be unchanged and a DOMException will be raised.</p><pre><code>cssPrimitiveValue.setFloatValue(unitType, floatValue);</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CSSPrimitiveValue/setFloatValue
CSSPrimitiveValue.setStringValue()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The setStringValue() method of the CSSPrimitiveValue interface is used to set a string value. CSSRule	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The CSSRule interface represents a single CSS rule. There are several types of rules, listed in the Type constants section below.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CSSRule
CSSRule.cssText	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>cssText returns the actual text of a CSSStyleSheet style-rule.</p><pre><code>string = cssRule.cssText \n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CSSRule/cssText
CSSRule.parentStyleSheet	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>parentStyleSheet returns the stylesheet object in which the current rule is defined.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CSSRule/parentStyleSheet
CSSRuleList	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>A CSSRuleList is an (indirect-modify only) array-like object containing an ordered collection of CSSRule objects.</p><pre><code>// get the first style sheet&#8217;s first rule\nvar first_rule = document.styleSheets[0].cssRules[0];\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CSSRuleList
CSSStyleDeclaration	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>CSSStyleDeclaration represents a collection of CSS property-value pairs. It is used in a few APIs:</p><pre><code>var styleObj= document.styleSheets[0].cssRules[0].style;\nalert(styleObj.cssText);\nfor (var i = styleObj.length-1; i &gt;= 0; i--) {\n   var nameString = styleObj[i];\n   styleObj.removeProperty(nameString);\n}\nalert(styleObj.cssText);</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CSSStyleDeclaration
CSSStyleDeclaration.cssText	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>cssText returns or sets the text of the element's inline&#160;style declaration only. To be able to set a stylesheet rule dynamically, see Using dynamic styling information.</p><pre><code>string = elem.style.cssText \n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CSSStyleDeclaration/cssText
CSSStyleRule	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>CSSStyleRule represents a single CSS style rule. It implements the CSSRule interface with a type value of 1 (CSSRule.STYLE_RULE).</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CSSStyleRule
CSSStyleRule.selectorText	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The CSSRule.selectorText&#160;property gets the textual representation of the selector for the rule set. This is implemented in a readonly manner; to set stylesheet rules dynamically, see Using dynamic styling information.</p><pre><code>string = cssRule.selectorText \n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CSSStyleRule/selectorText
CSSStyleRule.style	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The CSSRule.style property is the CSSStyleDeclaration interface for the declaration block of the CSSRule.</p><pre><code>styleObj = cssRule.style\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CSSStyleRule/style
CSSStyleSheet	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The CSSStyleSheet interface represents a single CSS style sheet. It inherits properties and methods from its parent, StyleSheet.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CSSStyleSheet
CSSStyleSheet.deleteRule()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The CSSStyleSheet.deleteRule() method removes a style rule from the current style sheet object.</p><pre><code>stylesheet.deleteRule(index) \n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CSSStyleSheet/deleteRule
CSSStyleSheet.insertRule()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>CSSStyleSheet.insertRule() method inserts a new CSS rule into the current style sheet. (with some restrictions)</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CSSStyleSheet/insertRule
CSSSupportsRule	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The CSSSupportsRule interface describes an object representing a single CSS @supports at-rule. It implements the CSSConditionRule interface, and therefore the CSSRule and CSSGroupingRule interfaces with a type value of 12 (CSSRule.SUPPORTS_RULE).</p><pre><code>interface CSSSupportsRule : CSSConditionRule {\n}\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CSSSupportsRule
