CSSValueList.length	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The length read-only property of the CSSValueList interface represents the number of CSSValue s in the list. The range of valid values of the indices is 0 to length-1 inclusive.</p><pre><code>var length = cssValueList.length;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CSSValueList/length
CSS Counter Styles	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The CSS Counter Styles module allows to define custom counter styles, which can be used for CSS list-marker and generated-content counters.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CSS_Counter_Styles
CSS Font Loading API	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The CSS Font Loading API provides events and interfaces for dynamically loading font resources.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CSS_Font_Loading_API
CSS Object Model	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The CSS Object Model is a set of APIs allowing to manipulate CSS from JavaScript. It is the pendant of DOM and HTML APIs, but for CSS. It allows to read and modify CSS style dynamically.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CSS_Object_Model
Determining the dimensions of elements	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>There are several properties you can look at in order to determine the width and height of elements, and it can be tricky to determine which is the right one for your needs. This article is designed to help you make that decision.  Note that all these properties are read-only.  If you want to set the width and height of an element, use width and height ; or, the overriding min-width and max-width, and min-height and max-height properties.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CSS_Object_Model/Determining_the_dimensions_of_elements
Managing screen orientation	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Screen orientation is something slightly different than device orientation. Even if a device doesn't have the capacity to detect its own orientation, a screen always has one. And if a device is able to know its orientation, it's good to have the ability to control the screen orientation in order to preserve or adapt the interface of a web application.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CSS_Object_Model/Managing_screen_orientation
Using dynamic styling information	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The CSS Object Model (CSSOM), part of the DOM, exposes specific interfaces allowing manipulation of a wide amount of information regarding CSS. Initially defined in the DOM Level 2 Style recommendation, these interfaces forms now a specification, CSS Object Model (CSSOM) which aims at superseding it.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CSS_Object_Model/Using_dynamic_styling_information
CustomEvent	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>This interface inherits properties from its parent, Event :</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CustomEvent
CustomEvent()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The CustomEvent() constructor creates a new CustomEvent.</p><pre><code> event = new CustomEvent(typeArg, customEventInit);</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CustomEvent/CustomEvent
CustomEvent.initCustomEvent()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The CustomEvent.initCustomEvent() method initializes a CustomEvent object. If the event has already been dispatched, this method does nothing.</p><pre><code>event.initCustomEvent(type, canBubble, cancelable, detail);\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CustomEvent/initCustomEvent
DataTransfer	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The DataTransfer object is used to hold the data that is being dragged during a drag and drop operation. It may hold one or more data items, each of one or more data types. For more information about drag and drop, see HTML Drag and Drop API.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/DataTransfer
DataTransfer.addElement()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The DataTransfer.addElement() method sets the drag source to the given element. This element will be the element to which drag and dragend events are fired, and not the defaut target (the node that was dragged).</p><pre><code>void dataTransfer.addElement(el);\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/DataTransfer/addElement
DataTransfer.clearData()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The DataTransfer.clearData() method removes the drag operation's drag data for the given type. If data for the given type does not exist, this method does nothing.</p><pre><code>DataTransfer.clearData([format]);\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/DataTransfer/clearData
DataTransfer.dropEffect	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The DataTransfer.dropEffect property controls the feedback (typically visual) the user is given during a drag and drop operation. It will affect which cursor is displayed while dragging. For example, when the user hovers over a target drop element, the browser's cursor may indicate which type of operation will occur.</p><pre><code>dataTransfer.dropEffect;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/DataTransfer/dropEffect
DataTransfer.effectAllowed	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The DataTransfer.effectAllowed property specifies the effect that is allowed for a drag operation. The copy operation is used to indicate that the data being dragged will be copied from its present location to the drop location. The move operation is used to indicate that the data being dragged will be moved, and the link operation is used to indicate that some form of relationship or connection will be created between the source and drop locations.</p><pre><code>dataTransfer.effectAllowed;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/DataTransfer/effectAllowed
DataTransfer.files	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The DataTransfer.files property is a list of the files in the drag operation. If the operation includes no files, the list is empty.</p><pre><code>dataTransfer.files;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/DataTransfer/files
DataTransfer.getData()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The DataTransfer.getData() method retrieves drag data (as a DOMString) for the specified type. If the drag operation does not include data, this method returns an empty string.</p><pre><code>DOMString dataTransfer.getData(format);\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/DataTransfer/getData
DataTransfer.items	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The DataTransfer.items property is a list of the data transfer items in a drag operation. The list includes one item for each item in the operation and if the operation had no items, the list is empty.</p><pre><code>dataTransfer.items;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/DataTransfer/items
DataTransfer.mozClearDataAt()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The DataTransfer.mozClearDataAt() method removes the data associated with the given format for an item at the specified index. The index must be in the range from zero to the number of items minus one.</p><pre><code>void dataTransfer.mozClearDataAt([type], index);\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/DataTransfer/mozClearDataAt
DataTransfer.mozCursor	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The DataTransfer.mozCursor property returns or sets the drag cursor's state. This is primarily used to control the cursor during tab drags.</p><pre><code>dataTransfer.mozCursor;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/DataTransfer/mozCursor
DataTransfer.mozGetDataAt()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The DataTransfer.mozGetDataAt() method is used to retrieve an item in the drag event's data transfer object, based on a given format and index. This method returns null if the specified item does not exist or if the index is not in the range from zero to the number of items minus one.</p><pre><code>nsIVariant dataTransfer.mozGetDataAt([type], index);\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/DataTransfer/mozGetDataAt
DataTransfer.mozItemCount	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The DataTransfer.mozItemCount property returns the number of items being dragged. This can be used, for example, to get the number of files being dragged.</p><pre><code>dataTransfer.mozItemCount;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/DataTransfer/mozItemCount
DataTransfer.mozSetDataAt()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The DataTransfer.mozSetDataAt() method is used to add data to a specific index in the drag event's data transfer object.</p><pre><code>void dataTransfer.mozSetDataAt([type], data, index);\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/DataTransfer/mozSetDataAt
DataTransfer.mozSourceNode	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The DataTransfer.mozSourceNode property is used to determine the Node over which the mouse cursor was located when the the drag operation was initiated (for example, when a button was clicked). For external drags or if the calling function cannot reach the node, null is returned.</p><pre><code>dataTransfer.mozSourceNode;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/DataTransfer/mozSourceNode
DataTransfer.mozTypesAt()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The DataTransfer.mozTypesAt() method returns a list of the format types that are stored for an item at the specified index. If the index is not in the range from 0 to the number of items minus one, an empty string list is returned.</p><pre><code>nsIVariant dataTransfer.mozTypesAt(index);\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/DataTransfer/mozTypesAt
DataTransfer.mozUserCancelled	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The DataTransfer.mozUserCancelled property is used in the dragend event handler to determine if the user canceled the drag or not. If the user canceled the event, the property returns true and returns false otherwise. This property only applies to the dragend event.</p><pre><code>dataTransfer.mozUserCancelled;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/DataTransfer/mozUserCancelled
DataTransfer.setData()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The DataTransfer.setData() method sets the drag operation's drag data to the specified data and type. If data for the given type does not exist, it is added at the end of the drag data store, such that the last item in the types list will be the new type. If data for the given type already exists, the existing data is replaced in the same position. That is, the order of the types list is not changed when replacing data of the same type.</p><pre><code>void dataTransfer.setData(format, data);\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/DataTransfer/setData
DataTransfer.setDragImage()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>When a drag occurs, a translucent image is generated from the drag target (the element the dragstart event is fired at), and follows the mouse pointer during the drag. This image is created automatically, so you do not need to create it yourself. However, if a custom image is desired, the DataTransfer.setDragImage() method can be used to set the custom image to be used.</p><pre><code>void dataTransfer.setDragImage(img, xOffset, yOffset);\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/DataTransfer/setDragImage
DataTransfer.types	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The DataTransfer.types read-only property is an array of the drag data formats (as strings) that were set in the dragstart event. The order of the formats is the same order as the data included in the drag operation.</p><pre><code>dataTransfer.types;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/DataTransfer/types
DataTransferItem	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The DataTransferItem object represents one drag data item. During a drag operation, each drag event has a dataTransfer property which contains a list of drag data items. Each item in the list is a DataTransferItem object.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/DataTransferItem
DataTransferItem.getAsFile()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>If the item is a file, the DataTransferItem.getAsFile() method returns the drag data item's File object. If the item is not a file, this method returns null.</p><pre><code>File = DataTransferItem.getAsFile();\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/DataTransferItem/getAsFile
DataTransferItem.getAsString()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The DataTransferItem.getAsString() method invokes the given callback with the drag data item's string data as the argument if the item's kind is a Plain unicode string (i.e. kind is string).</p><pre><code>dataTransferItem.getAsString(callback);\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/DataTransferItem/getAsString
DataTransferItem.kind	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The read-only DataTransferItem.kind property returns a DataTransferItem representing the drag data item kind: some text or some file.</p><pre><code>var itemKind = DataTransferItem.kind;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/DataTransferItem/kind
DataTransferItem.type	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The read-only DataTransferItem.type property returns the type (format) of the DataTransferItem object representing the drag data item. The type is a Unicode string generally given by a MIME type, although a MIME type is not required.</p><pre><code>dataItem.type;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/DataTransferItem/type
DataTransferItemList	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The DataTransferItemList object is a list of DataTransferItem objects representing items being dragged. During a drag operation, each DragEvent has a dataTransfer property and that property is a DataTransferItemList.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/DataTransferItemList
DataTransferItemList.add()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The DataTransferItemList.add() method creates a new DataTransferItem using the specified data and adds it to the drag data list. The item may be a File or a string of a given type. If the item is successfully added to the list, the newly-created DataTransferItem object is returned.</p><pre><code>DataTransferItem = DataTransferItemList.add(data, type);\nDataTransferItem = DataTransferItemList.add(file);\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/DataTransferItemList/add
DataTransferItemList.clear()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The DataTransferItemList.clear() method removes all DataTransferItem objects from the drag data items list, leaving the list empty.</p><pre><code>DataTransferItemList.clear();\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/DataTransferItemList/clear
DataTransferItemList.DataTransferItem()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The DataTransferItemList() getter method implements support for accessing items in the DataTransferItemList using array-style syntax (that is DataTransferItemList [ index ]).</p><pre><code>dataItem = DataTransferItemList[index];\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/DataTransferItemList/DataTransferItem
DataTransferItemList.length	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The read-only DataTransferItemList.length property returns the number of items in the list. If the list has no items, or is disabled (because it has no data store at all), this property returns zero.</p><pre><code>length = DataTransferItemList.length;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/DataTransferItemList/length
DataTransferItemList.remove()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The DataTransferItemList.remove() method removes the DataTransferItem at the specified index from the list. If the index is less than zero or greater than one less than the length of the list, the list will not be changed.</p><pre><code>DataTransferItemList.remove(index);\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/DataTransferItemList/remove
DedicatedWorkerGlobalScope.onmessage	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The onmessage property of the DedicatedWorkerGlobalScope interface represents an EventHandler to be called when the message event occurs and bubbles through the Worker &#8212; i.e. when a message is sent to the worker using the Worker.postMessage method.</p><pre><code>self.onmessage = function() { ... };</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/DedicatedWorkerGlobalScope/onmessage
DedicatedWorkerGlobalScope.postMessage()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The postMessage() method of the DedicatedWorkerGlobalScope interface sends a message to the main thread that spawned it. This accepts a single parameter, which is the data to send to the worker. The data may be any value or JavaScript object handled by the structured clone algorithm, which includes cyclical references.</p><pre><code>postMessage(aMessage, transferList);</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/DedicatedWorkerGlobalScope/postMessage
DelayNode	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>When creating a graph that has a cycle, it is mandatory to have at least one DelayNode in the cycle, or the nodes taking part in the cycle will be muted.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/DelayNode
DelayNode.delayTime	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>An AudioParam.</p><pre><code>var audioCtx = new AudioContext();\nvar myDelay = audioCtx.createDelay(5.0);\nmyDelay.delayTime.value = 3.0;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/DelayNode/delayTime
Detecting device orientation	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Increasingly, web-enabled devices are capable of determining their orientation ; that is, they can report data indicating changes to their orientation with relation to the pull of gravity. In particular, hand-held devices such as mobile phones can use this information to automatically rotate the display to remain upright, presenting a wide-screen view of the web content when the device is rotated so that its width is greater than its height.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Detecting_device_orientation
DeviceAcceleration	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>A DeviceAcceleration object provides information about the amount of acceleration the device is experiencing along all three axes.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/DeviceAcceleration
DeviceAcceleration.x	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>This read-only property indicates the amount of acceleration that occurred along the X axis in a DeviceAcceleration object.</p><pre><code>var xAccel = deviceAcceleration.x;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/DeviceAcceleration/x
DeviceAcceleration.y	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>This read-only property indicates the amount of acceleration that occurred along the Y axis in a DeviceAcceleration object.</p><pre><code>var yAccel = deviceAcceleration.y;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/DeviceAcceleration/y
DeviceAcceleration.z	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>This read-only property indicates the amount of acceleration that occurred along the Z axis in a DeviceAcceleration object.</p><pre><code>var zAccel = deviceAcceleration.z;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/DeviceAcceleration/z
DeviceLightEvent	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The DeviceLightEvent provides web developers with information from photo sensors or similiar detectors about ambient light levels near the device. For example this may be useful to adjust the screen's brightness based on the current ambient light level in order to save energy or provide better readability.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/DeviceLightEvent
Using light sensors	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Ambient Light Events give a web application access to a device's ambient light sensor to detect changes in light intensity.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/DeviceLightEvent/Using_light_sensors
DeviceLightEvent.value	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The value property provides the current level of the ambient light.</p><pre><code>var light = instanceOfDeviceLightEvent.value;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/DeviceLightEvent/value
DeviceMotionEvent	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The DeviceMotionEvent provides web developers with information about the speed of changes for the device's position and orientation.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/DeviceMotionEvent
DeviceMotionEvent.acceleration	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The acceleration property returns the amount of acceleration recorded by the device, in meters per second squared (m/s 2).</p><pre><code>var acceleration = instanceOfDeviceMotionEvent.acceleration;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/DeviceMotionEvent/acceleration
DeviceMotionEvent.accelerationIncludingGravity	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The accelerationIncludingGravity property returns the amount of acceleration recorded by the device, in meters per second squared (m/s 2). Unlike DeviceMotionEvent.acceleration which compensates for the influence of gravity, its value is the sum of the acceleration of the device as induced by the user and the acceleration caused by gravity.</p><pre><code>var acceleration = instanceOfDeviceMotionEvent.accelerationIncludingGravity;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/DeviceMotionEvent/accelerationIncludingGravity
DeviceMotionEvent.interval	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Returns the interval, in milliseconds, at which data is obtained from the underlaying hardware. You can use this to determine the granularity of motion events.</p><pre><code>var interval = instanceOfDeviceMotionEvent.interval;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/DeviceMotionEvent/interval
DeviceMotionEvent.rotationRate	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Returns the rate at which the device is rotating around each of its axes in degrees per second.</p><pre><code>var rates = instanceOfDeviceMotionEvent.rotationRate;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/DeviceMotionEvent/rotationRate
DeviceOrientationEvent	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The DeviceOrientationEvent provides web developers with information from the physical orientation of the device running the web page.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/DeviceOrientationEvent
DeviceOrientationEvent.absolute	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Indicates whether or not the device is providing orientation data absolutely (that is, in reference to the Earth's coordinate frame) or using some arbitrary frame determined by the device. See Orientation and motion data explained for details.</p><pre><code>var absolute = instanceOfDeviceOrientationEvent.absolute;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/DeviceOrientationEvent/absolute
DeviceOrientationEvent.alpha	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Returns the rotation of the device around the Z axis; that is, the number of degrees by which the device is being twisted around the center of the screen. See Orientation and motion data explained for details.</p><pre><code>var alpha = instanceOfDeviceOrientationEvent.alpha;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/DeviceOrientationEvent/alpha
DeviceOrientationEvent.beta	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Returns the rotation of the device around the X axis; that is, the number of degrees, ranged between -180 and 180,  by which the device is tipped forward or backward. See Orientation and motion data explained for details.</p><pre><code>var beta = instanceOfDeviceOrientationEvent.beta;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/DeviceOrientationEvent/beta
DeviceOrientationEvent.gamma	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Returns the rotation of the device around the Y axis; that is, the number of degrees, ranged between -90 and 90, by which the device is turned left or right. See Orientation and motion data explained for details.</p><pre><code>var gamma = orientationEvent.gamma;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/DeviceOrientationEvent/gamma
DeviceProximityEvent	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The DeviceProximityEvent interface provides information about the distance of a nearby physical object using the proximity sensor of a device.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/DeviceProximityEvent
DeviceProximityEvent.max	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The max property provides the maximum sensing distance the sensor is able to report, in centimeters.</p><pre><code>var value = instanceOfDeviceProximityEvent.max;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/DeviceProximityEvent/max
DeviceProximityEvent.min	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The min property provides the minimum distance the sensor can report, in centimeters.</p><pre><code>var value = instanceOfDeviceProximityEvent.min;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/DeviceProximityEvent/min
DeviceProximityEvent.value	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The value property of DeviceProximityEvent objects provides the current distance between the device and the detected object, in centimeters.</p><pre><code>var distance = instanceOfDeviceProximityEvent.value;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/DeviceProximityEvent/value
DeviceRotationRate	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>A DeviceRotationRate object provides information about the rate at which the device is rotating around all three axes.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/DeviceRotationRate
DeviceRotationRate.alpha	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>This property indicates the rate of rotation around the Z axis -- in degrees per second -- in a DeviceRotationRate object.</p><pre><code>var alpha = deviceRotationRate.alpha;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/DeviceRotationRate/alpha
DeviceRotationRate.beta	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>This property indicates the rate of rotation around the X axis -- in degrees per second -- in a DeviceRotationRate object.</p><pre><code>var beta = deviceRotationRate.beta;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/DeviceRotationRate/beta
DeviceRotationRate.gamma	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>This property indicates the rate of rotation around the Y axis -- in degrees per second -- in a DeviceRotationRate object.</p><pre><code>var gamma = deviceRotationRate.gamma;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/DeviceRotationRate/gamma
DirectoryEntrySync	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The DirectoryEntrySync interface of the File System API represents a directory in a file system. It includes methods for creating, reading, looking up, and recursively removing files in a directory.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/DirectoryEntrySync
DirectoryReaderSync	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The DirectoryReaderSync interface of the File System API lets you read the entries in a directory.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/DirectoryReaderSync
Document	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Document interface represents any web page loaded in the browser and serves as an entry point into the web page's content, which is the DOM tree. The DOM tree includes elements such as body and table, among many others. It provides functionality global to the document, like how to obtain the page's URL and create new elements in the document.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Document
Document.activeElement	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Returns the currently focused element, that is, the element that will get keystroke events if the user types any. This attribute is read only.</p><pre><code>var curElement = document.activeElement;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Document/activeElement
Document.adoptNode()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Adopts a node from an external document. The node and its subtree is removed from the document it's in (if any), and its ownerDocument is changed to the current document. The node can then be inserted into the current document.</p><pre><code>node = document.adoptNode(externalNode);\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Document/adoptNode
Document.alinkColor	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Returns or sets the color of an active link in the document body. A link is active during the time between mousedown and mouseup events.</p><pre><code>color = document.alinkColor\ndocument.alinkColor =\ncolor\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Document/alinkColor
Document.anchors	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>anchors returns a list of all of the anchors in the document.</p><pre><code>nodeList = document.anchors;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Document/anchors
Document.applets	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>applets returns an ordered list of the applets within a document.</p><pre><code>nodeList = document.applets \n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Document/applets
Document.async	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>document.async can be set to indicate whether a document.load call should be an asynchronous or synchronous request. true is the default value, indicating that documents should be loaded asynchronously.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Document/async
Document.bgColor	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The deprecated bgColor property gets or sets the background color of the current document.</p><pre><code>color = document.bgColor\ndocument.bgColor =color \n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Document/bgColor
Document.body	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Returns the body or frameset node of the current document, or null if no such element exists.</p><pre><code>var objRef = document.body; \ndocument.body = objRef;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Document/body
Document.caretPositionFromPoint()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>This method is used to retrieve the caret position in a document based on two coordinates. A CaretPosition is returned, containing the found DOM node and the character offset in that node.</p><pre><code>var caretPosition = document.caretPositionFromPoint(float x, float y);\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Document/caretPositionFromPoint
Document.caretRangeFromPoint()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The caretRangeFromPoint() method of the Document interface returns a Range object for the document fragment under the specified coordinates.</p><pre><code>var range = document.caretRangeFromPoint(float x, float y);\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Document/caretRangeFromPoint
Document.characterSet	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Document.characterSet read-only property returns the character encoding of the current document. The character encoding is the character set used for rendering the document, which may be different from the encoding specified by the page. (The user can override the encoding.).</p><pre><code>var string = document.characterSet</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Document/characterSet

Document.close()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The document.close() method finishes writing to a document, opened with document.open().</p><pre><code>document.close();\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Document/close
Document.compatMode	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Indicates whether the document is rendered in Quirks mode or Standards mode.</p><pre><code>mode = document.compatMode \n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Document/compatMode
Document.contentType	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Returns the MIME type that the document is being rendered as.  This may come from HTTP headers or other sources of MIME information, and might be affected by automatic type conversions performed by either the browser or extensions.</p><pre><code>contentType = document.contentType;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Document/contentType
Document.cookie	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Get and set the cookies associated with the current document. For a general library see this simple cookie framework.</p><pre><code>allCookies = document.cookie;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Document/cookie
Simple cookie framework	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>As cookies are just specially formatted strings it is sometimes difficult to manage them.  The following library aims to abstract the access to document.cookie by defining an object (docCookies) that is partially consistent with a Storage object. It also offers full Unicode support.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Document/cookie/Simple_document.cookie_framework
Document.createAttribute()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Document.createAttribute() method creates a new attribute node, and returns it. The object created a node implementing the Attr interface. The DOM does not enforce what sort of attributes can be added to a particular element in this manner.</p><pre><code>attribute = document.createAttribute(name) \n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Document/createAttribute

Document.defaultView	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>In browsers, document.defaultView returns the window object associated with a document, or null if none is available.</p><pre><code>var win = document.defaultView;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Document/defaultView
Document.designMode	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>document.designMode controls whether the entire document is editable. Valid values are "on" and "off".&#160;According to the specification, this property is meant to default to "off". Firefox follows this standard. The earlier versions of Chrome and IE default to "inherit". Starting in Chrome 43, the default is "off" and "inherit" is no longer supported.&#160;In IE6-10, the value is capitalized.&#160;</p><pre><code>var mode = document.designMode;\ndocument.designMode = "on";\ndocument.designMode = "off";</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Document/designMode
Document.dir	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Document.dir property is a DOMString representing the directionality of the text of the document, whether left to right (default) or right to left. Possible values are 'rtl', right to left, and 'ltr', left to right.</p><pre><code>dirStr = document.dir;\ndocument.dir = dirStr;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Document/dir
Document.doctype	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Returns the Document Type Declaration (DTD) associated with current document. The returned object implements the DocumentType interface. Document.execCommand()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>When an HTML document has been switched to designMode, the document object exposes the execCommand method which allows one to run commands to manipulate the contents of the editable region. Most commands affect the document's selection (bold, italics, etc.), while others insert new elements (adding a link) or affect an entire line (indenting). When using contentEditable, calling execCommand() will affect the currently active editable element.</p><pre><code>bool = document.execCommand(aCommandName, aShowDefaultUI, aValueArgument)\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Document/execCommand

Full screen mode is available only for a page that has no windowed plug-ins in any of its documents, and if all iframe elements which contain the document have their allowfullscreen attribute set.</p><pre><code>var isFullscreenAvailable = document.fullscreenEnabled;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Document/fullscreenEnabled

When called on the document object, the complete document is searched, including the root node. You may also call getElementsByClassName() on any element; it will return only elements which are descendants of the specified root element with the given class names.</p><pre><code>var elements = document.getElementsByClassName(names); // or:\nvar elements = rootElement.getElementsByClassName(names);</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Document/getElementsByClassName

Document.ononline	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>" online " event is fired on the body of each page when the browser switches between online and offline mode. Additionally, the events bubble up from document.body, to document, ending at window. Both events are non-cancellable (you can't prevent the user from coming online, or going offline).</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Document/ononline

Document.popupNode	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>When a popup attached via the popup or context attributes is opened, the XUL document's popupNode property is set to the node that was clicked on. This will be the target of the mouse event that activated the popup. If the popup was opened via the keyboard, the popup node may be set to null. Typically, this property will be checked during a popupshowing event handler for a context menu to initialize the menu based on the context.</p><pre><code>var node = document.popupNode;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Document/popupNode

DocumentFragment	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The DocumentFragment interface represents a minimal document object that has no parent. DocumentTimeline.DocumentTimeline()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The DocumentTimeline() constructor of the Web Animations API creates a new instance of the DocumentTimeline object associated with the active document of the current browsing context.</p><pre><code>var cats = document.querySelectorAll('.sharedTimelineCat');\ncats = Array.prototype.slice.call(cats);\n\nvar sharedTimeline = new DocumentTimeline(500);\n\ncats.forEach(function(cat) {\n&#160; var catKeyframes = new KeyframeEffect(cat, keyframes, timing);\n&#160; var catAnimation = new Animation(catKeyframes, sharedTimeline);\n&#160; catAnimation.play();\n});\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/DocumentTimeline/DocumentTimeline
DocumentType	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The DocumentType interface represents a Node containing a doctype.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/DocumentType
Document Object Model (DOM)	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Document Object Model (DOM) is a programming interface for HTML, XML and SVG documents. It provides a structured representation of the document as a tree. The DOM defines methods that allow access to the tree, so that they can change the document structure, style and content. The DOM provides a representation of the document as a structured group of nodes and objects, possessing various properties and methods. Nodes can also have event handlers attached to them, and once an event is triggered, the event handlers get executed. Essentially, it connects web pages to scripts or programming languages.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Document_Object_Model
Events and the DOM	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>This chapter describes the DOM Event Model. The Event interface itself is described, as well as the interfaces for event registration on nodes in the DOM, and event listeners, and several longer examples that show how the various event interfaces relate to one another.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Document_Object_Model/Events
Examples of web and XML development using the DOM	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>This chapter provides some longer examples of web and XML development using the DOM. Wherever possible, the examples use common APIs, tricks, and patterns in JavaScript for manipulating the document object.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Document_Object_Model/Examples
How to create a DOM tree	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>This page describes how to use the DOM Core API in JavaScript to create and modify DOM objects. It applies to all Gecko-based applications (such as Firefox) both in privileged (extensions) and unprivileged (web pages) code.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Document_object_model/How_to_create_a_DOM_tree
Introduction to the DOM	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>This section provides a brief conceptual introduction to the DOM : what it is, how it provides structure for HTML and XML documents, how you can access it, and how this API presents the reference information and examples.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Document_Object_Model/Introduction
Locating DOM elements using selectors	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Selectors API provides methods that make it quick and easy to retrieve Element nodes from the DOM by matching against a set of selectors. This is much faster than past techniques, wherein it was necessary to, for example, use a loop in JavaScript code to locate the specific items you needed to find.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Document_object_model/Locating_DOM_elements_using_selectors
Traversing an HTML table with JavaScript and DOM Interfaces	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>This article is an overview of some powerful, fundamental DOM level 1 methods and how to use them from JavaScript. You will learn how to create, access and control, and remove HTML elements dynamically. The DOM methods presented here are not specific to HTML; they also apply to XML. The demonstrations provided here will work fine in any modern browser, including all versions of Firefox and IE 5+.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Document_Object_Model/Traversing_an_HTML_table_with_JavaScript_and_DOM_Interfaces
Using the W3C DOM Level 1 Core	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The W3C's DOM Level 1 Core is a powerful object model for changing the content tree of documents. It is supported in all major browsers including Mozilla Firefox and Microsoft Internet Explorer. It is a powerful base for scripting on the web.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Document_object_model/Using_the_W3C_DOM_Level_1_Core
Whitespace in the DOM	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The presence of whitespace in the DOM can make manipulation of the content tree difficult in unforeseen ways. In Mozilla, all whitespace in the text content of the original document is represented in the DOM (this does not include whitespace within tags). (This is needed internally so that the editor can preserve formatting of documents and so that white-space: pre in CSS will work.) This means that:</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Document_Object_Model/Whitespace_in_the_DOM
DOMError	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The DOMError interface describes an error object that contains an error name.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/DOMError
DOMException	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The DOMException interface represents an abnormal event (called an exception) which occurs as a result of calling a method or accessing a property of a web API. This is basically how error conditions are described in web APIs.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/DOMException
DOMException()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The DOMException() constructor returns a DOMException object with a specified message and name.</p><pre><code>var domException = new DOMException();\nvar domException = new DOMException(message);\nvar domException = new DOMException(message, name);</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/DOMException/DOMException
DOMHighResTimeStamp	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The DOMHighResTimeStamp type is a double and is used to store a time value. The value could be a discrete point in time or the difference in time between two discrete points in time. The unit is milliseconds and should be accurate to 5 µs (microseconds). However, if the browser is unable to provide a time value accurate to 5 microseconds (due, for example, to hardware or software constraints), the browser can represent the value as a time in milliseconds accurate to a millisecond.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/DOMHighResTimeStamp
DOMImplementation	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The DOMImplementation interface represent an object providing methods which are not dependent on any particular document. Such an object is returned by the Document.implementation property.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/DOMImplementation

DOMString	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>DOMString is a UTF-16 String. As JavaScript already uses such strings, DOMString is mapped directly to a String.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/DOMString
Binary strings	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>As web applications become more and more powerful, adding features such as audio and video manipulation, access to raw data using WebSockets, and so forth, it has become clear that there are times when it would be helpful for JavaScript code to be able to quickly and easily manipulate raw binary data. In the past, this had to be simulated by treating the raw data as a string and using the charCodeAt() method to read the bytes from the data buffer.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/DOMString/Binary
DOMStringMap	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Used by the dataset HTML attribute to represent data for custom attributes added to elements.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/DOMStringMap
DOMTimeStamp	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The DOMTimeStamp type represents an absolute or relative number of milliseconds, depending on the specification in which it appears.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/DOMTimeStamp
DOMTokenList	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The DOMTokenList interface represents a set of space-separated tokens. Such a set is returned by Element.classList, HTMLLinkElement.relList, HTMLAnchorElement.relList or HTMLAreaElement.relList. It is indexed beginning with 0 as with JavaScript Array objects. DOMTokenList is always case-sensitive.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/DOMTokenList
DOMTokenList.replace()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The replace () method of the DOMTokenList interface replaces an existing token within a given list by a new one.</p><pre><code>tokenList.replace(oldToken, newToken);</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/DOMTokenList/replace

This method is intended to support feature detection.</p><pre><code>var boolean&#160;= element.supports(token)</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/DOMTokenList/supports
DragEvent	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The DragEvent interface is a DOM event that represents a drag and drop interaction. The user initiates a drag by placing a pointer device (such as a mouse) on the touch surface and then dragging the pointer to a new location (such as another DOM element). Applications are free to interpret a drag and drop interaction in an application-specific way.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/DragEvent
DragEvent.dataTransfer	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The DataEvent.dataTransfer property holds the drag operation's data (as a DataTransfer object).</p><pre><code>var data = dragEvent.dataTransfer;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/DragEvent/dataTransfer
