Element	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Element interface represents an object of a Document. This interface describes methods and properties common to all kinds of elements. Specific behaviors are described in interfaces which inherit from Element but add additional functionality.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Element
Element.accessKey	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Element.accessKey property sets the keystroke by which a user can press to jump to this element.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Element/accessKey
Element.assignedSlot	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The assignedSlot property of the Element interface returns the HTMLSlotElement interface associated with the element.</p><pre><code>var htmlSlotElement = element.assignedSlot</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Element/assignedSlot
Element.attachShadow()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Element.attachShadow() method attatches a shadow DOM tree to the specified element and returns a reference to its ShadowRoot.</p><pre><code>var shadowroot = element.attachShadow(shadowRootInit); \n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Element/attachShadow
Element.attributes	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Element.attributes property returns a live collection of all attribute nodes registered to the specified node. It is a NamedNodeMap, not an Array, so it has no Array methods and the Attr nodes' indexes may differ among browsers. To be more specific, attributes is a key/value pair of strings that represents any information regarding that attribute.</p><pre><code>var attr = element.attributes;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Element/attributes
Element.classList	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Element.classList is a read-only property which returns a live DOMTokenList collection of the class attributes of the element.</p><pre><code>var elementClasses = elementNodeReference.classList;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Element/classList
Element.className	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>className gets and sets the value of the class attribute of the specified element.</p><pre><code>var cName = elementNodeReference.className;\nelementNodeReference.className = cName;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Element/className
Element.clientHeight	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Element.clientHeight read-only property is zero for elements with no CSS or inline layout boxes, otherwise it's  the inner height of an element in pixels, including padding but not the horizontal scrollbar height, border, or margin.</p><pre><code>var h = element.clientHeight;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Element/clientHeight
Element.clientLeft	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The width of the left border of an element in pixels. It includes the width of the vertical scrollbar if the text direction of the element is right–to–left and if there is an overflow causing a left vertical scrollbar to be rendered. clientLeft does not include the left margin or the left padding. clientLeft is read-only.</p><pre><code>var left = element.clientLeft;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Element/clientLeft
Element.clientTop	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The width of the top border of an element in pixels. It does not include the top margin or padding. clientTop is read-only.</p><pre><code>var top = element.clientTop;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Element/clientTop
Element.clientWidth	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Element.clientWidth property is zero for elements with no CSS or inline layout boxes, otherwise it's the inner width of an element in pixels. It includes padding but not the vertical scrollbar (if present, if rendered), border or margin.</p><pre><code>var intElemClientWidth = element.clientWidth;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Element/clientWidth
Element.closest()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Element.closest() method returns the closest ancestor of the current element (or the current element itself) which matches the selectors given in parameter. If there isn't such an ancestor, it returns null.</p><pre><code>var elt = element.closest(selectors); \n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Element/closest
Element.createShadowRoot()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Use Element.createShadowRoot to create an instance of shadow DOM. When shadow DOM is created, it is always attached to an existing element. After the shadow DOM is created, the element that it is attached to is called the shadow root.</p><pre><code>var shadowroot = element.createShadowRoot(); \n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Element/createShadowRoot
Element.currentStyle	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Element.currentStyle is a property which is a proprietary alternative to the standardized window.getComputedStyle method. It is available in old versions of Microsoft Internet Explorer.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Element/currentStyle
Element.getAttribute()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>getAttribute() returns the value of a specified attribute on the element. If the given attribute does not exist, the value returned will either be null or "" (the empty string); see Notes for details.</p><pre><code>var attribute = element.getAttribute(attributeName);\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Element/getAttribute
Element.getAttributeNode()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Returns the specified attribute of the specified element, as an Attr node.</p><pre><code>var attrNode = element.getAttributeNode(attrName); \n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Element/getAttributeNode
Element.getAttributeNodeNS()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Returns the Attr node for the attribute with the given namespace and name.</p><pre><code>attributeNode = element.getAttributeNodeNS(\nnamespace,\nnodeName) \n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Element/getAttributeNodeNS
Element.getAttributeNS()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>getAttributeNS returns the string value of the attribute with the specified namespace and name. If the named attribute does not exist, the value returned will either be null or "" (the empty string); see Notes for details.</p><pre><code>attrVal = element.getAttributeNS(namespace, name)\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Element/getAttributeNS
Element.getBoundingClientRect()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Element.getBoundingClientRect() method returns the size of an element and its position relative to the viewport.</p><pre><code>rectObject = object.getBoundingClientRect();\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Element/getBoundingClientRect
Element.getClientRects()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Element.getClientRects() method returns a collection of rectangles that indicate the bounding rectangles for each box in a client.</p><pre><code>var rectCollection = object.getClientRects();</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Element/getClientRects
Element.getElementsByClassName()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Element.getElementsByClassName() method returns a live HTMLCollection containing all child elements which have all of the given class names. When called on the document object, the complete document is searched, including the root node.</p><pre><code>var elements = element.getElementsByClassName(names);</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Element/getElementsByClassName
Element.getElementsByTagName()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Element.getElementsByTagName() method returns a live HTMLCollection of elements with the given tag name. The subtree underneath the specified element is searched, excluding the element itself. The returned list is live, meaning that it updates itself with the DOM tree automatically. Consequently, there is no need to call several times Element.getElementsByTagName() with the same element and arguments.</p><pre><code>elements = element.getElementsByTagName(tagName)</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Element/getElementsByTagName
Element.getElementsByTagNameNS()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Element.getElementsByTagNameNS() method returns a live HTMLCollection of elements with the given tag name belonging to the given namespace. It is similar to Document.getElementsByTagNameNS, except that its search is restricted to descendants of the specified element.</p><pre><code>elements = element.getElementsByTagNameNS(namespaceURI, localName)</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Element/getElementsByTagNameNS
Element.hasAttribute()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Element.hasAttribute() method returns a Boolean value indicating whether the specified element has the specified attribute or not.</p><pre><code>var result = element.hasAttribute(attName);\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Element/hasAttribute
Element.hasAttributeNS()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>hasAttributeNS returns a boolean value indicating whether the current element has the specified attribute.</p><pre><code>result =\nelement.hasAttributeNS(\nnamespace,\nlocalName) \n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Element/hasAttributeNS
Element.hasAttributes()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Element.hasAttributes() method returns a Boolean value, true or false, indicating if the current element has any attributes or not.</p><pre><code>result = targetElement.hasAttributes();</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Element/hasAttributes
Element.id	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Element.id property represents the element's identifier, reflecting the id global attribute.</p><pre><code>var idStr = elt.id; // Get the id.\nelt.id = idStr; // Set the id\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Element/id
Element.innerHTML	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Element.innerHTML property sets or gets the HTML syntax describing the element's descendants.</p><pre><code>var content = element.innerHTML;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Element/innerHTML
Element.insertAdjacentElement()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The insertAdjacentElement() method inserts a given element node at a given position relative to the element it is invoked upon.</p><pre><code>element.insertAdjacentElement(position, element);</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Element/insertAdjacentElement
Element.insertAdjacentHTML()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>insertAdjacentHTML() parses the specified text as HTML or XML and inserts the resulting nodes into the DOM tree at a specified position. It does not reparse the element it is being used on and thus it does not corrupt the existing elements inside the element. This, and avoiding the extra step of serialization make it much faster than direct innerHTML manipulation.</p><pre><code>element.insertAdjacentHTML(position, text);</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Element/insertAdjacentHTML
Element.insertAdjacentText()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The insertAdjacentText() method inserts a given text node at a given position relative to the element it is invoked upon.</p><pre><code>element.insertAdjacentText(position, element);</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Element/insertAdjacentText
Element.localName	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Element.localName read-only property returns the local part of the qualified name of an element.</p><pre><code>name = element.localName\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Element/localName
Element.matches()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Element.matches() method returns true if the element would be selected by the specified selector string; otherwise, returns false.</p><pre><code>var result = element.matches(selectorString); \n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Element/matches
Element.name	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>name gets or sets the name property of a DOM object; it only applies to the following elements: &lt;a&gt;, &lt;applet&gt;, &lt;button&gt;, &lt;form&gt;, &lt;frame&gt;, &lt;iframe&gt;, &lt;img&gt;, &lt;input&gt;, &lt;map&gt;, &lt;meta&gt;, &lt;object&gt;, &lt;param&gt;, &lt;select&gt;, and &lt;textarea&gt;.</p><pre><code>HTMLElement.name = string;\nvar elName = HTMLElement.name;\n\nvar fControl = HTMLFormElement.elementName;\nvar controlCollection = HTMLFormElement.elements.elementName;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Element/name
Element.namespaceURI	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Element.namespaceURI read-only property returns the namespace URI of the element, or null if the element is not in a namespace.</p><pre><code>namespace = element.namespaceURI</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Element/namespaceURI
Element.ongotpointercapture	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>ongotpointercapture is an EventHandler property of the Element interface that returns the event handler (function) for the gotpointercapture event type.</p><pre><code>var gotCaptureHandler = target.ongotpointercpature;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Element/ongotpointercapture
Element.onlostpointercapture	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>onlostpointercapture is an EventHandler property of the Element interface that returns the event handler (function) for the lostpointercapture event type.</p><pre><code>var lostCaptureHandler = target.onlostpointercpature;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Element/onlostpointercapture
Element.onwheel	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The onwheel property returns the onwheel event handler code on the current element.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Element/onwheel
Element.outerHTML	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The outerHTML attribute of the element DOM interface gets the serialized HTML fragment describing the element including its descendants. It can be set to replace the element with nodes parsed from the given string.</p><pre><code>var content = element.outerHTML;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Element/outerHTML
Element.prefix	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Element.prefix read-only property returns the namespace prefix of the specified element, or null if no prefix is specified.</p><pre><code>string = element.prefix\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Element/prefix
Element.querySelector()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Returns the first element that is a descendant of the element on which it is invoked that matches the specified group of selectors.</p><pre><code>element = baseElement.querySelector(selectors);\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Element/querySelector
Element.querySelectorAll()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Returns a non-live NodeList of all elements descended from the element on which it is invoked that match the specified group of CSS selectors.</p><pre><code>elementList = baseElement.querySelectorAll(selectors);\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Element/querySelectorAll
Element.releasePointerCapture()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Releases (stops) pointer capture that was previously set for a specific (PointerEvent) pointer.</p><pre><code>targetElement.releasePointerCapture(pointerId);\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Element/releasePointerCapture
Element.removeAttribute()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>removeAttribute removes an attribute from the specified element.</p><pre><code>element.removeAttribute(attrName); \n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Element/removeAttribute
Element.removeAttributeNode()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>removeAttributeNode removes the specified attribute from the current element.</p><pre><code>removedAttr = element.removeAttributeNode(attributeNode)\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Element/removeAttributeNode
Element.removeAttributeNS()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>removeAttributeNS removes the specified attribute from an element.</p><pre><code>element.removeAttributeNS(\nnamespace,\nattrName);\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Element/removeAttributeNS
Element.requestFullscreen()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Element.requestFullscreen() method issues an asynchronous request to make the element be displayed full-screen.</p><pre><code>elt.requestFullscreen();\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Element/requestFullScreen
Element.requestPointerLock()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Element.requestPointerLock() method allows to asynchronously ask for the pointer to be locked on the given element.</p><pre><code>instanceOfElement.requestPointerLock();\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Element/requestPointerLock
Element.runtimeStyle	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Element.runtimeStyle is a proprietary property&#160; similar to HTMLElement.style, except its styles, that have higher precedence and modification.It does not modify the style content attribute. It is available in old versions of Microsoft Internet Explorer.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Element/runtimeStyle
Element.scrollHeight	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Element.scrollHeight read-only attribute is a measurement of the height of an element's content, including content not visible on the screen due to overflow. The scrollHeight value is equal to the minimum height (where height includes padding but does not include border and margin) the element would require in order to fit all the content in the viewpoint without using a vertical scrollbar. It includes the element padding but not its margin.</p><pre><code>var intElemScrollHeight = element.scrollHeight;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Element/scrollHeight
Element.scrollIntoView()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Element.scrollIntoView() method scrolls the current element into the visible area of the browser window.</p><pre><code>element.scrollIntoView(); // Equivalent to element.scrollIntoView(true)\nelement.scrollIntoView(alignToTop); // Boolean arguments\nelement.scrollIntoView(scrollIntoViewOptions); // Object argument\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Element/scrollIntoView
Element.scrollIntoViewIfNeeded()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Element.scrollIntoViewIfNeeded() method scrolls the current element into the visible area of the browser window if it's not already within the visible area of the browser window. If the element is already within the visible area of the browser window, then no scrolling takes place. This method is a proprietary variation of the standard Element.scrollIntoView() method.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Element/scrollIntoViewIfNeeded
Element.scrollLeft	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Element.scrollLeft property gets or sets the number of pixels that an element's content is scrolled to the left.</p><pre><code>// Get the number of pixels scrolled\nvar sLeft = element.scrollLeft;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Element/scrollLeft
Element.scrollLeftMax	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Element.scrollLeftMax read-only property returns a Number representing the maximum left scroll offset possible for the element.</p><pre><code>var pxl = elt.scrollLeftMax;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Element/scrollLeftMax
Element.scrollTop	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Element.scrollTop property gets or sets the number of pixels that the content of an element is scrolled upward. An element's scrollTop is a measurement of the distance of an element's top to its topmost visible content. When an element content does not generate a vertical scrollbar, then its scrollTop value defaults to 0.</p><pre><code>// Get the number of pixels scrolled\nvar  intElemScrollTop = someElement.scrollTop;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Element/scrollTop
Element.scrollTopMax	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Element.scrollTopMax read-only property returns a Number representing the maximum top scroll offset possible for the element.</p><pre><code>var pxl = elt.scrollTopMax;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Element/scrollTopMax
Element.scrollWidth	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Element.scrollWidth read–only property returns either the width in pixels of the content of an element or the width of the element itself, whichever is greater. If the element is wider than its content area (for example, if there are scroll bars for scrolling through the content), the scrollWidth is larger than the clientWidth.</p><pre><code>var xScrollWidth = element.scrollWidth;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Element/scrollWidth
Element.setAttribute()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Adds a new attribute or changes the value of an existing attribute on the specified element.</p><pre><code>element.setAttribute(name, value);\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Element/setAttribute
Element.setAttributeNode()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>setAttributeNode() adds a new Attr node to the specified element.</p><pre><code>var replacedAttr = element.setAttributeNode(attribute);\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Element/setAttributeNode
Element.setAttributeNodeNS()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>setAttributeNodeNS adds a new namespaced attribute node to an element.</p><pre><code>replacedAttr = element.setAttributeNodeNS(attributeNode) \n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Element/setAttributeNodeNS
Element.setAttributeNS()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>setAttributeNS adds a new attribute or changes the value of an attribute with the given namespace and name.</p><pre><code>element.setAttributeNS(\nnamespace,\nname,\nvalue)\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Element/setAttributeNS
Element.setCapture()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Call this method during the handling of a mousedown event to retarget all mouse events to this element until the mouse button is released or document.releaseCapture() is called.</p><pre><code>element.setCapture(retargetToElement);\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Element/setCapture
Element.setPointerCapture()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Pointer capture allows events for a particular pointer event (PointerEvent) to be re-targeted to a particular element instead of the normal target (or hit test) at a pointer's location. This can be used to ensure that an element continues to receive pointer events even if the pointer device's contact moves off the element (for example by scrolling).</p><pre><code>targetElement.setPointerCapture(pointerId);\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Element/setPointerCapture
Element.shadowRoot	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Element.shadowRoot read-only property represents the shadow root hosted by the element. Use Element.attachShadow to add a shadow root to an existing element.</p><pre><code>var shadowroot = element.shadowRoot; \n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Element/shadowRoot
Element.slot	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The slot property of the Element interface returns the name of the shadow DOM slot attatched to the element. A slot is a placeholder inside a web component that users can fill with their own markup.</p><pre><code>var aString = element.slot\nelement.slot = aString\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Element/slot
Element.tabStop	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The tabStop property of the Element interface returns a Boolean indicating if the element can receive input focus via the tab key. If the specified element is a shadow host tab navigation is delegated to its children.</p><pre><code>var isTabStop = element.tabStop;\nelement.tabStop = (true|false);\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Element/tabStop
Element.tagName	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Returns the name of the element.</p><pre><code>elementName = element.tagName;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Element/tagName
Encoding API	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Encoding API defines allows to deal with text encoded with different methods. It mainly allows to handle legacy content, encrypted with old methods, as it requires new content to be encoded using UTF-8.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Encoding_API
Encrypted Media Extensions API	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The EncryptedMediaExtenstions API provides interfaces for controlling the playback of content which is subject to a digital restrictions management scheme.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Encrypted_Media_Extensions_API
EntrySync	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The EntrySync interface of the FileSystem API represents an entry in a file system. The entry can be a FileEntrySync or a DirectoryEntry. It includes methods for working with files—including copying, moving, removing, and reading files—as well as information about the file it points to—including the file name and its path from the root to the entry.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/EntrySync
ErrorEvent	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The ErrorEvent interface represents events providing information related to errors in scripts or in files.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/ErrorEvent
Event	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Event interface represents any event of the DOM. It contains common properties and methods to any event.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Event
Event.bubbles	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Indicates whether the given event bubbles up through the DOM or not.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Event/bubbles
Event.cancelable	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Indicates whether the event is cancelable or not.</p><pre><code>bool = event.cancelable\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Event/cancelable
Event.cancelBubble	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Event.cancelBubble property indicates if event bubbling for this event has been canceled or not. It is set to false by default, allowing the event to bubble up the DOM, if it is a bubbleable event. Setting this property to true stops the event from bubbling up the DOM. Not all events are allowed to bubble up the DOM.</p><pre><code>event.cancelBubble = bool;\nvar bool = event.cancelBubble;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Event/cancelBubble
Comparison of Event Targets	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>It's easy to get confused about which target to examine when writing an event handler. This article should clarify the use of the target properties.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Event/Comparison_of_Event_Targets
Event.createEvent()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Creates a new event, which must then be initialized by calling its init() method.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Event/createEvent
Event.currentTarget	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Identifies the current target for the event, as the event traverses the DOM. It always refers to the element the event handler has been attached to as opposed to event.target which identifies the element on which the event occurred.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Event/currentTarget
Event.deepPath	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The deepPath property of the Event interface returns an Array of nodes through which the event bubbled.</p><pre><code>var nodes[] = Event.deepPath</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Event/deepPath
Event.defaultPrevented	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Returns a boolean indicating whether or not event.preventDefault() was called on the event.</p><pre><code>bool = event.defaultPrevented </code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Event/defaultPrevented
Event()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Event() constructor creates a new Event.</p><pre><code> event = new Event(typeArg, eventInit);</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Event/Event
Event.eventPhase	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Indicates which phase of the event flow is currently being evaluated.</p><pre><code>var phase = event.eventPhase;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Event/eventPhase
Event.explicitOriginalTarget	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The explicit original target of the event. (Mozilla-specific)</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Event/explicitOriginalTarget
Event.initEvent()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Event.initEvent() method is used to initialize the value of an event created using Document.createEvent().</p><pre><code>event.initEvent(type, bubbles, cancelable);</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Event/initEvent
Event.isTrusted	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The isTrusted read-only property of the Event interface is a boolean that is true when the event was generated by a user action, and false when the event was created or modified by a script or dispatched via dispatchEvent.</p><pre><code>var bool = event.isTrusted;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Event/isTrusted
Event.originalTarget	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The original target of the event before any retargetings. (Mozilla-specific)</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Event/originalTarget
Event.preventDefault()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Cancels the event if it is cancelable, without stopping further propagation of the event.</p><pre><code>event.preventDefault();</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Event/preventDefault
Event.returnValue	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Event.returnValue property indicates if the default action for this event has been prevented or not. It is set to true by default, allowing the default action to occur. Setting this property to false prevents the default action.</p><pre><code>event.returnValue = bool;\nvar bool = event.returnValue;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Event/returnValue
Event.scoped	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The scoped property of the Event interface returns a Boolean indicating whether the given event bubbles. If this value is true, deepPath will only contain a target node.</p><pre><code>var scoped = Event.scoped</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Event/scoped
Event.srcElement	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Event.srcElement is a proprietary alias for the standard Event.target property. It is specific to old versions of Microsoft Internet Explorer.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Event/srcElement
Event.stopImmediatePropagation()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Prevents other listeners of the same event from being called.</p><pre><code>event.stopImmediatePropagation(); \n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Event/stopImmediatePropagation
Event.stopPropagation()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Prevents further propagation of the current event in the capturing and bubbling phases.</p><pre><code>event.stopPropagation();</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Event/stopPropagation
Event.target	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>A reference to the object that dispatched the event. It is different from event.currentTarget when the event handler is called during the bubbling or capturing phase of the event.</p><pre><code>theTarget = event.target</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Event/target
Event.timeStamp	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Returns the time (in milliseconds) at which the event was created.</p><pre><code>event.timeStamp\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Event/timeStamp
Event.type	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Event.type read-only property returns a string containing the type of event. It is set when the event is constructed and is the name commonly used to refer to the specific event.</p><pre><code>event.type\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Event/type
EventListener	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>This method is called whenever an event occurs of the type for which the EventListener interface was registered.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/EventListener
EventSource	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The EventSource interface is used to receive server-sent events. It connects to a server over HTTP and receives events in text/event-stream format without closing the connection.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/EventSource
EventSource()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The EventSource () constructor returns a newly-created EventSource, which represents a remote ressource.</p><pre><code>pc = new EventSource(url, configuration);</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/EventSource/EventSource
EventTarget	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>EventTarget is an interface implemented by objects that can receive events and may have listeners for them.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/EventTarget
EventTarget.addEventListener()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The EventTarget.addEventListener() method registers the specified listener on the EventTarget it's called on. The event target may be an Element in a document, the Document itself, a Window, or any other object that supports events (such as XMLHttpRequest).</p><pre><code>target.addEventListener(type, listener[, options]);\ntarget.addEventListener(type, listener[, useCapture]);\ntarget.addEventListener(type, listener[, useCapture, wantsUntrusted  ]); // Gecko/Mozilla only\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/EventTarget/addEventListener
EventTarget.attachEvent()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>This is a proprietary Microsoft Internet Explorer alternative to the standard EventTarget.addEventListener() method.</p><pre><code>attached = target.attachEvent(eventNameWithOn, callback)\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/EventTarget/attachEvent
EventTarget.detachEvent()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>This is a proprietary Microsoft Internet Explorer alternative to the standard EventTarget.removeEventListener() method.</p><pre><code>target.detachEvent(eventNameWithOn, callback)\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/EventTarget/detachEvent
EventTarget.dispatchEvent()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Dispatches an Event at the specified EventTarget, invoking the affected EventListener s in the appropriate order. The normal event processing rules (including the capturing and optional bubbling phase) also apply to events dispatched manually with dispatchEvent().</p><pre><code>cancelled = !target.dispatchEvent(event)\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/EventTarget/dispatchEvent
EventTarget.fireEvent()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>This is a proprietary Microsoft Internet Explorer alternative to the standard EventTarget.dispatchEvent() method. Unlike EventTarget.dispatchEvent(), an event triggered via fireEvent() never triggers the default activation behavior of an event. For example, triggering a click event on an &lt;input type="checkbox"&gt; via fireEvent() will not toggle the checkedness of the checkbox.</p><pre><code>cancelled = target.fireEvent(eventNameWithOn, event)\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/EventTarget/fireEvent
EventTarget.removeEventListener()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The EventTarget.removeEventListener() method removes the event listener previously registered with EventTarget.addEventListener().</p><pre><code>target.removeEventListener(type, listener[, options]);\ntarget.removeEventListener(type, listener[, useCapture]);\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/EventTarget/removeEventListener
ExtendableEvent	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The ExtendableEvent interface extends the lifetime of the install and activate events dispatched on the global scope as part of the service worker lifecycle. This ensures that any functional events (like FetchEvent) are not dispatched until it upgrades database schemas and deletes the outdated cache entries.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/ExtendableEvent
ExtendableEvent.ExtendableEvent()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The ExtendableEvent() constructor creates a new ExtendableEvent object.</p><pre><code>var myExtendableEvent = new ExtendableEvent(type, init);</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/ExtendableEvent/ExtendableEvent
ExtendableEvent.waitUntil()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The ExtendableEvent.waitUntil() method extends the lifetime of the event. When called in an EventHandler associated to the install event, it delays treating the installing worker as installed until the passed Promise resolves successfully. This is primarily used to ensure that a service worker is not considered installed until all of the core caches it depends on are populated.</p><pre><code>event.waitUntil(function)</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/ExtendableEvent/waitUntil
ExtendableMessageEvent	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The ExtendableMessageEvent interface of the ServiceWorker API represents the event object of a message event fired on a service worker (when a channel message is received on the ServiceWorkerGlobalScope from another context) — extends the lifetime of such events.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/ExtendableMessageEvent
ExtendableMessageEvent.data	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The data read-only property of the ExtendableMessageEvent interface returns the event's data. It can be any data type.</p><pre><code>var myData = ExtendableMessageEventInstance.data;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/ExtendableMessageEvent/data

ExtendableMessageEvent.lastEventId	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The lastEventID read-only property of the ExtendableMessageEvent interface represents, in server-sent events, the last event ID of the event source.</p><pre><code>var myLastEventId = ExtendableMessageEventInstance.lastEventId;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/ExtendableMessageEvent/lastEventId
ExtendableMessageEvent.origin	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The origin read-only property of the ExtendableMessageEvent interface returns the origin of the ServiceWorkerClient that sent the message.</p><pre><code>var myOrigin = ExtendableMessageEventInstance.origin;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/ExtendableMessageEvent/origin
ExtendableMessageEvent.ports	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The ports read-only property of the ExtendableMessageEvent interface returns the array containing the MessagePort objects representing the ports of the associated message channel (the channel the message is being sent through.)</p><pre><code>var myPorts = ExtendableMessageEventInstance.ports;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/ExtendableMessageEvent/ports
ExtendableMessageEvent.source	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The source read-only property of the ExtendableMessageEvent returns a reference to the Client object from which the message was sent.</p><pre><code>var mySource = ExtendableMessageEventInstance.source;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/ExtendableMessageEvent/source
EXT_blend_minmax	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The EXT_blend_minmax extension is part of the WebGL API and extends blending capabilities by adding two new blend equations: the minimum or maximum color components of the source and destination colors.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/EXT_blend_minmax
EXT_color_buffer_float	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The EXT_color_buffer_float extension is part of WebGL and adds the ability to render a variety of floating point formats.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/EXT_color_buffer_float
EXT_color_buffer_half_float	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The EXT_color_buffer_half_float extension is part of the WebGL API and adds the ability to render to 16-bit floating-point color buffers.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/EXT_color_buffer_half_float
EXT_disjoint_timer_query	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The EXT_disjoint_timer_query extension is part of the WebGL API and provides a way to measure the duration of a set of GL commands, without stalling the rendering pipeline.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/EXT_disjoint_timer_query
EXT_disjoint_timer_query.beginQueryEXT()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The EXT_disjoint_timer_query.beginQueryEXT() method of the WebGL API starts a timer query.</p><pre><code>void ext.beginQueryEXT(target, query);\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/EXT_disjoint_timer_query/beginQueryEXT
EXT_disjoint_timer_query.createQueryEXT()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The EXT_disjoint_timer_query.createQueryEXT() method of the WebGL API creates and initializes WebGLTimerQueryEXT objects, which track the time needed to fully complete a set of GL commands.</p><pre><code>WebGLTimerQueryEXT ext.createQueryEXT();\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/EXT_disjoint_timer_query/createQueryEXT

EXT_disjoint_timer_query.isQueryEXT()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The EXT_disjoint_timer_query.isQueryEXT() method of the WebGL API returns true if the passed object is a WebGLTimerQueryEXT object.</p><pre><code>GLBoolean ext.isQueryEXT(query);\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/EXT_disjoint_timer_query/isQueryEXT
EXT_disjoint_timer_query.queryCounterEXT()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The EXT_disjoint_timer_query.queryCounterEXT() method of the WebGL API records the current time into the corresponding query object.</p><pre><code>void ext.queryCounterEXT(query, target);\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/EXT_disjoint_timer_query/queryCounterEXT
EXT_frag_depth	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The EXT_frag_depth extension is part of the WebGL API and enables to set a depth value of a fragment from within the fragment shader.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/EXT_frag_depth
EXT_shader_texture_lod	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The EXT_shader_texture_lod extension is part of the WebGL API and adds additional texture functions to the OpenGL ES Shading Language which provide the shader writer with explicit control of LOD (Level of detail).</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/EXT_shader_texture_lod
EXT_sRGB	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The EXT_sRGB extension is part of the WebGL API and adds sRGB support to textures and framebuffer objects.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/EXT_sRGB
EXT_texture_filter_anisotropic	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The EXT_texture_filter_anisotropic extension is part of the WebGL API and exposes two constants for anisotropic filtering (AF).</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/EXT_texture_filter_anisotropic
FederatedCredential	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The FederatedCredential interface of the the Credential Management API provides information about credentials from a federated identity provider, which is an entity that a website trusts to correctly authenticate a user, and which provides an API for that purpose. OpenID Connect is an example of such a framework. In supporting browsers an instance of this class may be passed in the credential member of the init object for global fetch.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/FederatedCredential
FederatedCredential	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The FederatedCredential constructor creates a new FederatedCredential object. In supporting browsers an instance of this class may be passed in the credential member of the init object for global fetch.</p><pre><code>var myCredential = new FederatedCredential(init)</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/FederatedCredential/FederatedCredential
provider	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The provider property of the FederatedCredential interface returns a USVString containing a credential's federated identity provider.</p><pre><code>var provider = FederatedCredential.provider</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/FederatedCredential/provider
FetchEvent	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The parameter passed into the ServiceWorkerGlobalScope.onfetch handler, FetchEvent represents a fetch action that is dispatched on the ServiceWorkerGlobalScope of a ServiceWorker. It contains information about the request and resulting response, and provides the FetchEvent.respondWith() method, which allows us to provide an arbitrary response back to the controlled page.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/FetchEvent
FetchEvent.client	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The FetchEvent.client read-only property returns the Client that the current service worker is controlling.</p><pre><code>var myClient = FetchEvent.client;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/FetchEvent/client
FetchEvent.clientId	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The clientId read-only property of the FetchEvent returns the id of the Client that the current service worker is controlling.</p><pre><code>var myClientId = FetchEvent.clientId;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/FetchEvent/clientId
FetchEvent.FetchEvent()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The FetchEvent() constructor creates a new FetchEvent object.</p><pre><code>var myFetchEvent = new FetchEvent(type, init);</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/FetchEvent/FetchEvent
FetchEvent.isReload	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The isReload read-only property of the FetchEvent interface returns true if the event was dispatched by the user attempting to reload the page, and false otherwise. Pressing the refresh button is a reload while clicking a link and pressing the back button is not.</p><pre><code>var reloaded = FetchEvent.isReload</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/FetchEvent/isReload
FetchEvent.request	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The request read-only property of the FetchEvent interface returns the Request that triggered the event handler.</p><pre><code>var recentRequest = FetchEvent.request;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/FetchEvent/request
FetchEvent.respondWith()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The respondWith() method of the FetchEvent interface is intended for containing code that generates custom responses to the requests coming from the controlled page. This code will resolve by returning a Response or network error to Fetch.</p><pre><code>FetchEvent.respondWith(\n  //Promise that resolves to a Response or a network error.\n&#8203;)</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/FetchEvent/respondWith
InstallEvent	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The InstallEvent interface represents an install action that is dispatched on the ServiceWorkerGlobalScope of a ServiceWorker. As a child of ExtendableEvent it ensures that functional events (like FetchEvent) are not dispatched during installation.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/FetchEvent_clone
Fetch API	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Fetch API provides an interface for fetching resources (including across the network). It will seem familiar to anyone who has used XMLHttpRequest, but the new API provides a more powerful and flexible feature set.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Fetch_API
Fetch basic concepts	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>At the heart of Fetch are the Interface abstractions of HTTP Request s, Response s, Headers, and Body payloads, along with a global fetch method for initiating asynchronous resource requests. Because the main components of HTTP are abstracted as JavaScript objects, it is easy for other APIs to make use of such functionality.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Fetch_API/Basic_concepts
Using Fetch	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>This kind of functionality was previously achieved using XMLHttpRequest. Fetch provides a better alternative that can be easily used by other technologies such as Service Workers. Fetch also provides a single logical place to define other HTTP-related concepts such as CORS and extensions to HTTP.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Fetch_API/Using_Fetch
File	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The File interface provides information about files and allows JavaScript in a web page to access their content.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/File
File.fileName	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Returns the name of the file. For security reasons the path is excluded from this property.</p><pre><code>var name = instanceOfFile.fileName</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/File/fileName
File.fileSize	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Returns the size of a file in bytes.</p><pre><code>var size = instanceOfFile.fileSize</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/File/fileSize
File.getAsDataURL()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The getAsDataURL provides a data: URL that encodes the entire contents of the referenced file.</p><pre><code>var url = instanceOfFile.getAsDataURL();</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/File/getAsDataURL
File.getAsText()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The getAsText method provides the file's data interpreted as text using a given encoding.</p><pre><code>var str = instanceOfFile.getAsText(encoding);</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/File/getAsText
File.lastModifiedDate	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The File.lastModifiedDate read-only property returns the last modified date of the file. Files without a known last modified date returns the current date.</p><pre><code>var time = instanceOfFile.lastModifiedDate</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/File/lastModifiedDate
File.name	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Returns the name of the file represented by a File object. For security reasons, the path is excluded from this property.</p><pre><code>var name = file.name;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/File/name
File.webkitRelativePath	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The File.webkitRelativePath is a read-only property that contains a DOMString with the path relative to the directory selected when the webkitdirectory has been set on the input element.</p><pre><code>&#160;str = fileObj.webkitRelativePath</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/File/webkitRelativePath
FileEntrySync	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The FileEntrySync interface of the File System API represents a file in a file system. It lets you write content to a file.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/FileEntrySync
FileException	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>In the File System API, a FileException object represents error conditions that you might encounter while accessing the file system using the synchronous API. It extends the FileException interface described in File Writer and adds several new error codes.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/FileException
FileList	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>An object of this type is returned by the files property of the HTML input element; this lets you access the list of files selected with the input type="file" element. It's also used for a list of files dropped into web content when using the drag and drop API; see the DataTransfer object for details on this usage.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/FileList
FileReader	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The FileReader object lets web applications asynchronously read the contents of files (or raw data buffers) stored on the user's computer, using File or Blob objects to specify the file or data to read.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/FileReader
FileReader.abort()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The abort method aborts the read operation. Upon return, the readyState will be DONE.</p><pre><code>instanceOfFileReader.abort();</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/FileReader/abort
FileReader.error	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Returns the error that occurred while reading the file.</p><pre><code>var error = instanceOfFileReader.error\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/FileReader/error
FileReader.onload	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The FileReader.onload property contains a event handler executed when the load event is fired, when content read with readAsArrayBuffer, readAsBinaryString, readAsDataURL or readAsText is available.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/FileReader/onload
FileReader.readAsArrayBuffer()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The FileReader interface's readAsArrayBuffer() method is used to start reading the contents of a specified Blob or File. When the read operation is finished, the readyState becomes DONE, and the loadend is triggered. At that time, the result attribute contains an ArrayBuffer representing the file's data.</p><pre><code>instanceOfFileReader.readAsArrayBuffer(blob);</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/FileReader/readAsArrayBuffer
FileReader.readAsBinaryString()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The readAsBinaryString method is used to start reading the contents of the specified Blob or File. When the read operation is finished, the readyState becomes DONE, and the loadend is triggered. At that time, the result attribute contains the raw binary data from the file.</p><pre><code>instanceOfFileReader.readAsBinaryString(blob);</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/FileReader/readAsBinaryString
FileReader.readAsDataURL()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The readAsDataURL method is used to read the contents of the specified Blob or File. When the read operation is finished, the readyState becomes DONE, and the loadend is triggered. At that time, the result attribute contains the data as a URL representing the file's data as a base64 encoded string.</p><pre><code>instanceOfFileReader.readAsDataURL(blob);</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/FileReader/readAsDataURL
FileReader.readAsText()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The readAsText method is used to read the contents of the specified Blob or File. When the read operation is complete, the readyState is changed to DONE, the loadend is triggered, and the result attribute contains the contents of the file as a text string.</p><pre><code>instanceOfFileReader.readAsText(blob[, encoding]);</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/FileReader/readAsText
FileReader.readyState	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Provides the current state of the reading operation.</p><pre><code>var state = instanceOfFileReader.readyState\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/FileReader/readyState
FileReader.result	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Returns the file's contents. This property is only valid after the read operation is complete, and the format of the data depends on which of the methods was used to initiate the read operation.</p><pre><code>var file = instanceOfFileReader.result\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/FileReader/result
FileReaderSync	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The FileReaderSync interface allows to read File or Blob objects in a synchronous way.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/FileReaderSync
FileRequest	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The FileRequest interface extends the DOMRequest interface to provide some extra properties necessary for the LockedFile objects.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/FileRequest
FileRequest.lockedFile	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The lockedFile property represents the LockedFile object from which the request was started.</p><pre><code>var lockedFile = instanceOfFileRequest.lockedFile\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/FileRequest/lockedFile
FileRequest.onprogress	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>This property specifies a callback function to be run repeatedly while the operation represented by a FileRequest object is in progress.</p><pre><code>instanceOfFileRequest.onprogress = function;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/FileRequest/onprogress
FileSystem	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The File and Directory Entries API interface FileSystem is used to represent a file system. Each object is passed to the success callback when requestFileSystem() is called.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/FileSystem
FileSystem.name	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The read-only name property of the FileSystem interface indicates the file system's name. This DOMString is unique among all file systems currently exposed by the File and Directory Entries API.</p><pre><code>var fsName = FileSystem.name;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/FileSystem/name
FileSystem.root	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The read-only root property of the FileSystem interface specifies a FileSystemDirectoryEntry object representing the root directory of the file system, for use with the File and Directory Entries API.</p><pre><code>var rootDirEnt = FileSystem.root;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/FileSystem/root
FileSystemDirectoryEntry	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The FileSystemDirectoryEntry interface of the File and Directory Entries API represents a directory in a file system. It provides methods which make it possible to access and manipulate the files in a directory, as well as to access the entries within the directory.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/FileSystemDirectoryEntry
FileSystemDirectoryEntry.createReader()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The FileSystemDirectoryEntry interface's method createReader () returns a FileSystemDirectoryReader object which can be used to read the entries in the directory.</p><pre><code>directoryReader = FileSystemDirectoryEntry.createReader();</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/FileSystemDirectoryEntry/createReader
FileSystemDirectoryEntry.getDirectory()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The FileSystemDirectoryEntry interface's method getDirectory () returns a FileSystemDirectoryEntry object corresponding to a directory contained somewhere within the directory subtree rooted at the directory on which it's called.</p><pre><code>FileSystemDirectoryEntry.getDirectory([path][, options][, successCallback][, errorCallback]);</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/FileSystemDirectoryEntry/getDirectory
FileSystemDirectoryEntry.getFile()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The FileSystemDirectoryEntry interface's method getFile () returns a FileSystemFileEntry object corresponding to a file contained somewhere within the directory subtree rooted at the directory on which it's called.</p><pre><code>FileSystemDirectoryEntry.getFile([path][, options][, successCallback][, errorCallback]);</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/FileSystemDirectoryEntry/getFile
FileSystemDirectoryEntry.removeRecursively()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The FileSystemDirectoryEntry interface's method removeRecursively () removes the directory as well as all of its content, hierarchically iterating over its entire subtree of descendant files and directories.</p><pre><code>FileSystemDirectoryEntry.removeRecursively(successCallback[, errorCallback]);</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/FileSystemDirectoryEntry/removeRecursively
FileSystemDirectoryReader	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The FileSystemDirectoryReader interface of the File and Directory Entries API lets you access the FileEntry -based objects (generally FileSystemFileEntry or FileSystemDirectoryEntry) representing each entry in a directory.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/FileSystemDirectoryReader
FileSystemDirectoryReader.readEntries()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The FileSystemDirectoryReader interface's readEntries() method retrieves the directory entries within the directory being read. Each time the method is called, an array containing some number of the directory's entries is passed to the success callback. When the end of the directory is reached, the success callback receives an empty array.</p><pre><code>readEntries(successCallback[, errorCallback]);\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/FileSystemDirectoryReader/readEntries
FileSystemEntry	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The FileSystemEntry interface of the File and Directory Entries API represents a single in a file system. The entry can be a file or a directory (directories are represented by the DirectoryEntry interface. It includes methods for working with files—including copying, moving, removing, and reading files—as well as information about a file it points to—including the file name and its path from the root to the entry.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/FileSystemEntry
FileSystemFileEntry	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The FileSystemFileEntry interface of the File System API represents a file in a file system. It offers properties describing the file's attributes, as well as methods for creating a FileWriter object to write to the file or a File object to read the file.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/FileSystemFileEntry
FileSystemFileEntry.createWriter()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The FileSystemFileEntry interface's method createWriter() returns a FileWriter object which can be used to write data into the file represented by the directory entry.</p><pre><code>FileSystemFileEntry.createWriter(successCallback[, errorCallback]);</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/FileSystemFileEntry/createWriter
FileSystemFileEntry.file()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The FileSystemFileEntry interface's method file () returns a File object which can be used to read data from the file represented by the directory entry.</p><pre><code>FileSystemFileEntry.file(successCallback[, errorCallback]);</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/FileSystemFileEntry/file

File and Directory Entries API	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The File and Directory Entries API simulates a local file system that web apps can navigate within. You can develop apps which read, write, and create files and/or directories in a virtual, sandboxed file system.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/File_and_Directory_Entries_API
Introduction to the File and Directory Entries API	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The File and Directory Entries API simulates a local file system that web apps can navigate around. You can develop apps that can read, write, and create files and directories in a sandboxed, virtual file system.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/File_and_Directory_Entries_API/Introduction
FileHandle API	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The FileHandle API allows for the manipulating of files, including creating files and modifying their content (unlike the File API). Because the files manipulated through that API can be physically stored on the device, the editing part uses a turn-based locking mechanism in order to avoid race issues.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/File_Handle_API
FocusEvent	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The FocusEvent interface represents focus-related events like focus, blur, focusin, or focusout.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/FocusEvent
FocusEvent()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The FocusEvent() constructor returns a newly created FocusEvent object with an optional EventTarget. When a change a focus has a source and a destination, the relatedTarget value must be set to the other target.</p><pre><code>var focusEvent = new FocusEvent(typeArg, focusEventInit); \n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/FocusEvent/FocusEvent
FocusEvent.relatedTarget	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The FocusEvent.relatedTarget read-only property represents a secondary target for this event, which will depend on the event itself. In some cases (like when tabbing in or out a page), this property may be set to null for security reasons.</p><pre><code>secondTarget = focusEvent.relatedTarget</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/FocusEvent/relatedTarget
FontFace	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The FontFace interface represents a single usable font face. It allows control of the source of the font face, being a URL to an external resource, or a buffer; it also allows control of when the font face is loaded and its current status.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/FontFace
FontFaceSet	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The FontFaceSet interface of the CSS Font Loading API is an interface for loading font faces and checking their download statuses.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/FontFaceSet
FontFaceSet.check()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>A Boolean that is true if the font list is available</p><pre><code>bool = aFontFaceSet.check(font);\nbool = aFontFaceSet.check(font, text);\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/FontFaceSet/check
FontFaceSet.load()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>A Promise of an Array of FontFace loaded. The promise is fulfilled when all the fonts are loaded; it is rejected if one of the fonts failed to load.</p><pre><code>result = aFontFaceSet.load(font);\n\nresult = aFontFaceSet.load(font, text);\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/FontFaceSet/load

Force Touch events	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Force Touch events are a proprietary, Apple-specific feature which makes possible (where supported by the input hardware) new interactions based on how hard the user clicks or presses down on the touchscreen or trackpad.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Force_Touch_events
FormData	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The FormData interface provides a way to easily construct a set of key/value pairs representing form fields and their values, which can then be easily sent using the XMLHttpRequest.send() method. It uses the same format a form would use if the encoding type were set to "multipart/form-data".</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/FormData
FormData.append()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The append() method of the FormData interface appends a new value onto an existing key inside a FormData object, or adds the key if it does not already exist.</p><pre><code>formData.append(name, value);\nformData.append(name, value, filename);</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/FormData/append
FormData.delete()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The delete() method of the FormData interface deletes a key and its value(s) from a FormData object.</p><pre><code>formData.delete(name);</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/FormData/delete
FormData.entries()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The FormData.entries() method returns an iterator allowing to go through all key/value pairs contained in this object. The key of each pair is a USVString object; the value either a USVString, or a Blob.</p><pre><code>formData.entries();</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/FormData/entries
FormData()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The FormData() constructor creates a new FormData object.</p><pre><code>var formData = new FormData(form)</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/FormData/FormData
FormData.get()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The get() method of the FormData interface returns the first value associated with a given key from within a FormData object. If you expect multiple values and want all of them, use the getAll() method instead.</p><pre><code>formData.get(name);</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/FormData/get
FormData.getAll()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The getAll() method of the FormData interface returns all the values associated with a given key from within a FormData object.</p><pre><code>formData.getAll(name);</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/FormData/getAll
FormData.has()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The has() method of the FormData interface returns a boolean stating whether a FormData object contains a certain key.</p><pre><code>formData.has(name);</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/FormData/has
FormData.keys()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The FormData.keys() method returns an iterator allowing to go through all keys contained in this object. The keys are USVString objects.</p><pre><code>formData.keys();</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/FormData/keys
FormData.set()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The set() method of the FormData interface sets a new value for an existing key inside a FormData object, or adds the key/value if it does not already exist.</p><pre><code>formData.set(name, value);\nformData.set(name, value, filename);</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/FormData/set
Using FormData Objects	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The FormData object lets you compile a set of key/value pairs to send using XMLHttpRequest. It is primarily intended for use in sending form data, but can be used independently from forms in order to transmit keyed data. The transmitted data is in the same format that the form's submit() method would use to send the data if the form's encoding type were set to multipart/form-data.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/FormData/Using_FormData_Objects
FormData.values()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The FormData.values() method returns an iterator allowing to go through all values contained in this object. The values are USVString or Blob objects.</p><pre><code>formData.values();</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/FormData/values
Frame Timing API	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The PerformanceFrameTiming interface provides frame timing data about the browser's event loop. A frame represents the amount of work a browser does in one event loop iteration such as processing DOM events, resizing, scrolling, rendering, CSS animations, etc. A frame rate of 60 fps (frames per second) for a 60 Hz refresh rate is a common target for a good responsive user experience. This means the browser should process a frame in about 16.7 ms.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Frame_Timing_API
Using the Frame Timing API	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The PerformanceFrameTiming interface provides frame timing data about the browser's event loop. A frame represents the amount of work a browser does in one event loop iteration such as processing DOM events, resizing, scrolling, rendering, CSS animations, etc. A frame rate of 60 fps (frames per second) for a 60 Hz refresh rate is a common target for a good responsive user experience. This means the browser should process a frame in about 16.7ms.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Frame_Timing_API/Using_the_Frame_Timing_API
Fullscreen API	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Fullscreen API provides an easy way for web content to be presented using the user's entire screen. The API lets you easily direct the browser to make an element and its children, if any, occupy the fullscreen, eliminating all browser user interface and other applications from the screen for the duration.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Fullscreen_API
GainNode	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The gain is a unitless value, changing with time, that is multiplied to each corresponding sample of all input channels. If modified, the new gain is applied using a de-zippering algorithm in order to prevent unaesthetic 'clicks' from appearing in the resulting audio.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/GainNode
GainNode.gain	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>An AudioParam.</p><pre><code>var audioCtx = new AudioContext();\nvar gainNode = audioCtx.createGain();\ngainNode.gain.value = 0.5;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/GainNode/gain
