GamepadEvent	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The GamepadEvent interface of the Gamepad API contains references to gamepads connected to the system, which is what the gamepad events Window.gamepadconnected and Window.gamepaddisconnected are fired in response to.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/GamepadEvent
GamepadEvent.gamepad	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The GamepadEvent.gamepad property of the GamepadEvent interface returns a Gamepad object, providing access to the associated gamepad data for fired gamepadconnected and gamepaddisconnected events.</p><pre><code>readonly    attribute Gamepad gamepad;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/GamepadEvent/gamepad
Gamepad API	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Gamepad API is a way for developers to access and respond to signals from gamepads and other game controllers in a simple, consistent way. It contains three interfaces, two events and one specialist function, to respond to gamepads being connected and disconnected, and to access other information about the gamepads themselves, and what buttons and other controls are currently being pressed.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Gamepad_API
Using the Gamepad API	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>HTML5 introduced many of the necessary components for rich, interactive game development. Technologies like canvas, WebGL, audio, and video, along with JavaScript implementations, have matured to the point where they can now support many tasks previously requiring native code. The Gamepad API is a way for developers and designers to access and use gamepads and other game controllers.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Gamepad_API/Using_the_Gamepad_API
Geolocation	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Geolocation interface represents an object able to programmatically obtain the position of the device. It gives Web content access to the location of the device. This allows a Web site or app to offer customized results based on the user's location.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Geolocation
Geolocation.clearWatch()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Geolocation.clearWatch() method is used to unregister location/error monitoring handlers previously installed using Geolocation.watchPosition().</p><pre><code>navigator.geolocation.clearWatch(id);</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Geolocation/clearWatch
Geolocation.getCurrentPosition()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Geolocation.getCurrentPosition() method is used to get the current position of the device.</p><pre><code>navigator.geolocation.getCurrentPosition(success[, error[, options]])</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Geolocation/getCurrentPosition
Using geolocation	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The geolocation API allows the user to provide their location to web applications if they so desire. For privacy reasons, the user is asked for permission to report location information.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Geolocation/Using_geolocation
Geolocation.watchPosition()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Geolocation.watchPosition() method is used to register a handler function that will be called automatically each time the position of the device changes. You can also, optionally, specify an error handling callback function.</p><pre><code>id = navigator.geolocation.watchPosition(success[, error[, options]])</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Geolocation/watchPosition

HashChangeEvent	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The hashchange event is fired when the fragment identifier of the URL has changed (the part of the URL that follows the # symbol, including the # symbol).</p><pre><code>window.onhashchange = funcRef;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/HashChangeEvent
Headers	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Headers interface of the Fetch API allows you to perform various actions on HTTP request and response headers. These actions include retrieving, setting, adding to, and removing. A Headers object has an associated header list, which is initially empty and consists of zero or more name and value pairs. You can add to this using methods like append() (see Examples.) In all methods of this interface, header names are matched by case-insensitive byte sequence.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Headers
Headers.append()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The append() method of the Headers interface appends a new value onto an existing header inside a Headers object, or adds the header if it does not already exist.</p><pre><code>myHeaders.append(name,value);</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Headers/append
Headers.delete()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The delete() method of the Headers interface deletes a header from the current Headers object.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Headers/delete
Headers.entries()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Headers.entries() method returns an iterator allowing to go through all key/value pairs contained in this object. The both the key and value of each pairs are ByteString objects.</p><pre><code>headers.entries();</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Headers/entries
Headers.get()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The get() method of the Headers interface returns the first value of a given header from within a Headers object. If the requested header doesn't exist in the Headers object, the call returns null.</p><pre><code>myHeaders.get(name);</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Headers/get
Headers.getAll()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The getAll() method of the Headers interface returns an array of all the values of a header within a Headers object with a given name. If the requested header doesn't exist in the Headers object, it returns an empty array.</p><pre><code>myHeaders.getAll(name);</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Headers/getAll
Headers.has()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The has() method of the Headers interface returns a boolean stating whether a Headers object contains a certain header.</p><pre><code>myHeaders.has(name);</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Headers/has
Headers()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Headers() constructor creates a new Headers object.</p><pre><code>var myHeaders = new Headers(init);</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Headers/Headers
Headers.keys()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Headers.keys() method returns an iterator allowing to go through all keys contained in this object. The keys are ByteString objects.</p><pre><code>headers.keys();</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Headers/keys
Headers.set()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The set() method of the Headers interface sets a new value for an existing header inside a Headers object, or adds the header if it does not already exist.</p><pre><code>myHeaders.set(name,value);</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Headers/set
Headers.values()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Headers.values() method returns an iterator allowing to go through all values contained in this object. The values are ByteString objects.</p><pre><code>headers.values();</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Headers/values
History	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The History interface allows to manipulate the browser session history, that is the pages visited in the tab or frame that the current page is loaded in.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/History
History.length	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The History.length read-only property returns an Integer representing the number of elements in the session history, including the currently loaded page. For example, for a page loaded in a new tab this property returns 1.</p><pre><code>length = history.length;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/History/length
Manipulating the browser history	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The DOM window object provides access to the browser's history through the history object. It exposes useful methods and properties that let you move back and forth through the user's history, as well as -- starting with HTML5 -- manipulate the contents of the history stack.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/History_API
Ajax navigation example	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>This is an example of an AJAX web site composed only of three pages (first_page.php, second_page.php and third_page.php). To see how it works, please, create the following files (or git clone https://github.com/giabao/mdn-ajax-nav-example.git):</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/History_API/Example
HTMLAnchorElement	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The HTMLAnchorElement interface represents hyperlink elements and provides special properties and methods (beyond those of the regular HTMLElement object interface they also have available to them by inheritance) for manipulating the layout and presentation of such elements.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/HTMLAnchorElement
HTMLAnchorElement.referrerPolicy	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The HTMLAnchorElement.referrerPolicy property reflect the HTML referrerpolicy attribute of the a element defining which referrer is sent when fetching the resource.</p><pre><code>refStr = anchorElt.referrerPolicy;\nanchorElt.referrerPolicy = refStr;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/HTMLAnchorElement/referrerPolicy
HTMLAnchorElement.rel	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The HTMLAnchorElement.rel property reflects the rel attribute. It is a DOMString containing a space-separated list of link types indicating the relationship between the resource represented by the a element and the current document.</p><pre><code>var relstr = anchorElt.rel;\nanchorElt.rel = relstr;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/HTMLAnchorElement/rel
HTMLAnchorElement.relList	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The HTMLAnchorElement.relList read-only property reflects the rel attribute. It is a live DOMTokenList containing the set of link types indicating the relationship between the resource represented by the a element and the current document.</p><pre><code>var relstr = anchorElt.relList;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/HTMLAnchorElement/relList
HTMLAreaElement	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The HTMLAreaElement interface provides special properties and methods (beyond those of the regular object HTMLElement interface it also has available to it by inheritance) for manipulating the layout and presentation of area elements.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/HTMLAreaElement
HTMLAreaElement.referrerPolicy	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The HTMLAreaElement.referrerPolicy property reflect the HTML referrerpolicy attribute of the area element defining which referrer is sent when fetching the resource.</p><pre><code>refStr = areaElt.referrerPolicy;\nareaElt.referrerPolicy = refStr;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/HTMLAreaElement/referrerPolicy
HTMLAreaElement.rel	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The HTMLAreaElement.rel property reflects the rel attribute. It is a DOMString containing a space-separated list of link types indicating the relationship between the resource represented by the a element and the current document.</p><pre><code>var relstr = areaElt.rel;\nareaElt.rel = relstr;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/HTMLAreaElement/rel
HTMLAreaElement.relList	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The HTMLAreaElement.relList read-only property reflects the rel attribute. It is a live DOMTokenList containing the set of link types indicating the relationship between the resource represented by the area element and the current document.</p><pre><code>var relstr = areaElt.relList;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/HTMLAreaElement/relList
HTMLAudioElement	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The HTMLAudioElement interface provides access to the properties of audio elements, as well as methods to manipulate them. It derives from the HTMLMediaElement interface.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/HTMLAudioElement
HTMLBaseElement	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The HTMLBaseElement interface contains the base URI for a document. This object inherits all of the properties and methods as described in the HTMLElement interface.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/HTMLBaseElement
HTMLBodyElement	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The HTMLBodyElement interface provides special properties (beyond those of the regular HTMLElement interface they also inherit) for manipulating body elements.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/HTMLBodyElement
HTMLBRElement	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The HTMLBRElement interface represents a HTML line break element (br). It inherits from HTMLElement.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/HTMLBRElement
HTMLButtonElement	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The HTMLButtonElement interface provides properties and methods (beyond the button object interface it also has available to them by inheritance) for manipulating the layout and presentation of button elements.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/HTMLButtonElement
HTMLCanvasElement	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The HTMLCanvasElement interface provides properties and methods for manipulating the layout and presentation of canvas elements. The HTMLCanvasElement interface also inherits the properties and methods of the HTMLElement interface.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/HTMLCanvasElement
HTMLCanvasElement.captureStream()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The HTMLCanvasElement.captureStream() method returns a CanvasCaptureMediaStream that is a real-time video capture of the surface of the canvas.</p><pre><code>MediaStream = canvas.captureStream(framerate);\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/HTMLCanvasElement/captureStream
HTMLCanvasElement.getContext()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The HTMLCanvasElement.getContext() method returns a drawing context on the canvas, or null if the context identifier is not supported.</p><pre><code>canvas.getContext(contextType, contextAttributes);\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/HTMLCanvasElement/getContext
HTMLCanvasElement.height	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The HTMLCanvasElement.height property is a positive integer reflecting the height HTML attribute of the canvas element interpreted in CSS pixels. When the attribute is not specified, or if it is set to an invalid value, like a negative, the default value of 150 is used.</p><pre><code>var pxl = canvas.height;\ncanvas.height = pxl;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/HTMLCanvasElement/height
HTMLCanvasElement.mozGetAsFile()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The HTMLCanvasElement.mozGetAsFille() method returns a File object representing the image contained in the canvas; this file is a memory-based file, with the specified name. If type is not specified, the image type is image/png.</p><pre><code>canvas.mozFetchAsStream(name, type);\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/HTMLCanvasElement/mozGetAsFile
HTMLCanvasElement.mozOpaque	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The HTMLCanvasElement.mozOpaque property is a Boolean reflecting the moz-opaque HTML attribute of the canvas element. It lets the canvas know whether or not translucency will be a factor. If the canvas knows there's no translucency, painting performance can be optimized.</p><pre><code>var opaque = canvas.mozOpaque;\ncanvas.mozOpaque = true;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/HTMLCanvasElement/mozOpaque
HTMLCanvasElement.toBlob()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The HTMLCanvasElement.toBlob() method creates a Blob object representing the image contained in the canvas; this file may be cached on the disk or stored in memory at the discretion of the user agent. If type is not specified, the image type is image/png. The created image is in a resolution of 96dpi. The third argument is used with image/jpeg images to specify the quality of the output.</p><pre><code>void canvas.toBlob(callback, mimeType, qualityArgument);\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/HTMLCanvasElement/toBlob
HTMLCanvasElement.toDataURL()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The HTMLCanvasElement.toDataURL() method returns a data URI containing a representation of the image in the format specified by the type parameter (defaults to PNG). The returned image is in a resolution of 96 dpi.</p><pre><code>canvas.toDataURL(type, encoderOptions);\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/HTMLCanvasElement/toDataURL
HTMLCanvasElement.transferControlToOffscreen()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The HTMLCanvasElement.transferControlToOffscreen() method transfers control to an OffscreenCanvas object, either on the main thread or on a worker.</p><pre><code>OffscreenCanvas HTMLCanvasElement.transferControlToOffscreen()</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/HTMLCanvasElement/transferControlToOffscreen
HTMLCanvasElement.width	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The HTMLCanvasElement.width property is a positive integer reflecting the width HTML attribute of the canvas element interpreted in CSS pixels. When the attribute is not specified, or if it is set to an invalid value, like a negative, the default value of 300 is used.</p><pre><code>var pxl = canvas.width;\ncanvas.width = pxl;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/HTMLCanvasElement/width
HTMLCollection	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The HTMLCollection interface represents a generic collection (array-like object similar to arguments) of elements (in document order) and offers methods and properties for selecting from the list.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/HTMLCollection
HTMLCollection.item	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>HTMLCollection.item() gets an element by position.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/HTMLCollection/item
HTMLContentElement	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The HTMLContentElement interface represents a content HTML Element, which is used in Shadow DOM.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/HTMLContentElement
HTMLContentElement.getDistributedNodes()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The HTMLContentElement.getDistributedNodes() method returns a static NodeList of the distributed nodes associated with this content element.</p><pre><code>var nodeList = object.getDistributedNodes()\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/HTMLContentElement/getDistributedNodes
HTMLContentElement.select	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The HTMLContentElement.select property reflects the select attribute. It is a DOMString containing a space-separated list of CSS selectors that select the content to insert in place of the content element.</p><pre><code>object.select = "CSSselector CSSselector ...";\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/HTMLContentElement/select
HTMLDataElement	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The HTMLDataElement interface provides special properties (beyond the regular HTMLElement interface it also has available to it by inheritance) for manipulating data elements.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/HTMLDataElement
HTMLDataListElement	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The HTMLDataListElement interface provides special properties (beyond the HTMLElement object interface it also has available to it by inheritance) to manipulate datalist elements and their content.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/HTMLDataListElement
HTMLDialogElement	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The HTMLDialogElement interface provides methods to manipulate dialog elements. It inherits properties and methods from the HTMLElement interface.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/HTMLDialogElement
HTMLDivElement	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The HTMLDivElement interface provides special properties (beyond the regular HTMLElement interface it also has available to it by inheritance) for manipulating div elements.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/HTMLDivElement
HTMLDListElement	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The HTMLDListElement interface provides special properties (beyond those of the regular HTMLElement interface it also has available to it by inheritance) for manipulating definition list elements.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/HTMLDListElement
HTMLDocument	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>HTMLDocument is an abstract interface of the DOM which provides access to special properties and methods not present by default on a regular (XML) document.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/HTMLDocument
HTMLElement	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The HTMLElement interface represents any HTML element. Some elements directly implement this interface, others implement it via an interface that inherits it.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/HTMLElement
HTMLElement.blur()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The HTMLElement.blur() method removes keyboard focus from the current element.</p><pre><code>elt.blur()</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/HTMLElement/blur
HTMLElement.click()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The HTMLElement.click() method simulates a mouse-click on an element.</p><pre><code>elt.click()</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/HTMLElement/click
HTMLElement.contentEditable	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The HTMLElement.contentEditable property is used to indicate whether or not the element is editable. This enumerated attribute can have the following values:</p><pre><code>editable = element.contentEditable\nelement.contentEditable = "true"\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/HTMLElement/contentEditable
HTMLElement.dataset	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The HTMLElement.dataset property allows access, both in reading and writing mode, to all the custom data attributes (data-*) set on the element. It is a map of DOMString, one entry for each custom data attribute.</p><pre><code>string = element.dataset.camelCasedName;\nelement.dataset.camelCasedName = string;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/HTMLElement/dataset
HTMLElement.dir	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The HTMLElement.dir property gets or sets the text writing directionality of the content of the current element.</p><pre><code>var currentWritingDirection = elementNodeReference.dir;\nelementNodeReference.dir = newWritingDirection;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/HTMLElement/dir
HTMLElement.focus()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The HTMLElement.focus() method sets focus on the specified element, if it can be focused.</p><pre><code>element.focus()</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/HTMLElement/focus
HTMLElement.forceSpellCheck()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Forces a spelling and grammar check on HTML elements, even if the user has not focused on the elements. This method overrides user agent behavior. The user interface of the check, for example whether red underlining appears, is determined by the user agent.</p><pre><code>element.forceSpellCheck()</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/HTMLElement/forceSpellCheck
HTMLElement.isContentEditable	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The HTMLElement.isContentEditable read-only property returns a Boolean that is true if the contents of the element are editable; otherwise it returns false.</p><pre><code>editable = element.isContentEditable\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/HTMLElement/isContentEditable
HTMLElement.lang	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The HTMLElement.lang property gets or sets the base language of an element's attribute values and text content.</p><pre><code>var languageUsed = elementNodeReference.lang; // Get the value of lang\nelementNodeReference.lang = NewLanguage; // Set new value for lang\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/HTMLElement/lang
HTMLElement.offsetHeight	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The HTMLElement.offsetHeight read-only property is the height of the element including vertical padding and borders, in pixels, as an integer.</p><pre><code>var intElemOffsetHeight = document.getElementById(id_attribute_value).offsetHeight;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/HTMLElement/offsetHeight
HTMLElement.offsetLeft	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The HTMLElement.offsetLeft read-only method returns the number of pixels that the upper left corner of the current element is offset to the left within the HTMLElement.offsetParent node.</p><pre><code>left = element.offsetLeft;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/HTMLElement/offsetLeft
HTMLElement.offsetParent	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The HTMLElement.offsetParent read-only property returns a reference to the object which is the closest (nearest in the containment hierarchy) positioned containing element. If the element is non-positioned, the nearest table cell or root element (html in standards compliant mode; body in quirks rendering mode) is the offsetParent. offsetParent returns null when the element has style.display set to "none". The offsetParent is useful because offsetTop and offsetLeft are relative to its padding edge.</p><pre><code>parentObj = element.offsetParent;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/HTMLElement/offsetParent
HTMLElement.offsetTop	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The HTMLElement.offsetTop read-only property returns the distance of the current element relative to the top of the offsetParent node.</p><pre><code>topPos = element.offsetTop;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/HTMLElement/offsetTop
HTMLElement.offsetWidth	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The HTMLElement.offsetWidth read-only property returns the layout width of an element. Typically, an element's offsetWidth is a measurement which includes the element borders, the element horizontal padding, the element vertical scrollbar (if present, if rendered) and the element CSS width.</p><pre><code>var offsetWidth =element.offsetWidth;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/HTMLElement/offsetWidth
HTMLElement.oncopy	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The oncopy property returns the onCopy event handler code on the current element.</p><pre><code>element.oncopy = functionRef;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/HTMLElement/oncopy
HTMLElement.oncut	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The oncut property returns the onCut event handler code on the current element.</p><pre><code>element.oncut = functionRef;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/HTMLElement/oncut
HTMLElement.onpaste	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The onpaste property returns the onPaste event handler code on the current element.</p><pre><code>element.onpaste = functionRef;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/HTMLElement/onpaste
HTMLElement.outerText	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>HTMLElement.outerText is a nonstandard property. As a getter, it returns the same value as Node.innerText. As a setter, it removes the current node and replaces it with the given text.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/HTMLElement/outerText
HTMLElement.style	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The&#160;HTMLElement.style property returns a CSSStyleDeclaration object that represents only the element's inline&#160;style attribute, ignoring&#160;any&#160;applied&#160;style rules.&#160; See&#160;the CSS Properties Reference for a list of the CSS properties accessible via style.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/HTMLElement/style
HTMLElement.tabIndex	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The HTMLElement.tabIndex property represents the tab order of the current element.</p><pre><code>elt.tabIndex = index;\nvar index = elt.tabIndex;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/HTMLElement/tabIndex
HTMLElement.title	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The HTMLElement.title property represents the title of the element, the text usually displayed in a 'tool tip' popup when the mouse is over the displayed node.</p><pre><code>var str = element.title;\nelement.title = str;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/HTMLElement/title
HTMLEmbedElement	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The HTMLEmbedElement interface, which provides special properties (beyond the regular HTMLElement interface it also has available to it by inheritance) for manipulating embed elements.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/HTMLEmbedElement
HTMLFieldSetElement	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The HTMLFieldSetElement interface has special properties and methods (beyond the regular HTMLElement interface it also has available to it by inheritance) for manipulating the layout and presentation of field-set elements.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/HTMLFieldSetElement
HTMLFormControlsCollection	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The HTMLFormControlsCollection interface represents a collection of HTML form control elements. It replaces one method of HTMLCollection.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/HTMLFormControlsCollection
HTMLFormControlsCollection.namedItem()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Note that this version of namedItem() hide the one inherited from HTMLCollection. Like that one, in JavaScript, using the array bracket syntax with a String, like collection ["value"] is equivalent to collection.namedItem("value").</p><pre><code>var item = collection.namedItem[str];\nvar item = collection[str];\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/HTMLFormControlsCollection/namedItem
HTMLFormElement	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The HTMLFormElement interface provides methods to create and modify form elements. document.forms - returns an array of HTMLFormElement objects referencing all forms on the page. document.forms[index] - returns an HTMLFormElement object referencing the form at the specified index. document.forms['id'] - returns an HTMLFormElement object referencing the form with the specified id. document.forms['name'] - returns an HTMLFormElement object referencing the form with the specified id.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/HTMLFormElement
HTMLFormElement.acceptCharset	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The HTMLFormElement.acceptCharset property represents a list of the supported character encodings for the given FORM element. This list can be comma- or space-separated.</p><pre><code>string = form.acceptCharset;\nform.acceptCharset = string;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/HTMLFormElement/acceptCharset
HTMLFormElement.action	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The HTMLFormElement.action property represents the action of the form element.</p><pre><code>string = form.action\nform.action = string\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/HTMLFormElement/action
HTMLFormElement.elements	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The HTMLFormElement.elements property returns an HTMLFormControlsCollection (HTML 4 HTMLCollection) of all the form controls contained in the FORM element, with the exception of input elements which have a type attribute of image.</p><pre><code>nodeList = HTMLFormElement.elements\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/HTMLFormElement/elements

HTMLFormElement.enctype	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The HTMLFormElement.enctype property is the MIME type of content that is used to submit the form to the server. Possible values are:</p><pre><code>string = form.enctype\nform.enctype = string\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/HTMLFormElement/enctype
HTMLFormElement.length	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The HTMLFormElement.length read-only property returns the number of controls in the form element.</p><pre><code>integer = form.length\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/HTMLFormElement/length
HTMLFormElement.method	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The HTMLFormElement.method represents the HTTP method used to submit the form.</p><pre><code>string = form.method\nform.method = string\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/HTMLFormElement/method
HTMLFormElement.name	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The HTMLFormElement.name property represents the name of the current form element as a string.</p><pre><code>string = form.name\nform.name = string</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/HTMLFormElement/name

When false is returned, cancelable invalid events are fired for each invalid child and validation problems are reported to the user.</p><pre><code>HTMLFormElement.reportValidity()\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/HTMLFormElement/reportValidity
HTMLFormElement.reset()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The HTMLFormElement.reset() method restores a form element's default values. This method does the same thing as clicking the form's reset button.</p><pre><code>HTMLFormElement.reset()\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/HTMLFormElement/reset
HTMLFormElement.submit()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The HTMLFormElement.submit() method submits the form. This method does something similar to activating a submit button of the form.</p><pre><code>HTMLFormElement.submit()\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/HTMLFormElement/submit
HTMLFormElement.target	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The HTMLFormElement.target property represents the target of the action (i.e., the frame to render its output in).</p><pre><code>string = form.target\nform.target = string\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/HTMLFormElement/target

HTMLHtmlElement	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The HTMLHtmlElement interface serves as the root node for a given HTML document.  This object inherits the properties and methods described in the HTMLElement interface.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/HTMLHtmlElement
HTMLHtmlElement.version	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Returns version information about the document type definition (DTD)&#160;of a document.&#160; While this property is recognized by Mozilla, the return value for this property is always an empty string.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/HTMLHtmlElement/version
HTMLHyperlinkElementUtils	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The HTMLHyperlinkElementUtils mixin defines utility methods and properties to work with HTMLAnchorElement and HTMLAreaElement. These utilities allow to deal with common features like URLs.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/HTMLHyperlinkElementUtils
HTMLHyperlinkElementUtils.hash	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The HTMLHyperlinkElementUtils.hash property returns a DOMString containing a '#' followed by the fragment identifier of the URL. The fragment is not percent-decoded.</p><pre><code>string = object.hash;\nobject.hash = string;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/HTMLHyperlinkElementUtils/hash
HTMLHyperlinkElementUtils.host	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The HTMLHyperlinkElementUtils.host property is a USVString containing the host, that is the hostname, and then, if the port of the URL is nonempty, a ':', and the port of the URL.</p><pre><code>string = object.host;\nobject.host = string;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/HTMLHyperlinkElementUtils/host
HTMLHyperlinkElementUtils.hostname	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The HTMLHyperlinkElementUtils.hostname property is a USVString containing the domain of the URL.</p><pre><code>string = object.hostname;\nobject.hostname = string;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/HTMLHyperlinkElementUtils/hostname
HTMLHyperlinkElementUtils.href	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The HTMLHyperlinkElementUtils.href property is a USVString containing the whole URL.</p><pre><code>string = object.href;\nobject.href = string;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/HTMLHyperlinkElementUtils/href
HTMLHyperlinkElementUtils.origin	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The HTMLHyperlinkElementUtils.origin read-only property is a USVString containing the Unicode serialization of the origin of the represented URL, that is:</p><pre><code>string = object.origin;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/HTMLHyperlinkElementUtils/origin
HTMLHyperlinkElementUtils.password	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The HTMLHyperlinkElementUtils.password property is a USVString containing the password specified before the domain name.</p><pre><code>string = object.password;\nobject.password = string;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/HTMLHyperlinkElementUtils/password

HTMLHyperlinkElementUtils.search	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The HTMLHyperlinkElementUtils.search property, is a search string, also called a query string, that is USVString containing a '?' followed by the parameters of the URL.</p><pre><code>string = object.search;\nobject.search = string;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/HTMLHyperlinkElementUtils/search

HTMLMediaElement.controls	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The HTMLMediaElement.controls property reflects the controls HTML attribute, which controls whether user interface controls for playing the media item will be displayed.</p><pre><code>var ctrls = video.controls;\naudio.controls = true;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/HTMLMediaElement/controls
HTMLMediaElement.crossOrigin	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The HTMLMediaElement.crossOrigin property is the CORS setting for this image element. See CORS settings attributes for details.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/HTMLMediaElement/crossOrigin
HTMLMediaElement.currentSrc	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The HTMLMediaElement.currentSrc property contains the absolute URL of the chosen media resource. This could happen, for example, if the web server selects a media file based on the resolution of the user's display. The value is an empty string if the networkState property is EMPTY.</p><pre><code>var mediaUrl = audioObject.currentSrc;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/HTMLMediaElement/currentSrc
HTMLMediaElement.currentTime	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The HTMLMediaElement.currentTime property gives the current playback time in seconds. Setting this value seeks the media to the new time.</p><pre><code>var cTime = video.currentTime;\naudio.currentTime = 35;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/HTMLMediaElement/currentTime
HTMLMediaElement.defaultMuted	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The HTMLMediaElement.defaultMuted property reflects the muted HTML attribute, which indicates whether the media element's audio output should be muted by default. This property has no dynamic effect. To mute and unmute the audio output, use the muted property.</p><pre><code>var dMuted = video.defaultMuted;\naudio.defaultMuted = true;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/HTMLMediaElement/defaultMuted
HTMLMediaElement.defaultPlaybackRate	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The HTMLMediaElement.defaultPlaybackRate property indicates the default playback rate for the media.</p><pre><code>var dSpeed = video.defaultPlaybackRate;\naudio.defaultPlaybackRate = 1.0;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/HTMLMediaElement/defaultPlaybackRate

play()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The HTMLMediaElement.play() method attempts to begin playback of the media and returns a Promise which is fulfilled when the playback has been successfully started, and which is rejected if playback fails to begin for any reason (such as permission issues or other problems).</p><pre><code>HTMLMediaElement.play().then(function() { ... }</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/HTMLMediaElement/play
HTMLMediaElement.playbackRate	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The HTMLMediaElement.playbackRate property sets the rate at which the media is being played back. This is used to implement user controls for fast forward, slow motion, and so forth. The normal playback rate is multiplied by this value to obtain the current rate, so a value of 1.0 indicates normal speed.</p><pre><code>var dSpeed = video.playbackRate;\naudio.playbackRate = 1.0;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/HTMLMediaElement/playbackRate

If it is using the user agent default, it returns an empty string. If the amount of rows to delete, specified by the parameter, is greater or equal to the number of available rows, or if it is negative and not equal to the special index -1, representing the last row of the table, the exception INDEX_SIZE_ERR is thrown.</p><pre><code>HTMLTableElement.deleteRow(index)</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/HTMLTableElement/deleteRow

IDBCursor.update()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The update() method of the IDBCursor interface returns an IDBRequest object, and, in a separate thread, updates the value at the current position of the cursor in the object store. If the cursor points to a record that has just been deleted, a new record is created.</p><pre><code>cursor.update(newValue);</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/IDBCursor/update
IDBCursorSync	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The IDBCursorSync interface of the IndexedDB API represents a cursor for iterating over multiple records in a database. You can have only one instance of IDBCursorSync representing a cursor, but you can have an unlimited number of cursors at the same time. Operations are performed on the underlying index or object store. It enables an application to synchronously process all the records in the cursor's range.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/IDBCursorSync
IDBCursorWithValue	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The IDBCursorWithValue interface of the IndexedDB API represents a cursor for traversing or iterating over multiple records in a database. IDBDatabase.close()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The connection is not actually closed until all transactions created using this connection are complete. No new transactions can be created for this connection once this method is called. Methods that create transactions throw an exception if a closing operation is pending.</p><pre><code>db.close();</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/IDBDatabase/close
IDBDatabase.createObjectStore()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The method takes the name of the store as well as a parameter object that lets you define important optional properties. You can use the property to uniquely identify individual objects in the store. As the property is an identifier, it should be unique to every object, and every object should have that property.</p><pre><code>var objectStore = db.createObjectStore("toDoList", { keyPath: "taskTitle" });</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/IDBDatabase/createObjectStore

If an error occurs while the database is being deleted, then an error event is fired on the request object that is returned from this method.</p><pre><code>var request = window.indexedDB.deleteDatabase("toDoList");</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/IDBFactory/deleteDatabase

IDBIndex	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>IDBIndex interface of the IndexedDB API provides asynchronous access to an index in a database. An index is a kind of object store for looking up records in another object store, called the referenced object store. You use this interface to retrieve data.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/IDBIndex
IDBIndex.count()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>A IDBRequest object on which subsequent events related to this operation are fired.</p><pre><code>var myIndex = objectStore.index('index');\nvar request = myIndex.count();</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/IDBIndex/count
IDBIndex.get()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>If a value is successfully found, then a structured clone of it is created and set as the result of the request object: this returns the record the key is associated with.</p><pre><code>var myIndex = objectStore.index('index');\nvar request = myIndex.get(key);</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/IDBIndex/get
IDBIndex.getAll()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>There is a performance cost associated with looking at the value property of a cursor, because the object is created lazily. To use a feature like getAll(), Gecko would have to create all the objects at once. If you were just interested in looking at each of the keys, for instance, it would be much more efficient to use a cursor. If you were trying to get an array of all the objects in an object store, though, you could use getAll().</p><pre><code>var getAllKeysRequest = IDBIndex.getAll(query, count);</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/IDBIndex/getAll
IDBIndex.getAllKeys()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>An IDBRequest object on which subsequent events related to this operation are fired.</p><pre><code>var myIndex = objectStore.index('index');\nvar getAllKeysRequest = myIndex.getAllKeys(query);</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/IDBIndex/getAllKeys
IDBIndex.getKey()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>If a key is successfully found it is set as the result of the request object: this returns the primary key of the record the key is associated with, not the whole record as IDBIndex.get does.</p><pre><code>var myIndex = objectStore.index('index');\nvar request = myIndex.getKey(key);</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/IDBIndex/getKey
IDBIndex.isAutoLocale	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The isAutoLocale read-only property of the IDBIndex interface returns a Boolean indicating whether the index had a locale value of auto specified upon its creation (see createIndex() 's optionalParameters.)</p><pre><code>var myIndex = objectStore.index('index');\nconsole.log(myIndex.isAutoLocale);</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/IDBIndex/isAutoLocale
IDBIndex.keyPath	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Any data type that can be used as a key path.</p><pre><code>var myIndex = objectStore.index('index');\nconsole.log(myIndex.keyPath);</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/IDBIndex/keyPath
IDBIndex.locale	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The locale read-only property of the IDBIndex interface returns the locale of the index (for example en-US, or pl) if it had a locale value specified upon its creation (see createIndex() 's optionalParameters.) Note that this property always returns the current locale being used in this index, in other words, it never returns "auto".</p><pre><code>var myIndex = objectStore.index('index');\nconsole.log(myIndex.locale);</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/IDBIndex/locale

IDBIndex.name	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>A DOMString specifying a name for the index.</p><pre><code>var indexName = IDBIndex.name;\n\nIDBIndex.name = indexName;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/IDBIndex/name
IDBIndex.objectStore	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>An IDBObjectStore.</p><pre><code>var myIndex = objectStore.index('index');\nconsole.log(myIndex.objectStore);</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/IDBIndex/objectStore
IDBIndex.openCursor()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The method sets the position of the cursor to the appropriate record, based on the specified direction.</p><pre><code>var myIndex = objectStore.index('index');\nvar request = myIndex.openCursor(range,direction);</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/IDBIndex/openCursor
IDBIndex.openKeyCursor()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The method sets the position of the cursor to the appropriate key, based on the specified direction.</p><pre><code>var myIndex = objectStore.index('index');\nvar request = myIndex.openKeyCursor(range,direction);</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/IDBIndex/openKeyCursor
IDBIndex.unique	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>A Boolean :</p><pre><code>var myIndex = objectStore.index('index');\nconsole.log(myIndex.unique);</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/IDBIndex/unique
IDBIndexSync	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The IDBIndexSync interface of the IndexedDB API provides synchronous access to an index in a database.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/IDBIndexSync
IDBKeyRange	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>A key range can be a single value or a range with upper and lower bounds or endpoints. If the key range has both upper and lower bounds, then it is bounded ; if it has no bounds, it is unbounded. A bounded key range can either be open (the endpoints are excluded) or closed (the endpoints are included). To retrieve all keys within a certain range, you can use the following code constructs:</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/IDBKeyRange
IDBKeyRange.bound()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The bounds can be open (that is, the bounds exclude the endpoint values) or closed (that is, the bounds include the endpoint values). By default, the bounds are closed.</p><pre><code>myKeyRange = IDBKeyRange.bound("A", "Z", true, true);</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/IDBKeyRange/bound
IDBKeyRange.includes()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>A Boolean.</p><pre><code>myIncludesResult = myKeyRange.includes('A');</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/IDBKeyRange/includes
IDBKeyRange.lower	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The lower bound of the key range (can be any type.)</p><pre><code>myKeyRange.lower;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/IDBKeyRange/lower
IDBKeyRange.lowerBound()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>By default, it includes the lower endpoint value and is closed.</p><pre><code>myKeyRange = IDBKeyRange.lowerBound("A", true);</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/IDBKeyRange/lowerBound
IDBKeyRange.lowerOpen	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>A boolean :</p><pre><code>myKeyRange.lowerOpen;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/IDBKeyRange/lowerOpen
IDBKeyRange.only()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>IDBKeyRange : The newly created key range.</p><pre><code>myKeyRange = IDBKeyRange.only("A");</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/IDBKeyRange/only
IDBKeyRange.upper	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The upper bound of the key range (can be any type.)</p><pre><code>myKeyRange.upper;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/IDBKeyRange/upper
IDBKeyRange.upperBound()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>By default, it includes the upper endpoint value and is closed.</p><pre><code>myKeyRange = IDBKeyRange.upperBound("Z", true);</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/IDBKeyRange/upperBound
IDBKeyRange.upperOpen	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>A boolean :</p><pre><code>myKeyRange.upperOpen;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/IDBKeyRange/upperOpen
IDBLocaleAwareKeyRange	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The IDBLocaleAwareKeyRange interface of the IndexedDB API is a Firefox-specific version of IDBKeyRange — it functions in exactly the same fashion, and has the same properties and methods, but it is intended for use with IDBIndex objects when the original index had a locale value specified upon its creation (see createIndex() 's optionalParameters) — that is, it has locale aware sorting enabled.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/IDBLocaleAwareKeyRange
IDBMutableFile	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The IDBMutableFile interface provides access in read or write mode to a file, dealing with all the necessary locks.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/IDBMutableFile
FileHandle.getFile()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The getFile method allows to retrieve a read-only snapshot of the handled file in the form of a File object.</p><pre><code>var request = instanceOfFileHandle.getFile();</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/IDBMutableFile/getFile
FileHandle.name	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Provides the name of the file.</p><pre><code>var name = instanceOfFileHandle.name\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/IDBMutableFile/name
FileHandle.onabort	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Specifies an event listener to receive abort events. These events occur when the associated locked file has been aborted with the LockedFile.abort() method.</p><pre><code>instanceOfFileHandle.onabort = funcRef;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/IDBMutableFile/onabort
FileHandle.onerror	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Specifies an event listener to receive error events. These events occur when something goes wrong.</p><pre><code>instanceOfFileHandle.onerror = funcRef;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/IDBMutableFile/onerror
FileHandle.open()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The open method returns a LockedFile object that allows to safely write in the file.</p><pre><code>var myFile = instanceOfFileHandle.open(mode);</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/IDBMutableFile/open
FileHandle.type	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Provides the mime type of the file.</p><pre><code>var type = instanceOfFileHandle.type\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/IDBMutableFile/type
IDBObjectStore	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>This example shows a variety of different uses of object stores, from updating the data structure with IDBObjectStore.createIndex inside an onupgradeneeded function, to adding a new item to our object store with IDBObjectStore.add. For a full working example, see our To-do Notifications app (view example live.)</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/IDBObjectStore
IDBObjectStore.add()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>To determine if the add operation has completed successfully, listen for the transaction’s complete event in addition to the IDBObjectStore.add request’s success event, because the transaction may still fail after the success event fires. In other words, the success event is only triggered when the transaction has been successfully queued.</p><pre><code>var request = objectStore.add(myItem, optionalKey);</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/IDBObjectStore/add
IDBObjectStore.autoIncrement	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>A Boolean :</p><pre><code>var myAutoIncrement = objectStore.autoIncrement;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/IDBObjectStore/autoIncrement
IDBObjectStore.clear()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Clearing an object store consists of removing all records from the object store and removing all records in indexes that reference the object store.</p><pre><code>var request = objectStore.clear();</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/IDBObjectStore/clear
IDBObjectStore.count()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>An IDBRequest object on which subsequent events related to this operation are fired.</p><pre><code>var request = ObjectStore.count(optionalKeyRange);</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/IDBObjectStore/count
IDBObjectStore.createIndex()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Note that this method must be called only from a VersionChange transaction mode callback.</p><pre><code>objectStore.createIndex(objectIndexName, objectKeypath, optionalObjectParameters);</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/IDBObjectStore/createIndex
IDBObjectStore.delete()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>An IDBRequest object on which subsequent events related to this operation are fired. The request.result attribute is set to undefined.</p><pre><code>var request = objectStore.delete(recordKey);</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/IDBObjectStore/delete
IDBObjectStore.deleteIndex()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Note that this method must be called only from a VersionChange transaction mode callback. Note that this method synchronously modifies the IDBObjectStore.indexNames property.</p><pre><code>objectStore.deleteIndex(indexName);</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/IDBObjectStore/deleteIndex
IDBObjectStore.get()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>If a value is successfully found, then a structured clone of it is created and set as the result of the request object.</p><pre><code>var request = objectStore.get(myItem);</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/IDBObjectStore/get

IDBObjectStore.indexNames	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>A DOMStringList.</p><pre><code>var myindexNames = objectStore.indexNames;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/IDBObjectStore/indexNames
IDBObjectStore.keyPath	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>If this property is null, the application must provide a key for each modification operation.</p><pre><code>var mykeyPath = objectStore.keyPath;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/IDBObjectStore/keyPath
IDBObjectStore.name	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>A DOMString containing the object store's name.</p><pre><code>var myObjectStoreName = IDBObjectStore.name;\n\nIDBObjectStore.name = myNewName;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/IDBObjectStore/name
IDBObjectStore.openCursor()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>To determine if the add operation has completed successfully, listen for the results’s success event.</p><pre><code>var request = ObjectStore.openCursor(optionalKeyRange, optionalDirection);</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/IDBObjectStore/openCursor
IDBObjectStore.openKeyCursor()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>To determine if the add operation has completed successfully, listen for the results’s success event.</p><pre><code>var request = objectStore.openKeyCursor(optionalKeyRange, optionalDirection);</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/IDBObjectStore/openKeyCursor
IDBObjectStore.put()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>If the record is successfully stored, then a success event is fired on the returned request object with the result set to the key for the stored record, and the transaction set to the transaction in which this object store is opened.</p><pre><code>var request = objectStore.put(myItem, optionalKey);</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/IDBObjectStore/put
