IDBObjectStoreSync	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The IDBObjectStoreSync interface of the IndexedDB API provides synchronous access to an object store of a database.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/IDBObjectStoreSync
IDBOpenDBRequest	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Inherits from: IDBRequest</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/IDBOpenDBRequest
IDBOpenDBRequest.onblocked	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The IDBOpenDBRequest.onblocked event handler is the event handler for the blocked event. This event is triggered when the upgradeneeded should be triggered because of a version change but the database is still in use (that is, not closed) somewhere, even after the versionchange event was sent.</p><pre><code>var request = indexedDB.open("toDoList", 4);\nrequest.onblocked = function() { ... };</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/IDBOpenDBRequest/onblocked
IDBOpenDBRequest.onupgradeneeded	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>In the following example you can see the onupgradeneeded handler being used to update the database structure if a database with a higher version number is loaded. For a full working example, see our To-do Notifications app (view example live.)</p><pre><code>var request = window.indexedDB.open("toDoList", 4);\nrequest.onupgradeneeded = function(event) { ... };</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/IDBOpenDBRequest/onupgradeneeded
IDBRequest	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The request object does not initially contain any information about the result of the operation, but once information becomes available, an event is fired on the request, and the information becomes available through the properties of the IDBRequest instance.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/IDBRequest
IDBRequest.error	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>A DOMError containing the relevant error. In Chrome 48 and later this property returns a DOMException because DOMError has been removed from the DOM standard. The following error codes are returned under certain conditions:</p><pre><code>var myError = request.error;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/IDBRequest/error
IDBRequest.onerror	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The following example requests a given record title, onsuccess gets the associated record from the IDBObjectStore (made available as objectStoreTitleRequest.result), updates one property of the record, and then puts the updated record back into the object store. Also included at the bottom is an onerror function that reports what the error was if the request fails. For a full working example, see our To-do Notifications app (view example live.)</p><pre><code>request.onerror = function( event ) { ... };</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/IDBRequest/onerror
IDBRequest.onsuccess	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The following example requests a given record title, onsuccess gets the associated record from the IDBObjectStore (made available as objectStoreTitleRequest.result), updates one property of the record, and then puts the updated record back into the object store. For a full working example, see our To-do Notifications app (view example live.)</p><pre><code>request.onsuccess = function( event ) { ... };</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/IDBRequest/onsuccess
IDBRequest.readyState	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The IDBRequestReadyState of the request, which takes one of the following two values:</p><pre><code>var currentReadyState = request.readyState;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/IDBRequest/readyState
IDBRequest.result	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>An IDBObjectStore containing the result of the request.</p><pre><code>var myResult = request.result;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/IDBRequest/result
IDBRequest.source	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>An object representing the source of the request, such as an IDBIndex, IDBObjectStore or IDBCursor.</p><pre><code>var mySource = request.source;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/IDBRequest/source
IDBRequest.transaction	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>An IDBTransaction.</p><pre><code>var myTransaction = request.transaction;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/IDBRequest/transaction
IDBTransaction	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Note that as of Firefox 40, IndexedDB transactions have relaxed durability guarantees to increase performance (see bug 1112702.) Previously in a readwrite transaction IDBTransaction.oncomplete was fired only when all data was guaranteed to have been flushed to disk. In Firefox 40+ the complete event is fired after the OS has been told to write the data but potentially before that data has actually been flushed to disk. The complete event may thus be delivered quicker than before, however, there exists a small chance that the entire transaction will be lost if the OS crashes or there is a loss of system power before the data is flushed to disk. Since such catastrophic events are rare most consumers should not need to concern themselves further.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/IDBTransaction
IDBTransaction.abort()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>All pending IDBRequest objects created during this transaction have their IDBRequest.error attribute set to AbortError.</p><pre><code>transaction.abort();</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/IDBTransaction/abort
IDBTransaction.db	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>An IDBDatabase object.</p><pre><code>var myDatabase = transaction.db;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/IDBTransaction/db
IDBTransaction.error	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>A DOMError containing the relevant error. In Chrome 48 and later this property returns a DOMException because DOMError has been removed from the DOM standard. The exact error is one of serveral possibilities. It can be a reference to the same error as the request object that raised it, or a transaction failure (for example QuotaExceededError or UnknownError).</p><pre><code>var myError = transaction.error;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/IDBTransaction/error
IDBTransaction.mode	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>An IDBTransactionMode object defining the mode for isolating access to data in the current object stores:</p><pre><code>var myCurrentMode = IDBTransaction.mode;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/IDBTransaction/mode
IDBTransaction.objectStore()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Every call to this method on the same transaction object, with the same name, returns the same IDBObjectStore instance. If this method is called on a different transaction object, a different IDBObjectStore instance is returned.</p><pre><code>var objectStore = transaction.objectStore("toDoList");</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/IDBTransaction/objectStore
IDBTransaction.objectStoreNames	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The objectStoreNames property of the IDBTransaction interface returns a DOMStringList of names of IDBObjectStore objects.</p><pre><code>var myDatabase = transactionObj.objectStoreNames;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/IDBTransaction/ObjectStoreNames
IDBTransaction.onabort	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>In the following code snippet, we open a read/write transaction on our database and add some data to an object store. Note also the functions attached to transaction event handlers to report on the outcome of the transaction opening in the event of success or failure. Note the transaction.onabort = function(event) { }; block, reporting when the transaction has been aborted. For a full working example, see our To-do Notifications app (view example live.)</p><pre><code>transaction.onabort = function() { ... };</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/IDBTransaction/onabort
IDBTransaction.oncomplete	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The oncomplete event handler of the IDBTransaction interface handles the complete event, fired when the transaction successfully completes.</p><pre><code>transaction.oncomplete = function() { ... };</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/IDBTransaction/oncomplete
IDBTransaction.onerror	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>In the following code snippet, we open a read/write transaction on our database and add some data to an object store. Note also the functions attached to transaction event handlers to report on the outcome of the transaction opening in the event of success or failure. Note the transaction.onerror = function(event) { }; block, making use of transaction.error to help in reporting what went wrong when the transaction was unsuccessful. For a full working example, see our To-do Notifications app (view example live.)</p><pre><code>transaction.onerror = function() { ... };</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/IDBTransaction/onerror
IDBTransactionSync	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The IDBTransactionSync interface of the IndexedDB API provides a synchronous transaction on a database. When an application creates an IDBTransactionSync object, it blocks until the browser is able to reserve the require database objects.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/IDBTransactionSync
IDBVersionChangeEvent	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The IDBVersionChangeEvent interface of the IndexedDB API indicates that the version of the database has changed, as the result of an IDBOpenDBRequest.onupgradeneeded event handler function.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/IDBVersionChangeEvent
IDBVersionChangeEvent.newVersion	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>In the following code snippet, we make a request to open a database, and include handlers for the success and error cases. These events are fired via the custom IDBVersionChangeEvent interface. For a full working example, see our To-do Notifications app (view example live.)</p><pre><code>readonly    attribute unsigned long long? newVersion;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/IDBVersionChangeEvent/newVersion
IDBVersionChangeEvent.oldVersion	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>In the following code snippet, we make a request to open a database, and include handlers for the success and error cases. These events are fired via the custom IDBVersionChangeEvent interface. For a full working example, see our To-do Notifications app (view example live.)</p><pre><code>readonly    attribute unsigned long long  oldVersion;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/IDBVersionChangeEvent/oldVersion
IDBVersionChangeEvent.version	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The version property of the IDBVersionChangeEvent interface returns The new version of the database in a versionchange transaction.</p><pre><code>readonly    attribute unsigned long long? version;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/IDBVersionChangeEvent/version
IDBVersionChangeRequest	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The IDBVersionChangeRequest interface the IndexedDB API represents a request to change the version of a database. It is used only by the setVersion() method of IDBDatabase.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/IDBVersionChangeRequest
IDBVersionChangeRequest.setVersion()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>For older WebKit browsers, call this method before creating or deleting an object store.</p><pre><code>IDBVersionChangeRequest setVersion ([TreatNullAs=EmptyString] in DOMString version);</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/IDBVersionChangeRequest/setVersion
IdentityManager	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The IdentityManager of the BrowserID protocol exposes the BrowserID API, via navigator.id. This API has gone through several significant revisions. Each generation is listed separately below.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/IdentityManager
IdentityManager.get()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>This function enables a web site to use BrowserID to authenticate its users. Call it in the click handler to your "log in with Persona" button with a callback function as a parameter.</p><pre><code>navigator.id.get(gotAssertion);\nnavigator.id.get(gotAssertion, {privacyPolicy: "/privacy.html", termsOfService: "/tos.html"});</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/IdentityManager/get
IdentityManager.getVerifiedEmail()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>This function enables a web site to use BrowserID to authenticate its users. Call it in the click handler to your "log in with BrowserID" button with a callback function as a parameter.</p><pre><code>window.navigator.id.getVerifiedEmail(gotAssertion);</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/IdentityManager/getVerifiedEmail
IdentityManager.logout()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>This function is used in Persona to cause the browser to reset the automatic / persistent login flag for a website. After being called, the user will need to explicitly log back into your site instead of being signed in automatically.</p><pre><code>navigator.id.logout();</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/IdentityManager/logout
IdentityManager.request()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>This function enables a web site to use Persona to authenticate its users. It must be invoked from within a click handler. For example, you should call it when a user clicks your "log in with Persona" button.</p><pre><code>navigator.id.request();\nnavigator.id.request({siteName: 'Example Site', siteLogo: '/logo.png'});\nnavigator.id.request({termsOfService: '/tos.html', privacyPolicy: '/privacy.html'});\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/IdentityManager/request
IdentityManager.watch()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>This function registers callbacks that respond to a Persona user logging in or out.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/IdentityManager/watch
IIRFilterNode	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The IIRFilterNode interface of the Web Audio API is a AudioNode processor which implements a general infinite impulse response (IIR)  filter; this type of filter can be used to implement tone control devices and graphic equalizers as well. It lets the parameters of the filter response be specified, so that it can be tuned as needed.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/IIRFilterNode
IIRFilterNode.getFrequencyResponse()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>undefined</p><pre><code>IIRFilterNode.getFrequencyResponse(frequencyArray, magResponseOutput, phaseResponseOutput);\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/IIRFilterNode/getFrequencyResponse
IIRFilterNode.getFrequencyResponse()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The getFrequencyResponse() method of the IIRFilterNode interface takes the current filtering algorithm's settings and calculates the frequency response for frequencies specified in the frequencyHz array of frequencies.</p><pre><code>var audioCtx = new AudioContext();\nvar iirFilter = audioCtx.createIIRFilter();\niirFilter.getFrequencyResponse(myFrequencyArray,magResponseOutput,phaseResponseOutput);\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/IIRFilterNode/getFrequencyResponse()
ImageBitmap	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The ImageBitmap interface represents a bitmap image which can be drawn to a canvas without undue latency. It can be created from a variety of source objects using the createImageBitmap() factory method. ImageBitmap provides an asynchronous and resource efficient pathway to prepare textures for rendering in WebGL.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/ImageBitmap
ImageBitmap.close()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The ImageBitmap.close() method disposes of all graphical resources associated with an ImageBitmap.</p><pre><code>void ImageBitmap.close()</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/ImageBitmap/close
ImageBitmap.height	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The read-only ImageBitmap.height property returns the ImageBitmap object's height in CSS pixels.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/ImageBitmap/height
ImageBitmap.width	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The read-only ImageBitmap.width property returns the ImageBitmap object's width in CSS pixels.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/ImageBitmap/width
ImageBitmapFactories	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The ImageBitmapFactories mixin interface contains utility methods to create an ImageBitmap. There is no object of this type, but the two interfaces Window, available within the regular browsing scope, and the WorkerGlobalScope interface for workers, implement this interface.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/ImageBitmapFactories
ImageBitmapFactories.createImageBitmap()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The createImageBitmap method accepts a variety of different image sources, and returns a Promise which resolves to an ImageBitmap. Optionally the source is cropped to the rectangle of pixels originating at (sx, sy) with width sw, and height sh.</p><pre><code>createImageBitmap(image[, options]).then(function(response) { ... });\ncreateImageBitmap(image, sx, sy, sw, sh[, options]).then(function(response) { ... });\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/ImageBitmapFactories/createImageBitmap
ImageBitmapRenderingContext	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The ImageBitmapRenderingContext interface is a canvas rendering context which only provides the functionality to replace the canvas's contents with the given ImageBitmap. Its context id (the first argument to HTMLCanvasElement.getContext() or OffscreenCanvas.getContext() is "bitmaprenderer".</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/ImageBitmapRenderingContext
ImageBitmapRenderingContext.transferImageBitmap()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The ImageBitmapRenderingContext.transferImageBitmap() method displays the given ImageBitmap in the canvas associated with this rendering context. The ownership of the ImageBitmap is transferred to the canvas as well.</p><pre><code>void ImageBitmapRenderingContext.transferImageBitmap(bitmap)</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/ImageBitmapRenderingContext/transferImageBitmap
ImageData	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The ImageData interface represents the underlying pixel data of an area of a canvas element. It is created using the ImageData() constructor or creator methods on the CanvasRenderingContext2D object associated with a canvas: createImageData() and getImageData(). It can also be used to set a part of the canvas by using putImageData().</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/ImageData
ImageData.data	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The readonly ImageData.data property returns a Uint8ClampedArray representing a one-dimensional array containing the data in the RGBA order, with integer values between 0 and 255 (included).</p><pre><code>imagedata.data\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/ImageData/data
ImageData.height	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The readonly ImageData.height property returns the number of rows in the image data object.</p><pre><code>imagedata.height\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/ImageData/height
ImageData()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The ImageData() constructor returns a newly instantiated ImageData object build from the typed array given and having the specified width and height.</p><pre><code>new ImageData(array, width, height);\nnew ImageData(width, height);\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/ImageData/ImageData

Index	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Found 2889 pages:</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Index
IndexedDB API	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>IndexedDB is a low-level API for client-side storage of significant amounts of structured data, including files/blobs. This API uses indexes to enable high performance searches of this data. While DOM Storage is useful for storing smaller amounts of data, it is less useful for storing larger amounts of structured data. IndexedDB provides a solution. This is the main landing page for MDN's IndexedDB coverage — here we provide links to the full API reference and usage guides, browser support details, and some explanation of key concepts.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/IndexedDB_API
Basic concepts	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>This introduction discusses essential concepts and terminology in IndexedDB. It gives you the big picture and explains key concepts.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/IndexedDB_API/Basic_Concepts_Behind_IndexedDB
Browser storage limits and eviction criteria	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>There are a number of web technologies that store data of one kind or another on the client-side (i.e. on your local disk.) The process by which the browser works out how much space to allocate to web data storage and what to delete when that limit is reached is not simple, and differs between browsers. This article attempts to explain how this all works.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/IndexedDB_API/Browser_storage_limits_and_eviction_criteria
Using IndexedDB	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>This tutorial walks you through using the asynchronous API of IndexedDB. If you are not familiar with IndexedDB, you should first read Basic Concepts About IndexedDB.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/IndexedDB_API/Using_IndexedDB
Using IndexedDB in chrome	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The indexedDB API is typically used to store data in the user's browser from content JavaScript.  (See Using IndexedDB for an overview.)  However, the APIs can be also be accessed from system-privileged JavaScript using the Components.utils.importGlobalProperties() function:</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/IndexedDB_API/Using_IndexedDB_in_chrome

You can opt in in HTML as follows:</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/IndexedDB_API/Using_JavaScript_Generators_in_Firefox
InputDeviceCapabilities	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The InputDeviceCapabilities interface of the Input Device Capabilities API provides information about the physical device or a group of related devices responsible for generating input events. Events caused by the same physical input device get the same instance of this object, but the converse isn't true. For example, two mice with the same capabilities in a system may appear as a single InputDeviceCapabilities instance.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/InputDeviceCapabilities
firesTouchEvents	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The InputDeviceCapabilities.firesTouchEvents read-only property returns a Boolean that indicates whether the device dispatches touch events.</p><pre><code>var boolean = InputDeviceCapabilities.firesTouchEvents</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/InputDeviceCapabilities/fireTouchEvents

InputDeviceCapabilities API	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The InputDeviceCapabilities API provides details about the underlying sources of input events. The API attempts to describe how the device behaves rather than what it is. For example, the first version of the API indicates whether a device fires touch events rather than whether it is a touch screen.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/InputDeviceCapabilities_API

IntersectionObserver	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The IntersectionObserver interface of the the Intersection Observer API provides a way to asynchronously observe changes in the intersection of a target element with an ancestor element or with a top-level document's viewport. The ancestor or viewport is referred to as the root.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/IntersectionObserver

IntersectionObserverEntry	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The IntersectionObserverEntry interface of the the Intersection Observer API provides information about the intersection of a particular target with the observers root element at a particular time. Instances of this interface cannot be created, but a list of them is returned by IntersectionObserver.takeRecords().</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/IntersectionObserverEntry
Intersection Observer API	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Intersection Observer API allows you to configure a callback that is called whenever one item, called a target, intersects either the device viewport or a specified element called, for the purpose of this API, the root element. Create the intersection observer by calling its constructor and passing it a reference to the callback function.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Intersection_Observer_API
KeyboardEvent	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>KeyboardEvent objects describe a user interaction with the keyboard. Each event describes a key; the event type (keydown, keypress, or keyup) identifies what kind of activity was performed.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/KeyboardEvent
KeyboardEvent.altKey	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The KeyboardEvent.altKey read-only property is a Boolean indicates if the alt key (Option or ⌥ on OS X) was pressed (true) or not (false) when the event occured.</p><pre><code>var altKeyPressed = instanceOfKeyboardEvent.altKey\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/KeyboardEvent/altKey

KeyboardEvent.code	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The KeyboardEvent.code property represents a physical key on the keyboard (as opposed to the character generated by pressing the key). In other words, this property returns a value which isn't altered by keyboard layout or the state of the modifier keys.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/KeyboardEvent/code
KeyboardEvent.ctrlKey	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The KeyboardEvent.ctrlKey read-only property returns a Boolean that indicates if the control key was pressed (true) or not (false) when the event occured.</p><pre><code>var ctrlKeyPressed = instanceOfKeyboardEvent.ctrlKey\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/KeyboardEvent/ctrlKey
KeyboardEvent.getModifierState()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The KeyboardEvent.getModifierState() method returns the current state of the specified modifier key: true if the modifier is active (that is the modifier key is pressed or locked), otherwise, false.</p><pre><code>var active = event.getModifierState(keyArg);</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/KeyboardEvent/getModifierState
KeyboardEvent.initKeyboardEvent()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The KeyboardEvent.initKeyboardEvent() initializes the attributes of a keyboard event object. This method was introduced in draft of DOM Level 3 Events, but deprecated in newer draft. Gecko won't support this feature since implementing this method as experimental broke existing web apps (see bug 999645). Web applications should use constructor instead of this if it's available.</p><pre><code>kbdEvent.initKeyboardEvent(typeArg, canBubbleArg, cancelableArg,\n                           viewArg, charArg, keyArg,\n                           locationArg, modifiersListArg, repeat)\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/KeyboardEvent/initKeyboardEvent
KeyboardEvent.initKeyEvent()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The KeyboardEvent.initKeyEvent method is used to initialize the value of an event created using document.createEvent ("KeyboardEvent"). Events initialized in this way must have been created with the document.createEvent ("KeyboardEvent") method. initKeyEvent must be called to set the event before it is dispatched.</p><pre><code>event.initKeyEvent (type, bubbles, cancelable, viewArg, \n                    ctrlKeyArg, altKeyArg, shiftKeyArg, metaKeyArg, \n                    keyCodeArg, charCodeArg) \n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/KeyboardEvent/initKeyEvent

KeyboardEvent.key	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The KeyboardEvent.key read-only property returns the value of a key or keys pressed by the user.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/KeyboardEvent/key

KeyboardEvent()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The KeyboardEvent() constructor creates a new KeyboardEvent.</p><pre><code> event = new KeyboardEvent(typeArg, KeyboardEventInit);</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/KeyboardEvent/KeyboardEvent
KeyboardEvent.keyCode	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The KeyboardEvent.keyCode read-only property represents a system and implementation dependent numerical code identifying the unmodified value of the pressed key. This is usually the decimal ASCII (RFC 20) or Windows 1252 code corresponding to the key. If the key can't be identified, this value is 0.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/KeyboardEvent/keyCode
KeyboardEvent.keyIdentifier	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The deprecated KeyboardEvent.keyIdentifier read-only property returns a "key identifier" string that can be used to determine what key was pressed. Its non-deprecated replacement is KeyboardEvent.key.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/KeyboardEvent/keyIdentifier
KeyboardEvent.location	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The KeyboardEvent.location read-only property returns an unsigned long representing the location of the key on the keyboard or other input device</p><pre><code>var location = event.location;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/KeyboardEvent/location
KeyboardEvent.metaKey	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The KeyboardEvent.metaKey read-only property returning a Boolean that indicates if the Meta key was pressed (true) or not (false) when the event occurred.  Some operating systems may intercept the key so it is never detected.</p><pre><code>var metaKeyPressed = instanceOfKeyboardEvent.metaKey\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/KeyboardEvent/metaKey

KeyboardEvent.shiftKey	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The KeyboardEvent.shiftKey read-only property indicates if the shift key was pressed (true) or not (false) when the event occurred.</p><pre><code>var shiftKeyPressed = instanceOfKeyboardEvent.shiftKey\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/KeyboardEvent/shiftKey
KeyboardEvent.which	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The KeyboardEvent.which read-only property returns the numeric keyCode of the key pressed, or the character code (charCode) for an alphanumeric key pressed.</p><pre><code>var keyResult = event.which;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/KeyboardEvent/which
KeyframeEffect	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The KeyframeEffect interface of the Web Animations API lets us create sets of animatable properties and values, called keyframes. These can then be played using the Animation.Animation() constructor.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/KeyframeEffect
KeyframeEffect.KeyframeEffect()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The KeyframeEffect() constructor of the Web Animations API returns a new KeyframeEffect object instance.</p><pre><code>&#160;var rabbitDownKeyframes = new KeyframeEffect( \n&#160; &#160; whiteRabbit,&#160;// element to animate\n&#160; &#160; [\n&#160; &#160; &#160; { transform: 'translateY(0%)' }, // keyframe&#160;\n&#160; &#160; &#160; { transform: 'translateY(100%)' } // keyframe\n&#160; &#160; ],&#160;\n&#160; &#160; { duration: 3000, fill: 'forwards' } // keyframe options\n&#160; );\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/KeyframeEffect/KeyframeEffect
KeyframeEffect.setKeyframes()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The setKeyframes() method of the KeyframeEffect interface replaces the keyframes that make up the affected KeyframeEffect with a new set of keyframes.</p><pre><code>// passing an array of keyframe objects\nexistingKeyframeEffect.setKeyframes(\n[\n  { color: 'blue' },\n    { color: 'green', left: '10px' }\n  ]\n);\n\n// passing an object with arrays for values\nexistingKeyframeEffect.setKeyframes(\n  {\n    color: ['blue', 'green'],\n    left: [ '0', '10px']\n  }\n);\n\n// passing a single-member object\nexistingKeyframeEffect.setKeyframes(\n  {\n    color: 'blue'\n  }\n);</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/KeyframeEffect/setKeyframes
KeyframeEffectReadOnly	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The KeyframeEffectReadOnly interface of the Web Animations API describes sets of animatable properties and values that can be played using the Animation.Animation() constructor, and which are inherited by KeyframeEffect.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/KeyframeEffectReadOnly
KeyframeEffectReadOnly.composite	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The composite property of a KeyframeEffectReadOnly or a KeyframeEffect resolves how an element's animation impacts its underlying property values.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/KeyframeEffectReadOnly/composite
KeyframeEffectReadOnly.getKeyframes()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The getKeyframes() method of a KeyframeEffectReadOnly or a KeyframeEffect returns an Array of the computed keyframes that make up this animation along with their computed offsets.</p><pre><code>// Return the array of keyframes\n\nredQueen_alice.effect.getKeyframes();\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/KeyframeEffectReadOnly/getKeyframes
KeyframeEffectReadOnly.iterationComposite	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The iterationComposite property of a KeyframeEffectReadOnly or a KeyframeEffect resolves how the the animation's property value changes accumulate or override each other upon each of the animation's iterations.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/KeyframeEffectReadOnly/iterationComposite
KeyframeEffectReadOnly.KeyframeEffectReadOnly()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The KeyframeEffectReadOnly() constructor of the Web Animations API returns a new KeyframeEffectReadOnly object instance.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/KeyframeEffectReadOnly/KeyframeEffectReadOnly
KeyframeEffectReadOnly.spacing	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The spacing property of a KeyframeEffectReadOnly or a KeyframeEffect sets the temporal spacing of the animation's iterations.</p><pre><code>var keyframes = new KeyframeEffect(\n  element,\n  [\n    { left: '0px' },\n    { left: '-20px' },\n    { left: '100px' },\n    { left: '50px' }\n  ],\n  1000\n);</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/KeyframeEffectReadOnly/spacing
KeyframeEffectReadOnly.target	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The target property of a KeyframeEffectReadOnly or a KeyframeEffect interface represents the element or pseudo-element being animated. It may be null for animations that do not target a specific element. It performs as both a getter and a setter, except with animations and transitions generated by CSS.</p><pre><code>var whiteRabbit = document.getElementById("rabbit");\n\nvar rabbitDownKeyframes = new KeyframeEffect(\n  whiteRabbit,\n  [\n    { transform: 'translateY(0%)' }, \n    { transform: 'translateY(100%)' }\n  ],\n  { duration: 3000, fill: 'forwards' }\n);\n\n// returns &lt;div id=&#8203;"rabbit"&gt;&#8203;Click the rabbit's ears!&#8203;&lt;/div&gt;&#8203;\nrabbitDownKeyframes.target;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/KeyframeEffectReadOnly/target
L10n.formatValue	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>formatValue is used to retrieve translations from the localization resources, optionally interpolating them with additional variable data. If the translation is not found in the first supported locale, the L10n context will try the next locale in the fallback chain (asynchronously) until it finds an available translation.</p><pre><code>var translationPromise = navigator.mozL10n.formatValue(identifier[, data]);</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/L10n.formatValue
L10n.get	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The get method is used to retrieve translations from the localization resources, optionally interpolating them with additional variable data. If the translation is not found in the first supported locale, the L10n context will try the next locale in the fallback chain (synchronously !) until it finds an available translation.</p><pre><code>var translation = navigator.mozL10n.get(identifier[, data]);</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/L10n.get
L10n.language.code	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The language.code property returns the code of the currently active language and allows to change the language by setting the value to a new code.</p><pre><code>var languageCode = navigator.mozL10n.language.code;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/L10n.language.code
L10n.language.direction	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The language.direction property returns the direction (ltr or rtl) of the currently active language.</p><pre><code>var languageCode = navigator.mozL10n.language.direction;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/L10n.language.direction
L10n.once	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The once method is used to register a callback that will execute exactly once.  If the L10n context is ready when L10n.once() is called, the callback will be invoked immediately on the next tick of the event loop. If the L10n context is not ready when L10n.once() is called (because the localization resources are still downloading), the callback will be invoked when the ready event of the L10n context fires.</p><pre><code>navigator.mozL10n.once(callback);</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/L10n.once
L10n.ready	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The ready method is used to register a callback that will execute at least once.  The callback is registered as a listener to the ready event of the L10n context.  Additionally, if the L10n context is ready when L10n.ready() is called, the callback will be invoked immediately on the next tick of the event loop.</p><pre><code>navigator.mozL10n.ready(callback);</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/L10n.ready
L10n.readyState	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The readyState property returns either loading or complete — depending on the current state of the L10n context.</p><pre><code>var readyState = navigator.mozL10n.readyState;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/L10n.readyState
L10n.setAttributes	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The setAttributes method may be used to set the data-l10n-id and data-l10n-args attributes on DOM elements.</p><pre><code>navigator.mozL10n.setAttributes(element, identifier[, data]);</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/L10n.setAttributes
LinkStyle	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The LinkStyle interface allows to access the associated CSS style sheet of a node.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/LinkStyle
LocalFileSystem	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The LocalFileSystem interface of the File System API gives you access to a sandboxed file system.  The methods are implemented by window and worker objects.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/LocalFileSystem
LocalFileSystemSync	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The LocalFileSystemSync interface of the File System API gives you access to a sandboxed file system. It is intended to be used with WebWorkers. The methods are implemented by worker objects.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/LocalFileSystemSync
LocalMediaStream	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The LocalMediaStream interface represents a stream of media content fetched from a local data source. This is the interface returned by getUserMedia().</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/LocalMediaStream
Location	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Location interface represents the location (URL) of the object it is linked to. Changes done on it are reflected on the object it relates to. Both the Document and Window interface have such a linked Location, accessible via Document.location and Window.location respectively.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Location
Location.assign()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Location.assign() method causes the window to load and display the document at the URL specified.</p><pre><code>object.assign(url);\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Location/assign
Location.reload()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Location.reload() method reloads the resource from the current URL. Its optional unique parameter is a Boolean, which, when it is true, causes the page to always be reloaded from the server. If it is false or not specified, the browser may reload the page from its cache. Besides caching behaviour forcedReload flag also impacts how some browsers handle scroll position: ordinary reload happens to try to restore scroll position after reloading page DOM, while in forced mode (when parameter is set to true) the new DOM gets loaded with scrollTop == 0.</p><pre><code>object.reload(forcedReload);\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Location/reload
Location.replace()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Location.replace() method replaces the current resource with the one at the provided URL. The difference from the assign() method is that after using replace() the current page will not be saved in session History, meaning the user won't be able to use the back button to navigate to it.</p><pre><code>object.replace(url);\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Location/replace
LockedFile	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The LockedFile interface provides tools to deal with a given file with all the necessary locks.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/LockedFile
LockedFile.abort()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The abort method is used to release the lock on the LockedFile object, making it inactive: its active property is set to false and all ongoing operations are canceled.</p><pre><code>var request = instanceOfLockedFile.abort();</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/LockedFile/abort
LockedFile.active	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The active property allows to know if the LockedFile object is still usable (true) or not (false). If the object is inactive then it is impossible to perform any read or write operation with it. Typically, a LockedFile object becomes inactive when the LockedFile.abort() method is called or if an error occurs.</p><pre><code>var state = instanceOfLockedFile.active\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/LockedFile/active
LockedFile.append()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The append method is used to write some data at the end of the file.</p><pre><code>var request = instanceOfLockedFile.append(data);</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/LockedFile/append
LockedFile.fileHandle	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The fileHandle property gives access to the FileHandle object that produced the LockedFile object.</p><pre><code>var handler = instanceOfLockedFile.fileHandle\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/LockedFile/fileHandle
LockedFile.flush()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The flush method is used to ensure any change made to a file is properly written on disk.</p><pre><code>var request = instanceOfLockedFile.flush();</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/LockedFile/flush
LockedFile.getMetadata()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The getMetadata method allows to retrieve some metadata about the locked file.</p><pre><code>var request = instanceOfLockedFile.getMetadata(param);</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/LockedFile/getMetaData
LockedFile.location	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The location property is a zero-based index representing the position of the read/write pointer within the file. Its value indicates at which bytes within the file any write or read operation will start.</p><pre><code>var location = instanceOfLockedFile.location\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/LockedFile/location
LockedFile.mode	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The mode property provides the read/write status of the LockedFile file.</p><pre><code>var mode = instanceOfLockedFile.mode\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/LockedFile/mode
LockedFile.onabort	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Specifies an event listener to receive abort events. These events occur when the locked file has been aborted with the LockedFile.abort() method.</p><pre><code>instanceOfLockedFile.onabort = funcRef;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/LockedFile/onabort
LockedFile.oncomplete	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Specifies an event listener to receive complete events. These events occur each time a read or write operation is successful.</p><pre><code>instanceOfLockedFile.oncomplete = funcRef;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/LockedFile/oncomplete
LockedFile.onerror	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Specifies an event listener to receive error events. These events occur when something goes wrong.</p><pre><code>instanceOfLockedFile.onerror = funcRef;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/LockedFile/onerror
LockedFile.readAsArrayBuffer()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The readAsArrayBuffer method is used to read the content of the LockedFile object and provide the result of that reading as an ArrayBuffer. In many ways, it performs like the FileReader.readAsArrayBuffer() method.</p><pre><code>var request = instanceOfLockedFile.readAsArrayBuffer(size);</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/LockedFile/readAsArrayBuffer

LockedFile.write()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The write method is used to write some data within the file.</p><pre><code>var request = instanceOfLockedFile.write(data);</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/LockedFile/write
MediaDeviceInfo	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The MediaDevicesInfo interface contains information on the available media input and output devices.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/MediaDeviceInfo
MediaDevices	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The MediaDevices interface provides access to connected media input devices like cameras and microphones, as well as screensharing.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/MediaDevices
MediaDevices.enumerateDevices()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The MediaDevices.enumerateDevices() method collects information about the media input and output devices available on the system.</p><pre><code>navigator.mediaDevices.enumerateDevices()\n.then(function(MediaDeviceInfo) { ... })</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/MediaDevices/enumerateDevices
MediaDevices.getUserMedia()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The MediaDevices.getUserMedia() method prompts the user for permission to use one video and/or one audio input device such as a camera or screensharing and/or a microphone. If the user provides permission, then the returned Promise is resolved with the resulting MediaStream object. If the user denies permission, or media is not available, then the promise is rejected with PermissionDeniedError or NotFoundError respectively. Note that it is possible for the returned promise to neither resolve nor reject, as the user is not required to make a choice.</p><pre><code>navigator.mediaDevices.getUserMedia(constraints)\n.then(function(mediaStream) { ... })\n.catch(function(error) { ... })</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/MediaDevices/getUserMedia
MediaElementAudioSourceNode	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>A MediaElementSourceNode has no inputs and exactly one output, and is created using the AudioContext.createMediaElementSource method. The amount of channels in the output equals the number of channels of the audio referenced by the HTMLMediaElement used in the creation of the node, or is 1 if the HTMLMediaElement has no audio.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/MediaElementAudioSourceNode
MediaError	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The MediaError interface represents an error associated to a media, like a HTMLMediaElement.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/MediaError

mediaerror code	R	MediaError.code										
MediaKeyMessageEvent	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The MediaKeyMessageEvent interface of the EncryptedMediaExtensions API contains the content and related data when the content decryption module generates a message for the session.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/MediaKeyMessageEvent
message	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The MediaKeyMessageEvent.message read-only property returns an ArrayBuffer with a message from the content decryption module. MediaKeys	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The MediaKeys interface of EncryptedMediaExtensions API the represents a set of keys that an associated HTMLMediaElement can use for decryption of media data during playback.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/MediaKeys
createSession()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The MediaKeys.createSession() method returns a new MediaKeySession object, which represents a context for message exchange with a content decryption module (CDM).</p><pre><code>&#8203;var mediaKeySessionObject = MediaKeys.createSession([MediaKeySessionType]);</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/MediaKeys/createSession

MediaKeySession	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The MediaKeySession interface of the EncryptedMediaExtensions API represents a context for message exchange with a content decryption module (CDM).</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/MediaKeySession
close()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The MediaKeySession.close() method notifies that the current media session is no longer needed, and that the content decryption module should release any resources associated with this object and close it. Then, it returns a Promise.</p><pre><code>mediaKeySession.close().then(function() { ... });</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/MediaKeySession/close
closed	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The MediaKeySession.closed read-only property returns a Promise signaling when a MediaKeySession closes. This promise can only be fulfilled and is never rejected. Closing a session means that licenses and keys associated with it are no longer valid for decrypting media data.</p><pre><code>var closed = mediaKeySessionObj.closed;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/MediaKeySession/closed
expiration	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The MediaKeySession.expiration read-only property returns the time after which the keys in the current session can no longer be used to decrypt media data, or NaN if no such time exists. This value is determined by the CDM and measured in milliseconds since January 1, 1970, UTC. This value may change during a session lifetime, such as when an action triggers the start of a window.</p><pre><code>&#8203;var expirationTime = mediaKeySessionObj.expiration;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/MediaKeySession/expiration
generateRequest()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The MediaKeySession.generateRequest() method returns a Promise after generating a media request based on initialization data.</p><pre><code>mediaKeySession.generateRequest().then(function) { ... });</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/MediaKeySession/generateRequest
keyStatuses	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The MediaKeySession.keyStatuses read-only property returns a reference to a read-only MediaKeyStatusMap of the current session's keys and their statuses.</p><pre><code>var mediaKeyStatusMapObj = mediaKeySessionObj.keyStatuses;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/MediaKeySession/keyStatuses

sessionId	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The MediaKeySession.sessionId read-only property contains a unique string generated by the CDM for the current media object and its associated keys or licenses.</p><pre><code>&#8203;var sessionId = mediaKeySessionObj.sessionId;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/MediaKeySession/sessionId

MediaKeyStatusMap	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The MediaKeyStatusMap interface of the EncryptedMediaExtensions API is a read-only map of media key statuses by key IDs.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/MediaKeyStatusMap

MediaRecorder	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The MediaRecorder interface of the MediaRecorder API provides functionality to easily record media. It is created by the invocation of the MediaRecorder() constructor.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/MediaRecorder
Media.Recorder.isMimeTypeSupported	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The MediaRecorder.isMimeTypeSupported() method returns a true that indicates whether the value of the argument is one the user agent can record. isMimeTypeSupported</p><pre><code>var canRecord = MediaRecorder.isMimeTypeSupported(mimeType)</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/MediaRecorder/canRecordMimeType

MediaRecorder API	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The MediaRecorder API (MediaStream Recording) aims to provide a really simple mechanism by which developers can record media streams from the user's input devices and instantly use them in web apps, rather than having to perform manual encoding operations on raw PCM data, etc., which would be required when using Navigator.getUserMedia() alone.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/MediaRecorder_API
Using the MediaRecorder API	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The MediaRecorder API is a simple construct to record media streams. When used with Navigator.getUserMedia(), it provides an easy way of recording from the user's input devices and instantly using the result in web apps. Both audio and video may be recorded, separately or together. This article aims to provide a basic guide on how to use MediaRecorder.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/MediaRecorder_API/Using_the_MediaRecorder_API

The amount of channels in the output equals the number of channels in AudioMediaStreamTrack.
