MediaStreamTrack	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The MediaStreamTrack interface represents a single media track within a stream; typically, these are audio or video tracks, but other track types may exist as well.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/MediaStreamTrack
MediaStreamTrack.applyConstraints()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The applyConstraints () method of the MediaStreamTrack interface applies a set of constraints to the track; these constraints let the Web site or app establish ideal values and acceptable ranges of values for the constrainable properties of the track, such as frame rate, dimensions, echo cancelation, and so forth.</p><pre><code>var appliedPromise = MediaStreamTrack.applyConstraints(constraints);</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/MediaStreamTrack/applyConstraints
MediaStreamTrack.clone()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The clone() method of the MediaStreamTrack interface creates a duplicate of the MediaStreamTrack. This new MediaStreamTrack object is identical except for its unique id.</p><pre><code>var track&#160;= MediaStreamTrack.clone();</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/MediaStreamTrack/clone
MediaStreamTrack.enabled	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The MediaStreamTrack.enabled property returns a Boolean with a value of true if the track is enabled, that is allowed to render the media source stream; or false if it is disabled, that is not rendering the media source stream but silence and blackness. If the track has been disconnected, this value can be changed but has no effect.</p><pre><code>var bool = track.enabled;\ntrack.enabled = [true | false];</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/MediaStreamTrack/enabled
MediaStreamTrack.getCapabilities()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The getCapabilities() method of the MediaStreamTrack interface returns a MediaTrackCapabilities object which specifies the values or range of values which each constrianable property, based upon the platform and user agent.</p><pre><code>var capabilities = MediaStreamTrack.getCapabilities();</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/MediaStreamTrack/getCapabilities
MediaStreamTrack.getConstraints()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The getConstraints() method of the MediaStreamTrack interface returns a MediaTrackConstraints object containing the set of constraints most recently established for the track using a prior call to applyConstraints(). These constraints indicate values and ranges of values that the Web site or application has specified are acceptable for the included constrainable properties.</p><pre><code>var constraints = MediaStreamTrack.getConstraints();</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/MediaStreamTrack/getConstraints
MediaStreamTrack.getSettings()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The getSettings() method of the MediaStreamTrack interface returns a MediaTrackSettings object containing the current values of each of the constrainable properties for the current MediaStreamTrack.</p><pre><code>var settings = MediaStreamTrack.getSettings();</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/MediaStreamTrack/getSettings
MediaStreamTrack.id	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The read-only property MediaStreamTrack.id returns a DOMString containing a unique identifier (GUID) for the track; it is generated by the browser.</p><pre><code> var id = track.id;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/MediaStreamTrack/id
MediaStreamTrack.kind	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The read-only property MediaStreamTrack.kind returns a DOMString set to "audio" if the track is an audio track and to "video", if it is a video track. It doesn't change if the track is deassociated from its source.</p><pre><code> var type = track.kind;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/MediaStreamTrack/kind
MediaStreamTrack.label	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The read-only property MediaStreamTrack.label returns a DOMString containing a user agent-assigned label that identifies the track source, as in "internal microphone". The string may be left empty and is empty as long as no source has been connected. When the track is deassociated from its source, the label is not changed.</p><pre><code> var name = track.label;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/MediaStreamTrack/label
muted	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The muted read-only property of the MediaStreamTrack interface returns a Boolean value indicating whether the track is muted.</p><pre><code>var bool&#160;= track.muted;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/MediaStreamTrack/muted
MediaStreamTrack.onended	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The MediaStreamTrack.onended event handler is used to specify a function which serves as an EventHandler to be called when the ended event occurs on the track. This event occurs when the track will no longer provide data to the stream for any reason, including the end of the media input being reached, the user revoking needed permissions, the source device being removed, or the remote peer ending a connection.</p><pre><code>MediaStreamTrack.onended = function;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/MediaStreamTrack/onended
MediaStreamTrack.onmute	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The MediaStreamTrack.onmute event handler is a property called when the mute event is received. Such an event is sent when the track is temporarily not able to send data.</p><pre><code>track.onmute = function;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/MediaStreamTrack/onmute
MediaStreamTrack.onoverconstrained	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The MediaStreamTrack.onoverconstrained event handler is a property called when the overconstrained event is received. Such an event is sent when the track is again able to send data.</p><pre><code>track.onoverconstrained = function;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/MediaStreamTrack/onoverconstrained
MediaStreamTrack.onunmute	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The MediaStreamTrack.onunmute event handler is a property called when the unmute event is received. Such an event is sent when the track is again able to send data.</p><pre><code>track.onunmute = function;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/MediaStreamTrack/onunmute
MediaStreamTrack.readyState	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The read-only property MediaStreamTrack.readyState returns an enumerated value giving the status of the track.</p><pre><code> var state = track.readyState;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/MediaStreamTrack/readyState
MediaStreamTrack.remote	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The MediaStreamTrack.remote read-only property allows Javascript to know whether a WebRTC MediaStreamTrack is from a remote source or a local one. It returns a Boolean with a value of true if the track is sourced remotely (that is, sourced by an RTCPeerConnection), or false if it is sourced locally.</p><pre><code>var bool &#8203;= track.remote;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/MediaStreamTrack/remote
MediaStreamTrack.stop()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The MediaStreamTrack.stop() method stops playing the source associated with the track. Both the source and the track are deassociated. The track state is set to ended.</p><pre><code>track.stop();\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/MediaStreamTrack/stop
MediaStreamTrackEvent	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The MediaStreamTrackEvent interface represents events which indicate that a MediaStream has had tracks added to or removed from the stream through calls to Media Stream API methods. These events are sent to the stream when these changes occur.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/MediaStreamTrackEvent
MediaStreamTrackEvent()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The MediaStreamTrackEvent() constructor returns a newly created MediaStreamTrackEvent object, which represents an event announcing that a MediaStreamTrack has been added to or removed from a MediaStream.</p><pre><code>var trackEvent = new MediaStreamTrackEvent(type, {track: aMediaStreamTrack});\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/MediaStreamTrackEvent/MediaStreamTrackEvent
MediaTrackConstraints	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The MediaTrackConstraints dictionary is used to describe a set of capabilities and the value or values each can take on. A constraints dictionary is passed into applyConstraints() to allow a script to establish a set of ideal values and/or preferred ranges of values for the track, and the most recently-requested set of custom constraints can be retrieved by calling getConstraints().</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/MediaTrackConstraints
MediaTrackSettings	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The MediaTrackSettings dictionary is used to return the current values configured for each of a MediaStreamTrack 's settings. These values will adhere as closely as possible to any constraints previously set using applyConstraints(), and will adhere to the default constraints for any properties whose constraints haven't been changed, or whose customized constraints couldn't be matched.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/MediaTrackSettings
MediaTrackSupportedConstraints	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The MediaTrackSupportedConstraints dictionary establishes the list of constrainable properties recognized by the user agent or browser in its implementation of the MediaStreamTrack object. An object conforming to MediaTrackSupportedConstraints is returned by MediaDevices.getSupportedConstraints().</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/MediaTrackSupportedConstraints
Media Source Extensions API	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Media Source Extensions API (MSE) provides functionality enabling plugin-free web-based streaming media. Using MSE, media streams can be created via JavaScript, and played using audio and video elements.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Media_Source_Extensions_API
Transcoding assets for Media Source Extensions	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>When working with media source extensions, it is likely that you need to condition your assets before you can stream them. This article takes you through the requirements and shows you a toolchain you can use to encode your assets appropriately.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Media_Source_Extensions_API/Transcoding_assets_for_MSE
Media Capture and Streams API (Media Streams)	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Media Capture and Streams API, often called the Media Stream API or the Stream API,  is an API related to WebRTC which supports streams of audio or video data, the methods for working with them, the constraints associated with the type of data, the success and error callbacks when using the data asynchronously, and the events that are fired during the process.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Media_Streams_API
MessageChannel	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The MessageChannel interface of the Channel Messaging API allows us to create a new message channel and send data through it via its two MessagePort properties.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/MessageChannel
MessageChannel()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The MessageChannel() constructor of the MessageChannel interface returns a new MessageChannel object with two new MessagePort objects.</p><pre><code>var channel = new MessageChannel();</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/MessageChannel/MessageChannel
MessageChannel.port1	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The port1 read-only property of the MessageChannel interface returns the first port of the message channel, the port attached to the context that originated the channel.</p><pre><code>channel.port1;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/MessageChannel/port1
MessageChannel.port2	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The port2 read-only property of the MessageChannel interface returns second port of the message channel, the port attached to the context at the other end of the channel, which the message is initially sent to.</p><pre><code>channel.port2;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/MessageChannel/port2
MessageEvent	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>A MessageEvent is the interface representing a message received by a target, being a WebSocket or a WebRTC RTCDataChannel</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/MessageEvent
MessagePort	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The MessagePort interface of the Channel Messaging API represents one of the two ports of a MessageChannel, allowing sending of messages from one port and listening out for them arriving at the other.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/MessagePort
MessagePort.close()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The close() method of the MessagePort interface disconnects the port, so it is no longer active. This stops the flow of messages to that port.</p><pre><code>port.close()</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/MessagePort/close
MessagePort.onmessage	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The onmessage event handler of the MessagePort interface is an EventListener, called whenever an MessageEvent of type message is fired on the port — that is, when the port receives a message.</p><pre><code>channel.onmessage = function() { ... };</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/MessagePort/onmessage
MessagePort.postMessage()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The postMessage() method of the MessagePort interface sends a message from the port, and optionally, transfers ownership of objects to other browsing contexts.</p><pre><code>port.postMessage(message [,transfer]);</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/MessagePort/postMessage
MessagePort.start()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The start() method of the MessagePort interface starts the sending of messages queued on the port. This method is only needed when using EventTarget.addEventListener ; it is implied when using MessageChannel.onmessage.</p><pre><code>port.start()</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/MessagePort/start
Microdata DOM API	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Microdata becomes even more useful when scripts can use it to expose information to the user, for example offering it in a form that can be used by other applications. The document.getItems(typeNames) method provides access to the top-level microdata items. It returns a NodeList containing the items with the specified types, or all types if no argument is specified. Each item is represented in the DOM by the element on which the relevant itemscope attribute is found. These elements have their element.itemScope IDL attribute set to true. The type(s) of items can be obtained using the element.itemType IDL attribute on the element with the itemscope attribute.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Microdata_DOM_API
MIDIAccess	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The MIDIAccess interface of the Web MIDI API provides methods for listing MIDI input and output devices, and obtaining access to those devices.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/MIDIAccess
MIDIConnectionEvent	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The MIDIConnectionEvent interface of the Web MIDI API is the event passed to the onstatechange event of the MIDIAccess interface and the onstatechange event of the MIDIPorts interface. This occurs any time a new port becomes available, or when a previously available port becomes unavailable. For example, this event is fired whenever a MIDI device is either plugged in to or unplugged from a computer.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/MIDIConnectionEvent
MIDIInput	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Use the MIDIInput interface of the Web MIDI API to access and pass messages to a MIDI input port.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/MIDIInput
MIDIInputMap	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The MIDIInputMap read-only interface of the Web MIDI API provides a Map -like interface to the currently available MIDI input ports. Though it works generally like a map, because it is read-only it does not contain clear(), delete(), or set() functions.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/MIDIInputMap
MIDIOutputMap	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The MIDIOutputMap read-only interface of the Web MIDI API provides a Map -like interface to the currently available MIDI output ports. Although it works like a map, because it is read-only, it does not contain clear(), delete(), or set() functions.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/MIDIOutputMap
MouseEvent	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The MouseEvent interface represents events that occur due to the user interacting with a pointing device (such as a mouse). Common events using this interface include click, dblclick, mouseup, mousedown.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/MouseEvent
MouseEvent.altKey	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The MouseEvent.altKey read-only property is a Boolean indicates if the alt key was pressed (true) or not (false) when the event occurred.</p><pre><code>var altKeyPressed = instanceOfMouseEvent.altKey\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/MouseEvent/altKey
MouseEvent.button	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The MouseEvent.button read-only property indicates which button was pressed on the mouse to trigger the event.</p><pre><code>var buttonPressed = instanceOfMouseEvent.button\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/MouseEvent/button
MouseEvent.buttons	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The MouseEvent.buttons read-only property indicates which buttons are pressed on the mouse when the event is triggered.</p><pre><code>var buttonPressed = instanceOfMouseEvent.buttons\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/MouseEvent/buttons
MouseEvent.clientX	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The MouseEvent.clientX read-only property provides the horizontal coordinate within the application's client area at which the event occurred (as opposed to the coordinates within the page). For example, clicking in the top-left corner of the client area will always result in a mouse event with a clientX value of 0, regardless of whether the page is scrolled horizontally.</p><pre><code>var x = instanceOfMouseEvent.clientX\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/MouseEvent/clientX
MouseEvent.clientY	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The MouseEvent.clientY read-only property returns the vertical coordinate within the application's client area at which the event occurred (as opposed to the coordinates within the page). For example, clicking in the top-left corner of the client area will always result in a mouse event with a clientY value of 0, regardless of whether the page is scrolled vertically.</p><pre><code>var y = instanceOfMouseEvent.clientY\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/MouseEvent/clientY
MouseEvent.ctrlKey	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The MouseEvent.ctrlKey read-only property returns a Boolean that indicates if the control key was pressed (true) or not (false) when the event occured.</p><pre><code>var ctrlKeyPressed = instanceOfMouseEvent.ctrlKey\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/MouseEvent/ctrlKey
MouseEvent.getModifierState()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The MouseEvent.getModifierState() method returns the current state of the specified modifier key: true if the modifier is active (i.e., the modifier key is pressed or locked), otherwise, false.</p><pre><code>var active =&#8203; event.getModifierState(keyArg);</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/MouseEvent/getModifierState
MouseEvent.initMouseEvent()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The MouseEvent.initMouseEvent() method initializes the value of a mouse event once it's been created (normally using the Document.createEvent() method).</p><pre><code>event.initMouseEvent(type, canBubble, cancelable, view,\n                     detail, screenX, screenY, clientX, clientY,\n                     ctrlKey, altKey, shiftKey, metaKey,\n                     button, relatedTarget);</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/MouseEvent/initMouseEvent
MouseEvent.metaKey	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The MouseEvent.metaKey read-only property returning a Boolean that indicates if the Meta key was pressed (true) or not (false) when the event occured.</p><pre><code>var metaKeyPressed = instanceOfMouseEvent.metaKey\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/MouseEvent/metaKey
MouseEvent()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The MouseEvent() constructor creates a new MouseEvent.</p><pre><code> event = new MouseEvent(typeArg, mouseEventInit);</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/MouseEvent/MouseEvent
MouseEvent.WEBKIT_FORCE_AT_FORCE_MOUSE_DOWN	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>See MouseEvent.WEBKIT_FORCE_AT_FORCE_MOUSE_DOWN</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/MouseEvent/MouseEvent.WEBKIT_FORCE_AT_FORCE_MOUSE_DOWN
MouseEvent.WEBKIT_FORCE_AT_MOUSE_DOWN	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>See MouseEvent.WEBKIT_FORCE_AT_MOUSE_DOWN</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/MouseEvent/MouseEvent.WEBKIT_FORCE_AT_MOUSE_DOWN
MouseEvent.movementX	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The MouseEvent.movementX read-only property provides the shift in the X coordinate of the mouse pointer between that event and the previous mousemove event. In other words, the value of that property is computed that way : currentEvent.movementX = currentEvent.screenX - previousEvent.screenX.</p><pre><code>var xShift = instanceOfMouseEvent.movementX\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/MouseEvent/movementX
MouseEvent.movementY	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The MouseEvent.movementY read-only property provides the shift in the Y coordinate of the mouse pointer between that event and the previous mousemove event. In other words, the value of that property is computed that way : currentEvent.movementY = currentEvent.screenY - previousEvent.screenY.</p><pre><code>var yShift = instanceOfMouseEvent.movementY\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/MouseEvent/movementY
MouseEvent.mozInputSource	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The MouseEvent.mozInputSource read-only property on MouseEvent provides information indicating the type of device that generated the event. This lets you, for example, determine whether a mouse event was generated by an actual mouse or by a touch event (which might affect the degree of accuracy with which you interpret the coordinates associated with the event).</p><pre><code>var source = event.mozInputSource;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/MouseEvent/mozInputSource
MouseEvent.offsetX	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The MouseEvent.offsetX read-only property provides the offset in the X coordinate of the mouse pointer between that event and the padding edge of the target node.</p><pre><code>var xOffset = instanceOfMouseEvent.offsetX;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/MouseEvent/offsetX
MouseEvent.offsetY	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The MouseEvent.offsetY read-only property provides the offset in the Y coordinate of the mouse pointer between that event and the padding edge of the target node.</p><pre><code>var yOffset = instanceOfMouseEvent.offsetY;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/MouseEvent/offsetY
MouseEvent.pageX	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The MouseEvent.pageX read-only property returns the horizontal coordinate of the event relative to the whole document.</p><pre><code>var pos = event.pageXvar pageX = event.pageX;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/MouseEvent/pageX
MouseEvent.pageY	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The MouseEvent.pageY read-only property returns the vertical coordinate of the event relative to the whole document.</p><pre><code>var pos = event.pageYvar pageY = event.pageY;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/MouseEvent/pageY
MouseEvent.region	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The MouseEvent.region read-only property returns the id of the canvas hit region affected by the event. If no hit region is affected, null is returned.</p><pre><code>var hitRegion = instanceOfMouseEvent.region\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/MouseEvent/region
MouseEvent.relatedTarget	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The MouseEvent.relatedTarget read-only property is the secondary target for the event, if there is one. That is:</p><pre><code>var tgt = instanceOfMouseEvent.relatedTarget\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/MouseEvent/relatedTarget
MouseEvent.screenX	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The MouseEvent.screenX read-only property provides the horizontal coordinate of the mouse pointer in global (screen) coordinates.</p><pre><code>var pixelNumber = instanceOfMouseEvent.screenX\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/MouseEvent/screenX
MouseEvent.screenY	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The MouseEvent.screenY read-only property provides the vertical coordinate of the mouse pointer in global (screen) coordinates.</p><pre><code>var pixelNumber = instanceOfMouseEvent.screenY\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/MouseEvent/screenY
MouseEvent.shiftKey	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The MouseEvent.shiftKey read-only property indicates if the shift key was pressed (true) or not (false) when the event occurred.</p><pre><code>var shiftKeyPressed = instanceOfMouseEvent.shiftKey\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/MouseEvent/shiftKey
MouseEvent.webkitForce	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>MouseEvent.webkitForce is a proprietary, WebKit-specific numeric property whose value represents the amount of pressure that is being applied on the touchpad or touchscreen.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/MouseEvent/webkitForce
MouseEvent.WEBKIT_FORCE_AT_FORCE_MOUSE_DOWN	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>MouseEvent.WEBKIT_FORCE_AT_FORCE_MOUSE_DOWN is a proprietary, WebKit-specific, static numeric property whose value is the minimum force necessary for a force click.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/MouseEvent/WEBKIT_FORCE_AT_FORCE_MOUSE_DOWN
MouseEvent.WEBKIT_FORCE_AT_MOUSE_DOWN	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>MouseEvent.WEBKIT_FORCE_AT_MOUSE_DOWN is a proprietary, WebKit-specific, static numeric property whose value is the minimum force necessary for a normal click.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/MouseEvent/WEBKIT_FORCE_AT_MOUSE_DOWN
MouseEvent.which	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The MouseEvent.which read-only property indicates which button was pressed on the mouse to trigger the event. The standard alternatives to this property are MouseEvent.button and MouseEvent.buttons.</p><pre><code>var buttonPressed = instanceOfMouseEvent.which\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/MouseEvent/which

MouseWheelEvent	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The MouseWheelEvent interface represents events that occur due to the user turning a mouse wheel.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/MouseWheelEvent
MSGestureEvent	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The MSGestureEvent is a proprietary interface specific to Internet Explorer and Microsoft Edge which represents events that occur due to touch gestures. Events using this interface include MSGestureStart, MSGestureEnd, MSGestureTap, MSGestureHold, MSGestureChange, and MSInertiaStart.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/MSGestureEvent
MutationEvent	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Provides event properties that are specific to modifications to the Document Object Model (DOM) hierarchy and nodes.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/MutationEvent
MutationObserver	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>MutationObserver provides developers a way to react to changes in a DOM. It is designed as a replacement for Mutation Events defined in the DOM3 Events specification.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/MutationObserver
MutationRecord	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>A MutationRecord represents an individual DOM mutation. It is the object that is passed to MutationObserver 's callback.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/MutationRecord
NamedNodeMap	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The NamedNodeMap interface represents a collection of Attr objects. Objects inside a NamedNodeMap are not in any particular order, unlike NodeList, although they may be accessed by an index as in an array.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/NamedNodeMap
NamedNodeMap.getNamedItem()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The NamedNodeMap.getNamedItem() method returns the Attr corresponding to the given name, or null if there is no corresponding attribute.</p><pre><code>myAttr = attrs.getNamedItem(name)</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/NamedNodeMap/getNamedItem
Navigation Timing API	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Navigation Timing API provides data that can be used to measure the performance of a website. Unlike other JavaScript-based mechanisms that have been used for the same purpose, this API can provide end-to-end latency data that can be more useful and accurate.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Navigation_timing_API
Using Navigation Timing	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>This page has no content. Enrich MDN by contributing.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Navigation_timing_API/Using_Navigation_Timing
Navigator	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Navigator interface represents the state and the identity of the user agent. It allows scripts to query it and to register themselves to carry on some activities.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Navigator
Navigator.activeVRDisplays	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The activeVRDisplays read-only property of the Navigator interface returns an array containing every VRDisplay object that is currently presenting (VRDisplay.ispresenting is true).</p><pre><code>var myActiveDisplays = navigator.activeVRDisplays;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Navigator/activeVRDisplays
Navigator.addIdleObserver()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>This method is used to add an observer that will check if the user is idle and will act accordingly. Once an observer is added, it can be removed with Navigator.removeIdleObserver.</p><pre><code>navigator.addIdleObserver(IdleObserver);</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Navigator/addIdleObserver
Navigator.buildID	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Returns the build identifier of the browser.</p><pre><code>buildID = navigator.buildID;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Navigator/buildID
Navigator.connection	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Navigator.connection read-only property represents a NetworkInformation containing information about the system's connection, such as the current bandwidth of the user's device or whether the connection is metered. This could be used to select high definition content or low definition content based on the user's connection.</p><pre><code>connectionInfo = navigator.connection</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Navigator/connection
Navigator.cookieEnabled	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Returns a Boolean value indicating whether cookies are enabled or not (read-only).</p><pre><code>var cookieEnabled = navigator.cookieEnabled;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Navigator/cookieEnabled
credentials	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The credentials property of the Navigator interface returns the CredentialsContainer interface which exposes methods to request credentials and notify the user agent when interesting events occur, such as successful sign in or sign out. This interface can be used for feature detection.</p><pre><code>var credentialsContainer = Navigator.credentials</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Navigator/credentials
Navigator.doNotTrack	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Returns the user's do-not-track setting. This is "1" if the user has requested not to be tracked by web sites, content, or advertising.</p><pre><code>dnt = navigator.doNotTrack;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Navigator/doNotTrack
Navigator.geolocation	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Navigator.geolocation read-only property returns a Geolocation object that gives Web content access to the location of the device. This allows a Web site or app to offer customized results based on the user's location.</p><pre><code>geo = navigator.geolocation\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Navigator/geolocation
Navigator.getBattery()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The getBattery() method provides information about the system's battery, returns a battery promise, which is resolved in a BatteryManager object providing also some new events you can handle to monitor the battery status.. This implements the Battery Status API ; see that documentation for additional details, a guide to using the API, and sample code.</p><pre><code>var batteryPromise = navigator.getBattery();</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Navigator/getBattery
Navigator.getGamepads()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Navigator.getGamepads() method returns an array: the first value is null, and the others are all Gamepad objects, one for each gamepad connected to the device. So if no gamepads are connected, the method will just return null.</p><pre><code> var arrayGP = navigator.getGamepads();</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Navigator/getGamepads
Navigator.getUserMedia()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Navigator.getUserMedia() method prompts the user for permission to use 0 or 1 video and 0 or 1 audio input device such as a camera, a shared screen, or a microphone. If the user provides permission, then the successCallback is invoked with the resulting MediaStream object as its argument. If the user denies permission or media is not available, then the errorCallback is called with PermissionDeniedError or NotFoundError respectively. Note that it is possible for neither completion callback to be called, as the user is not required to make a choice.</p><pre><code>navigator.getUserMedia(constraints, successCallback, errorCallback);</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Navigator/getUserMedia
Navigator.getVRDisplays()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The getVRDisplays() method of the Navigator interface returns a promise that resolves to an array of VRDisplay objects representing any available VR devices connected to the computer.</p><pre><code>navigator.getVRDisplays().then(function(displays) {\n  // Do something with the available VR displays\n});</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Navigator/getVRDisplays
Navigator.id	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The BrowserID protocol defines a new id property on the window.navigator object, through which it exposes the BrowserID API, that is the IdentityManager intreface. This API has gone through several significant revisions. Each generation is listed separately below.</p><pre><code>var id = navigator.id</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Navigator/id
cebutaxidriver	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Cebu food droid</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Navigator/id/cebutaxidriver

Navigator.mediaDevices	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Navigator.mediaDevices read-only property returns a MediaDevices object, which provides access to connected media input devices like cameras and microphones, as well as screensharing.</p><pre><code>var mediaDevices = navigator.mediaDevices;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Navigator/mediaDevices
Navigator.mozBluetooth	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Returns a BluetoothManager object you can use to get a BluetoothAdapter object.</p><pre><code>var bluetooth = window.navigator.mozBluetooth;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Navigator/mozBluetooth

Currently, these are only supported on Firefox Mobile and Firefox OS. See Displaying notifications for an example.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Navigator/mozNotification

Navigator.mozTime	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Returns a MozTimeManager object you can use to change the device's time.</p><pre><code>var time = window.navigator.mozTime;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Navigator/mozTime
Navigator.mozVoicemail	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Returns a MozVoicemail object you can use to handle the access to the voicemail functionality from the RIL of a Firefox OS phone.</p><pre><code>var voicemail = window.navigator.mozVoicemail;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Navigator/mozVoicemail
Navigator.oscpu	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Returns a string that identifies the current operating system.</p><pre><code>oscpuInfo = window.navigator.oscpu \n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Navigator/oscpu
Navigator.permissions	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Navigator.permissions read-only property returns a Permissions object that can be used to query and update permission status of APIs covered by the Permissions API.</p><pre><code>permissionsObj = globalObj.navigator.permissions\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Navigator/permissions
Navigator.productSub	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Navigator.productSub read-only property returns the build number of the current browser.</p><pre><code>prodSub = window.navigator.productSub</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Navigator/productSub
Navigator.push	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Navigator.push read-only property is a PushManager object providing a way to receive notifications from third party servers. These are real-time notifications provided by external services directly to installed apps. This implements the SimplePush API that does not require sending real data on those notifications. Also, you can see this documentation for additional details, a guide to using the API, and sample code.</p><pre><code>var push = window.navigator.push;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Navigator/push
Navigator.registerContentHandler()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Allows web sites to register themselves as possible handlers for content of a particular MIME type.</p><pre><code>navigator.registerContentHandler(mimeType, uri, title);</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Navigator/registerContentHandler
Navigator.registerProtocolHandler()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Allows web sites to register themselves as possible handlers for particular protocols.</p><pre><code>window.navigator.registerProtocolHandler(protocol, url, title);\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Navigator/registerProtocolHandler
Navigator.requestMediaKeySystemAccess()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Navigator.requestMediaKeySystemAccess() method returns a Promise for a MediaKeySystemAccess object.</p><pre><code>&#8203;Navigator.requestMediaKeySystemAccess(keySystem, supportedConfigurations).then(function(mediaKeySystemAccess) { ... });</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Navigator/requestMediaKeySystemAccess
Navigator.requestWakeLock()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>This Navigator.requestWakeLock() method of the Wake Lock API is used to request a MozWakeLock on any resource of the device. This means that you can prevent that resource from becoming unavailable as long as your app holds a lock for that resource. For example, a voice recording app can obtain a lock to keep the screen on during recording so that it can give prover visual feedback to the user that recording is progressing.</p><pre><code>lock = window.navigator.requestWakeLock(resourceName);</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Navigator/requestWakeLock
Navigator.sendBeacon()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The navigator.sendBeacon() method can be used to asynchronously transfer a small amount of data over HTTP to a web server.</p><pre><code>navigator.sendBeacon(url, data);\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Navigator/sendBeacon
Navigator.serviceWorker	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Navigator.serviceWorker read-only property returns the ServiceWorkerContainer object for the associated document, which provides access to registration, removal, upgrade, and communication with the ServiceWorker.</p><pre><code>var workerContainerInstance = navigator.serviceWorker;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Navigator/serviceWorker
Navigator.vendor	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Returns the name of the browser vendor for the current browser.</p><pre><code>venString = window.navigator.vendor \n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Navigator/vendor
Navigator.vendorSub	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Navigator.vendorSub read-only property is the substring of the vendor having to do with the vendor version number.  The specification allows browsers to always return the empty string, so don't rely on this property to get a reliable answer.</p><pre><code>venSub = window.navigator.vendorSub \n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Navigator/vendorSub
Navigator.vibrate()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Navigator.vibrate() method pulses the vibration hardware on the device, if such hardware exists. If the device doesn't support vibration, this method has no effect. If a vibration pattern is already in progress when this method is called, the previous pattern is halted and the new one begins instead.</p><pre><code>var successBool = window.navigator.vibrate(pattern);\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Navigator/vibrate
NavigatorConcurrentHardware	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The NavigatorConcurrentHardware mixin adds to the Navigator interface features which allow Web content to determine how many logical processors the user has available, in order to let content and Web apps optimize their operations to best take advantage of the user's CPU.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/NavigatorConcurrentHardware
NavigatorConcurrentHardware.hardwareConcurrency	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The NavigatorConcurrentHardware.hardwareConcurrency read-only property returns the number of logical processors available to run threads on the user's computer.</p><pre><code>logicalProcessors = window.navigator.hardwareConcurrency\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/NavigatorConcurrentHardware/hardwareConcurrency
NavigatorGeolocation	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>NavigatorGeolocation contains a creation method allowing objects implementing it to obtain a Geolocation instance.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/NavigatorGeolocation
NavigatorID	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The NavigatorID interface contains methods and properties related to the identity of the browser.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/NavigatorID
NavigatorID.appCodeName	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The NavigatorID.appCodeName always returns 'Mozilla', on any browser. This property is kept only for compatibility purposes.</p><pre><code>codeName = window.navigator.appCodeName \n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/NavigatorID/appCodeName
NavigatorID.appName	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The NavigatorID.appName property returns the name of the browser. The HTML5 specification also allows any browser to return " Netscape " here, for compatibility reasons.</p><pre><code>appName = window.navigator.appName \n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/NavigatorID/appName
NavigatorID.appVersion	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Returns the version of the browser as a string. It may be either a plain version number, like "5.0", or a version number followed by more detailed information. The HTML5 specification also allows any browser to return " 4.0 ", for compatibility reasons.</p><pre><code>window.navigator.appVersion \n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/NavigatorID/appVersion
NavigatorID.platform	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Returns a string representing the platform of the browser. The specification allows browsers to always return the empty string, so don't rely on this property to get a reliable answer.</p><pre><code>platform = navigator.platform \n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/NavigatorID/platform
NavigatorID.product	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The NavigatorID.product property returns the product name of the current browser.</p><pre><code>productName = window.navigator.product \n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/NavigatorID/product
NavigatorID.taintEnabled()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The NavigatorID.taintEnabled() method always returns false.</p><pre><code>result = window.navigator.taintEnabled()\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/NavigatorID/taintEnabled
NavigatorID.userAgent	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The NavigatorID.userAgent read-only property returns the user agent string for the current browser.</p><pre><code>var ua = window.navigator.userAgent;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/NavigatorID/userAgent
NavigatorLanguage	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>NavigatorLanguage contains methods and properties related to the language of the navigator.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/NavigatorLanguage
NavigatorLanguage.language	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The NavigatorLanguage.language read-only property returns a string representing the preferred language of the user, usually the language of the browser UI.</p><pre><code>lang = globalObj.navigator.language \n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/NavigatorLanguage/language
NavigatorLanguage.languages	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The NavigatorLanguage.languages read-only property returns an array of DOMString s representing the user's preferred languages. The language is described using BCP 47 language tags. In the returned array they are ordered by preference with the most preferred language first.</p><pre><code>preferredLanguages = globalObj.navigator.languages\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/NavigatorLanguage/languages
NavigatorOnLine	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The NavigatorOnLine interface contains methods and properties related to the connectivity status of the browser.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/NavigatorOnLine
NavigatorOnLine.onLine	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Returns the online status of the browser. The property returns a boolean value, with true meaning online and false meaning offline. The property sends updates whenever the browser's ability to connect to the network changes. The update occurs when the user follows links or when a script requests a remote page. For example, the property should return false when users click links soon after they lose internet connection.</p><pre><code>online = window.navigator.onLine;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/NavigatorOnLine/onLine
NavigatorPlugins	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The NavigatorPlugins interface contains methods and properties related to the plugins installed in the browser.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/NavigatorPlugins
NavigatorPlugins.javaEnabled()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>This method indicates whether the current browser is Java-enabled or not.</p><pre><code>result = window.navigator.javaEnabled()\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/NavigatorPlugins/javaEnabled
NavigatorPlugins.mimeTypes	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Returns a MimeTypeArray object, which contains a list of MimeType objects representing the MIME types recognized by the browser.</p><pre><code>mimeTypes = navigator.mimeTypes; \n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/NavigatorPlugins/mimeTypes
NavigatorPlugins.plugins	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Returns a PluginArray object, listing the plugins installed in the application.</p><pre><code>var plugins = navigator.plugins;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/NavigatorPlugins/plugins
NetworkInformation	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The NetworkInformation interface provides information about the connection a device is using to commuinicate with the network and provides a means for scripts to be notified if the connection type changes. The NetworkInformation interfaces cannot be instantiated. It is instead accessed through the connection property of the Navigator interface.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/NetworkInformation
NetworkInformation.downlinkMax	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The NetworkInformation.downlinkMax read-only property returns the maximum downlink speed, in megabits per second (Mbps), for the underlying connection technology.</p><pre><code>var max = NetworkInformation.downlinkMax</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/NetworkInformation/downlinkMax
NetworkInformation.onchange	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The NetworkInformation.onchange event handler contains the code that is fired when connection information changes, and the change is received by the NetworkInformation object.</p><pre><code>netInfo.onchange = function() { ... }\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/NetworkInformation/onchange
NetworkInformation.ontypechange	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The NetworkInformation.ontypechange event handler is a property containing the code to execute when the typechange event, of type Event, is received by this NetworkInformation instance. That event is sent by the browser to let content know that the value of the NetworkInformation.type attribute has changed.</p><pre><code>networkinformation.ontypechange = function;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/NetworkInformation/ontypechange
NetworkInformation.type	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The NetworkInformation.type read-only property returns the type of connection a device is using to communicate with the network.</p><pre><code>var type = netInfo.type</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/NetworkInformation/type
Network Information API	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Network Information API provides information about the system's connection, which is in term of general connection type (e.g., 'wifi', 'cellular', etc.). This can be used to select high definition content or low definition content based on the user's connection. The entire API consists of the addition of the NetworkInformation interface and a single property to the Navigator interface: Navigator.connection.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Network_Information_API
Node	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>A Node is an interface from which a number of DOM types inherit, and allows these various types to be treated (or tested) similarly.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Node
Node.appendChild()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Node.appendChild() method adds a node to the end of the list of children of a specified parent node. If the given child is a reference to an existing node in the document, appendChild() moves it from its current position to the new position (there is no requirement to remove the node from its parent node before appending it to some other node).</p><pre><code>var aChild = element.appendChild(aChild);</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Node/appendChild
Node.baseURI	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Node.baseURI read-only property returns the absolute base URL of a node.</p><pre><code>var baseURI = node.baseURI;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Node/baseURI
Node.baseURIObject	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Node.baseURIObject property returns the nsIURI representing the node's (typically a document or an element) base URL. It's similar to Node.baseURI, except it returns an nsIURI instead of a string.</p><pre><code>uriObj = node.baseURIObject\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Node/baseURIObject
Node.childNodes	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Node.childNodes read-only property returns a live collection of child nodes of the given element.</p><pre><code>var ndList = elementNodeReference.childNodes; \n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Node/childNodes
Node.cloneNode()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Node.cloneNode() method returns a duplicate of the node on which this method was called.</p><pre><code>var dupNode = node.cloneNode(deep);\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Node/cloneNode
Node.compareDocumentPosition()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Node.compareDocumentPosition() method compares the position of the current node against another node in any other document.</p><pre><code>node.compareDocumentPosition( otherNode ) \n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Node/compareDocumentPosition
Node.contains()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Node.contains() method returns a Boolean value indicating whether a node is a descendant of a given node or not.</p><pre><code>node.contains( otherNode ) \n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Node/contains
Node.firstChild	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Node.firstChild read-only property returns the node's first child in the tree, or null if the node is childless. If the node is a Document, it returns the first node in the list of its direct children.</p><pre><code>var childNode = node.firstChild;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Node/firstChild
Node.hasChildNodes()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Node.hasChildNodes() method returns a Boolean value indicating whether the current Node has child nodes or not.</p><pre><code>node.hasChildNodes()</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Node/hasChildNodes
Node.innerText	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Node.innerText is a nonstandard property that represents the text content of a node and its descendants. As a getter, it approximates the text the user would get if they highlighted the contents of the element with the cursor and then copied to the clipboard.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Node/innerText
Node.insertBefore()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Node.insertBefore() method inserts the specified node before the reference node as a child of the current node.</p><pre><code>var insertedNode = parentNode.insertBefore(newNode, referenceNode);\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Node/insertBefore
Node.isDefaultNamespace()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Node.isDefaultNamespace() method accepts a namespace URI as an argument and returns a Boolean with a value of true if the namespace is the default namespace on the given node or false if not.</p><pre><code>result = node.isDefaultNamespace(namespaceURI) \n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Node/isDefaultNamespace
Node.isEqualNode()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Node.isEqualNode() method tests whether two nodes are equal. Two nodes are equal when they have the same type, defining characteristics (for elements, this would be their ID, number of children, and so forth), its attributes match, and so on. The specific set of data points that much match varies depending on the types of the nodes.</p><pre><code>var isEqualNode = node.isEqualNode(otherNode);\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Node/isEqualNode
Node.isSameNode()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Node.isSameNode() method tests whether two nodes are the same, that is if they reference the same object.</p><pre><code>var isSameNode = node.isSameNode(other);\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Node/isSameNode
Node.lastChild	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Node.lastChild read-only property returns the last child of the node. If its parent is an element, then the child is generally an element node, a text node, or a comment node. It returns null if there are no child elements.</p><pre><code>var last_child = element.lastChild\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Node/lastChild
Node.lookupNamespaceURI()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Node.lookupNamespaceURI() method takes a prefix and returns the namespace URI associated with it on the given node if found (and null if not). Supplying null for the prefix will return the default namespace.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Node/lookupNamespaceURI
Node.lookupPrefix()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Node.lookupPrefix() method returns a DOMString containing the prefix for a given namespace URI, if present, and null if not. When multiple prefixes are possible, the result is implementation-dependent.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Node/lookupPrefix
Node.nextSibling	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Node.nextSibling read-only property returns the node immediately following the specified one in its parent's childNodes list, or null if the specified node is the last node in that list.</p><pre><code>nextNode = node.nextSibling\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Node/nextSibling
Node.nodeName	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Node.nodeName read-only property returns the name of the current node as a string.</p><pre><code>var str = node.nodeName;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Node/nodeName
Node.nodeType	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The read-only Node.nodeType property that represents the type of the node.</p><pre><code>var type = node.nodeType;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Node/nodeType
Node.nodeValue	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Node.nodeValue property returns or sets the value of the current node.</p><pre><code>value = node.nodeValue;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Node/nodeValue
Node.normalize()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Node.normalize() method puts the specified node and all of its sub-tree into a "normalized" form. In a normalized sub-tree, no text nodes in the sub-tree are empty and there are no adjacent text nodes.</p><pre><code>element.normalize();\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Node/normalize
Node.outerText	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>See HTMLElement.outerText</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Node/outerText
Node.ownerDocument	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Node.ownerDocument read-only property returns the top-level document object for this node.</p><pre><code>document = element.ownerDocument\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Node/ownerDocument
Node.parentElement	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Node.parentElement read-only property returns the DOM node's parent Element, or null if the node either has no parent, or its parent isn't a DOM Element.</p><pre><code>parentElement = node.parentElement</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Node/parentElement
Node.parentNode	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Node.parentNode read-only property returns the parent of the specified node in the DOM tree.</p><pre><code>parentNode = node.parentNode\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Node/parentNode
Node.previousSibling	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Node.previousSibling read-only property returns the node immediately preceding the specified one in its parent's childNodes list, or null if the specified node is the first in that list.</p><pre><code>previousNode = node.previousSibling;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Node/previousSibling
Node.removeChild()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Node.removeChild() method removes a child node from the DOM. Returns removed node.</p><pre><code>var oldChild = node.removeChild(child);\nOR\nelement.removeChild(child);\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Node/removeChild
Node.replaceChild()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Node.replaceChild() method replaces one child node of the specified node with another.</p><pre><code>replacedNode = parentNode.replaceChild(newChild, oldChild);\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Node/replaceChild
Node.rootNode	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Node.rootNode read-only property returns a Node object representing the topmost node in the tree, or the current node if it's the topmost node in the tree. This is found by walking backward along Node.parentNode until the top is reached.</p><pre><code>rootNode = node.rootNode;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Node/rootNode
Node.textContent	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Node.textContent property represents the text content of a node and its descendants.</p><pre><code>var text = element.textContent;\nelement.textContent = "this is some sample text";\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Node/textContent
NodeFilter	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>A NodeFilter interface represents an object used to filter the nodes in a NodeIterator or TreeWalker. They don't know anything about the DOM or how to traverse nodes; they just know how to evaluate a single node against the provided filter.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/NodeFilter
NodeFilter.acceptNode()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The NodeFilter.acceptNode() method returns an unsigned short that will be used to tell if a given Node must be accepted or not by the NodeIterator or TreeWalker iteration algorithm. This method is expected to be written by the user of a NodeFilter. Possible return values are:</p><pre><code>result = nodeFilter.acceptNode(node)\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/NodeFilter/acceptNode
NodeIterator	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The NodeIterator interface represents an iterator over the members of a list of the nodes in a subtree of the DOM. The nodes will be returned in document order.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/NodeIterator
NodeIterator.expandEntityReferences	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The NodeIterator.expandEntityReferences read-only property returns a Boolean flag indicating whether or not the children of entity reference nodes are visible to the NodeIterator.</p><pre><code>expand = nodeIterator.expandEntityReferences;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/NodeIterator/expandEntityReferences
NodeIterator.filter	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The NodeIterator.filter read-only method returns a NodeFilter object, that is an object implement an acceptNode(node) method, used to screen nodes.</p><pre><code>nodeFilter = nodeIterator.filter;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/NodeIterator/filter
NodeIterator.nextNode()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The NodeIterator.nextNode() method returns the next node in the set represented by the NodeIterator and advances the position of the iterator within the set.  The first call to nextNode() returns the first node in the set.</p><pre><code>node = nodeIterator.nextNode();\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/NodeIterator/nextNode
NodeIterator.pointerBeforeReferenceNode	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The NodeIterator.pointerBeforeReferenceNode read-only property returns a Boolean flag that indicates whether the NodeFilter is anchored before (if this value is true) or after (if this value is false) the anchor node indicated by the NodeIterator.referenceNode property.</p><pre><code>flag = nodeIterator.pointerBeforeReferenceNode;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/NodeIterator/pointerBeforeReferenceNode
NodeIterator.previousNode()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The NodeIterator.previousNode() method returns the previous node in the set represented by the NodeIterator and moves the position of the iterator backwards within the set.</p><pre><code>node = nodeIterator.previousNode();\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/NodeIterator/previousNode
NodeIterator.referenceNode	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The NodeIterator.referenceNode read-only returns the Node to which the iterator is anchored; as new nodes are inserted, the iterator remains anchored to the reference node as specified by this property.</p><pre><code>node = nodeIterator.referenceNode;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/NodeIterator/referenceNode
NodeIterator.root	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The NodeIterator.root read-only property represents the Node that is the root of what the NodeIterator traverses.</p><pre><code>root = nodeIterator.root;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/NodeIterator/root
NodeIterator.whatToShow	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The NodeIterator.whatToShow read-only property represents an unsigned integer representing a bitmask signifying what types of nodes should be returned by the NodeIterator.</p><pre><code>var nodeTypes = nodeIterator.whatToShow;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/NodeIterator/whatToShow
NodeList	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>NodeList objects are collections of nodes such as those returned by Node.childNodes and the document.querySelectorAll method.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/NodeList
NodeList.item()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Returns a node from a NodeList by index. This method doesn't throw exceptions as long as you provide arguments; a value of null is returned if the index is out of range and a TypeError is thrown if no argument is provided.</p><pre><code>nodeItem = nodeList.item(index) \n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/NodeList/item
NodeList.length	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>length returns the number of items in a NodeList.</p><pre><code>numItems =\nnodeList.length\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/NodeList/length

NonDocumentTypeChildNode.nextElementSibling	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The NonDocumentTypeChildNode.nextElementSibling read-only property returns the element immediately following the specified one in its parent's children list, or null if the specified element is the last one in the list.</p><pre><code>var nextNode = elementNodeReference.nextElementSibling; </code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/NonDocumentTypeChildNode/nextElementSibling
NonDocumentTypeChildNode.previousElementSibling	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The NonDocumentTypeChildNode.previousElementSibling read-only property returns the Element immediately prior to the specified one in its parent's children list, or null if the specified element is the first one in the list.</p><pre><code>prevNode = elementNodeReference.previousElementSibling; \n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/NonDocumentTypeChildNode/previousElementSibling

Notifications API	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Notifications API allows web pages to control the display of system notifications to the end user — these are outside the top-level browsing context viewport, so therefore can be displayed even the user has switched tabs or moved to a different app. The API is designed to be compatible with existing notification systems across different platforms.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Notifications_API
Using the Notifications API	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Notifications API lets a web page or app send notifications that are displayed outside the page at the system level; this lets web apps send information to a user even if the application is idle or in the background. This article looks at the basics of using this API in your own apps.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Notifications_API/Using_the_Notifications_API

OES_texture_half_float	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The OES_texture_half_float extension is part of the WebGL API and adds texture formats with 16- (aka half float) and 32-bit floating-point components.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/OES_texture_half_float

OfflineAudioCompletionEvent	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Web Audio API OfflineAudioCompletionEvent interface represents events that occur when the processing of an OfflineAudioContext is terminated. The complete event implements this interface.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/OfflineAudioCompletionEvent
OfflineAudioContext	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The OfflineAudioContext interface is an AudioContext interface representing an audio-processing graph built from linked together AudioNode s. In contrast with a standard AudioContext, an OfflineAudioContext doesn't render the audio to the device hardware; instead, it generates it, as fast as it can, and outputs the result to an AudioBuffer.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/OfflineAudioContext
OfflineAudoContext.length	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The length property of the OfflineAudioContext interface returns an integer representing the size of the buffer in sample-frames.</p><pre><code>var length = OfflineAudioContext.length;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/OfflineAudioContext/length
OfflineAudioContext.oncomplete	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>In this simple example, we declare both an AudioContext and an OfflineAudioContext object. We use the AudioContext to load an audio track via XHR (AudioContext.decodeAudioData), then the OfflineAudioContext to render the audio into an AudioBufferSourceNode and play the track through. After the offline audio graph is set up, you need to render it to an AudioBuffer using OfflineAudioContext.startRendering.</p><pre><code>var offlineAudioCtx = new OfflineAudioContext();\nofflineAudioCtx.oncomplete = function() { ... }</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/OfflineAudioContext/oncomplete
OfflineAudioContext.resume()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The resume() method of the OfflineAudioContext interface resumes the progression of time in an audio context that has been suspended. The promise resolves immediately because the OfflineAudioContext does not require the audio hardware. If the context is not currently suspended or the rendering has not started, the promise is rejected with InvalidStateError.</p><pre><code>OfflineAudioContext.resume().then(function() { ... });</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/OfflineAudioContext/resume
OfflineAudioContext.startRendering()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The startRendering() method of the OfflineAudioContext Interface starts rendering the audio graph, taking into account the current connections and the current scheduled changes.</p><pre><code>offlineAudioCtx.startRendering();\nofflineAudioCtx.oncomplete = function(e) {\n  // e.renderedBuffer contains the output buffer\n}</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/OfflineAudioContext/startRendering
OfflineAudioContext.startRendering (promise)	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The promise-based startRendering() method of the OfflineAudioContext Interface starts rendering the audio graph, taking into account the current connections and the current scheduled changes.</p><pre><code>offlineAudioCtx.startRendering().then(function(renderedBuffer) {\n  // do something with the output buffer\n});</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/OfflineAudioContext/startRendering(promise)
suspend	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The suspend() method of the OfflineAudioContext interface schedules a suspension of the time progression in the audio context at the specified time and returns a promise. This is generally useful at the time of manipulating the audio graph synchronously on OfflineAudioContext.</p><pre><code>OfflineAudioContext.suspend(suspendTime).then(function() { ... });</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/OfflineAudioContext/suspend

OscillatorNode	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The OscillatorNode interface represents a periodic waveform, like a sine wave. It is an AudioNode audio-processing module that causes a given frequency of sine wave to be created — in effect, a constant tone.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/OscillatorNode
