OscillatorNode.onended	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The onended property of the OscillatorNode interface is used to set the event handler for the ended event, which fires when the tone has stopped playing.</p><pre><code>var oscillator = audioCtx.createOscillator();\noscillator.onended = function() { ... };</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/OscillatorNode/onended
OscillatorNode.setPeriodicWave()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The setPeriodicWave() method of the OscillatorNode interface is used to point to a PeriodicWave defining a periodic waveform that can be used to shape the oscillator's output, when type = "custom" is used.</p><pre><code>var oscillator = audioCtx.createOscillator();\noscillator.setPeriodicWave(wave);</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/OscillatorNode/setPeriodicWave
OscillatorNode.start()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The following example shows basic usage of an AudioContext to create an oscillator node. For an applied example, check out our Violent Theremin demo (see app.js for relevant code).</p><pre><code>oscillator.start(when); // start playing oscillator in when seconds</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/OscillatorNode/start
OscillatorNode.stop()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The following example shows basic usage of an AudioContext to create an oscillator node. For an applied example, check out our Violent Theremin demo (see app.js for relevant code).</p><pre><code>oscillator.stop(when); // stop playing oscillator at when</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/OscillatorNode/stop

The different available values are:</p><pre><code>var oscillator = audioCtx.createOscillator();\noscillator.type = 'square';</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/OscillatorNode/type

PaymentResponse	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The PaymentResponse interface of the the Payment Request API is returned after a user selects a payment method and approves a payment request.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/PaymentResponse
PaymentResponse.complete()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The PaymentRequest.complete() method of the PaymentRequest API notifies the user agent that the user interaction is over, and causes any remaining user interface to be closed. This method must be called after the user accepts the payment request and the Promise returned by the PaymentRequest.show() method is resolved.</p><pre><code>PaymentRequest.complete([result])\n&#160;  .then(function() { ... } )\n&#160;  .catch( error =&gt; { ... } )</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/PaymentResponse/complete

PaymentResponse.shippingOption	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The shippingOption read-only property of the PaymentRequest interface returns the ID attribute of the shipping option selected by the user. This option is only present when the requestShipping option is set to true in the PaymentOptions object passed to the PaymentRequest constructor.</p><pre><code>var shippingOption = PaymentRequest.shippingOption;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/PaymentResponse/shippingOption
Payment Request API	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Many problems related to online purchase abandonment can be traced to checkout forms, which are user-intensive, difficult to use, slow to load and refresh, and require multiple steps to complete. The Payment Request API is a system that is meant to eliminate checkout forms. It vastly improves user workflow during the purchase process, providing a more consistent user experience and enabling web merchants to easily leverage disparate payment methods.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Payment_Request_API
Performance	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Performance interface represents timing-related performance information for the given page.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Performance
Performance.clearMarks()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The clearMarks() method removes the named mark from the browser's performance entry buffer. If the method is called with no arguments, all performance entries with an entry type of " mark " will be removed from the performance entry buffer.</p><pre><code>performance.clearMarks();\nperformance.clearMarks(name);\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Performance/clearMarks
Performance.clearMeasures()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The clearMeasures() method removes the named measure from the browser's performance entry buffer. If the method is called with no arguments, all performance entries with an entry type of " measure " will be removed from the performance entry buffer.</p><pre><code>performance.clearMeasures();\nperformance.clearMeasures(name);\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Performance/clearMeasures
Performance.clearResourceTimings()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The clearResourceTimings() method removes all performance entries with an entryType of " resource " from the browser's performance data buffer and sets the size of the performance data buffer to zero. To set the size of the browser's performance data buffer, use the Performance.setResourceTimingBufferSize() method.</p><pre><code>performance.clearResourceTimings();\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Performance/clearResourceTimings
Performance.getEntries()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The getEntries() method returns a list of PerformanceEntry objects for a given filter. The list's members (entries) can be created by making performance marks or measures (for example by calling the mark() method) at explicit points in time.</p><pre><code>entries = window.performance.getEntries();\nentries = window.performance.getEntries(PerformanceEntryFilterOptions);\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Performance/getEntries
Performance.getEntriesByName()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The getEntriesByName() method returns a list of PerformanceEntry objects for the given name and type. The list's members (entries) can be created by making performance marks or measures (for example by calling the mark() method) at explicit points in time.</p><pre><code>entries = window.performance.getEntriesByName(name, type);\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Performance/getEntriesByName
Performance.getEntriesByType()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The getEntriesByType() method returns a list of PerformanceEntry objects for a given type. The list's members (entries) can be created by making performance marks or measures (for example by calling the mark() method) at explicit points in time.</p><pre><code>entries = window.performance.getEntriesByType(type);\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Performance/getEntriesByType
Performance.mark()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The mark() method creates a timestamp in the browser's performance entry buffer with the given name. The application defined timestamp can be retrieved by one of the Performance interface's getEntries*() methods (getEntries(), getEntriesByName() or getEntriesByType()).</p><pre><code>performance.mark(name);\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Performance/mark
Performance.measure()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The measure() method creates a named timestamp in the browser's performance entry buffer between two specified marks (known as the start mark and end mark, respectively). The named timestamp is referred to as a measure.</p><pre><code>performance.measure(name, startMark, endMark);\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Performance/measure
Performance.navigation	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Performance.navigation read-only property returns a PerformanceNavigation object representing the type of navigation that occurs in the given browsing context, like the amount of redirections needed to fetch the resource.</p><pre><code>navObject = performance.navigation;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Performance/navigation
Performance.now()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Performance.now() method returns a DOMHighResTimeStamp, measured in milliseconds, accurate to one thousandth of a millisecond.</p><pre><code>t = performance.now();</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Performance/now
Performance.onresourcetimingbufferfull	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The onresourcetimingbufferfull property is an event handler that will be called when the resourcetimingbufferfull event is fired. This event is fired when the browser's resource timing performance buffer is full.</p><pre><code>callback = performance.onresourcetimingbufferfull = buffer_full_cb;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Performance/onresourcetimingbufferfull
Performance.setResourceTimingBufferSize()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The setResourceTimingBufferSize() method sets the browser's resource timing buffer size to the specified number of " resource " performance entry type objects.</p><pre><code>performance.setResourceTimingBufferSize(maxSize);\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Performance/setResourceTimingBufferSize
Performance.timing	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Performance.timing read-only property returns a PerformanceTiming object containing latency-related performance information.</p><pre><code>timingInfo = performance.timing;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Performance/timing
Performance.toJSON()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The toJSON() method of the Performance interface is a standard serializer: it returns a JSON representation of the performance object's properties.</p><pre><code>myPerf = performance.toJSON()\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Performance/toJSON
PerformanceEntry	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The PerformanceEntry object encapsulates a single performance metric that is part of the performance timeline. A performance entry can be directly created by making a performance mark or measure (for example by calling the mark() method) at an explicit point in an application. Performance entries are also created in indirect ways such as loading a resource (such as an image).</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/PerformanceEntry
PerformanceEntry.duration	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The duration property returns a timestamp that is the duration of the performance entry.</p><pre><code>entry.duration;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/PerformanceEntry/duration
PerformanceEntry.entryType	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The entryType property returns the performance entry's type. The valid entryType values are:</p><pre><code>entry.entryType;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/PerformanceEntry/entryType
PerformanceEntry.name	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The name property returns the name given to a performance entry when the entry was created (for example by calling performance.mark()).</p><pre><code>entry.name;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/PerformanceEntry/name
PerformanceEntry.startTime	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The startTime property returns the first recorded timestamp of the performance entry.</p><pre><code>entry.startTime;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/PerformanceEntry/startTime
PerformanceEntry.toJSON()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The toJSON() method is a serializer ; it returns a JSON representation of the performance entry object.</p><pre><code>json = perfEntry.toJSON();\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/PerformanceEntry/toJSON
PerformanceFrameTiming	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The PerformanceFrameTiming interface provides frame timing data about the browser's event loop. A frame represents the amount of work a browser does in one event loop such as processing DOM events, resizing, scrolling, rendering, CSS animations, etc. A frame rate of 60fps (frames per second) for a 60Hz refresh rate is the target for a good responsive user experience. This means the browser should process a frame in about 16.7ms.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/PerformanceFrameTiming
PerformanceMark	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>PerformanceMark is an abstract interface for performance entries with an entry type of " mark ". Entries of this type are created by calling performance.mark() to add a named DOMHighResTimeStamp (the mark) to the browser's performance timeline.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/PerformanceMark
PerformanceMeasure	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>PerformanceMeasure is an abstract interface for performance entries with an entry type of " measure ". Entries of this type are created by calling performance.measure() to add a named DOMHighResTimeStamp (the measure) between two marks to the browser's performance timeline.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/PerformanceMeasure
PerformanceNavigation	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The PerformanceNavigation interface represents information about how the navigation to the current document was done.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/PerformanceNavigation
PerformanceNavigation.redirectCount	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The PerformanceNavigation.redirectCount read-only property returns an unsigned short representing the number of REDIRECTs done before reaching the page.</p><pre><code>amount = performanceNavigation.redirectCount;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/PerformanceNavigation/redirectCount
PerformanceNavigation.type	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The PerformanceNavigation.type read-only property returns an unsigned short containing a constant describing how the navigation to this page was done. Possible values are:</p><pre><code>type = performanceNavigation.type;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/PerformanceNavigation/type
PerformanceNavigationTiming	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The PerformanceNavigationTiming interface provides methods and properties to store and retrieve high resolution timestamps or metrics regarding the browser's document navigation events. For example, this interface can be used to determine how much time it takes to load or unload a document.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/PerformanceNavigationTiming
PerformanceNavigationTiming.domComplete	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The domComplete property returns a timestamp representing the time value equal to the time immediately before the user agent sets the current document readiness of the current document to complete.</p><pre><code>perfEntry.domComplete;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/PerformanceNavigationTiming/domComplete
PerformanceNavigationTiming.domContentLoadedEventEnd	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The domContentLoadedEventEnd property returns a timestamp representing the time value equal to the time immediately after the current document's DOMContentLoaded event completes.</p><pre><code>perfEntry.domContentLoadedEventEnd;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/PerformanceNavigationTiming/domContentLoadedEventEnd
PerformanceNavigationTiming.domContentLoadedEventStart	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The domContentLoadedEventStart property returns a timestamp representing the time value equal to the time immediately before the user agent fires the DOMContentLoaded event at the current document.</p><pre><code>perfEntry.domContentLoadedEventStart;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/PerformanceNavigationTiming/domContentLoadedEventStart
PerformanceNavigationTiming.domInteractive	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The domInteractive property returns a timestamp representing the time value equal to the time immediately before the user agent sets the current document readiness of the current document to interactive.</p><pre><code>perfEntry.domInteractive;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/PerformanceNavigationTiming/domInteractive
PerformanceNavigationTiming.loadEventEnd	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The loadEventEnd property returns a timestamp which is equal to the time when the load event of the current document is completed.</p><pre><code>perfEntry.loadEventEnd;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/PerformanceNavigationTiming/loadEventEnd
PerformanceNavigationTiming.loadEventStart	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The loadEventStart property returns a timestamp representing the time value equal to the time immediately before the load event of the current document is fired.</p><pre><code>perfEntry.loadEventStart;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/PerformanceNavigationTiming/loadEventStart
PerformanceNavigationTiming.redirectCount	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The redirectCount property returns a timestamp representing the number of redirects since the last non-redirect navigation under the current browsing context.</p><pre><code>perfEntry.redirectCount;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/PerformanceNavigationTiming/redirectCount
PerformanceNavigationTiming.toJSON()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The toJSON() method is a serializer - it returns a JSON representation of the PerformanceNavigationTiming object.</p><pre><code>json = resourcePerfEntry.toJSON();\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/PerformanceNavigationTiming/toJSON
PerformanceNavigationTiming.type	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The type property returns a string representing the type of navigation. The value must be one of the following:</p><pre><code>perfEntry.type;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/PerformanceNavigationTiming/type
PerformanceNavigationTiming.unloadEventEnd	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The unloadEventEnd property returns a timestamp representing the time value equal to the time immediately after the user agent finishes the unload event of the previous document. If there is no previous document, this property value is 0.</p><pre><code>perfEntry.unloadEventEnd;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/PerformanceNavigationTiming/unloadEventEnd

PerformanceObserver	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The PerformanceObserver interface is used to observe performance measurement events and be notified of new performance entries as they are recorded in the browser's performance timeline.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/PerformanceObserver
PeformanceObserver.disconnect()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The disconnect() method of the PerformanceObserver interface is used to stop the performance observer from receiving any performance entry events.</p><pre><code>observer.disconnect();\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/PerformanceObserver/disconnect
PerformanceObserver.observe()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The observe() method of the PerformanceObserver interface is used to specify the set of performance interface types to observe. The performance observer's callback function will be invoked when a performance entry is recorded for one of the specified types.</p><pre><code>observer.observe(options);\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/PerformanceObserver/observe
PerformanceObserver()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The PerformanceObserver() constructor creates a new PerformanceObserver object with the given observer callback. The observer callback is invoked when performance entry events are recorded for the entry types that have been registered, via the observe() method.</p><pre><code>var observer = new PerformanceObserver(callback);\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/PerformanceObserver/PerformanceObserver
PerformanceObserverEntryList	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The PerformanceObserverEntryList interface is a list of peformance events that were explicitly observed via the observe() method.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/PerformanceObserverEntryList
PerformanceObserverEntryList.getEntries()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The getEntries() method of the PerformanceObserverEntryList interface returns a list of explicitly observed performance entry objects for a given filter. The list's members are determined by the set of entry types specified in the call to the observe() method. The list is available in the observer's callback function (as the first parameter in the callback).</p><pre><code>entries = list.getEntries();\nentries = list.getEntries(PerformanceEntryFilterOptions);\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/PerformanceObserverEntryList/getEntries
PerformanceObserverEntryList.getEntriesByName()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The getEntriesByName() method of the PerformanceObserverEntryList interface returns a list of explicitly observed performance entry objects for a given name and entry type. The list's members are determined by the set of entry types specified in the call to the observe() method. The list is available in the observer's callback function (as the first parameter in the callback).</p><pre><code>entries = list.getEntriesByName(name, type);\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/PerformanceObserverEntryList/getEntriesByName
PerformanceObserverEntryList.getEntriesByType()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The getEntriesByType() method of the PerformanceObserverEntryList returns a list of explicitly observed performance entry objects for a given performance entry type. The list's members are determined by the set of entry types specified in the call to the observe() method. The list is available in the observer's callback function (as the first parameter in the callback).</p><pre><code>entries = list.getEntriesByType(type);\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/PerformanceObserverEntryList/getEntriesByType
PerformanceResourceTiming	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The PerformanceResourceTiming interface enables retrieving and analyzing detailed network timing data regarding the loading of an application's resources. An application can use the timing metrics to determine, for example, the length of time it takes to fetch a specific resource, such as an XMLHttpRequest, SVG, image, or script.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/PerformanceResourceTiming
PerformanceResourceTiming.connectEnd	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The connectEnd property returns the timestamp immediately after the browser finishes establishing the connection to the server to retrieve the resource. The timestamp value includes the time interval to establish the transport connection, as well as other time intervals such as SSL handshake and SOCKS authentication.</p><pre><code>resource.connectEnd;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/PerformanceResourceTiming/connectEnd
PerformanceResourceTiming.connectStart	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The connectStart property returns the timestamp immediately before the user agent starts establishing the connection to the server to retrieve the resource.</p><pre><code>resource.connectStart;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/PerformanceResourceTiming/connectStart
PerformanceResourceTiming.decodedBodySize	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The decodedBodySize property returns the size (in octets) received from the fetch (HTTP or cache) of the message body, after removing any applied content-codings. If the resource is retrieved from an application cache or local resources, it returns the size of the payload after removing any applied content-codings.</p><pre><code>resource.decodedBodySize;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/PerformanceResourceTiming/decodedBodySize
PerformanceResourceTiming.domainLookupEnd	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The domainLookupEnd property returns the timestamp immediately after the browser finishes the domain name lookup for the resource.</p><pre><code>resource.domainLookupEnd;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/PerformanceResourceTiming/domainLookupEnd
PerformanceResourceTiming.domainLookupStart	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The domainLookupStart property returns the timestamp immediately before the browser starts the domain name lookup for the resource.</p><pre><code>resource.domainLookupStart;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/PerformanceResourceTiming/domainLookupStart
PerformanceResourceTiming.encodedBodySize	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The encodedBodySize property represents the size (in octets) received from the fetch (HTTP or cache), of the payload body, before removing any applied content-codings.</p><pre><code>resource.encodedBodySize;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/PerformanceResourceTiming/encodedBodySize
PerformanceResourceTiming.fetchStart	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The fetchStart property represents a timestamp immediately before the browser starts to fetch the resource.</p><pre><code>resource.fetchStart;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/PerformanceResourceTiming/fetchStart
PerformanceResourceTiming.initiatorType	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The initiatorType property is a string that represents the type of resource that initiated the performance event. The value of this string is as follows:</p><pre><code>resource.initiatorType;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/PerformanceResourceTiming/initiatorType
PerformanceResourceTiming.nextHopProtocol	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The nextHopProtocol property is a string representing the network protocol used to fetch the resource, as identified by the ALPN Protocol ID (RFC7301).</p><pre><code>resource.nextHopProtocol;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/PerformanceResourceTiming/nextHopProtocol
PerformanceResourceTiming.redirectEnd	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The redirectEnd property returns a timestamp immediately after receiving the last byte of the response of the last redirect.</p><pre><code>resource.redirectEnd;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/PerformanceResourceTiming/redirectEnd
PerformanceResourceTiming.redirectStart	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The redirectStart property returns a timestamp representing the start time of the fetch which that initiates the redirect.</p><pre><code>resource.redirectStart;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/PerformanceResourceTiming/redirectStart
PerformanceResourceTiming.requestStart	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The requestStart property returns a timestamp of the time immediately before the browser starts requesting the resource from the server, cache, or local resource. If the transport connection fails and the browser retires the request, the value returned will be the start of the retry request.</p><pre><code>resource.requestStart;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/PerformanceResourceTiming/requestStart
PerformanceResourceTiming.responseEnd	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The responseEnd property returns a timestamp immediately after the browser receives the last byte of the resource or immediately before the transport connection is closed, whichever comes first.</p><pre><code>resource.responseEnd;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/PerformanceResourceTiming/responseEnd
PerformanceResourceTiming.responseStart	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The responseStart property returns a timestamp immediately after the browser receives the first byte of the response from the server, cache, or local resource.</p><pre><code>resource.responseStart;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/PerformanceResourceTiming/responseStart
PerformanceResourceTiming.secureConnectionStart	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The secureConnectionStart property returns a timestamp immediately before the browser starts the handshake process to secure the current connection. If a secure connection is not used, the property returns zero.</p><pre><code>resource.secureConnectionStart;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/PerformanceResourceTiming/secureConnectionStart
PerformanceResourceTiming.toJSON()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The toJSON() method is a serializer that returns a JSON representation of the PerformanceResourceTiming object.</p><pre><code>json = resourcePerfEntry.toJSON();\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/PerformanceResourceTiming/toJSON
PerformanceResourceTiming.transferSize	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The transferSize property represents the size (in octets) of the fetched resource. The size includes the response header fields plus the response payload body (as defined by RFC7230.</p><pre><code>resource.transferSize;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/PerformanceResourceTiming/transferSize
PerformanceResourceTiming.workerStart	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>If the current context is a worker, the workerStart property returns a timestamp immediately before the worker that fetches the resource is started. If the context is not a worker (i.e. a browser context), this property returns zero.</p><pre><code>resource.workerStart;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/PerformanceResourceTiming/workerStart
PerformanceTiming	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The PerformanceTiming interface represents timing-related performance information for the given page.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/PerformanceTiming
PerformanceTiming.connectEnd	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The PerformanceTiming.connectEnd read-only property returns an unsigned long long representing the moment, in miliseconds since the UNIX epoch, where the connection is opened network. If the transport layer reports an error and the connection establishment is started again, the last connection establisment end time is given. If a persistent connection is used, the value will be the same as PerformanceTiming.fetchStart. A connection is considered as opened when all secure connection handshake, or SOCKS authentication, is terminated.</p><pre><code>time = performanceTiming.connectEnd;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/PerformanceTiming/connectEnd
PerformanceTiming.connectStart	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The PerformanceTiming.connectStart read-only property returns an unsigned long long representing the moment, in miliseconds since the UNIX epoch, where the request to open a connection is sent to the network. If the transport layer reports an error and the connection establishment is started again, the last connection establisment start time is given. If a persistent connection is used, the value will be the same as PerformanceTiming.fetchStart.</p><pre><code>time = performanceTiming.connectStart;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/PerformanceTiming/connectStart
PerformanceTiming.domainLookupEnd	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The PerformanceTiming.domainLookupEnd read-only property returns an unsigned long long representing the moment, in miliseconds since the UNIX epoch, where the domain lookup is finished. If a persistent connection is used, or the information is stored in a cache or a local resource, the value will be the same as PerformanceTiming.fetchStart.</p><pre><code>time = performanceTiming.domainLookupEnd;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/PerformanceTiming/domainLookupEnd
PerformanceTiming.domainLookupStart	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The PerformanceTiming.domainLookupStart read-only property returns an unsigned long long representing the moment, in miliseconds since the UNIX epoch, where the domain lookup starts. If a persistent connection is used, or the information is stored in a cache or a local resource, the value will be the same as PerformanceTiming.fetchStart.</p><pre><code>time = performanceTiming.domainLookupStart;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/PerformanceTiming/domainLookupStart
PerformanceTiming.domComplete	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The PerformanceTiming.domComplete read-only property returns an unsigned long long representing the moment, in miliseconds since the UNIX epoch, when the parser finished its work on the main document, that is when its Document.readyState changes to 'complete' and the corresponding readystatechange event is thrown.</p><pre><code>time = performanceTiming.domComplete;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/PerformanceTiming/domComplete
PerformanceTiming.domContentLoadedEventEnd	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The PerformanceTiming.domContentLoadedEventEnd read-only property returns an unsigned long long representing the moment, in miliseconds since the UNIX epoch, right after all the scripts that need to be executed as soon as possible, in order or not, has been executed.</p><pre><code>time = performanceTiming.domContentLoadedEventEnd;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/PerformanceTiming/domContentLoadedEventEnd
PerformanceTiming.domContentLoadedEventStart	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The PerformanceTiming.domContentLoadedEventStart read-only property returns an unsigned long long representing the moment, in miliseconds since the UNIX epoch, right before the parser sent the DOMContentLoaded event, that is right after all the scripts that need to be executed right after parsing has been executed.</p><pre><code>time = performanceTiming.domContentLoadedEventStart;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/PerformanceTiming/domContentLoadedEventStart
PerformanceTiming.domInteractive	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The PerformanceTiming.domInteractive read-only property returns an unsigned long long representing the moment, in miliseconds since the UNIX epoch, when the parser finished its work on the main document, that is when its Document.readyState changes to 'interactive' and the corresponding readystatechange event is thrown.</p><pre><code>time = performanceTiming.domInteractive;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/PerformanceTiming/domInteractive
PerformanceTiming.domLoading	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The PerformanceTiming.domLoading read-only property returns an unsigned long long representing the moment, in miliseconds since the UNIX epoch, when the parser started its work, that is when its Document.readyState changes to 'loading' and the corresponding readystatechange event is thrown.</p><pre><code>time = performanceTiming.domLoading;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/PerformanceTiming/domLoading
PerformanceTiming.fetchStart	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The PerformanceTiming.fetchStart read-only property returns an unsigned long long representing the moment, in miliseconds since the UNIX epoch, the browser is ready to fetch the document using an HTTP request. This moment is before the check to any application cache.</p><pre><code>time = performanceTiming.fetchStart;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/PerformanceTiming/fetchStart
PerformanceTiming.loadEventEnd	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The PerformanceTiming.loadEventEnd read-only property returns an unsigned long long representing the moment, in miliseconds since the UNIX epoch, when the load event handler terminated, that is when the load event is completed. If this event has not yet been sent, or is not yet completed, it returns 0.</p><pre><code>time = performanceTiming.loadEventEnd;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/PerformanceTiming/loadEventEnd
PerformanceTiming.loadEventStart	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The PerformanceTiming.loadEventStart read-only property returns an unsigned long long representing the moment, in miliseconds since the UNIX epoch, when the load event was sent for the current document. If this event has not yet been sent, it returns 0.</p><pre><code>time = performanceTiming.loadEventStart;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/PerformanceTiming/loadEventStart
PerformanceTiming.navigationStart	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The PerformanceTiming.navigationStart read-only property returns an unsigned long long representing the moment, in miliseconds since the UNIX epoch, right after the prompt for unload terminates on the previous document in the same browsing context. If there is no previous document, this value will be the same as PerformanceTiming.fetchStart.</p><pre><code>time = performanceTiming.navigationStart;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/PerformanceTiming/navigationStart
PerformanceTiming.redirectEnd	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The PerformanceTiming.redirectEnd read-only property returns an unsigned long long representing the moment, in miliseconds since the UNIX epoch, the last HTTP redirect is completed, that is when the last byte of the HTTP response has been received. If there is no redirect, or if one of the redirect is not of the same origin, the value returned is 0.</p><pre><code>time = performanceTiming.redirectEnd;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/PerformanceTiming/redirectEnd
PerformanceTiming.redirectStart	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The PerformanceTiming.redirectStart read-only property returns an unsigned long long representing the moment, in miliseconds since the UNIX epoch, the first HTTP redirect starts. If there is no redirect, or if one of the redirect is not of the same origin, the value returned is 0.</p><pre><code>time = performanceTiming.redirectStart;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/PerformanceTiming/redirectStart
PerformanceTiming.requestStart	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The PerformanceTiming.requestStart read-only property returns an unsigned long long representing the moment, in miliseconds since the UNIX epoch, when the browser sent the request to obtain the actual document, from the server or from a cache. If the transport layer fails after the start of the request and the connection is reopened, this property will be set to the time corresponding to the new request.</p><pre><code>time = performanceTiming.requestStart;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/PerformanceTiming/requestStart
PerformanceTiming.responseEnd	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The PerformanceTiming.responseEnd read-only property returns an unsigned long long representing the moment, in miliseconds since the UNIX epoch, when the browser received the last byte of the response, or when the connection is closed if this happened first, from the server from a cache, of from a local resource.</p><pre><code>time = performanceTiming.responseEnd;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/PerformanceTiming/responseEnd
PerformanceTiming.responseStart	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The PerformanceTiming.responseStart read-only property returns an unsigned long long representing the moment in time (in milliseconds since the UNIX epoch) when the browser received the first byte of the response from the server, cache, or local resource.</p><pre><code>time = performanceTiming.responseStart;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/PerformanceTiming/responseStart
PerformanceTiming.secureConnectionStart	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The PerformanceTiming.secureConnectionStart read-only property returns an unsigned long long representing the moment, in miliseconds since the UNIX epoch, where the secure connection handshake starts. If no such connection is requested, it returns 0.</p><pre><code>time = performanceTiming.secureConnectionStart;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/PerformanceTiming/secureConnectionStart
PerformanceTiming.unloadEventEnd	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The PerformanceTiming.unloadEventEnd read-only property returns an unsigned long long representing the moment, in miliseconds since the UNIX epoch, the unload event handler finishes. If there is no previous document, or if the previous document, or one of the needed redirects, is not of the same origin, the value returned is 0.</p><pre><code>time = performanceTiming.unloadEventEnd;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/PerformanceTiming/unloadEventEnd
PerformanceTiming.unloadEventStart	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The PerformanceTiming.unloadEventStart read-only property returns an unsigned long long representing the moment, in miliseconds since the UNIX epoch, the unload event has been thrown. If there is no previous document, or if the previous document, or one of the needed redirects, is not of the same origin, the value returned is 0.</p><pre><code>time = performanceTiming.unloadEventStart;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/PerformanceTiming/unloadEventStart
Performance API	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The High Resolution Time standard defines a Performance interface that supports client-side latency measurements within applications. The Performance interfaces are considered high resolution because they are accurate to a thousandth of a millisecond (subject to hardware or software constraints). The interfaces support a number of use cases including calculating frame-rates (potentially important in animations) and benchmarking (such as the time to load a resource).</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Performance_API
Using the Performance API	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>A fundamental requirement of web performance is a precise and consistent definition of time. The DOMHighResTimeStamp type (a double) is used by all performance interfaces to hold such time values. Additionally, there must be a way to create a timestamp for a specific point in time; this is done with the now() method.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Performance_API/Using_the_Performance_API
Performance Timeline	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Performance Timeline API defines extensions to the Performance interface to support client-side latency measurements within applications. The extensions provide interfaces to retrieve performance entry metrics based on specific filter criteria. The standard also includes interfaces that allow an application to define performance observer callbacks that are notified when specific performance events are added to the browser's performance timeline.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Performance_Timeline
Using Performance Timeline	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Performance Timeline standard defines extensions to the Performance interface to support client-side latency measurements within applications. The standard also includes interfaces that allow an application to be notified when specific performance events occur. Together, these interfaces can be used to help identify an application's performance bottlenecks.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Performance_Timeline/Using_Performance_Timeline
PeriodicSyncEvent	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The parameter passed into the sync handler, the PeriodicSyncEvent interface represents a periodic sync action that is dispatched on the ServiceWorkerGlobalScope of a ServiceWorker.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/PeriodicSyncEvent
PeriodicSyncManager	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The PeriodicSyncManager interface of the the ServiceWorker API provides an interface for registering and retrieving PeriodicSyncRegistration objects.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/PeriodicSyncManager
PeriodicSyncRegistration	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The PeriodicSyncRegistration interface of the ServiceWorker API provides an object for managing periodic background synchronization.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/PeriodicSyncRegistration
PeriodicWave	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>PeriodicWave has no inputs or outputs; it is used to create custom oscillators via OscillatorNode.setPeriodicWave. The PeriodicWave itself is created/returned by AudioContext.createPeriodicWave.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/PeriodicWave
Permissions	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Permissions interface of the Permissions API provides the core Permission API functionality, such as methods for querying and revoking permissions</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Permissions
Permissions.query()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Permissions.query() method of the Permissions interface returns the status of a user permission on the global scope.</p><pre><code>navigator.permissions.query(PermissionDescriptor).then(function(permissionStatus) { ... })</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Permissions/query
Permissions.revoke()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Permissions.revoke() method of the Permissions interface reverts a currently set permission back to its default state, which is usually prompt.</p><pre><code>navigator.permissions.revoke(PermissionDescriptor).then(function(permissionStatus) { ... })</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Permissions/revoke
PermissionStatus	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The PermissionStatus interface of the Permissions API provides the state of an object and an event handler for monitoring changes to said state.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/PermissionStatus
PermissionStatus.onchange	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The PermissionStatus.onchange event of the PermissionStatus interface is called whenever the PermissionStatus.state property changes.</p><pre><code>PermissionStatus.onchange = function() { ... }\nPermissionStatus.addEventListener('change', function() { ... })</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/PermissionStatus/onchange
PermissionStatus.state	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The PermissionStatus.state read-only property of the PermissionStatus interface returns the state of a requested permission. This property returns one of 'granted', 'denied', or 'prompt'.</p><pre><code>var permission = PermissionStatus.state</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/PermissionStatus/state
PermissionStatus.status	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The PermissionStatus.status read-only property of the PermissionStatus interface returns the status of a requested permission. This property returns one of 'granted', 'denied', or 'prompt'.</p><pre><code>var permission = PermissionStatus.status</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/PermissionStatus/status
Permissions API	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Historically different APIs handle their own permissions inconsistently — for example the Notifications API allows for explicit checking of permission status and requesting permission, whereas the Geolocation API doesn't (which causes problems if the user denied the initial permission request). The Permissions API provides the tools to allow developers to implement a better user experience as far as permissions are concerned.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Permissions_API
Using the Permissions API	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>This article provides a basic guide to using the W3C Permissions API, which provides a programmatic way to query the status of API permissions attributed to the current context.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Permissions_API/Using_the_Permissions_API
Plugin	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Plugin interface provides information about a browser plugin.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Plugin
PluginArray	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The PluginArray interface is used to store a list of available plugins; it's returned by the window.navigator.plugins property.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/PluginArray
Point	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Point represents a 2D point.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Point
PointerEvent	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>A pointer is a hardware agnostic representation of input devices (such as a mouse, pen or contact point on a touch-enable surface). The pointer can target a specific coordinate (or set of coordinates) on the contact surface such as a screen.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/PointerEvent
PointerEvent.height	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The height of the pointer's contact geometry, along the Y axis (in CSS pixels). Depending on the source of the pointer device (for example a finger), for a given pointer, each event may produce a different value.</p><pre><code>var contactHeight = pointerEvent.height;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/PointerEvent/height
PointerEvent.isPrimary	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The property indicates whether or not the pointer device that created the event is the primary pointer. Returns true if the pointer that caused the event to be fired is the primary device and returns false otherwise.</p><pre><code>var isPrime = pointerEvent.isPrimary;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/PointerEvent/isPrimary
PointerEvent()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The PointerEvent() constructor creates a new synthetic and untrusted PointerEvent.</p><pre><code> event = new PointerEvent(type, PointerEventInit);</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/PointerEvent/PointerEvent
PointerEvent.pointerId	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>An identifier assigned to a pointer event that is unique from the identifiers of all active pointer events at the time. Authors cannot assume values convey any particular meaning other than an identifier for the pointer that is unique from all other active pointers.</p><pre><code>var id = pointerEvent.pointerId;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/PointerEvent/pointerId
PointerEvent.pointerType	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Indicates the device type that caused the pointer event. The supported values are the following strings:</p><pre><code>var pType = pointerEvent.pointerType;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/PointerEvent/pointerType
PointerEvent.pressure	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The normalized pressure of the pointer input in the range of 0 to 1, where 0 and 1 represent the minimum and maximum pressure the hardware is capable of detecting, respectively. For hardware that does not support pressure, including but not limited to mouse, the value MUST be 0.5 when the pointer is active and 0 otherwise.</p><pre><code>var pressure = pointerEvent.pressure;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/PointerEvent/pressure
PointerEvent.tiltX	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>This property is the angle (in degrees) between the Y-Z plane of the pointer and the screen. This property is typically only useful for a pen/stylus pointer type. The range of values is -90 to 90 degrees and a positive value means a tilt to the right. For devices that do not support this property, the value is 0.</p><pre><code>var tilt = pointerEvent.tiltX;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/PointerEvent/tiltX
PointerEvent.tiltY	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>This property is the angle (in degrees) between the X-Z plane of the pointer and the screen. This property is typically only useful for a pen/stylus pointer type. The range of values is -90 to 90 degrees and a positive value is a tilt toward the user. For devices that do not support this property, the value is 0.</p><pre><code>var tilt = pointerEvent.tiltY;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/PointerEvent/tiltY
PointerEvent.width	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The width of the pointer's contact geometry&#160;along the x-axis, measured in CSS pixels. Depending on the source of the pointer device (such as a finger), for a given pointer, each event may produce a different value.</p><pre><code>var contactWidth = pointerEvent.width;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/PointerEvent/width
Pointer events	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Most of today's web content assumes the user's pointing device will be a mouse. However, since many devices support other types of pointing input devices, such as pen/stylus and touch surfaces, extensions to the existing pointing device event models are needed and pointer events address that need.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Pointer_events
Multi-touch interaction	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Pointer events extend DOM input events to support various pointing input devices such as pen/stylus and touch screens as well as mouse. The pointer is a hardware-agnostic device that can target a specific set of screen coordinates. Having a single event model for pointers can simplify creating Web sites, applications and provide a good user experience regardless of the user's hardware.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Pointer_events/Multi-touch_interaction
Pinch zoom gestures	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Adding gestures to an application can significantly improve the user experience. There are many types of gestures, from the simple single-touch swipe gesture to the more complex multi-touch twist gesture, where the touch points (aka pointers) move in different directions.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Pointer_events/Pinch_zoom_gestures
Using Pointer Events	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>This document demonstrates how to use pointer events and canvas to build a multi-touch enabled drawing application. This example is identical to the application described in the Touch events Overview except this example uses the pointer events input event model (instead of touch events. Another difference is that because pointer events are pointer device agnostic, the application accepts both touch input, pen and mouse input, the latter two for free.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Pointer_events/Using_Pointer_Events
Pointer Lock API	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Pointer Lock API (formerly called Mouse Lock API) provides input methods based on the movement of the mouse over time (i.e., deltas), not just the absolute position of the mouse cursor in the viewport. It gives you access to raw mouse movement, locks the target of mouse events to a single element, eliminates limits on how far mouse movement can go in a single direction, and removes the cursor from view.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Pointer_Lock_API
PopStateEvent	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>An event handler for the popstate event on the window.</p><pre><code>window.onpopstate = funcRef;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/PopStateEvent
Position	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Position interface represents the position of the concerned device at a given time. The position, represented by a Coordinates object, comprehends the 2D position of the device, on a spheroid representing the Earth, but also its altitude and its speed.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Position
Position.coords	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Position.coords read-only property, a Coordinates object, represents a geographic attitude: it contains the location, that is longitude and latitude on the Earth, the altitude, and the speed of the object concerned, regrouped inside the returned value. It also contains accuracy information about these values.</p><pre><code>coord = position.coords\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Position/coords
Position.timestamp	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Position.timestamp read-only property, a DOMTimeStamp object, represents the date and the time of the creation of the Position object it belongs to. The precision is to the millisecond.</p><pre><code>coord = position.timestamp\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Position/timestamp
PositionError	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The PositionError interface represents the reason of an error occurring when using the geolocating device.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/PositionError
PositionError.code	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The PositionError.code read-only property is an unsigned short representing the error code. The following values are possible:</p><pre><code>typeErr = poserr.code\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/PositionError/code
positionerror code	R	PositionError.code										
PositionError.message	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The PositionError.message read-only property returns a human-readable DOMString describing the details of the error.</p><pre><code>msg = positionError.message\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/PositionError/message
positionerror message	R	PositionError.message										
PositionOptions	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The PositionOptions interface describes an object containing option properties to pass as a parameter of Geolocation.getCurrentPosition() and Geolocation.watchPosition().</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/PositionOptions
PositionOptions.enableHighAccuracy	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The PositionOptions.enableHighAccuracy property is a Boolean that indicates the application would like to receive the best possible results. If true and if the device is able to provide a more accurate position, it will do so. Note that this can result in slower response times or increased power consumption (with a GPS chip on a mobile device for example). On the other hand, if false (the default value), the device can take the liberty to save resources by responding more quickly and/or using less power.</p><pre><code>positionOptions.enableHighAccuracy = booleanValue\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/PositionOptions/enableHighAccuracy
PositionOptions.maximumAge	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The PositionOptions.maximumAge property is a positive long value indicating the maximum age in milliseconds of a possible cached position that is acceptable to return. If set to 0, it means that the device cannot use a cached position and must attempt to retrieve the real current position. If set to Infinity the device must return a cached position regardless of its age.</p><pre><code>positionOptions.maximumAge = timeLength\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/PositionOptions/maximumAge
PositionOptions.timeout	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The PositionOptions.timeout property is a positive long value representing the maximum length of time (in milliseconds) the device is allowed to take in order to return a position. The default value is Infinity, meaning that getCurrentPosition() won't return until the position is available.</p><pre><code>positionOptions.timeout = timeLength\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/PositionOptions/timeout
Presentation	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Presentation can be defined as two possible user agents in the context: Controlling user agent and Receiving user agent.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Presentation
Presentation.defaultRequest	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>In a controlling user agent, the defaultRequest attribute MUST return the default presentation request if any, null otherwise. In a receiving browsing context, it MUST return null.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Presentation/defaultRequest
Presentation.receiver	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>In a receiving user agent, the receiver attribute MUST return the PresentationReceiver instance associated with the receiving browsing context and created by the receiving user agent when the receiving browsing context is created. In any other browsing context, it MUST return null.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Presentation/receiver
PresentationAvailability	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>A PresentationAvailability object is associated with available presentation displays and represents the presentation display availability for a presentation request. If the controlling user agent can monitor the list of available presentation displays in the background (without a pending request to start ()), the PresentationAvailability object MUST be implemented in a controlling browsing context.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/PresentationAvailability
onchange	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The onchange attribute is an event handler whose corresponding event handler event type is change.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/PresentationAvailability/onchange
value	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The value attribute MUST return the last value it was set to. The value is updated by the monitor the list of available presentation displays algorithm.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/PresentationAvailability/value
PresentationConnection	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The PresentationConnection interface of the Presentation API provides methods and properties for managing a single presentation. Each presentation connection is represented by a PresentationConnection object. Both the controlling user agent and receiving user agent MUST implement PresentationConnection.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/PresentationConnection
binaryType	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>When a PresentationConnection object is created, its binaryType IDL attribute MUST be set to the string " arraybuffer ". On getting, it MUST return the last value it was set to. On setting, the user agent MUST set the IDL attribute to the new value.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/PresentationConnection/binaryType
close	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>When the close () method is called on a PresentationConnection S, the user agent MUST start closing the presentation connection S with closed as closeReason and an empty message as closeMessage.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/PresentationConnection/close
id	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The id attribute specifies the presentation connection 's presentation identifier.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/PresentationConnection/id
send	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The PresentationConnection.send() method of the PresentationConnection interface sends either binary or text data between a controlling browsing context and a presenting browsing context.</p><pre><code>PresentationConnection.send(data);</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/PresentationConnection/send
state	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The state attribute represents the presentation connection 's current state. It can take one of the values of PresentationConnectionState depending on the connection state:</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/PresentationConnection/state
terminate	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>When the terminate () method is called on a PresentationConnection S in a controlling browsing context, the user agent MUST run the algorithm to terminate a presentation in a controlling browsing context using S.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/PresentationConnection/terminate
PresentationConnectionAvailableEvent	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The PresentationConnectionAvailableEvent interface of the Presentation API is fired on a PresentationRequest when a connection associated with the object is created.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/PresentationConnectionAvailableEvent
connection	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>A receiving user agent fires a trusted event named connectionavailable on a PresentationReceiver when an incoming connection is created. It is fired at the presentation controllers monitor, using the PresentationConnectionAvailableEvent interface, with the connection attribute set to the PresentationConnection object that was created. The event is fired for all connections that are created when monitoring incoming presentation connections.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/PresentationConnectionAvailableEvent/connection
PresentationConnectionAvailableEvent	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The PresentationConnectionAvailableInit() constructor creates a new PresentationConnectionAvailableEvent.</p><pre><code>var pcaEvent = new PresentationConnectionAvailableInit(typeArg, eventInit)</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/PresentationConnectionAvailableEvent/PresentationConnectionAvailableEvent
PresentationConnectionClosedEvent	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>A PresentationConnectionClosedEvent is fired when a presentation connection enters a closed state. The reason attribute provides the reason why the connection was closed.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/PresentationConnectionClosedEvent
PresentationConnectionCloseEvent	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The PresentationConnectionCloseEvent interface of the Presentation API is fired on a PresentationConnection when it is closed.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/PresentationConnectionCloseEvent
PresentationConnectionList	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>PresentationConnectionList is the collection of incoming presentation connections.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/PresentationConnectionList
PresentationReceiver	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The PresentationReceiver interface allows a receiving browsing context to access the controlling browsing contexts and communicate with them. The PresentationReceiver interface MUST be implemented in a receiving browsing context provided by a receiving user agent.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/PresentationReceiver
PresentationRequest	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>A PresentationRequest object is used to initiate or reconnect to a presentation made by a controlling browsing context. The PresentationRequest object MUST be implemented in a controlling browsing context provided by a controlling user agent.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/PresentationRequest
getAvailability	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>When the getAvailability () method is called, the user agent MUST run the following steps:</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/PresentationRequest/getAvailability
onconnectionavailable	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The following are the event handlers (and their corresponding event handler event types) that must be supported, as event handler IDL attributes, by objects implementing the PresentationRequest interface:</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/PresentationRequest/onconnectionavailable
reconnect	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>When the reconnect (presentationId) method is called on a PresentationRequest presentationRequest, the user agent MUST run the following steps to reconnect to a presentation :</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/PresentationRequest/reconnect
start	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>When the start method is called, the user agent MUST run the following steps to start a presentation :</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/PresentationRequest/start
Presentation API	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Presentation API is developed to effectively display web content through large scale presentation devices such as projectors and connected TVs. The relevant multimedia devices include wired displays, such as HDMI, DVI, or similar, and wireless technologies like Miracast, Chromecast, DLNA, or AirPlay.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Presentation_API
ProcessingInstruction	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>A processing instruction provides an opportunity for application-specific instructions to be embedded within XML and which can be ignored by XML processors which do not support processing their instructions (outside of their having a place in the DOM).</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/ProcessingInstruction
ProgressEvent	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The ProgressEvent interface represents events measuring progress of an underlying process, like an HTTP request (for an XMLHttpRequest, or the loading of the underlying resource of an img, audio, video, style or link).</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/ProgressEvent
ProgressEvent.initProgressEvent()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The ProgressEvent.initProgressEvent() method Initializes an animation event created using the deprecated Document.createEvent("ProgressEvent") method.</p><pre><code>Progress.initProgressEvent(typeArg, canBubbleArg, cancelableArg, lengthComputable, loaded, total);\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/ProgressEvent/initProgressEvent
ProgressEvent.lengthComputable	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The ProgressEvent.lengthComputable read-only property is a Boolean flag indicating if the resource concerned by the ProgressEvent has a length that can be calculated. If not, the ProgressEvent.total property has no significant value.</p><pre><code>flag = ProgressEvent.lengthComputable</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/ProgressEvent/lengthComputable
ProgressEvent.loaded	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The ProgressEvent.loaded read-only property is an unsigned long long representing the amount of work already performed by the underlying process. The ratio of work done can be calculated with the property and ProgressEvent.total. When downloading a resource using HTTP, this only represent the part of the content itself, not headers and other overhead.</p><pre><code>value = ProgressEvent.loaded</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/ProgressEvent/loaded
ProgressEvent()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The ProgressEvent() constructor returns a newly created ProgressEvent, representing the current completion of a long process.</p><pre><code>progressEvent = new ProgressEvent(type, {lengthComputable: aBooleanValue, loaded: aNumber, total: aNumber});\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/ProgressEvent/ProgressEvent
ProgressEvent.total	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The ProgressEvent.total read-only property is an unsigned long long representing the total amount of work that the underlying process is in the progress of performing. When downloading a resource using HTTP, this only represent the content itself, not headers and other overhead.</p><pre><code>value = ProgressEvent.total</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/ProgressEvent/total

reason	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The reason read-only property of the PromiseRejection returns the rejection reason for the Promise that the current notification is about. Although the reason can be undefined, it is generally an Error object, like in exception handling.</p><pre><code>var myPromiseRejectionReason = myPromiseRejection.reason;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/PromiseRejection/reason
PromiseRejectionEvent	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The PromiseRejectionEvent interface represents events which are fired when JavaScript Promise s are rejected. These events are particularly useful for telemetry and debugging purposes.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/PromiseRejectionEvent
PromiseRejectionEvent.promise	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The PromiseRejectionEvent.promise read-only property indicates the JavaScript Promise which has been rejected. You can examine the event's PromiseRejectionEvent.reason property to learn why the promise was rejected.</p><pre><code>promise = PromiseRejectionEvent.promise</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/PromiseRejectionEvent/promise
PromiseRejectionEvent()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The PromiseRejectionEvent() constructor returns a newly created PromiseRejectionEvent, which represents events fired when a JavaScript Promise is rejected.</p><pre><code>new PromiseRejectionEvent(type, {\n  promise: somePromise, \n  reason : someValue\n});\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/PromiseRejectionEvent/PromiseRejectionEvent
PromiseRejectionEvent.reason	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The PromiseRejectionEvent.reason read-only property is any JavaScript value or Object which provides the reason passed into Promise.reject(). This in theory provides information about why the promise was rejected.</p><pre><code>reason = PromiseRejectionEvent.reason</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/PromiseRejectionEvent/reason

These events make it possible to react to such a change, for example by shutting down the screen of a smartphone when the user is having a phone call with the device close to their ear.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Proximity_Events
PushEvent	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The PushEvent interface of the Push API represents a push message that has been received. This event is sent to the global scope of a ServiceWorker. It contains the information sent from an application server to a PushSubscription.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/PushEvent

This lets developers deliver asynchronous notifications and updates to users that opt in, resulting in better engagement with timely new content.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Push_API

RadioNodeList.value	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>If the underlying element collection contains radio buttons, the RadioNodeList.value property represents the checked radio button. On retrieving the value property, the value of the currently checked radio button is returned as a string. If the collection does not contain any radio buttons or none of the radio buttons in the collection is in checked state, the empty string is returned. On setting the value property, the first radio button input element whose value property is equal to the new value will be set to checked.</p><pre><code>value = radioNodeList.value;\nradioNodeList.value = string;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/RadioNodeList/value
