Range.createContextualFragment()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Range.createContextualFragment() method returns a DocumentFragment by invoking the HTML fragment parsing algorithm or the XML fragment parsing algorithm with the start of the range (the parent of the selected node) as the context node. The HTML fragment parsing algorithm is used if the range belongs to a Document whose HTMLness bit is set. In the HTML case, if the context node would be html, for historical reasons the fragment parsing algorithm is invoked with body as the context instead.</p><pre><code>documentFragment = range.createContextualFragment( tagString )\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Range/createContextualFragment

Range.detach()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Range.detach() method releases a Range from use. This lets the browser choose to release resources associated with this Range. Subsequent attempts to use the detached range will result in a DOMException being thrown with an error code of INVALID_STATE_ERR.</p><pre><code>range.detach();\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Range/detach

RenderingContext	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>RenderingContext is a helper type representing any of the following rendering contexts CanvasRenderingContext2D, WebGLRenderingContext or WebGL2RenderingContext (which inherits from WebGLRenderingContext).</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/RenderingContext
Request	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Request interface of the Fetch API represents a resource request.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Request
Request.cache	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The cache read-only property of the Request interface contains the cache mode of the request.</p><pre><code>var currentCacheMode = request.cache;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Request/cache
Request.clone()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The clone() method of the Request interface creates a copy of the current Request object.</p><pre><code>var newRequest = request.clone();</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Request/clone
Request.context	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The context read-only property of the Request interface contains the context of the Request (e.g., audio, image, iframe). This defines what sort of resource is being fetched.</p><pre><code>var myContext = request.context;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Request/context
Request.credentials	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The credentials read-only property of the Request interface indicates whether the user agent should send cookies from the other domain in the case of cross-origin requests. This is similar to XHR’s withCredentials flag, but with three available values (instead of two):</p><pre><code>var myCred = request.credentials;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Request/credentials
Request.headers	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The headers read-only property of the Request interface contains the Headers object associated with the request.</p><pre><code>var myHeaders = request.headers;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Request/headers
Request.method	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The method read-only property of the Request interface contains the request's method (GET, POST, etc.)</p><pre><code>var myMethod = request.method;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Request/method
Request.mode	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The mode read-only property of the Request interface contains the mode of the request (e.g., cors, no-cors, cors-with-forced-preflight, same-origin, or navigate.) This is used to determine if cross-origin requests lead to valid responses, and which properties of the response are readable:</p><pre><code>var myMode = request.mode;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Request/mode
Request.referrer	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The referrer read-only property of the Request interface is set by the user agent to be the referrer of the Request. (e.g., about:client, no-referrer, or a URL.)</p><pre><code>var myReferrer = request.referrer;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Request/referrer
Request.referrerPolicy	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The referrerPolicy read-only property of the Request interface contains the referrer policy governing the referrer for the  request.</p><pre><code>var myReferrerPolicy = request.referrerPolicy;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Request/referrerPolicy
Request()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Request() constructor creates a new Request object.</p><pre><code>var myRequest = new Request(input, init);</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Request/Request
Request.url	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The url read-only property of the Request interface contains the URL of the request.</p><pre><code>var myURL = request.url;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Request/url
Resource Timing API	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Resource Timing interfaces enable retrieving and analyzing detailed network timing data regarding the loading of an application's resource(s). An application can use the timing metrics to determine, for example, the length of time it takes to load a specific resource, such as an XMLHttpRequest, SVG, image, or script.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Resource_Timing_API
Using the Resource Timing API	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Resource Timing interfaces enable retrieving and analyzing detailed network timing data regarding the loading of an application's resource(s). An application can use the timing metrics to determine, for example, the length of time it takes to fetch a specific resource such as an XMLHttpRequest, SVG, image, script, etc.).</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Resource_Timing_API/Using_the_Resource_Timing_API
Response	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Response interface of the Fetch API represents the response to a request.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Response
Response.clone()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The clone() method of the Response interface creates a clone of a response object, identical in every way, but stored in a different variable.</p><pre><code>var response2 = response1.clone();</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Response/clone
Response.error()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The error() method of the Response interface returns a new Response object associated with a network error.</p><pre><code>var errorResponse = Response.error();</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Response/error
Response.headers	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The headers read-only property of the Response interface contains the Headers object associated with the response.</p><pre><code>var myHeaders = response.headers;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Response/headers
Response.ok	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The ok read-only property of the Response interface contains a boolean stating whether the response was successful (status in the range 200-299) or not.</p><pre><code>var myOK = response.ok;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Response/ok
Response.redirect()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The redirect() method of the Response interface returns a Response resulting in a redirect to the specified URL.</p><pre><code>var response = Response.redirect(url,status);</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Response/redirect
Response.redirected	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The read-only redirected property of the Response interface indicates whether or not the response is the result of a request you made which was redirected.</p><pre><code>var isRedirected = Response.redirected;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Response/redirected
Response()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Response() constructor creates a new Response object.</p><pre><code>var myResponse = new Response(body, init);</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Response/Response
Response.status	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The status read-only property of the Response interface contains the status code of the response (e.g., 200 for a success).</p><pre><code>var myStatus = response.status;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Response/status
Response.statusText	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The statusText read-only property of the Response interface contains the status message corresponding to the status code (e.g., OK for 200).</p><pre><code>var myStatusText = response.statusText;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Response/statusText
Response.type	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The type read-only property of the Response interface contains the type of the response. It can be one of the following:</p><pre><code>var myType = response.type;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Response/type
Response.url	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The url read-only property of the Response interface contains the URL of the response.</p><pre><code>var myURL = response.url;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Response/url
RTCCertificate	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The interface of the the WebRTC API provides an object represents a certificate that an RTCPeerConnection uses to authenticate.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/RTCCertificate
RTCConfiguration	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The RTCConfiguration dictionary is used to provide configuration options for an RTCPeerConnection. It may be passed into the constructor when instantiating a connection, or used with the RTCPeerConnection.getConfiguration() and RTCPeerConnection.setConfiguration() methods, which allow inspecting and changing the configuration while a connection is established.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/RTCConfiguration
RTCDataChannel	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The RTCDataChannel interface represents a network channel which can be used for bidirectional peer-to-peer transfers of arbitrary data. Every data channel is associated with an RTCPeerConnection, and each peer connection can have up to a theoretical maximum of 65,534 data channels (the actual limit may vary from browser to browser).</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/RTCDataChannel
RTCDataChannel.binaryType	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The property binaryType on the RTCDataChannel interface is a DOMString which specifies the type of JavaScript object which should be used to represent binary data received on the RTCDataChannel. Values allowed by the WebSocket.binaryType property are also permitted here: "blob" if Blob objects are being used or "arraybuffer" if ArrayBuffer objects are being used. The default is "blob".</p><pre><code>var type = aDataChannel.binaryType;\n\naDataChannel.binaryType = type; \n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/RTCDataChannel/binaryType
RTCDataChannel.bufferedAmount	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The read-only RTCDataChannel property bufferedAmount returns the number of bytes of data currently queued to be sent over the data channel.</p><pre><code>var amount = aDataChannel.bufferedAmount;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/RTCDataChannel/bufferedAmount
RTCDataChannel.bufferedAmountLowThreshold	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The RTCDataChannel property bufferedAmountLowThreshold is used to specify the number of bytes of buffered outgoing data that is considered "low." The default value is 0 (meaning no bufferedamountlow events are sent).</p><pre><code>var threshold = aDataChannel.bufferedAmountLowThreshold;\n\naDataChannel.bufferedAmountLowThreshold = threshold;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/RTCDataChannel/bufferedAmountLowThreshold
RTCDataChannel.close()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The RTCDataChannel.close() method closes the RTCDataChannel. Either peer is permitted to call this method to initiate closure of the channel.</p><pre><code>RTCDataChannel.close();\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/RTCDataChannel/close
RTCDataChannel.id	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The read-only RTCDataChannel property id returns an ID number (between 0 and 65,534) which uniquely identifies the RTCDataChannel.</p><pre><code>var id = aDataChannel.id;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/RTCDataChannel/id
RTCDataChannel.label	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The read-only RTCDataChannel property label returns a DOMString containing a name describing the data channel. These labels are not required to be unique.</p><pre><code>var name = aDataChannel.label;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/RTCDataChannel/label
RTCDataChannel.maxPacketLifeTime	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The read-only RTCDataChannel property maxPacketLifeTime returns the amount of time, in milliseconds, the browser is allowed to take to attempt to transmit a message, as set when the data channel was created, or null.</p><pre><code>var lifetime = aDataChannel.maxPacketLifeTime;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/RTCDataChannel/maxPacketLifeTime
RTCDataChannel.maxRetransmits	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The read-only RTCDataChannel property maxRetransmits returns the maximum number of times the browser should try to transmit a message before giving up when in unordered mode, as set when the data channel was created, or null, which indicates that there is no maximum.</p><pre><code>var tries = aDataChannel.maxRetransmits;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/RTCDataChannel/maxRetransmits
RTCDataChannel.negotiated	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The read-only RTCDataChannel property negotiated indicates whether the RTCDataChannel 's connection was negotiated by the Web app (true) or by the WebRTC layer (false). The default is false.</p><pre><code>var negotiated = aDataChannel.negotiated;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/RTCDataChannel/negotiated
RTCDataChannel.onbufferedamountlow	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The RTCDataChannel.onbufferedamountlow property is an EventHandler which specifies a function the browser calls when the bufferedamountlow event is sent to the RTCDataChannel. This event, which is represented by a simple Event object, is sent when the amount of data buffered to be sent falls to or below the threshold specified by the channel's bufferedAmountLowThreshold.</p><pre><code>RTCDataChannel.onbufferedamountlow = function;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/RTCDataChannel/onbufferedamountlow
RTCDataChannel.onclose	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The RTCDataChannel.onclose property is an EventHandler which specifies a function to be called by the browser when the close event is received by the RTCDataChannel. This is a simple Event which indicates that the data channel has closed down.</p><pre><code>RTCDataChannel.onclose = function;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/RTCDataChannel/onclose
RTCDataChannel.onerror	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The RTCDataChannel.onerror property is an EventHandler which specifies a function to be called when the error event is received. When an error occurs on the data channel, the function receives as input an ErrorEvent object describing the error which occurred.</p><pre><code>RTCDataChannel.onerror = function;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/RTCDataChannel/onerror
RTCDataChannel.onmessage	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The RTCDataChannel.ommessage property stores an EventHandler which specifies a function to be called when the message event is fired on the channel. This event is represented by the MessageEvent interface. This event is sent to the channel when a message is received from the other peer.</p><pre><code>RTCDataChannel.onmessage = function;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/RTCDataChannel/onmessage
RTCDataChannel.onopen	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The RTCDataChannel.onopen property is an EventHandler which specifies a function to be called when the open event is fired; this is a simple Event which is sent when the data channel's underlying data transport—the link over which the RTCDataChannel 's messages flow—is established or re-established.</p><pre><code>RTCDataChannel.onopen = function;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/RTCDataChannel/onopen
RTCDataChannel.ordered	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The read-only RTCDataChannel property ordered indicates whether or not the data channel guarantees in-order delivery of messages; the default is true, which indicates that the data channel is indeed ordered.</p><pre><code>var ordered = aDataChannel.ordered;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/RTCDataChannel/ordered
RTCDataChannel.protocol	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The read-only RTCDataChannel property protocol returns a DOMString containing the name of the subprotocol in use. If no protocol was specified when the data channel was created, then this property's value is "" (the empty string).</p><pre><code>var subProtocol = aDataChannel.protocol;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/RTCDataChannel/protocol
RTCDataChannel.readyState	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The read-only RTCDataChannel property readyState returns an enum of type RTCDataChannelState which indicates the state of the data channel's underlying data connection.</p><pre><code>var state = aDataChannel.readyState;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/RTCDataChannel/readyState
RTCDataChannel.send()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The send() method of the RTCDataChannel interface sends data across the data channel to the remote peer.</p><pre><code>RTCDataChannel.send(data);\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/RTCDataChannel/send
RTCDataChannelEvent	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The RTCDataChannelEvent() constructor returns a new RTCDataChannelEvent object, which represents a datachannel event. These events sent to an RTCPeerConnection when its remote peer is asking to open an RTCDataChannel between the two peers.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/RTCDataChannelEvent
RTCDataChannelEvent.channel	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The read-only property RTCDataChannelEvent.channel returns the RTCDataChannel associated with the event.</p><pre><code> var channel = RTCDataChannelEvent.channel;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/RTCDataChannelEvent/channel
RTCDataChannelEvent()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The RTCDataChannelEvent() constructor creates a new RTCDataChannelEvent.</p><pre><code> var event = new RTCDataChannelEvent(type, rtcDataChannelEventInit);</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/RTCDataChannelEvent/RTCDataChannelEvent
RTCIceCandidate	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The RTCIceCandidate interface of the the WebRTC API represents a candidate internet connectivity establishment (ICE) server for establishing an RTCPeerConnection.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/RTCIceCandidate
RTCIceServer	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The RTCIceServer dictionary defines how to connect to a single ICE server (such as a STUN or TURN server). It includes both the URL and the necessary credentials, if any, to connect to the server.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/RTCIceServer
RTCIceServer.credential	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The RTCIceServer dictionary's credential property is a string providing the credential to use when connecting to the described server. This is typically a password, key, or other secret.</p><pre><code>var iceServer = {\n                  ...\n                  credential = credential,\n                  ...\n                };\n\nvar credential = iceServer.credential;\n\niceServer.credential = newCredential;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/RTCIceServer/credential
RTCIceServer.credentialType	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The RTCIceServer dictionary's credentialType property is a string value from the RTCIceCredentialType enum which indicates what type of credential the RTCIceServer.credential value is. The default is "password".</p><pre><code>var iceServer = {\n                  ...\n                  credentialType = ["password" | "token"],\n                  ...\n                };\n\nvar credential = iceServer.credentialType;\n\niceServer.credential = ["password" | "token"];</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/RTCIceServer/credentialType
RTCIceServers.urls	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The RTCIceServer dictionary's urls property specifies the URL or URLs of the servers to be used for ICE negotiations. These are typically STUN and/or TURN servers.</p><pre><code>var iceServer = {\n                  ...\n                  urls = iceServerUrl | [ url1, ..., urlN ],\n                  ...\n                };\n\nvar serverUrls = iceServer.urls;\n\niceServer.urls = iceServerUrl | [ url1, ..., urlN ];</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/RTCIceServer/urls
RTCIceServer.username	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The RTCIceServer dictionary's username property is a string which specifies the username to use when authenticating with the ICE server being described.</p><pre><code>var iceServer = {\n                  ...\n                  username = username,\n                  ...\n                };\n\nvar username = iceServer.username;\n\niceServer.username = newUsername;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/RTCIceServer/username
RTCIdentityAssertion	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The RTCIdentityAssertion interface of the the WebRTC API represents the identity of the a remote peer of the current connection. If no peer has yet been set and verified this interface returns null. Once set it can't be changed.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/RTCIdentityAssertion
RTCIdentityErrorEvent	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The RTCIdentityErrorEvent interface represents an error associated with the identity provider (idP). This is usually for an RTCPeerConnection. Two events are sent with this type: idpassertionerror and idpvalidationerror.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/RTCIdentityErrorEvent
RTCIdentityErrorEvent.idp	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The read-only property RTCIdentityErrorEvent.idp returns the DOMString describing the domain name of the identity provider (idp) generating the error response event.</p><pre><code>var idp = event.idp;\nevent.idp = "developer.mozilla.org";\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/RTCIdentityErrorEvent/idp
rtcidentityerrorevent idp	R	RTCIdentityErrorEvent.idp										
RTCIdentityErrorEvent.loginUrl	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The read-only property RTCIdentityErrorEvent.loginUrl is a DOMString giving the URL where the user can complete the authentication. It can be null and is provided by the identity provider (idp).</p><pre><code>var loginUrl = event.loginUrl;\nevent.loginUrl = "https://developer.mozilla.org/fakeURL";\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/RTCIdentityErrorEvent/loginUrl
rtcidentityerrorevent loginurl	R	RTCIdentityErrorEvent.loginUrl

rtcidentityerrorevent protocol	R	RTCIdentityErrorEvent.protocol										
RTCIdentityEvent	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The RTCIdentityEvent interface represents an identity assertion generated by an identity provider (idP). This is usually for an RTCPeerConnection. The only event sent with this type is identityresult..</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/RTCIdentityEvent
RTCIdentityEvent.assertion	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The read-only property RTCIdentityEvent.assertion returns the DOMString containing a blob being the coded assertion associated with the event.</p><pre><code> var blob = event.assertion;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/RTCIdentityEvent/assertion
RTCPeerConnection	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The RTCPeerConnection interface represents a WebRTC connection between the local computer and a remote peer. It provides methods to connect to a remote peer, maintain and monitor the connection, and close the connection once it's no longer needed.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/RTCPeerConnection
RTCPeerConnection.addIceCandidate()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>When a web site or app using RTCPeerConnection receives a new ICE candidate from the remote peer over its signaling channel, it delivers the newly-received candidate to the browser's ICE agent by calling RTCPeerConnection.addIceCandidate().</p><pre><code>aPromise = pc.addIceCandidate(candidate);\n\naddIceCandidate(candidate, successCallback, failureCallback);  \n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/RTCPeerConnection/addIceCandidate
RTCPeerConnection.addStream()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The RTCPeerConnection.addStream() method adds a MediaStream as a local source of audio or video. If the negotiation already happened, a new one will be needed for the remote peer to be able to use it.</p><pre><code>pc.addStream(mediaStream);</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/RTCPeerConnection/addStream
RTCPeerConnection.addTrack()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The RTCPeerConnection method addTrack() adds a new media track to the connection. The track is added to the set of tracks which will be transmitted to the other peer.</p><pre><code>rtpSender = RTCPeerConnection.addTrack(track, stream...);</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/RTCPeerConnection/addTrack
RTCPeerConnection.canTrickleIceCandidates	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The read-only property RTCPeerConnection.canTrickleIceCandidates returns a Boolean which indicates whether or not the remote peer can accept trickled ICE candidates.</p><pre><code> var canTrickle = RTCPeerConnection.canTrickleIceCandidates;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/RTCPeerConnection/canTrickleIceCandidates
RTCPeerConnection.close()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The RTCPeerConnection.close() method closes the current peer connection.</p><pre><code>peerConnection.close();\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/RTCPeerConnection/close
RTCPeerConnection.connectionState	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The read-only connectionState property of the RTCPeerConnection interface indicates the current state of the peer connection by returning one of the string values specified by the enum RTCPeerConnectionState.</p><pre><code>var connectionState = RTCPeerConnection.connectionState;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/RTCPeerConnection/connectionState
RTCPeerConnection.createAnswer()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The createAnswer() method on the RTCPeerConnection interface creates an answer to an offer received from a remote peer during the offer/answer negotiation of a WebRTC connection. Once the answer is created, it should be sent to the source of the offer to continue the negotiation process.</p><pre><code>aPromise = RTCPeerConnection.createAnswer([options]);\n\nRTCPeerConnection.createAnswer(successCallback, failureCallback[, options]);  </code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/RTCPeerConnection/createAnswer
RTCPeerConnection.createDataChannel()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The createDataChannel() method on the RTCPeerConnection interface creates a new channel over which any kind of data may be transmitted. This can be useful for back-channel content such as images, file transfer, text chat, game update packets, and so forth.</p><pre><code>dataChannel = RTCPeerConnection.createDataChannel(label[, options]);</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/RTCPeerConnection/createDataChannel
RTCPeerConnection.createOffer()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The createOffer() method of the RTCPeerConnection interface initiates the creation of an SDP offer which includes information about any MediaStreamTrack s already attached to the WebRTC session, codec and options supported by the browser, and any candidates already gathered by the ICE agent, for the purpose of being sent over the signaling channel to a potential peer to request a connection or to update the configuration of an existing connection.</p><pre><code>aPromise = myPeerConnection.createOffer([options]);\n\nmyPeerConnection.createOffer(successCallback, failureCallback[, options])  \n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/RTCPeerConnection/createOffer
RTCPeerConnection.currentLocalDescription	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The read-only property RTCPeerConnection.currentLocalDescription returns an RTCSessionDescription object describing the local end of the connection as it was most recently successfully negotiated since the last time the RTCPeerConnection finished negotiating and connecting to a remote peer. Also included is a list of any ICE candidates that may already have been generated by the ICE agent since the offer or answer represented by the description was first instantiated.</p><pre><code> var sessionDescription = peerConnection.currentLocalDescription;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/RTCPeerConnection/currentLocalDescription
RTCPeerConnection.currentRemoteDescription	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The read-only property RTCPeerConnection.currentRemoteDescription returns an RTCSessionDescription object describing the remote end of the connection as it was most recently successfully negotiated since the last time the RTCPeerConnection finished negotiating and connecting to a remote peer. Also included is a list of any ICE candidates that may already have been generated by the ICE agent since the offer or answer represented by the description was first instantiated.</p><pre><code> var sessionDescription = peerConnection.currentRemoteDescription;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/RTCPeerConnection/currentRemoteDescription
RTCPeerConnection.defaultIceServers	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The read-only property RTCPeerConnection.defaultIceServers returns an array of objects based on the RTCIceServer dictionary, which indicates what—if any—ICE servers the browser will use by default if none are provided to the RTCPeerConnection in its RTCConfiguration. However, browsers are not required to provide any default ICE servers at all.</p><pre><code> var defaultIceServers = RTCPeerConnection.defaultIceServers;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/RTCPeerConnection/defaultIceServers
RTCPeerConnection.generateCertificate()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The generateCertificate() method of the RTCPeerConnection interface creates and stores an X.509 certificate and corresponding private key then returns an RTCCertificate, providing access to it.</p><pre><code>var cert = RTCPeerConnection.generateCertificate(keygenAlgorithm)</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/RTCPeerConnection/generateCertificate
RTCPeerConnection.getConfiguration()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The RTCPeerConnection.getConfiguration() method returns a RTCConfiguration object which indicates the current configuration of the RTCPeerConnection on which the method is called.</p><pre><code>configuration = RTCPeerConnection.getConfiguration();</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/RTCPeerConnection/getConfiguration
RTCPeerConnection.getIdentityAssertion()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The RTCPeerConnection.getIdentityAssertion() method initiates the gathering of an identity assertion. This has an effect only if the signalingState is not "closed".</p><pre><code>pc.getIdentityAssertion();\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/RTCPeerConnection/getIdentityAssertion
RTCPeerConnection.getLocalStreams()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The RTCPeerConnection.getLocalStreams() method returns an array of MediaStream associated with the local end of the connection. The array may be empty.</p><pre><code>var mediaStreams[] = pc.getLocalStream();\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/RTCPeerConnection/getLocalStreams
RTCPeerConnection.getRemoteStreams()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The RTCPeerConnection.getRemoteStreams() method returns an array of MediaStream associated with the remote end of the connection. The array may be empty.</p><pre><code>var mediaStreams[] = pc.getRemoteStream();\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/RTCPeerConnection/getRemoteStreams
RTCPeerConnection.getStreamById()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The RTCPeerConnection.getStreamById() method returns the MediaStream with the given id that is associated with local or remote end of the connection. If no stream matches, it returns null.</p><pre><code>var mediaStream = pc.getStream(id);\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/RTCPeerConnection/getStreamById
RTCPeerConnection.iceConnectionState	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The read-only property RTCPeerConnection.iceConnectionState returns an enum of type RTCIceConnectionState which state of the ICE agent associated with the RTCPeerConnection.</p><pre><code> var state = peerConnection.iceConnectionState;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/RTCPeerConnection/iceConnectionState
RTCPeerConnection.iceGatheringState	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The read-only property RTCPeerConnection.iceGatheringState returns an enum of type RTCIceGatheringState that describes connection's ICE gathering state. This lets you detect, for example, when collection of ICE candidates has finished.</p><pre><code> var state = RTCPeerConnection.iceGatheringState;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/RTCPeerConnection/iceGatheringState
RTCPeerConnection.localDescription	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The read-only property RTCPeerConnection.localDescription returns an RTCSessionDescription describing the session for the local end of the connection. If it has not yet been set, this is null.</p><pre><code> var sessionDescription = peerConnection.localDescription;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/RTCPeerConnection/localDescription
RTCPeerConnection.onaddstream	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The RTCPeerConnection.onaddstream event handler is a property containing the code to execute when the addstream event, of type MediaStreamEvent, is received by this RTCPeerConnection. Such an event is sent when a MediaStream is added to this connection by the remote peer. The event is sent immediately after the call setRemoteDescription() and doesn't wait for the result of the SDP negotiation.</p><pre><code>RTCPeerConnection.onaddstream = eventHandler;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/RTCPeerConnection/onaddstream
RTCPeerConnection.onconnectionstatechange	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The RTCPeerConnection.onconnectionstatechange property specifies an EventHandler which is called to handle the connectionstatechange event when it occurs on an instance of RTCPeerConnection. This happens whenever the aggregate state of the connection changes.</p><pre><code>RTCPeerConnection.onconnectionstatechange = eventHandler;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/RTCPeerConnection/onconnectionstatechange
RTCPeerConnection.ondatachannel	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The RTCPeerConnection.ondatachannel property is an EventHandler which specifies a function which is called when the datachannel event occurs on an RTCPeerConnection. This event, of type RTCDataChannelEvent, is sent when an RTCDataChannel is added to the connection by the remote peer calling createDataChannel().</p><pre><code>RTCPeerConnection.ondatachannel = function;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/RTCPeerConnection/ondatachannel
RTCPeerConnection.onicecandidate	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The RTCPeerConnection.onicecandidate property is an EventHandler which specifies a function to be called when the icecandidate event occurs on an RTCPeerConnection instance. This happens whenever the local ICE agent needs to deliver a message to the other peer through the signaling server.</p><pre><code>RTCPeerConnection.onicecandidate = eventHandler;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/RTCPeerConnection/onicecandidate
RTCPeerConnection.onicecandidateerror	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The RTCPeerConnection.onicecandidateerror property is an EventHandler which specifies a function which is called to handle the icecandidateerror event when it occurs on an RTCPeerConnection instance. This event is fired when an error occurs during the ICE candidate gathering process.</p><pre><code>RTCPeerConnection.onicecandidateerror = eventHandler;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/RTCPeerConnection/onicecandidateerror
RTCPeerConnection.oniceconnectionstatechange	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The RTCPeerConnection.oniceconnectionstatechange property is an event handler which specifies a function to be called when the iceconnectionstatechange event is fired on an RTCPeerConnection instance. This happens when the state of the connection's ICE agent, as represented by the iceConnectionState property, changes.</p><pre><code>RTCPeerConnection.oniceconnectionstatechange = eventHandler;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/RTCPeerConnection/oniceconnectionstatechange
RTCPeerConnection.onicegatheringstatechange	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The RTCPeerConnection.onicegatheringstatechange property is an EventHandler which specifies a function to be called when the icegatheringstatechange event is sent to an RTCPeerConnection instance. This happens when the ICE gathering state—that is, whether or not the ICE agent is actively gathering candidates—changes.</p><pre><code>RTCPeerConnection.onicegatheringstatechange = eventHandler;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/RTCPeerConnection/onicegatheringstatechange
RTCPeerConnection.onidentityresult	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The RTCPeerConnection.onidentityresult event handler is a property containing the code to execute when the identityresult event, of type RTCIdentityEvent, is received by this RTCPeerConnection. Such an event is sent when an identity assertion is generated, via getIdentityAssertion() or during the creation of an offer or an answer.</p><pre><code>peerconnection.onidentityresult = function;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/RTCPeerConnection/onidentityresult
RTCPeerConnection.onidpassertionerror	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The RTCPeerConnection.onidpassertionerror event handler is a property containing the code to execute whent the idpassertionerror event, of type RTCIdentityErrorEvent, is received by this RTCPeerConnection. Such an event is sent when the associated identity provider (IdP) encounters an error while generating an identity assertion.</p><pre><code>peerconnection.onidpassertionerror = function;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/RTCPeerConnection/onidpassertionerror
RTCPeerConnection.onidpvalidationerror	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The RTCPeerConnection.onidpvalidationerror event handler is a property containing the code to execute whent the idpvalidationerror event, of type RTCIdentityErrorEvent, is received by this RTCPeerConnection. Such an event is sent when the associated identity provider (IdP) encounters an error while validating an identity assertion.</p><pre><code>peerconnection.onidpvalidationerror = function;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/RTCPeerConnection/onidpvalidationerror
RTCPeerConnection.onnegotiationneeded	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The RTCPeerConnection.onnegotiationneeded property is an EventHandler which specifies a function which is called to handle the negotiationneeded event when it occurs on an RTCPeerConnection instance. This event is fired when a change has occurred which requires session negotiation.</p><pre><code>RTCPeerConnection.onnegotiationneeded = eventHandler;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/RTCPeerConnection/onnegotiationneeded
RTCPeerConnection.onpeeridentity	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The RTCPeerConnection.onpeeridentity event handler is a property containing the code to execute whent the peeridentity event, of type Event, is received by this RTCPeerConnection. Such an event is sent when an identity assertion, received from a peer, has been successfully validated.</p><pre><code>peerconnection.onpeeridentity = function;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/RTCPeerConnection/onpeeridentity
RTCPeerConnection.onremovestream	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The RTCPeerConnection.onremovestream event handler is a property containing the code to execute when the removestream event, of type MediaStreamEvent, is received by this RTCPeerConnection. Such an event is sent when a MediaStream is removed from this connection.</p><pre><code>peerconnection.onremovestream = function;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/RTCPeerConnection/onremovestream
RTCPeerConnection.onsignalingstatechange	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The RTCPeerConnection.onsignalingstatechange property is an EventHandler which specifies a function to be called when the signalingstatechange event occurs on an RTCPeerConnection interface. The function receives as input the event object, of type Event ; this event is sent when the value of RTCPeerConnection.signalingState changes, as the result of a call to either setLocalDescription() or setRemoteDescription().</p><pre><code>RTCPeerConnection.onsignalingstatechange = errorHandler;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/RTCPeerConnection/onsignalingstatechange
RTCPeerConnection.ontrack	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The RTCPeerConnection.ontrack property is an EventHandler which specifies a function to be called when the track event occurs on an RTCPeerConnection interface. The function receives as input the event object, of type RTCTrackEvent ; this event is sent when a new incoming MediaStreamTrack has been created and associated with an RTCRtpReceiver object which has been added to the set of receivers on connection.</p><pre><code>RTCPeerConnection.ontrack = errorHandler;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/RTCPeerConnection/ontrack
RTCPeerConnection.peerIdentity	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The read-only property RTCPeerConnection.peerIdentity returns an RTCIdentityAssertion, containing a DOMString once set and verified. If no peer has yet been set and verified, this property will return null. Once set, via the appropriate method, it can't be changed.</p><pre><code> var identity = peerConnection.peerIdentity;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/RTCPeerConnection/peerIdentity
RTCPeerConnection.pendingLocalDescription	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The read-only property RTCPeerConnection.pendingLocalDescription returns an RTCSessionDescription object describing a pending configuration change for the local end of the connection. This does not describe the connection as it currently stands, but as it may exist in the near future. Use RTCPeerConnection.currentLocalDescription or RTCPeerConnection.localDescription to get the current state of the endpoint. For details on the difference, see " Pending and current descriptions " in WebRTC connectivity.</p><pre><code> var sessionDescription = peerConnection.pendingLocalDescription;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/RTCPeerConnection/pendingLocalDescription
RTCPeerConnection.pendingRemoteDescription	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The read-only property RTCPeerConnection.pendingRemoteDescription returns an RTCSessionDescription object describing a pending configuration change for the remote end of the connection. This does not describe the connection as it currently stands, but as it may exist in the near future. Use RTCPeerConnection.currentRemoteDescription or RTCPeerConnection.remoteDescription to get the current session description for the remote endpoint. For details on the difference, see " Pending and current descriptions " in WebRTC connectivity.</p><pre><code> var sessionDescription = peerConnection.pendingRemoteDescription;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/RTCPeerConnection/pendingRemoteDescription
RTCPeerConnection.remoteDescription	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The read-only property RTCPeerConnection.remoteDescription returns a RTCSessionDescription describing the session (which includes configuration and media information) for the remote end of the connection. If this hasn't been set yet, this is null.</p><pre><code> var sessionDescription = peerConnection.remoteDescription;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/RTCPeerConnection/remoteDescription
RTCPeerConnection.removeStream()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The RTCPeerConnection.removeStream() method removes a MediaStream as a local source of audio or video. If the negotiation already happened, a new one will be needed for the remote peer to be able to use it.</p><pre><code>pc.removeStream(mediaStream);\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/RTCPeerConnection/removeStream
removeTrack	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The RTCPeerConnection.removeTrack() method tells the local end of the connection to stop sending media from the specified track, without actually removing the corresponding RTCRtpSender from the list of senders as reported by RTCPeerConnection.getSenders(). If the track is already stopped, or is not in the connection's senders list, this method has no effect.</p><pre><code>pc.removeTrack(sender);\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/RTCPeerConnection/removeTrack
RTCPeerConnection()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The RTCPeerConnection() constructor returns a newly-created RTCPeerConnection, which represents a connection between the local device and a remote peer.</p><pre><code>pc = new RTCPeerConnection([configuration]);</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/RTCPeerConnection/RTCPeerConnection
RTCPeerConnection.sctp	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The read-only sctp property on the RTCPeerConnection interface returns an RTCSctpTransport describing the SCTP transport over which SCTP data is being sent and received. If SCTP hasn't been negotiated, this value is null.</p><pre><code>var sctp = RTCPeerConnection.sctp;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/RTCPeerConnection/sctp
RTCPeerConnection.setConfiguration()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The RTCPeerConnection.setConfiguration() method sets the current configuration of the RTCPeerConnection based on the values included in the specified RTCConfiguration object. This lets you change the ICE servers used by the connection and which transport policies to use.</p><pre><code>RTCPeerConnection.setConfiguration(configuration);</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/RTCPeerConnection/setConfiguration
RTCPeerConnection.setIdentityProvider()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The RTCPeerConnection.setIdentityProvider() method sets the Identity Provider (IdP) to the triplet given in parameter: its name, the protocol used to communicate with it (optional) and an optional username. The IdP will be used only when an assertion is needed.</p><pre><code>pc.setIdentityProvider(domainname [, protocol] [, username]);\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/RTCPeerConnection/setIdentityProvider
RTCPeerConnection.setLocalDescription()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The RTCPeerConnection.setLocalDescription() method changes the local description associated with the connection. This description specifies the properties of the local end of the connection, including the media format.</p><pre><code>aPromise = pc.setLocalDescription(sessionDescription);\n\npc.setLocalDescription(sessionDescription, successCallback, errorCallback);  \n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/RTCPeerConnection/setLocalDescription
RTCPeerConnection.setRemoteDescription()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The RTCPeerConnection.setRemoteDescription() method changes the remote description associated with the connection. This description specifies the properties of the remote end of the connection, including the media format.</p><pre><code>aPromise = pc.setRemoteDescription(sessionDescription);\n\npc.setRemoteDescription(sessionDescription, successCallback, errorCallback);  \n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/RTCPeerConnection/setRemoteDescription
RTCPeerConnection.signalingState	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The read-only signalingState property on the RTCPeerConnection interface returns one of the string values specified by the RTCSignalingState enum; these values describe the state of the signaling process on the local end of the connection while connecting or reconnecting to another peer. See " Signaling " in Lifetime of a WebRTC session for more details about the signaling process.</p><pre><code> var state = RTCPeerConnection.signalingState;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/RTCPeerConnection/signalingState
RTCPeerConnectionIceEvent	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The RTCPeerConnectionIceEvent interface represents events that occurs in relation to ICE candidates with the target, usually an RTCPeerConnection. Only one event is of this type: icecandidate.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/RTCPeerConnectionIceEvent
RTCPeerConnectionIceEvent.candidate	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The read-only property RTCPeerConnectionIceEvent.candidate returns the RTCIceCandidate associated with the event.</p><pre><code> var candidate = event.candidate;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/RTCPeerConnectionIceEvent/candidate
RTCPeerConnectionIceEvent()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The RTCPeerConnectionIceEvent() constructor creates a new RTCPeerConnectionIceEvent.</p><pre><code> var event = new RTCPeerConnectionIceEvent(type, options);</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/RTCPeerConnectionIceEvent/RTCPeerConnectionIceEvent
RTCSctpTransport	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The RTCSctpTransport interface provides information which describes a Stream Control Transmission Protocol (SCTP) transport. This provides information about limitations of the transport, but also provides a way to access the underlying Datagram Transport Layer Security (DTLS) transport over which SCTP packets for all of an RTCPeerConnection 's data channels are sent and received.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/RTCSctpTransport
RTCSessionDescription	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The RTCSessionDescription interface represents the parameters of a session. Each RTCSessionDescription consists of a description type indicating which part of the offer/answer negotiation process it describes and of the SDP descriptor of the session.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/RTCSessionDescription
RTCSessionDescription()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The RTCSessionDescription() constructor creates a new RTCSessionDescription.</p><pre><code> sessionDescription = new RTCSessionDescription(rtcSessionDescriptionInit);</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/RTCSessionDescription/RTCSessionDescription
RTCSessionDescription.sdp	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The property RTCSessionDescription.sdp is a read-only DOMString containing the SDP which describes the session.</p><pre><code>var value = sessionDescription.sdp;\nsessionDescription.sdp = value; \n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/RTCSessionDescription/sdp
RTCSessionDescription.toJSON()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The RTCPeerConnection.toJSON() method generates a JSON description of the object. Both properties, type and sdp, are contained in the generated JSON.</p><pre><code>var jsonValue = sd.toJSON();\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/RTCSessionDescription/toJSON
RTCSessionDescription.type	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The property RTCSessionDescription.type is a read-only value of type RTCSdpType which describes the description's type.</p><pre><code>var value = sessionDescription.type;\nsessionDescription.type = value; \n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/RTCSessionDescription/type
RTCStatsReport	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>WebRTC provides a method— RTCPeerConnection.getStats() —which returns a set of statistics about the state of the connection and the data transfers which have taken place. This status report is an object of type RTCStatsReport, and consists of a mapping of strings identifying objects which have had statistics recorded and a dictionary containing all of the corresponding data.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/RTCStatsReport
Screen	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Screen interface represents a screen, usually the one on which the current window is being rendered.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Screen
Screen.availHeight	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Returns the amount of vertical space available to the window on the screen.</p><pre><code>iAvail = window.screen.availHeight</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Screen/availHeight
Screen.availLeft	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Returns the first available pixel available from the left side of the screen.</p><pre><code>iAvail = window.screen.availLeft\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Screen/availLeft
Screen.availTop	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Specifies the y-coordinate of the first pixel that is not allocated to permanent or semipermanent user interface features.</p><pre><code>iAvail = window.screen.availTop\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Screen/availTop
Screen.availWidth	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Returns the amount of horizontal space in pixels available to the window.</p><pre><code>window.screen.availWidth</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Screen/availWidth
Screen.colorDepth	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Returns the color depth of the screen. Per CSSOM View, the value is always 24, for compatibility reasons.</p><pre><code>bitDepth = window.screen.colorDepth\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Screen/colorDepth
Screen.height	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Returns the height of the screen in pixels.</p><pre><code>iHeight = window.screen.height\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Screen/height
Screen.left	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Returns the distance in pixels from the left side of the main screen to the left side of the current screen.</p><pre><code>varleft = window.screen.left;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Screen/left
Screen.lockOrientation()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The lockOrientation method locks the screen into the specified orientation.</p><pre><code>lockedAllowed = window.screen.lockOrientation(orientation);</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Screen/lockOrientation
Screen.mozBrightness	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Indicates how bright the screen's backlight is, on a scale from 0 (very dim) to 1 (full brightness); this value is a double-precision float.</p><pre><code>screenBrightness = window.screen.mozBrightness;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Screen/mozBrightness
Screen.mozEnabled	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>This Boolean attribute controls the device's screen. Setting it to false will turn off the screen.</p><pre><code>screenEnabled = window.screen.mozEnabled</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Screen/mozEnabled
Screen.onorientationchange	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>An event handler for the orientationchange events sent to the screen object.</p><pre><code>screen.onorientationchange = funcRef;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Screen/onorientationchange
Screen.orientation	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Screen.orientation property give the current orientation of the screen.</p><pre><code>var orientation = window.screen.orientation;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Screen/orientation
Screen.pixelDepth	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Returns the bit depth of the screen. Per CSSOM View, the value is always 24, for compatibility reasons.</p><pre><code>depth = window.screen.pixelDepth\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Screen/pixelDepth
Screen.top	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Returns the distance in pixels from the top side of the current screen.</p><pre><code>iTop = window.screen.top\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Screen/top
Screen.unlockOrientation()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Screen.unlockOrientation method removes all the previous screen locks set by the page/app.</p><pre><code>var unlocked = window.screen.unlockOrientation();\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Screen/unlockOrientation
Screen.width	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Returns the width of the screen.</p><pre><code>lWidth = window.screen.width\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Screen/width
ScriptProcessorNode	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The size of the input and output buffer are defined at the creation time, when the AudioContext.createScriptProcessor() method is called (both are defined by AudioContext.createScriptProcessor() 's bufferSize parameter). The buffer size must be a power of 2 between 256 and 16384, that is 256, 512, 1024, 2048, 4096, 8192 or 16384. Small numbers lower the latency, but large number may be necessary to avoid audio breakup and glitches.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/ScriptProcessorNode
ScriptProcessorNode.bufferSize	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The following example shows basic usage of a ScriptProcessorNode to take a track loaded via AudioContext.decodeAudioData, process it, adding a bit of white noise to each audio sample of the input track (buffer) and play it through the AudioDestinationNode. For each channel and each sample frame, the scriptNode.onaudioprocess function takes the associated audioProcessingEvent and uses it to loop through each channel of the input buffer, and each sample in each channel, and add a small amount of white noise, before setting that result to be the output sample in each case.</p><pre><code>var audioCtx = new AudioContext();\nvar scriptNode = audioCtx.createScriptProcessor(4096, 1, 1);\nconsole.log(scriptNode.bufferSize);</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/ScriptProcessorNode/bufferSize
ScriptProcessorNode.onaudioprocess	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The following example shows basic usage of a ScriptProcessorNode to take a track loaded via AudioContext.decodeAudioData, process it, adding a bit of white noise to each audio sample of the input track (buffer) and play it through the AudioDestinationNode. For each channel and each sample frame, the scriptNode.onaudioprocess function takes the associated audioProcessingEvent and uses it to loop through each channel of the input buffer, and each sample in each channel, and add a small amount of white noise, before setting that result to be the output sample in each case.</p><pre><code>var audioCtx = new AudioContext();\nvar scriptNode = audioCtx.createScriptProcessor(4096, 1, 1);\nscriptNode.onaudioprocess = function() { ... }</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/ScriptProcessorNode/onaudioprocess
Selection	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Calling the Selection.toString() method returns the text contained in the selection, e.g.:</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Selection
Selection.addRange()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Selection.addRange() method adds a Range to a Selection.</p><pre><code>sel.addRange(range)</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Selection/addRange
Selection.anchorNode	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Selection.anchorNode read-only property returns the Node in which the selection begins.</p><pre><code>node =\n sel.anchorNode</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Selection/anchorNode
Selection.anchorOffset	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Selection.anchorOffset read-only property returns the number of characters that the selection's anchor is offset within the Selection.anchorNode.</p><pre><code>number = sel.anchorOffset</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Selection/anchorOffset
Selection.collapse()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Selection.collapse() method collapses the current selection to a single point. The document is not modified. If the content is focused and editable, the caret will blink there.</p><pre><code>sel.collapse(parentNode, offset);\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Selection/collapse
Selection.collapseToEnd()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Selection.collapseToEnd() method collapses the selection to the end of the last range in the selection.  If the content of the selection is focused and editable, the caret will blink there.</p><pre><code>sel.collapseToEnd()\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Selection/collapseToEnd
Selection.collapseToStart()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Selection.collapseToStart() method collapses the selection to the start of the first range in the selection.  If the content of the selection is focused and editable, the caret will blink there.</p><pre><code>sel.collapseToStart()\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Selection/collapseToStart
Selection.containsNode()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Selection.containsNode() method indicates if the node is part of the selection.</p><pre><code>sel.containsNode(aNode,aPartlyContained)\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Selection/containsNode
Selection.deleteFromDocument()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Selection.deleteFromDocument() method deletes the actual text being represented by a selection object from the document's DOM.</p><pre><code>sel.deleteFromDocument()\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Selection/deleteFromDocument
Selection.extend()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Selection.extend() method moves the focus of the selection to a specified point. The anchor of the selection does not move. The selection will be from the anchor to the new focus regardless of direction.</p><pre><code>sel.extend(parentNode, offset)\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Selection/extend
Selection.focusNode	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Selection.focusNode read-only property returns the Node, in which selection ends.</p><pre><code>node = sel.focusNode\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Selection/focusNode
Selection.focusOffset	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Selection.focusOffset read-only property returns the number of characters that the selection's focus is offset within the Selection.focusNode.</p><pre><code>offset =\n sel.focusOffset\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Selection/focusOffset
Selection.getRangeAt()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Selection.getRangeAt() method returns a range object representing one of the ranges currently selected.</p><pre><code>range = sel.getRangeAt(index)\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Selection/getRangeAt
Selection.isCollapsed	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Selection.isCollapsed read-only property returns a Boolean which indicates whether or not there is currently any text selected; That is to say that the selection's start and end points are at the same position in the content.</p><pre><code>bool =\n sel.isCollapsed\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Selection/isCollapsed
Selection.modify()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Selection.modify() method applies a change to the current selection or cursor position, using simple textual commands.</p><pre><code>sel.modify(alter, direction, granularity)\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Selection/modify
Selection.rangeCount	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Selection.rangeCount read-only property returns the number of ranges in the selection.</p><pre><code>value = sel.rangeCount\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Selection/rangeCount
Selection.removeAllRanges()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Selection.removeAllRanges() method removes all ranges from the selection, leaving the anchorNode and focusNode properties equal to null and leaving nothing selected.</p><pre><code>sel.removeAllRanges();\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Selection/removeAllRanges
Selection.removeRange()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Selection.removeRange() method removes a range from the selection.</p><pre><code>sel.removeRange(\nrange)\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Selection/removeRange
Selection.selectAllChildren()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Selection.selectAllChildren() method adds all the children of the specified node to the selection. Previous selection is lost.</p><pre><code>sel.selectAllChildren(parentNode)\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Selection/selectAllChildren
Selection.toString()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Selection.toString() method returns a string currently being represented by the selection object, i.e. the currently selected text.</p><pre><code>str =\n sel.toString()\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Selection/toString
Server-sent events	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Traditionally, a web page has to send a request to the server to receive new data; that is, the page requests data from the server. With server-sent events, it's possible for a server to send new data to a web page at any time, by pushing messages to the web page. These incoming messages can be treated as Events + data inside the web page.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Server-sent_events
Using server-sent events	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The server-sent event API is contained in the EventSource interface; to open a connection to the server to begin receiving events from it, create a new EventSource object specifying the URI of a script that generates the events. For example:</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Server-sent_events/Using_server-sent_events
ServiceWorker	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The ServiceWorker interface of the ServiceWorker API provides a reference to a service worker. Multiple browsing contexts (e.g. pages, workers, etc.) can be associated with the same service worker, each through a unique ServiceWorker object.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/ServiceWorker
ServiceWorker.onstatechange	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>An EventListener property called whenever an event of type statechange is fired; it is basically fired anytime the ServiceWorker.state changes.</p><pre><code>ServiceWorker.onstatechange = function(statechangeevent) { ... }\nServiceWorker.addEventListener('statechange',&#160;function(statechangeevent) { ... } )</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/ServiceWorker/onstatechange
ServiceWorker.scriptURL	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Returns the ServiceWorker serialized script URL defined as part of ServiceWorkerRegistration. Must be on the same origin as the document that registers the ServiceWorker.</p><pre><code>someURL = ServiceWorker.scriptURL \n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/ServiceWorker/scriptURL
ServiceWorker.state	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The state read-only property of the ServiceWorker interface returns a string representing the current state of the service worker. It can be one of the following values: installing, installed, activating, activated, or redundant.</p><pre><code>someURL = ServiceWorker.state \n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/ServiceWorker/state
ServiceWorkerContainer	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The ServiceWorkerContainer interface of the ServiceWorker API provides an object representing the service worker as an overall unit in the network ecosystem, including facilities to register, unregister and update service workers, and access the state of service workers and their registrations.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/ServiceWorkerContainer
ServiceWorkerContainer.controller	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The controller read-only property of the ServiceWorkerContainer interface returns a ServiceWorker object if its state is activated (the same object returned by ServiceWorkerRegistration.active). This property returns null if the request is a force refresh (Shift + refresh) or if there is no active worker.</p><pre><code>var myController = navigator.serviceWorker.controller;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/ServiceWorkerContainer/controller
ServiceWorkerContainer.getRegistration()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The getRegistration() method of the ServiceWorkerContainer interface gets a ServiceWorkerRegistration object whose scope URL matches the provided document URL.  The method returns a Promise that resolves to a ServiceWorkerRegistration or undefined.</p><pre><code>ServiceWorkerContainer.getRegistration(scope).then(function(ServiceWorkerRegistration) { ... });</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/ServiceWorkerContainer/getRegistration
ServiceWorkerContainer.getRegistrations()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The getRegistrations() method of the ServiceWorkerContainer interface returns all ServiceWorkerRegistration s associated with a ServiceWorkerContainer in an array.  If the method can't return ServiceWorkerRegistration s, it returns a Promise.</p><pre><code>ServiceWorkerContainer.getRegistrations().then(function(ServiceWorkerRegistrations) { ... });</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/ServiceWorkerContainer/getRegistrations
ServiceWorkerContainer.oncontrollerchange	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The oncontrollerchange property of the ServiceWorkerContainer interface is an event handler fired whenever a controllerchange event occurs — when the document's associated ServiceWorkerRegistration acquires a new ServiceWorkerRegistration.active worker.</p><pre><code>ServiceWorkerContainer.oncontrollerchange = function(controllerchangeevent) { ... }</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/ServiceWorkerContainer/oncontrollerchange
ServiceWorkerContainer.onerror	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The onerror property of the ServiceWorkerContainer interface is an event handler fired whenever an error event occurs in the associated service workers.</p><pre><code>ServiceWorkerContainer.onerror = function(errorevent) { ... }</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/ServiceWorkerContainer/onerror
ServiceWorkerContainer.onmessage	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The onmessage property of the ServiceWorkerContainer interface is an event handler fired whenever a message event occurs — when incoming messages are received to the ServiceWorkerContainer object (e.g., via a MessagePort.postMessage() call).</p><pre><code>ServiceWorkerContainer.onmessage = function(messageevent) { ... }</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/ServiceWorkerContainer/onmessage
ServiceWorkerContainer.ready	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The ready read-only property of the ServiceWorkerContainer interface defines whether a service worker is ready to control a page or not. It returns a Promise that will never reject, which resolves to a ServiceWorkerRegistration with an ServiceWorkerRegistration.active worker.</p><pre><code>navigator.serviceWorker.ready.then(function(serviceWorkerRegistration) { ... });</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/ServiceWorkerContainer/ready
ServiceWorkerContainer.register()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The register() method of the ServiceWorkerContainer interface creates or updates a ServiceWorkerRegistration for the given scriptURL.</p><pre><code>ServiceWorkerContainer.register(scriptURL, options)\n  .then(function(ServiceWorkerRegistration) { ... });</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/ServiceWorkerContainer/register
ServiceWorkerGlobalScope.caches	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The ServiceWorkerGlobalScope.caches read-only property returns the CacheStorage object associated with the service worker.</p><pre><code>var myCacheStorage = self.caches;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/ServiceWorkerGlobalScope/caches
ServiceWorkerGlobalScope.clients	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The clients read-only property of the ServiceWorkerGlobalScope interface returns the Clients object associated with the service worker.</p><pre><code>swClients = self.clients \n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/ServiceWorkerGlobalScope/clients
ServiceWorkerGlobalScope.onactivate	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The onactivate property of the ServiceWorkerGlobalScope interface is an event handler fired whenever an activate event occurs (when the service worker activates). This happens after installation, when the page to be controlled by the service worker refreshes.</p><pre><code>ServiceWorkerGlobalScope.onactivate = function(event) { ... };\nServiceWorkerGlobalScope.addEventListener('activate', function(event) { ... });</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/ServiceWorkerGlobalScope/onactivate
