ServiceWorkerGlobalScope.onfetch	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The onfetch property of the ServiceWorkerGlobalScope interface is an event handler fired whenever a fetch event occurs (usually when the ServiceWorkerGlobalScope.fetch method is called.)</p><pre><code>ServiceWorkerGlobalScope.onfetch = function(FetchEvent) { ... }</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/ServiceWorkerGlobalScope/onfetch
ServiceWorkerGlobalScope.oninstall	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The oninstall property of the ServiceWorkerGlobalScope interface is an event handler fired whenever an install event occurs (when the service worker installs). This happens before activation.</p><pre><code>ServiceWorkerGlobalScope.oninstall = function(event) { ... };\nServiceWorkerGlobalScope.addEventListener('install', function(event) { ... });</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/ServiceWorkerGlobalScope/oninstall
ServiceWorkerGlobalScope.onmessage	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The ServiceWorkerGlobalScope.onmessage event of the ServiceWorkerGlobalScope interface is called whenever incoming messages are received.</p><pre><code>ServiceWorkerGlobalScope.onmessage = function(MessageEvent) { ... }</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/ServiceWorkerGlobalScope/onmessage
ServiceWorkerGlobalScope.onnotificationclick	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The ServiceWorkerGlobalScope.onnotificationclick property is an event handler called whenever the notificationclick event is dispatched on the ServiceWorkerGlobalScope object, that is when a user clicks on a displayed notification spawned by ServiceWorkerRegistration.showNotification().</p><pre><code>ServiceWorkerGlobalScope.onnotificationclick = function(NotificationEvent) { ... };\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/ServiceWorkerGlobalScope/onnotificationclick
onnotificationclose	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The ServiceWorkerGlobalScope.onnotificationclose property is an event handler called whenever the notificationclose event is dispatched on the ServiceWorkerGlobalScope object, that is when a user closes a displayed notification spawned by ServiceWorkerRegistration.showNotification().</p><pre><code>ServiceWorkerGlobalScope.onnotificationclose = function(NotificationEvent) { ... };\nServiceWorkerGlobalScope.addEventListener('notificationclose', function(NotificationEvent) { ... });</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/ServiceWorkerGlobalScope/onnotificationclose
ServiceWorkerGlobalScope.onpush	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The ServiceWorkerGlobalScope.onpush event of the ServiceWorkerGlobalScope interface is fired whenever a push message is received by a service worker via a push server.</p><pre><code>ServiceWorkerGlobalScope.onpush = function(PushEvent) { ... }\nself.addEventListener('push', function(PushEvent) { ... })\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/ServiceWorkerGlobalScope/onpush
ServiceWorkerGlobalScope.onpushsubscriptionchange	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The ServiceWorkerGlobalScope.onpushsubscriptionchange event of the ServiceWorkerGlobalScope interface is fired whenever a push subscription has been invalidated (or is about to become so). This offers an opportunity to resubscribe in order to continue receiving push messages, if desired. This might happen if, for example, the push service sets an expiration time a subscription.</p><pre><code>ServiceWorkerGlobalScope.onpushsubscriptionchange = function() { ... }\nself.addEventListener('pushsubscriptionchange', function() { ... })\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/ServiceWorkerGlobalScope/onpushsubscriptionchange
ServiceWorkerGlobalScope.onsync	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The ServiceWorkerGlobalScope.onsync event of the ServiceWorkerGlobalScope interface is fired whenever a SyncEvent event occurs. This is triggered when a call to SyncManager.register is made from a service worker client page. The attempt to sync is made either immediately if the network is available or as soon as the network becomes available.</p><pre><code>ServiceWorkerGlobalScope.onsync = function(SyncEvent) { ... }\nself.addEventListener('sync', function(SyncEvent) { ... })</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/ServiceWorkerGlobalScope/onsync
ServiceWorkerGlobalScope.registration	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The registration read-only property of the ServiceWorkerGlobalScope interface returns a reference to the ServiceWorkerRegistration object, which represents the service worker's registration.</p><pre><code>serviceWorkerRegistration = self.registration\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/ServiceWorkerGlobalScope/registration
ServiceWorkerGlobalScope.skipWaiting()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The ServiceWorkerGlobalScope.skipWaiting() method of the ServiceWorkerGlobalScope forces the waiting service worker to become the active service worker.</p><pre><code>ServiceWorkerGlobalScope.skipWaiting().then(function() {\n&#160; //Do something\n});</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/ServiceWorkerGlobalScope/skipWaiting
ServiceWorkerMessageEvent	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The ServiceWorkerMessageEvent interface of the ServiceWorker API contains information about an event sent to a ServiceWorkerContainer target. This extends the default message event to allow setting a ServiceWorker object as the source of a message. The event object is accessed via the handler function of a message event, when fired by a message received from a service worker.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/ServiceWorkerMessageEvent
ServiceWorkerMessageEvent.data	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The data read-only property of the ServiceWorkerMessageEvent interface returns the event's data. It can be any data type.</p><pre><code>var myData = ServiceWorkerMessageEventInstance.data;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/ServiceWorkerMessageEvent/data
ServiceWorkerMessageEvent.lastEventId	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The lastEventID read-only property of the ServiceWorkerMessageEvent interface represents, in server-sent events, the last event ID of the event source.</p><pre><code>var myLastEventId = ServiceWorkerMessageEventInstance.lastEventId;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/ServiceWorkerMessageEvent/lastEventId
ServiceWorkerMessageEvent.origin	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The origin read-only property of the ServiceWorkerMessageEvent interface returns the origin of the service worker's environment settings object.</p><pre><code>var myOrigin = ServiceWorkerMessageEventInstance.origin;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/ServiceWorkerMessageEvent/origin
ServiceWorkerMessageEvent.ports	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The ports read-only property of the ServiceWorkerMessageEvent interface returns an array of MessagePort objects connected with the message channel the message is being sent through.</p><pre><code>var myPorts = ServiceWorkerMessageEventInstance.ports;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/ServiceWorkerMessageEvent/ports
ServiceWorkerMessageEvent.ServiceWorkerMessageEvent()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The ServiceWorkerMessageEvent() constructor creates a new ServiceWorkerMessageEvent object instance.</p><pre><code>var mySWME = new ServiceWorkerMessageEvent(type, init);</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/ServiceWorkerMessageEvent/ServiceWorkerMessageEvent
ServiceWorkerMessageEvent.source	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The source read-only property of the ServiceWorkerMessageEvent returns a reference to the ServiceWorker object of the associated service worker that sent the message.</p><pre><code>var mySource = ServiceWorkerMessageEventInstance.source;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/ServiceWorkerMessageEvent/source
ServiceWorkerRegistration	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The ServiceWorkerRegistion interface of the ServiceWorker API represents the service worker registration. You register a service worker to control one or more pages that share the same origin.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/ServiceWorkerRegistration
ServiceWorkerRegistration.active	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The active property of the ServiceWorkerRegistration interface returns a service worker whose ServiceWorker.state is activating or activated. This property is initially set to null.</p><pre><code>sw = ServiceWorker.active \n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/ServiceWorkerRegistration/active
ServiceWorkerRegistration.getNotifications()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The getNotifications() method of the ServiceWorkerRegistration interface returns a list of the notifications that have been fired from the current service worker.</p><pre><code>&#8203;ServiceWorkerRegistration.getNotifications(options).then(function(NotificationsList) { ... });</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/ServiceWorkerRegistration/getNotifications
ServiceWorkerRegistration.installing	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The installing property of the ServiceWorkerRegistration interface returns a service worker whose ServiceWorker.state is installing. This property is initially set to null.</p><pre><code>sw = ServiceWorker.installing \n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/ServiceWorkerRegistration/installing
ServiceWorkerRegistration.onupdatefound	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The onupdatefound property of the ServiceWorkerRegistration interface is an EventListener property called whenever an event of type statechange is fired; it is fired any time the ServiceWorkerRegistration.installing property acquires a new service worker.</p><pre><code>ServiceWorkerRegistration.onupdatefound = function() { ... };</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/ServiceWorkerRegistration/onupdatefound
ServiceWorkerRegistration.periodicSync	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The periodicSync read-only property of the ServiceWorkerRegistration interface returns a reference to the PeriodicSyncManager interface, which manages periodic background synchronization processes.</p><pre><code>myPeriodicSync = ServiceWorker.periodicSync \n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/ServiceWorkerRegistration/periodicSync
ServiceWorkerRegistration.pushManager	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The pushManager property of the ServiceWorkerRegistration interface returns a reference to the PushManager interface for managing push subscriptions; this includes support for subscribing, getting an active subscription, and accessing push permission status.</p><pre><code>myPushManager = ServiceWorker.pushManager \n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/ServiceWorkerRegistration/pushManager
ServiceWorkerRegistration.scope	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The scope read-only property of the ServiceWorkerRegistration interface returns a unique identifier for a service worker registration. The service worker must be on the same origin as the document that registers the ServiceWorker.</p><pre><code>swScope = ServiceWorkerRegistration.scope;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/ServiceWorkerRegistration/scope
ServiceWorkerRegistration.showNotification()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The showNotification() method of the ServiceWorkerRegistration interface creates a notification on an active service worker.</p><pre><code>&#8203;ServiceWorkerRegistration.showNotification(title, [options]).then(function(NotificationEvent) { ... });</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/ServiceWorkerRegistration/showNotification
ServiceWorkerRegistration.sync	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The sync property of the ServiceWorkerRegistration interface returns a reference to the SyncManager interface, which manages background synchronization processes.</p><pre><code>mySyncManager = ServiceWorker.sync\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/ServiceWorkerRegistration/sync
ServiceWorkerRegistration.unregister()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The unregister method of the ServiceWorkerRegistration interface unregisters the service worker registration and returns a Promise. The promise will resolve to false if no registration was found, otherwise it resolves to true irrespective of whether unregistration happened or not (it may not unregister if someone else just called ServiceWorkerContainer.register with the same scope.) The service worker will finish any ongoing operations before it is unregistered.</p><pre><code>ServiceWorkerRegistration.unregister().then(function(boolean) {\n});</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/ServiceWorkerRegistration/unregister
ServiceWorkerRegistration.update()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The update method of the ServiceWorkerRegistration interface attempts to update the service worker. It fetches the worker's script URL, and if the new worker is not byte-by-byte identical to the current worker, it installs the new worker. The fetch of the worker bypasses any browser caches if the previous fetch occurred over 24 hours ago.</p><pre><code>ServiceWorkerRegistration.update();</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/ServiceWorkerRegistration/update
ServiceWorkerRegistration.waiting	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The waiting property of the ServiceWorkerRegistration interface returns a service worker whose ServiceWorker.state is installed. This property is initially set to null.</p><pre><code>sw = ServiceWorker.waiting \n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/ServiceWorkerRegistration/waiting
ServiceWorkerState	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The ServiceWorkerState is associated with its ServiceWorker 's state.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/ServiceWorkerState
Service Worker API	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>A service worker is an event-driven worker registered against an origin and a path. It takes the form of a JavaScript file that can control the web page/site it is associated with, intercepting and modifying navigation and resource requests, and caching resources in a very granular fashion to give you complete control over how your app behaves in certain situations (the most obvious one being when the network is not available.)</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Service_Worker_API
Using Service Workers	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>One overriding problem that web users have suffered with for years is loss of connectivity. The best web app in the world will provide a terrible user experience if you can’t download it. There have been various attempts to create technologies to solve this problem, as our Offline page shows, and some of the issues have been solved. But the overriding problem is that there still isn’t a good overall control mechanism for asset caching and custom network requests. The previous attempt — AppCache — seemed to be a good idea because it allowed you to specify assets to cache really easily. However, it made many assumptions about what you were trying to do and then broke horribly when your app didn’t follow those assumptions exactly. Read Jake Archibald's Application Cache is a Douchebag for more details.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Service_Worker_API/Using_Service_Workers
ShadowRoot	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The ShadowRoot interface of the Shadow DOM API is the root node of a DOM subtree that is rendered separately from a document's main DOM tree.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/ShadowRoot
ShadowRoot.host	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The host read-only property of the ShadowRoot returns the DOM element to which the ShadowRoot is attatched.</p><pre><code>var element = shadowRoot.host</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/ShadowRoot/host
ShadowRoot.innerHTML	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The innerHTML property of the ShadowRoot interface sets or returns the DOM tree inside the ShadowRoot.</p><pre><code>var domString = shadowRoot.innerHTML\nshadowRoot.innerHTML = domString\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/ShadowRoot/innerHTML
SharedKeyframeList	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The SharedKeyframeList interface of the Web Animations API represents a sequence of keyframes that can be shared between KeyframeEffect objects.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/SharedKeyframeList
SharedKeyframeList.SharedKeyframeList()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The SharedKeyframeList() constructor of the SharedKeyframeList interface creates a new SharedKeyframeList object that can be shared across multiple KeyframeEffect objects.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/SharedKeyframeList/SharedKeyframeList
SharedWorker	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The SharedWorker interface represents a specific kind of worker that can be accessed from several browsing contexts, such as several windows, iframes or even workers. They implement an interface different than dedicated workers and have a different global scope, SharedWorkerGlobalScope.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/SharedWorker
SharedWorker.port	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The port property of the SharedWorker interface returns a MessagePort object used to communicate and control the shared worker.</p><pre><code>myWorker.port;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/SharedWorker/port
SharedWorker()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The SharedWorker() constructor creates a SharedWorker object that executes the script at the specified URL. This script must obey the same-origin policy.</p><pre><code>var myWorker = new SharedWorker("aURL", name);</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/SharedWorker/SharedWorker
SharedWorkerGlobalScope.applicationCache	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The applicationCache read-only property of the SharedWorkerGlobalScope interface returns the ApplicationCache object for the worker (see Using the application cache).</p><pre><code>var nameObj = self.applicationCache;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/SharedWorkerGlobalScope/applicationCache
SharedWorkerGlobalScope.name	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The name read-only property of the SharedWorkerGlobalScope interface returns the name that the SharedWorker was (optionally) given when it was created. This is the name that the SharedWorker() constructor can pass to get a reference to the SharedWorkerGlobalScope.</p><pre><code>var nameObj = self.name;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/SharedWorkerGlobalScope/name
SharedWorkerGlobalScope.onconnect	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The onconnect property of the SharedWorkerGlobalScope interface is an EventHandler representing the code to be called when the connect event is raised — that is, when a MessagePort connection is opened between the associated SharedWorker and the main thread.</p><pre><code>onconnect = function() { ... };</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/SharedWorkerGlobalScope/onconnect
SourceBuffer	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The SourceBuffer interface represents a chunk of media to be passed into an HTMLMediaElement and played, via a MediaSource object. This can be made up of one or several media segments.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/SourceBuffer
SourceBuffer.abort()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The abort() method of the SourceBuffer interface aborts the current segment and resets the segment parser.</p><pre><code>sourceBuffer.abort();\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/SourceBuffer/abort
SourceBuffer.appendBuffer()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The appendBuffer() method of the SourceBuffer interface appends media segment data from an ArrayBuffer or ArrayBufferView object to the SourceBuffer.</p><pre><code>sourceBuffer.appendBuffer(ArrayBuffer);\nsourceBuffer.appendBuffer(ArrayBufferView);\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/SourceBuffer/appendBuffer
SourceBuffer.appendStream()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The appendStream() method of the SourceBuffer interface appends media segment data from a ReadableStream object to the SourceBuffer.</p><pre><code>sourceBuffer.appendStream(stream, maxSize);\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/SourceBuffer/appendStream
SourceBuffer.appendWindowEnd	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The appendWindowEnd property of the SourceBuffer interface controls the timestamp for the end of the append window, a timestamp range that can be used to filter what media data is appended to the SourceBuffer. Coded media frames with timestamps wthin this range will be appended, whereas those outside the range will be filtered out.</p><pre><code>var myAppendWindowEnd = sourceBuffer.appendWindowEnd;\n\nsourceBuffer.appendWindowEnd = 120.0;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/SourceBuffer/appendWindowEnd
SourceBuffer.appendWindowStart	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The appendWindowStart property of the SourceBuffer interface controls the timestamp for the start of the append window, a timestamp range that can be used to filter what media data is appended to the SourceBuffer. Coded media frames with timestamps wthin this range will be appended, whereas those outside the range will be filtered out.</p><pre><code>var myAppendWindowStart = sourceBuffer.appendWindowStart;\n\nsourceBuffer.appendWindowStart = 2.0;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/SourceBuffer/appendWindowStart
SourceBuffer.audioTracks	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The audioTracks read-only property of the SourceBuffer interface returns a list of the audio tracks currently contained inside the SourceBuffer.</p><pre><code>var myAudioTracks = sourceBuffer.audioTracks;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/SourceBuffer/audioTracks
SourceBuffer.buffered	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The buffered read-only property of the SourceBuffer interface returns the time ranges that are currently buffered in the SourceBuffer.</p><pre><code>var myBufferedRange = sourceBuffer.buffered;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/SourceBuffer/buffered
SourceBuffer.mode	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The mode property of the SourceBuffer interface controls whether media segments can be appended to the SourceBuffer in any order, or in a strict sequence.</p><pre><code>var myMode = sourceBuffer.mode;\n\nsourceBuffer.mode = 'sequence';\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/SourceBuffer/mode
SourceBuffer.remove()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The remove() method of the SourceBuffer interface removes media segments within a specific time range from the SourceBuffer.</p><pre><code>sourceBuffer.remove(start, end);\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/SourceBuffer/remove
SourceBuffer.textTracks	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The textTracks read-only property of the SourceBuffer interface returns a list of the text tracks currently contained inside the SourceBuffer.</p><pre><code>var myTextTracks = sourceBuffer.textTracks;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/SourceBuffer/textTracks
SourceBuffer.timestampOffset	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The timestampOffset property of the SourceBuffer interface controls the offset applied to timestamps inside media segments that are appended to the SourceBuffer.</p><pre><code>var myOffset = sourceBuffer.timestampOffset;\n\nsourceBuffer.timestampOffset = 2.5;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/SourceBuffer/timestampOffset
SourceBuffer.trackDefaults	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The trackDefaults property of the SourceBuffer interface specifies the default values to use if kind, label, and/or language information is not available in the initialization segment of the media to be appended to the SourceBuffer.</p><pre><code>var myTrackDefaults = sourceBuffer.trackDefaults;\n\nsourceBuffer.trackDefaults = myTrackDefaultList;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/SourceBuffer/trackDefaults
SourceBuffer.updating	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The updating read-only property of the SourceBuffer interface indicates whether the SourceBuffer is currently being updated — i.e. whether an SourceBuffer.appendBuffer(), SourceBuffer.appendStream(), or SourceBuffer.remove() operation is currently in progress.</p><pre><code>var isUpdating = sourceBuffer.updating;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/SourceBuffer/updating
SourceBuffer.videoTracks	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The videoTracks read-only property of the SourceBuffer interface returns a list of the video tracks currently contained inside the SourceBuffer.</p><pre><code>var myVideoTracks = sourceBuffer.videoTracks;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/SourceBuffer/videoTracks

SourceBufferList.length	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The length read-only property of the SourceBufferList interface returns the number of SourceBuffer objects in the list.</p><pre><code>var myListLength = SourceBufferList.length;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/SourceBufferList/length
SourceBufferList.SourceBuffer()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The SourceBuffer() getter method of the SourceBufferList interface allows the SourceBuffer objects in the list to be accessed with an array operator (i.e. [].)</p><pre><code>var mySourceBuffer = SourceBufferList[index];</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/SourceBufferList/SourceBuffer

SpeechRecognition	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The SpeechRecognition interface of the Web Speech API is the controller interface for the recognition service; this also handles the SpeechRecognitionEvent sent from the recognition service.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/SpeechRecognition
SpeechRecognition.abort()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The abort() method of the Web Speech API stops the speech recognition service from listening to incoming audio, and doesn't attempt to return a SpeechRecognitionResult.</p><pre><code>mySpeechRecognition.abort();</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/SpeechRecognition/abort
SpeechRecognition.continuous	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The continuous property of the SpeechRecognition interface controls whether continuous results are returned for each recognition, or only a single result.</p><pre><code>var myContinuous = mySpeechRecognition.continuous;\nmySpeechRecognition.continuous = true;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/SpeechRecognition/continuous

SpeechRecognition.interimResults	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The interimResults property of the SpeechRecognition interface controls whether interim results should be returned (true) or not (false.) Interim results are results that are not yet final (e.g. the SpeechRecognitionResult.isFinal property is false.)</p><pre><code>var myInterimResult = mySpeechRecognition.interimResults;\nmySpeechRecognition.interimResults = false;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/SpeechRecognition/interimResults
SpeechRecognition.lang	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The lang property of the SpeechRecognition interface returns and sets the language of the current SpeechRecognition. If not specified, this defaults to the HTML lang attribute value, or the user agent's language setting if that isn't set either.</p><pre><code>var myLang = mySpeechRecognition.lang;\nmySpeechRecognition.lang = 'en-US';\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/SpeechRecognition/lang
SpeechRecognition.maxAlternatives	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The maxAlternatives property of the SpeechRecognition interface sets the maximum number of SpeechRecognitionAlternative s provided per SpeechRecognitionResult.</p><pre><code>var myMaxAlternativeNumber = mySpeechRecognition.maxAlternatives;\nmySpeechRecognition.maxAlternatives = 2;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/SpeechRecognition/maxAlternatives

SpeechRecognition.onnomatch	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The onnomatch property of the SpeechRecognition interface represents an event handler that will run when the speech recognition service returns a final result with no significant recognition (when the nomatch event fires.)</p><pre><code>mySpeechRecognition.onnomatch = function() { ... };\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/SpeechRecognition/onnomatch
SpeechRecognition.onresult	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The onresult property of the SpeechRecognition interface represents an event handler that will run when the speech recognition service returns a result — a word or phrase has been positively recognized and this has been communicated back to the app (when the result event fires.)</p><pre><code>mySpeechRecognition.onresult = function() { ... };\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/SpeechRecognition/onresult
SpeechRecognition.onsoundend	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The onsoundend property of the SpeechRecognition interface represents an event handler that will run when any sound — recognisable speech or not — has stopped being detected (when the soundend event fires.)</p><pre><code>mySpeechRecognition.onsoundend = function() { ... };\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/SpeechRecognition/onsoundend

SpeechRecognition.serviceURI	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The serviceURI property of the SpeechRecognition interface specifies the location of the speech recognition service used by the current SpeechRecognition to handle the actual recognition. The default is the user agent's default speech service.</p><pre><code>var myServiceURI = mySpeechRecognition.serviceURI;\nmySpeechRecognition.serviceURI = 'path/to/my/service/';\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/SpeechRecognition/serviceURI

SpeechRecognition.stop()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The start() method of the Web Speech API stops the speech recognition service from listening to incoming audio, and attempts to return a SpeechRecognitionResult using the audio captured so far.</p><pre><code>mySpeechRecognition.stop();</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/SpeechRecognition/stop

SpeechRecognitionEvent	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The SpeechRecognitionEvent interface of the Web Speech API represents the event object for the result and nomatch events, and contains all the data associated with an interim or final speech recognition result.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/SpeechRecognitionEvent
SpeechRecognitionEvent.emma	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The emma read-only property of the SpeechRecognitionEvent interface returns an E xtensible MultiModal Annotation markup language (EMMA) — XML — representation of the result.</p><pre><code>var myEmma = event.emma;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/SpeechRecognitionEvent/emma
SpeechRecognitionEvent.interpretation	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The interpretation read-only property of the SpeechRecognitionEvent interface returns the semantic meaning of what the user said.</p><pre><code>var myInterpretation = event.interpretation;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/SpeechRecognitionEvent/interpretation
SpeechRecognitionEvent.resultIndex	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The resultIndex read-only property of the SpeechRecognitionEvent interface returns the lowest index value result in the SpeechRecognitionResultList "array" that has actually changed.</p><pre><code>var myResultIndex = event.resultIndex;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/SpeechRecognitionEvent/resultIndex

SpeechRecognitionResult	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The SpeechRecognitionResult interface of the Web Speech API represents a single recognition match, which may contain multiple SpeechRecognitionAlternative objects.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/SpeechRecognitionResult
SpeechRecognitionResult.isFinal	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The isFinal read-only property of the SpeechRecognitionResult interface is a Boolean that states whether this result is final (true) or not (false) — if so, then this is the final time this result will be returned; if not, then this result is an interim result, and may be updated later on.</p><pre><code>var myIsFinal = speechRecognitionResultInstance.isFinal;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/SpeechRecognitionResult/isFinal

SpeechRecognitionResult.length	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The length read-only property of the SpeechRecognitionResult interface returns the length of the "array" — the number of SpeechRecognitionAlternative objects contained in the result (also referred to as "n-best alternatives".)</p><pre><code>var myLength = speechRecognitionResultInstance.length;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/SpeechRecognitionResult/length

SpeechSynthesis	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The SpeechSynthesis interface of the Web Speech API is the controller interface for the speech service; this can be used to retrieve information about the synthesis voices available on the device, start and pause speech, and other commands besides.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/SpeechSynthesis

SpeechSynthesis.resume()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The resume() method of the SpeechSynthesis interface puts the SpeechSynthesis object into a non-paused state: resumes it if it was already paused.</p><pre><code>speechSynthesisInstance.resume();\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/SpeechSynthesis/resume
SpeechSynthesis.speak()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The speak() method of the SpeechSynthesis interface adds an utterance to the utterance queue; it will be spoken when any other utterances queued before it have been spoken.</p><pre><code>speechSynthesisInstance.speak(utterance);\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/SpeechSynthesis/speak
SpeechSynthesis.speaking	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The speaking read-only property of the SpeechSynthesis interface is a Boolean that returns true if an utterance is currently in the process of being spoken — even if SpeechSynthesis is in a paused state.</p><pre><code>var amISpeaking = speechSynthesisInstance.speaking;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/SpeechSynthesis/speaking

A style sheet may be disabled by manually setting this property to true or if it's an inactive alternative style sheet. Note that disabled == false does not guarantee the style sheet is applied (it could be removed from the document, for instance).</p><pre><code>bool = stylesheet.disabled \n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/StyleSheet/disabled

SubtleCrypto	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The SubtleCrypto interface represents a set of cryptographic primitives. It is available via the Crypto.subtle properties available in a window context (via Window.crypto).</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/SubtleCrypto
SubtleCrypto.decrypt()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The SubtleCrypto.decrypt() method returns a Promise of the cleartext corresponding to the ciphertext, algorithm and key given as parameters.</p><pre><code>var result = crypto.decrypt(algo, key, ciphertext);\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/SubtleCrypto/decrypt
SubtleCrypto.deriveKey()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The SubtleCrypto.deriveKey() method returns a Promise of a newly generated CryptoKey derivated from a master key and a specific algorithm given as parameters.</p><pre><code>var result = crypto.deriveKey(algo, masterKey, derivedKeyAlgo, extractable, keyUsages);\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/SubtleCrypto/deriveKey
SubtleCrypto.digest()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The SubtleCrypto.digest() method returns a Promise of a digest generated from the hash function and text given as parameters.</p><pre><code>var hash = crypto.subtle.digest(algo, buffer);\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/SubtleCrypto/digest
SubtleCrypto.encrypt()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The SubtleCrypto.encrypt() method returns a Promise of the encrypted data corresponding to the cleartext, algorithm and key given as parameters.</p><pre><code>var result = crypto.encrypt(algo, key, cleartext);\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/SubtleCrypto/encrypt
SubtleCrypto.exportKey()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The SubtleCrypto.exportKey() method returns a Promise of the key encrypted in the requested format. If the key is not extractable, that is if CryptoKey.extractable returns false, the promise fails with an InvalidAccessError exception; it the format is unknown, the promive fails with a NotSupported exception.</p><pre><code>var result = crypto.exportKey(format, key);\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/SubtleCrypto/exportKey
SubtleCrypto.generateKey()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The SubtleCrypto.generateKey() method returns a Promise of a newly generated CryptoKey, for symmetrical algorithms, or a CryptoKeyPair, containing two newly generated keys, for asymmetrical algorithm, that matches the algorithm, the usages and the extractability given as parameters.</p><pre><code>var result = crypto.generateKey(algo, extractable, keyUsages);\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/SubtleCrypto/generateKey
SubtleCrypto.importKey()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The SubtleCrypto.importKey() method returns a Promise of the CryptoKey generated from the data given in parameters.</p><pre><code>var result = crypto.importKey(format, keyData, algo, extractable, usages);\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/SubtleCrypto/importKey
SubtleCrypto.sign()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The SubtleCrypto.sign() method returns a Promise containing the signature corresponding to the text, algorithm and key given as parameters.</p><pre><code>var signature = crypto.sign(algo, key, text2sign);\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/SubtleCrypto/sign
SubtleCrypto.unwrapKey()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The SubtleCrypto.unwrapKey() method returns a Promise of a CryptoKey corresponding to the wrapped key given in parameter.</p><pre><code>var result = crypto.unwrapKey(format, wrappedKey, unwrappingKey, unwrapAlgo, unwrappedKeyAlgo, extractable, keyUsages);\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/SubtleCrypto/unwrapKey
SubtleCrypto.verify()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The SubtleCrypto.verify() method returns a Promise of a Boolean value indicating if the signature given as parameter matches the text, algorithm and key also given as parameters.</p><pre><code>var result = crypto.verify(algo, key, signature, text2verify);\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/SubtleCrypto/verify
SubtleCrypto.wrapKey()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The SubtleCrypto.wrapKey() method returns a Promise of a wrapped symmetric key for usage (transfer, storage) in unsecure environments. The wrapped buffer returned is in the format given in parameters, and contained the key wrapped by the give wrapping key with the given algorithm.</p><pre><code>var result = crypto.wrapKey(format, key, wrappingKey, wrapAlgo);\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/SubtleCrypto/wrapKey
SVGAElement	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The SVGAElement interface provides access to the properties of a element, as well as methods to manipulate them.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/SVGAElement
SVGAElement.target	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The SVGAElement.target read-only property of SVGAElement returns an SVGAnimatedString object that specifies the portion of a target window, frame, pane into which a document is to be opened when a link is activated.</p><pre><code>myLink.target = 'value';</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/SVGAElement/SVGAlement.target
SVGAElement.target	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The SVGAElement.target read-only property of SVGAElement returns an SVGAnimatedString object that specifies the portion of a target window, frame, pane into which a document is to be opened when a link is activated.</p><pre><code>myLink.target = 'value';</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/SVGAElement/target
SVGAltGlyphElement	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The SVGAltGlyphElement interface represents an altglyph element. This interface makes it possible to implement more sophisticated and particular glyph characters. For some textal representations as: ligatures (e.g. æ, ß, etc), special-purpose fonts (e.g. musical symbols) or even alternate glyphs such as Asian text strings it is required that a different set of glyphs be used than the normal given character data.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/SVGAltGlyphElement
format	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The SVGAltGlyphElement.format property is a DOMString that defines the format of the given font. It has the same meaning as the 'format' property of SVGGlyphRefElement property. If the font is in one of the formats listed in CSS2([CSS2], section15.3.5), then its value is the corresponding string parameter of the font.</p><pre><code>string = myGlyph.format;\n myGlyph.format = string;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/SVGAltGlyphElement/format
SVGAltGlyphElement.glyphRef	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The SVGAltGlyphElement.glyphRef property is a DOMString representing a glyph identifier. It has the same meaning as the ‘glyphRef’ property on the SVGGlyphRefElement interface of the glyphRef element.</p><pre><code>string = myGlyph.glyphRef;\nmyGlyph.glyphRef = string;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/SVGAltGlyphElement/glyphRef

SVGAnimatedString.animVal	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>AnimVal attribute or animVal property contains the same value as the baseVal property. If the given attribute or property is being animated, contains the current animated value of the attribute or property. If the given attribute or property is not currently being animated, then it contains the same value as baseVal</p><pre><code>var = object.animVal</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/SVGAnimatedString/animVal

SVGCircleElement	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The SVGCircleElement interface is an interface for the circle element. The circle element is defined by the cx and c y attributes, that denote the coordinates of the centre of the circle. It also has a radius attribute r that denotes the radius of the circle. The radius value must be positive to allow the successful rendering of the element.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/SVGCircleElement
cx	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>For the circle and the ellipse elements, this attribute define the x-coordinate of the center of the element. SyncEvent.tag	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The SyncEvent.tag read-only property of the SyncEvent interface returns the developer-defined identifier for this SyncEvent. SyncManager	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The SyncManager interface of the the ServiceWorker API provides an interface for registering and listing sync registrations.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/SyncManager
SyncManager.getTags()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The SyncManager.getTags method of the SyncManager interface returns a list of developer-defined identifiers for SyncManager registrations.</p><pre><code>SyncManager.getTags().then(function(tags[]) { ... })</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/SyncManager/getTags
SyncManager.register()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The SyncManager.register method of the SyncManager interface returns a Promise that resolves to a SyncRegistration instance.</p><pre><code>SyncManager.register([options]).then(function(syncRegistration) { ... })</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/SyncManager/register
SyncRegistration	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The SyncRegistration interface of the the ServiceWorker API provides an object for managing background synchronization.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/SyncRegistration
id	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>tbd</p><pre><code>&#8203;tbd</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/SyncRegistration/id
SyncRegistration.tag	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The tag read-only property of the SyncRegistration interface provides the unique identifier of the specified SyncRegistration object.</p><pre><code>&#8203;var myRegistrationID = SyncRegistration.tag;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/SyncRegistration/tag
unregister	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The unregister() method of the SyncRegistration interface returns a Promise that resolves to a  Boolean indicating whether the SyncRegistration object was unregistered.</p><pre><code>&#160;SyncRegistration.unregister().then(function(Boolean) { ... }):</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/SyncRegistration/unregister
Text	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Text interface represents the textual content of Element or Attr.  If an element has no markup within its content, it has a single child implementing Text that contains the element's text.  However, if the element contains markup, it is parsed into information items and Text nodes that form its children.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Text
HTMLSlotElement.assignedSlot	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The assignedSlot property of the Text interface returns the HTMLSlotElement object associated with the element.</p><pre><code>var htmlSlotElement = Text.assignedSlot</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Text/assignedSlot
Text.splitText()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Text.splitText() method breaks the Text node into two nodes at the specified offset, keeping both nodes in the tree as siblings.</p><pre><code>replacementNode = textnode.splitText(offset) \n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Text/splitText
Text()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Text() constructor returns a newly created Text object with the optional DOMString given in parameter as its textual content.</p><pre><code>text1 = new Text(); // Create an empty text node\ntext2 = new Text("This is a text node");\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Text/Text
Text.wholeText	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Text.wholeText read-only property returns all text of all Text nodes logically adjacent to the node. The text is concatenated in document order.  This allows to specify any text node and obtain all adjacent text as a single string.</p><pre><code>str = textnode.wholeText;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Text/wholeText
TextDecoder	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The TextDecoder interface represents a decoder for a specific method, that is a specific character encoding, like utf-8, iso-8859-2, koi8, cp1261, gbk,... A decoder takes a stream of bytes as input and emits a stream of code points. For a more scalable, non-native library, see StringView – a C-like representation of strings based on typed arrays.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/TextDecoder
TextDecoder.decode()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The TextDecoder.decode method returns a DOMString containing the text, given in parameters, decoded with the specific method for that TextDecoder object.</p><pre><code>b1 = decoder.decode(buffer, options);\nb2 = decoder.decode(buffer);\nb3 = decoder.decode();\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/TextDecoder/decode
TextDecoder.encoding	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The TextDecoder.encoding read-only property returns a DOMString containing the name of the decoding algorithm used by the specific decoder.</p><pre><code>b = decoder.decoding;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/TextDecoder/encoding
TextDecoder()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The TextDecoder() constructor returns a newly created TextDecoder object for the encoding specified in parameter.</p><pre><code>decoder = new TextDecoder(utfLabel, options); \n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/TextDecoder/TextDecoder
TextEncoder	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>TextEncoder takes a stream of code points as input and emits a stream of bytes. For a more scalable, non-native library, see StringView – a C-like representation of strings based on typed arrays.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/TextEncoder
TextEncoder.encode()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The TextEncoder.encode method returns a Uint8Array containing the text given in parameters encoded with the specific method for that TextEncoder object.</p><pre><code>b1 = encoder.encode(buffer, options);\nb2 = encoder.encode(buffer);\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/TextEncoder/encode
TextEncoder.encoding	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The TextEncoder.encoding read-only property returns a DOMString containing the name of the encoding algorithm used by the specific encoder.</p><pre><code>b = encoder.encoding;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/TextEncoder/encoding
TextEncoder()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The TextEncoder() constructor returns a newly created TextEncoder object for the encoding specified in parameter.</p><pre><code>encoder = new TextEncoder(utfLabel); \n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/TextEncoder/TextEncoder
TextMetrics	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The TextMetrics interface represents the dimension of a text in the canvas, as created by the CanvasRenderingContext2D.measureText() method.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/TextMetrics
TextMetrics.width	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The readonly TextMetrics.width property contains the text's advance width (the width of that inline box) in CSS pixels.</p><pre><code>readonly metrics.width;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/TextMetrics/width
TimeEvent	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Extends Event.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/TimeEvent
TimeRanges	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The TimeRanges interface is used to represent a set of time ranges, primarily for the purpose of tracking which portions of media have been buffered when loading it for use by the audio and video elements.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/TimeRanges
TimeRanges.end()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Returns the time offset at which a specified time range ends.</p><pre><code>endTime = TimeRanges.end(index) \n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/TimeRanges/end
TimeRanges.length	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The TimeRanges.length read-only property returns the number of ranges in the object.</p><pre><code>length = TimeRanges.length;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/TimeRanges/length
TimeRanges.start()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Returns the time offset at which a specified time range begins.</p><pre><code>startTime = TimeRanges.start(index) \n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/TimeRanges/start
Touch	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Touch interface represents a single contact point on a touch-sensitive device. The contact point is commonly a finger or stylus and the device may be a touchscreen or trackpad.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Touch
Touch.clientX	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Touch.clientX read-only property returns the X coordinate of the touch point relative to the viewport, not including any scroll offset.</p><pre><code>touchItem.clientX;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Touch/clientX
Touch.clientY	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Touch.clientY read-only property returns the Y coordinate of the touch point relative to the browser's viewport, not including any scroll offset.</p><pre><code>touchItem.clientY;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Touch/clientY
Touch.force	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Touch.force read-only property returns the amount of pressure the user is applying to the touch surface for a Touch point.</p><pre><code>touchItem.force;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Touch/force
Touch.identifier	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Touch.identifier returns a value uniquely identifying this point of contact with the touch surface. This value remains consistent for every event involving this finger's (or stylus's) movement on the surface until it is lifted off the surface.</p><pre><code>touchItem.identifier;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Touch/identifier
Touch.pageX	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Touch.pageX read-only property returns the X coordinate of the touch point relative to the viewport, including any scroll offset.</p><pre><code>touchItem.pageX;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Touch/pageX
Touch.pageY	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Touch.pageY read-only property returns the Y coordinate of the touch point relative to the viewport, including any scroll offset.</p><pre><code>touchItem.pageY;</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Touch/pageY
Touch.radiusX	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Returns the X radius of the ellipse that most closely circumscribes the area of contact with the touch surface. The value is in CSS pixels of the same scale as Touch.screenX.</p><pre><code>var xRadius = touchItem.radiusX;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Touch/radiusX
Touch.radiusY	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Returns the Y radius of the ellipse that most closely circumscribes the area of contact with the touch surface. The value is in CSS pixels of the same scale as Touch.screenX.</p><pre><code>var yRadius = touchItem.radiusY;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Touch/radiusY
Touch.rotationAngle	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Returns the rotation angle, in degrees, of the contact area ellipse defined by Touch.radiusX&#160;and Touch.radiusY. The value may be between 0 and 90. Together, these three values describe an ellipse that approximates the size and shape of the area of contact between the user and the screen. This may be a relatively large ellipse representing the contact between a fingertip and the screen or a small area representing the tip of a stylus, for example.</p><pre><code>var angle = touchItem.rotationAngle;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Touch/rotationAngle
Touch.screenX	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Returns the X coordinate of the touch point relative to the screen, not including any scroll offset.</p><pre><code>var x = touchItem.screenX;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Touch/screenX
Touch.screenY	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Returns the Y coordinate of the touch point relative to the screen, not including any scroll offset.</p><pre><code>var y = touchItem.screenY;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Touch/screenY
Touch.target	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Returns the Element (EventTarget) on which the touch contact started when it was first placed on the surface, even if the touch point has since moved outside the interactive area of that element or even been removed from the document. Note that if the target element is removed from the document, events will still be targeted at it, and hence won't necessarily bubble up to the window or document anymore. If there is any risk of an element being removed while it is being touched, the best practice is to attach the touch listeners directly to the target.</p><pre><code>var el = touchPoint.target;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Touch/target
Touch()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Touch() constructor creates a new Touch object.</p><pre><code> touch = new Touch(touchInit);</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Touch/Touch
TouchEvent	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The TouchEvent interface represents an event sent when the state of contacts with a touch-sensitive surface changes. This surface can be a touch screen or trackpad, for example. The event can describe one or more points of contact with the screen and includes support for detecting movement, addition and removal of contact points, and so forth.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/TouchEvent
TouchEvent.altKey	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>A Boolean value indicating whether or not the alt (Alternate) key is enabled when the touch event is created. If the alt key&#160;is enabled, the attribute's value is true. Otherwise, it is&#160;false.</p><pre><code>var altEnabled = touchEvent.altKey;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/TouchEvent/altKey
TouchEvent.changedTouches	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>A TouchList whose touch points (Touch objects) varies depending on the event type, as follows:</p><pre><code>var changes = touchEvent.changedTouches;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/TouchEvent/changedTouches
TouchEvent.ctrlKey	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>A Boolean value indicating whether the control (Control) key is enabled when the touch event is created.&#160;If&#160;this key is enabled, the attribute's value is true. Otherwise, it is false.</p><pre><code>var ctrlEnabled = touchEvent.ctrlKey;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/TouchEvent/ctrlKey
TouchEvent.metaKey	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>A Boolean value indicating whether or not the Meta key is enabled when the touch event is created. If this key is enabled, the attribute's value is true. Otherwise, it is&#160;false.</p><pre><code>var metaEnabled = touchEvent.metaKey;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/TouchEvent/metaKey
TouchEvent.shiftKey	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>A Boolean value indicating whether or not the shift key is enabled when the touch event is created. If this key is enabled, the attribute's value is true. Otherwise, it is&#160;false.</p><pre><code>var shiftEnabled = touchEvent.shiftKey;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/TouchEvent/shiftKey
TouchEvent.targetTouches	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>A TouchList listing all the Touch objects for touch points that are still in contact with the touch surface and whose touchstart event occurred inside the same target element as the current target element.</p><pre><code>var touches = touchEvent.targetTouches;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/TouchEvent/targetTouches
TouchEvent.touches	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>A TouchList listing all the Touch objects for touch points that are currently in contact with the touch surface, regardless of whether or not they've changed or what their target element was at touchstart time.</p><pre><code>var touches = touchEvent.touches;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/TouchEvent/touches
TouchEvent()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Touch Event() constructor creates a new TouchEvent.</p><pre><code> event = new TouchEvent(typeArg, touchEventInit);</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/TouchEvent/TouchEvent
TouchList	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The TouchList interface represents a list of contact points with a touch surface; for example, if the user has three fingers on the touch surface (such as a screen or trackpad), the corresponding TouchList object would have one Touch object for each finger, for a total of three entries.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/TouchList
TouchList.item()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Returns the Touch object at the specified index in the TouchList.</p><pre><code>var touchPoint = touchList.item(index);\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/TouchList/item
TouchList.length	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>This read-only property indicates the number of items (touch points) in a TouchList.</p><pre><code>var numTouches = touchList.length;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/TouchList/length
Touch events	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>In order to provide quality support for touch-based user interfaces, touch events offer the ability to interpret finger (or stylus) activity on touch screens or trackpads.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Touch_events
Multi-touch interaction	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The touch event interfaces support application-specific single and multi-touch interactions. However, the interfaces can be a bit tricky for programmers to use because touch events are very different from other DOM input events, such as mouse events. The application described in this guide shows how to use touch events for simple single and multi-touch interactions, the basics needed to build application-specific gestures.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Touch_events/Multi-touch_interaction
Supporting both TouchEvent and MouseEvent	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The touch interfaces enable applications to create enhanced user experiences on touch enabled devices. However, the reality is the vast majority of today's web content is designed only to work with mouse input. Consequently, even if a browser supports touch, the browser must still emulate mouse events so content that assumes mouse-only input will work as is without direct modification.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Touch_events/Supporting_both_TouchEvent_and_MouseEvent
Using Touch Events	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Today, most Web content is designed for keyboard and mouse input. However, devices with touch screens (especially portable devices) are mainstream and Web applications can either directly process touch-based input by using Touch Events or the application can use interpreted mouse events for the application input. A disadvantage to using mouse events is that they do not support concurrent user input, whereas touch events support multiple simultaneous inputs (possibly at different locations on the touch surface), thus enhancing user experiences.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Touch_events/Using_Touch_Events
TrackDefault	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The TrackDefault interface provides a SourceBuffer with kind, label, and language information for tracks that do not contain this information in the initialization segments of a media chunk.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/TrackDefault
TrackDefault.byteStreamTrackID	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The byteStreamTrackID read-only property of the TrackDefault interface returns the ID of the specific track that the SourceBuffer should apply to.</p><pre><code>var myID = TrackDefault.byteStreamTrackID;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/TrackDefault/byteStreamTrackID
TrackDefault.kinds	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The kinds read-only property of the TrackDefault interface returns default kinds for an associated SourceBuffer to use when an initialization segment does not contain label information for a new track.</p><pre><code>var mykinds = TrackDefault.kinds;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/TrackDefault/kinds
TrackDefault.label	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The label read-only property of the TrackDefault interface returns the default label for an associated SourceBuffer to use when an initialization segment does not contain label information for a new track.</p><pre><code>var mylabel = TrackDefault.label;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/TrackDefault/label

TrackDefault.type	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The type read-only property of the TrackDefault interface returns the type of track that this SourceBuffer 's media segment data relates to (i.e. audio, video, or text track.)</p><pre><code>var myType = TrackDefault.type;\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/TrackDefault/type
