Date.prototype.setMinutes	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The setMinutes() method sets the minutes for a specified date according to local time.</p><pre><code>Date.prototype.setMinutes (min [, sec [, ms ] ] )</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Date/setMinutes
Date.prototype.setMonth	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The setMonth() method sets the month for a specified date according to the currently set year.</p><pre><code>Date.prototype.setMonth (month [, date ] )</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Date/setMonth
Date.prototype.setSeconds	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The setSeconds() method sets the seconds for a specified date according to local time.</p><pre><code>Date.prototype.setSeconds (sec [, ms ] )</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Date/setSeconds
Date.prototype.setTime	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The setTime() method sets the Date object to the time represented by a number of milliseconds since January 1, 1970, 00:00:00 UTC.</p><pre><code>Date.prototype.setTime (time)</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Date/setTime
Date.prototype.setUTCDate	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The setUTCDate() method sets the day of the month for a specified date according to universal time.</p><pre><code>Date.prototype.setUTCDate (date)</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Date/setUTCDate
Date.prototype.setUTCFullYear	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The setUTCFullYear() method sets the full year for a specified date according to universal time.</p><pre><code>Date.prototype.setUTCFullYear (year [, month [, date ] ] )</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Date/setUTCFullYear
Date.prototype.setUTCHours	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The setUTCHours() method sets the hour for a specified date according to universal time, and returns the number of milliseconds since 1 January 1970 00:00:00 UTC until the time represented by the updated Date instance.</p><pre><code>Date.prototype.setUTCHours (hour [, min [, sec [, ms ] ] ] )</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Date/setUTCHours
Date.prototype.setUTCMilliseconds	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The setUTCMilliseconds() method sets the milliseconds for a specified date according to universal time.</p><pre><code>Date.prototype.setUTCMilliseconds (ms)</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Date/setUTCMilliseconds
Date.prototype.setUTCMinutes	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The setUTCMinutes() method sets the minutes for a specified date according to universal time.</p><pre><code>Date.prototype.setUTCMinutes (min [, sec [, ms ] ] )</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Date/setUTCMinutes
Date.prototype.setUTCMonth	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The setUTCMonth() method sets the month for a specified date according to universal time.</p><pre><code>Date.prototype.setUTCMonth (month [, date ] )</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Date/setUTCMonth
Date.prototype.setUTCSeconds	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The setUTCSeconds() method sets the seconds for a specified date according to universal time.</p><pre><code>Date.prototype.setUTCSeconds (sec [, ms ] )</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Date/setUTCSeconds
Date.prototype.setYear	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The setYear() method sets the year for a specified date according to local time. Because setYear() does not set full years ("year 2000 problem"), it is no longer used and has been replaced by the setFullYear() method.</p><pre><code>Date.prototype.setYear (year)</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Date/setYear
Date.prototype.toDateString	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The toDateString() method returns the date portion of a Date object in human readable form in American English.</p><pre><code>Date.prototype.toDateString ( )</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Date/toDateString
Date.prototype.toGMTString	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The toGMTString() method converts a date to a string, using Internet Greenwich Mean Time (GMT) conventions. The exact format of the value returned by toGMTString() varies according to the platform and browser, in general it should represent a human readable date string.</p><pre><code>Date.prototype.toGMTString ( )</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Date/toGMTString
Date.prototype.toISOString	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The toISOString() method returns a string in simplified extended ISO format (ISO 8601), which is always 24 or 27 characters long (YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:ss.sssZ or ±YYYYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:ss.sssZ, respectively). The timezone is always zero UTC offset, as denoted by the suffix " Z ".</p><pre><code>Date.prototype.toISOString ( )</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Date/toISOString
Date.prototype.toJSON	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The toJSON() method returns a string representation of the Date object.</p><pre><code>Date.prototype.toJSON ( key )</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Date/toJSON
Date.prototype.toLocaleDateString	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The toLocaleDateString() method returns a string with a language sensitive representation of the date portion of this date. The new locales and options arguments let applications specify the language whose formatting conventions should be used and allow to customize the behavior of the function. In older implementations, which ignore the locales and options arguments, the locale used and the form of the string returned are entirely implementation dependent.</p><pre><code>Date.prototype.toLocaleDateString ( )</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Date/toLocaleDateString
Date.prototype.toLocaleFormat()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The non-standard toLocaleFormat() method converts a date to a string using the specified formatting. Intl.DateTimeFormat is an alternative to format dates in a standards-compliant way. See also the newer version of Date.prototype.toLocaleDateString().</p><pre><code>dateObj.toLocaleFormat(formatString)</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Date/toLocaleFormat
Date.prototype.toLocaleString	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The toLocaleString() method returns a string with a language sensitive representation of this date. The new locales and options arguments let applications specify the language whose formatting conventions should be used and customize the behavior of the function. In older implementations, which ignore the locales and options arguments, the locale used and the form of the string returned are entirely implementation dependent.</p><pre><code>Date.prototype.toLocaleString ( )</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Date/toLocaleString
Date.prototype.toLocaleTimeString	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The toLocaleTimeString() method returns a string with a language sensitive representation of the time portion of this date. The new locales and options arguments let applications specify the language whose formatting conventions should be used and customize the behavior of the function. In older implementations, which ignore the locales and options arguments, the locale used and the form of the string returned are entirely implementation dependent.</p><pre><code>Date.prototype.toLocaleTimeString ( )</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Date/toLocaleTimeString
Date.prototype.toSource()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The toSource() method returns a string representing the source code of the object.</p><pre><code>dateObj.toSource()\nDate.toSource()</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Date/toSource
Date.prototype.toString	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The toString() method returns a string representing the specified Date object.</p><pre><code>Date.prototype.toString ( )</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Date/toString
Date.prototype.toTimeString	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The toTimeString() method returns the time portion of a Date object in human readable form in American English.</p><pre><code>Date.prototype.toTimeString ( )</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Date/toTimeString
Date.prototype.toUTCString	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The toUTCString() method converts a date to a string, using the UTC time zone.</p><pre><code>Date.prototype.toUTCString ( )</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Date/toUTCString
Date.UTC	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Date.UTC() method accepts the same parameters as the longest form of the constructor, and returns the number of milliseconds in a Date object since January 1, 1970, 00:00:00, universal time.</p><pre><code>Date.UTC (year, month [, date [, hours [, minutes [, seconds [, ms ] ] ] ] ] )</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Date/UTC
Date.prototype.valueOf	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The valueOf() method returns the primitive value of a Date object.</p><pre><code>Date.prototype.valueOf ( )</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Date/valueOf
Intl.DateTimeFormat	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Intl.DateTimeFormat object is a constructor for objects that enable language sensitive date and time formatting.</p><pre><code>new Intl.DateTimeFormat([locales[, options]])\nIntl.DateTimeFormat.call(this[, locales[, options]])</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/DateTimeFormat
Global.decodeURI	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The decodeURI() function decodes a Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) previously created by encodeURI or by a similar routine.</p><pre><code>Global.decodeURI (encodedURI)</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/decodeURI
Global.decodeURIComponent	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The decodeURIComponent() function decodes a Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) component previously created by encodeURIComponent or by a similar routine.</p><pre><code>Global.decodeURIComponent (encodedURIComponent)</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/decodeURIComponent
Global.encodeURI	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The encodeURI() function encodes a Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) by replacing each instance of certain characters by one, two, three, or four escape sequences representing the UTF-8 encoding of the character (will only be four escape sequences for characters composed of two "surrogate" characters).</p><pre><code>Global.encodeURI (uri)</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/encodeURI
Global.encodeURIComponent	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The encodeURIComponent() function encodes a Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) component by replacing each instance of certain characters by one, two, three, or four escape sequences representing the UTF-8 encoding of the character (will only be four escape sequences for characters composed of two "surrogate" characters).</p><pre><code>Global.encodeURIComponent (uriComponent)</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/encodeURIComponent
Error	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Error constructor creates an error object. Instances of Error objects are thrown when runtime errors occur. The Error object can also be used as a base object for user-defined exceptions. See below for standard built-in error types.</p><pre><code>new Error([message[, fileName[, lineNumber]]])</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Error
Error.prototype.columnNumber	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The columnNumber property contains the column number in the line of the file that raised this error.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Error/columnNumber
error prototype columnnumber	R	Error.prototype.columnNumber										
Error.prototype.fileName	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The fileName property contains the path to the file that raised this error.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Error/fileName
error prototype filename	R	Error.prototype.fileName										
Error.prototype.lineNumber	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The lineNumber property contains the line number in the file that raised this error.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Error/lineNumber
error prototype linenumber	R	Error.prototype.lineNumber										
Error.prototype.message	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The message property is a human-readable description of the error.</p><pre><code>Error.prototype.message</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Error/message
error prototype message	R	Error.prototype.message										
Error.prototype.name	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The name property represents a name for the type of error. The initial value is "Error".</p><pre><code>Error.prototype.name</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Error/name
error prototype name	R	Error.prototype.name										
Error.prototype	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Error.prototype property represents the prototype for the Error constructor.</p><pre><code>Error.prototype</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Error/prototype
error prototype	R	Error.prototype										
Error.prototype.stack	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The non-standard stack property of Error objects offer a trace of which functions were called, in what order, from which line and file, and with what arguments. The stack string proceeds from the most recent calls to earlier ones, leading back to the original global scope call.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Error/Stack
error prototype stack	R	Error.prototype.stack										
Error.prototype.toSource()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The toSource() method returns code that could eval to the same error.</p><pre><code>e.toSource()</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Error/toSource
error prototype tosource()	R	Error.prototype.toSource()

error prototype tostring	R	Error.prototype.toString										
Global.escape	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The deprecated escape() function computes a new string in which certain characters have been replaced by a hexadecimal escape sequence. Use encodeURI or encodeURIComponent instead.</p><pre><code>Global.escape (string)</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/escape
Global.eval	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The eval() function evaluates JavaScript code represented as a string.</p><pre><code>Global.eval (x)</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/eval
EvalError	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The EvalError object indicates an error regarding the global eval() function. This exception is not thrown by JavaScript anymore, however the EvalError object remains for compatibility.</p><pre><code>new EvalError([message[, fileName[, lineNumber]]])</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/EvalError
Float32Array	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Float32Array typed array represents an array of 32-bit floating point numbers (corresponding to the C float data type) in the platform byte order. If control over byte order is needed, use DataView instead. The contents are initialized to 0. Once established, you can reference elements in the array using the object's methods, or using standard array index syntax (that is, using bracket notation).</p><pre><code>new Float32Array(length);\nnew Float32Array(typedArray);\nnew Float32Array(object);\nnew Float32Array(buffer [, byteOffset [, length]]);</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Float32Array
SIMD.Float32x4	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The SIMD.Float32x4 data type is a 128-bit vector divided into 4 lanes storing single precision floating point values.</p><pre><code>SIMD.Float32x4(x, y, z, w);</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Float32x4
Float64Array	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Float64Array typed array represents an array of 64-bit floating point numbers (corresponding to the C double data type) in the platform byte order. If control over byte order is needed, use DataView instead. The contents are initialized to 0. Once established, you can reference elements in the array using the object's methods, or using standard array index syntax (that is, using bracket notation).</p><pre><code>new Float64Array(length);\nnew Float64Array(typedArray);\nnew Float64Array(object);\nnew Float64Array(buffer [, byteOffset [, length]]);</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Float64Array
SIMD.Float64x2	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The SIMD.Float64x2 data type is a 128-bit vector divided into 2 lanes storing double precision floating point values.</p><pre><code>SIMD.Float64x2(x, y);</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Float64x2
Function	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Function constructor creates a new Function object. In JavaScript every function is actually a Function object.</p><pre><code>new Function ([arg1[, arg2[, ...argN]],] functionBody)</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Function
Function.prototype.apply	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The apply() method calls a function with a given this value and arguments provided as an array (or an array-like object).</p><pre><code>Function.prototype.apply (thisArg, argArray)</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Function/apply
Function.arguments	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The function.arguments property refers to an an array-like object corresponding to the arguments passed to a function. Use the simple variable arguments instead.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Function/arguments
Function.prototype.bind	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The bind() method creates a new function that, when called, has its this keyword set to the provided value, with a given sequence of arguments preceding any provided when the new function is called.</p><pre><code>Function.prototype.bind (thisArg [, arg1 [, arg2, …]])</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Function/bind
Function.prototype.call	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The call() method calls a function with a given this value and arguments provided individually.</p><pre><code>Function.prototype.call (thisArg [ , arg1 [ , arg2, … ] ] )</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Function/call
Function.caller	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The function.caller property returns the function that invoked the specified function.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Function/caller
Function.displayName	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The function.displayName property returns the display name of the function.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Function/displayName

Generator	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Generator object is returned by a generator function and it conforms to both the iterable protocol and the iterator protocol.</p><pre><code>function* gen() { \n  yield 1;\n  yield 2;\n  yield 3;\n}\n\nvar g = gen(); // "Generator { }"</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Generator
GeneratorFunction	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The GeneratorFunction constructor creates a new generator function object. In JavaScript every generator function is actually a GeneratorFunction object.</p><pre><code>new GeneratorFunction ([arg1[, arg2[, ...argN]],] functionBody)</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/GeneratorFunction

Int16Array	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Int16Array typed array represents an array of twos-complement 16-bit signed integers in the platform byte order. If control over byte order is needed, use DataView instead. The contents are initialized to 0. Once established, you can reference elements in the array using the object's methods, or using standard array index syntax (that is, using bracket notation).</p><pre><code>new Int16Array(length);\nnew Int16Array(typedArray);\nnew Int16Array(object);\nnew Int16Array(buffer [, byteOffset [, length]]);</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Int16Array
SIMD.Int16x8	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The SIMD.Int16x8 data type is a 128-bit vector divided into 8 lanes storing 16-bit signed integer values.</p><pre><code>SIMD.Int16x8(s0, s1, s2, s3, s4, s5, s6, s7);</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Int16x8
Int32Array	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Int32Array typed array represents an array of twos-complement 32-bit signed integers in the platform byte order. If control over byte order is needed, use DataView instead. The contents are initialized to 0. Once established, you can reference elements in the array using the object's methods, or using standard array index syntax (that is, using bracket notation).</p><pre><code>new Int32Array(length);\nnew Int32Array(typedArray);\nnew Int32Array(object);\nnew Int32Array(buffer [, byteOffset [, length]]);</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Int32Array

Once established, you can reference elements in the array using the object's methods, or using standard array index syntax (that is, using bracket notation).</p><pre><code>new Int8Array(length);\nnew Int8Array(typedArray);\nnew Int8Array(object);\nnew Int8Array(buffer [, byteOffset [, length]]);</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Int8Array

InternalError	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The InternalError object indicates an error that occurred internally in the JavaScript engine. For example: "InternalError : too much recursion".</p><pre><code>new InternalError([message[, fileName[, lineNumber]]])</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/InternalError
Intl	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Intl object is the namespace for the ECMAScript Internationalization API, which provides language sensitive string comparison, number formatting, and date and time formatting. The constructors for Collator, NumberFormat, and DateTimeFormat objects are properties of the Intl object. This page documents these properties as well as functionality common to the internationalization constructors and other language sensitive functions.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Intl
Global.isFinite	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The global isFinite() function determines whether the passed value is a finite number. If needed, the parameter is first converted to a number.</p><pre><code>Global.isFinite (number)</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/isFinite
Global.isNaN	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The isNaN() function determines whether a value is NaN or not. Note: coercion inside the isNaN function has interesting rules; you may alternatively want to use Number.isNaN(), as defined in ECMAScript 6, or you can use typeof to determine if the value is Not-A-Number.</p><pre><code>Global.isNaN (number)</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/isNaN
Iterator	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Iterator function returns an object which implements legacy iterator protocol and iterates over enumerable properties of an object.</p><pre><code>Iterator(object, [keyOnly])</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Iterator
JSON	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The JSON object contains methods for parsing JavaScript Object Notation (JSON) and converting values to JSON. It can't be called or constructed, and aside from its two method properties it has no interesting functionality of its own.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/JSON
JSON.parse	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The JSON.parse() method parses a string as JSON, optionally transforming the value produced by parsing.</p><pre><code>JSON.parse ( text [ , reviver ] )</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/JSON/parse
JSON.stringify	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The JSON.stringify() method converts a JavaScript value to a JSON string, optionally replacing values if a replacer function is specified, or optionally including only the specified properties if a replacer array is specified.</p><pre><code>JSON.stringify ( value [ , replacer [ , space ] ] )</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/JSON/stringify
Map	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Map object is a simple key/value map. Any value (both objects and primitive values) may be used as either a key or a value.</p><pre><code>new Map([iterable])</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Map

The implementation selects the initial seed to the random number generation algorithm; it cannot be chosen or reset by the user.</p><pre><code>Math.random ( )</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Math/random

Object.prototype.constructor	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Returns a reference to the Object function that created the instance's prototype. Note that the value of this property is a reference to the function itself, not a string containing the function's name. The value is only read-only for primitive values such as 1, true and "test".</p><pre><code>Object.prototype.constructor</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Object/constructor

Object.defineProperty	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Object.defineProperty() method defines a new property directly on an object, or modifies an existing property on an object, and returns the object.</p><pre><code>Object.defineProperty ( O, P, Attributes )</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Object/defineProperty
Object.entries()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Object.entries() method returns an array of a given object's own enumerable property [key, value] pairs, in the same order as that provided by a for...in loop (the difference being that a for-in loop enumerates properties in the prototype chain as well).</p><pre><code>Object.entries(obj)</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Object/entries
Object.freeze	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Object.freeze() method freezes an object: that is, prevents new properties from being added to it; prevents existing properties from being removed; and prevents existing properties, or their enumerability, configurability, or writability, from being changed. In essence the object is made effectively immutable. The method returns the object being frozen.</p><pre><code>Object.freeze ( O )</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Object/freeze
Object.getOwnPropertyDescriptor	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Object.getOwnPropertyDescriptor() method returns a property descriptor for an own property (that is, one directly present on an object, not present by dint of being along an object's prototype chain) of a given object.</p><pre><code>Object.getOwnPropertyDescriptor ( O, P )</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Object/getOwnPropertyDescriptor
Object.getOwnPropertyDescriptors()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Object.getOwnPropertyDescriptors() method returns all own property descriptors of a given object.</p><pre><code>Object.getOwnPropertyDescriptors(obj)</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Object/getOwnPropertyDescriptors
Object.getOwnPropertyNames	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Object.getOwnPropertyNames() method returns an array of all properties (enumerable or not) found directly upon a given object.</p><pre><code>Object.getOwnPropertyNames ( O )</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Object/getOwnPropertyNames
Object.getOwnPropertySymbols()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Object.getOwnPropertySymbols() method returns an array of all symbol properties found directly upon a given object.</p><pre><code>Object.getOwnPropertySymbols(obj)</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Object/getOwnPropertySymbols
Object.getPrototypeOf	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Object.getPrototypeOf() method returns the prototype (i.e. the value of the internal [[Prototype]] property) of the specified object.</p><pre><code>Object.getPrototypeOf ( O )</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Object/getPrototypeOf

Object.keys	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Object.keys() method returns an array of a given object's own enumerable properties, in the same order as that provided by a for...in loop (the difference being that a for-in loop enumerates properties in the prototype chain as well).</p><pre><code>Object.keys ( O )</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Object/keys
Object.preventExtensions	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Object.preventExtensions() method prevents new properties from ever being added to an object (i.e. prevents future extensions to the object).</p><pre><code>Object.preventExtensions ( O )</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Object/preventExtensions

Object.prototype.__proto__	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The __proto__ property of Object.prototype is an accessor property (a getter function and a setter function) that exposes the internal [[Prototype]] (either an object or null) of the object through which it is accessed.</p><pre><code>var shape = {};\nvar circle = new Circle();\n\n// Set the object prototype.\n// DEPRECATED. This is for example purposes only. DO NOT DO THIS in real code.\nshape.__proto__ = circle;\n\n// Get the object prototype\nconsole.log(shape.__proto__ === circle); // true\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Object/proto

Object.seal	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The Object.seal() method seals an object, preventing new properties from being added to it and marking all existing properties as non-configurable. Values of present properties can still be changed as long as they are writable.</p><pre><code>Object.seal ( O )</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Object/seal

SIMD operations perform the same computation on multiple data points resulting in data level parallelism and thus performance gains, for example for 3D graphics and video processing, physics simulations or cryptography, and other domains.</p></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/SIMD

String.prototype.charCodeAt	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The charCodeAt() method returns an integer between 0 and 65535 representing the UTF-16 code unit at the given index (the UTF-16 code unit matches the Unicode code point for code points representable in a single UTF-16 code unit, but might also be the first code unit of a surrogate pair for code points not representable in a single UTF-16 code unit, e.g. Unicode code points  0x10000). If you want the entire code point value, use codePointAt ().</p><pre><code>String.prototype.charCodeAt (pos)</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String/charCodeAt

String.prototype.indexOf	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The indexOf() method returns the index within the calling String object of the first occurrence of the specified value, starting the search at fromIndex. Returns -1 if the value is not found.</p><pre><code>String.prototype.indexOf (searchString, position)</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String/indexOf

Returns -1 if the value is not found.</p><pre><code>String.prototype.lastIndexOf (searchString, position)</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String/lastIndexOf

String.prototype.normalize()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The normalize() method returns the Unicode Normalization Form of a given string (if the value isn't a string, it will be converted to one first).</p><pre><code>str.normalize([form])</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String/normalize
String.prototype.padEnd()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The padEnd() method pads the current string with a given string (eventually repeated) so that the resulting string reaches a given length. The pad is applied from the end (right) of the current string.</p><pre><code>str.padEnd(targetLength [, padString])</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String/padEnd
String.prototype.padStart()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The padStart() method pads the current string with a given string (eventually repeated) so that the resulting string reaches a given length. The pad is applied from the start (left) of the current string.</p><pre><code>str.padStart(targetLength [, padString])</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String/padStart

String.raw()	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The static String.raw() method is a tag function of template literals, similar to the r prefix in Python or the @ prefix in C# for string literals (yet there is a difference: see explanations in this issue). It's used to get the raw string form of template strings (that is, the original, uninterpreted text).</p><pre><code>String.raw(callSite, ...substitutions)\n\nString.raw`templateString`\n</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String/raw

Whitespace in this context is all the whitespace characters (space, tab, no-break space, etc.) and all the line terminator characters (LF, CR, etc.).</p><pre><code>String.prototype.trim ( )</code></pre></section>	https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String/Trim
